fruits.name: Fighting Styles
trivia:
All fighting styles have three different moves, except Combat, which has two, and Death Step and Dark Step, which have four.
However, the extra moves on the four-skill fighting styles exist mainly to boost damage of the other abilities.
However, the extra moves on the four-skill fighting styles exist mainly to boost damage of the other abilities.
Dragon Breath is currently the only fighting style having a fragment-only price.
Sanguine Art and possibly Combat are the only fighting styles in the game without a "V2".
Godhuman and Sanguine Art are the only fighting styles that require Materials.
On each fighting style other than Combat, there is the letter M at the bottom left corner of their icon, along with a white or black border surrounding the icon.
All First Sea fighting style teachers are Shop NPCs, but in the Second Sea and the Third Sea, all Fighting Style Teachers are Misc. NPCs.

fruits.name: Guns
trivia:
Guns can have many different types of projectile weapons, such as:
The Venom Bow being a bow,
The Skull Guitar being a guitar,
The Refined Slingshot, the Kabucha and the Slingshot being slingshots.
The Venom Bow being a bow,
The Skull Guitar being a guitar,
The Refined Slingshot, the Kabucha and the Slingshot being slingshots.

fruits.name: Blox Fruit Gacha
trivia: The player should be careful after spinning a fruit since if they are killed with a fruit that's not stored, they will lose it. This is especially true in Jungle as the safe zone is very small and high-level players often stay in this area.
A common tradition/joke among players is to blame Zioles, Blox Fruits' video editor and likeness of the Blox Fruit Gacha, for giving them bad Blox Fruits on purpose.

Some players would type in their own "secret commands" (Example: /OPluck) in the chat before rolling, in hopes that they should get good fruits. The commands do not work, as the chances of getting different Blox Fruits are based on pure luck.
The Blox Fruit Gacha does not have any chances of giving a permanent fruit. The only ways to obtain permanent fruits is buying them with Robux   or trading for them.
In Update 17.3, due to some problem, his original skin was corrupted. The developers had to change the Blox Fruit Gacha skin in all seas to Zioles'.
There is currently a text error where it displays "Shares cooldown with Regular Gacha!", same as the Summer Gacha says, however it's supposed to say, "Shares cooldown with Summer Gacha!"

fruits.name: Trading
fruits.description: Trading is a feature that was added in Update 15.
trivia: The soundtrack that plays while trading is Drip Fruits.
The player only had four maximum trades before cooldown before Update 17 Part 2.
As of Update 17.3, players are allowed to store permanent fruits in order to trade them.
Permanent Fruits are often traded for very high value fruits due to the fact that they cost Robux  .
Permanent Fruits have 100% value difference but some product's have 50% - 100%. (Like exp boosts).

On multiple trading chair/table legs, there will be words on them saying, "Chad is the king of Blox Fruits." This is most likely another funny Easter Egg. Same goes for the Chess tables in the Second Sea and the Third Sea.

If the player has a gamepass up for trade, it is recommended to trade it in the Third Sea if the player has access to that sea. This is because most players there have better fruits for trade due to rolling fruits for a longer time or more success in the number of Factory raids or Pirate Raid.
If the player received a permanent fruit from a trade it doesn't go in their inventory but instantly activates (doesn't swap their current fruit).

Some scammers/exploiters abuse bugs or cheat during trades in order to scam their victims of high-value-fruits. A common method is to freeze the trade GUI (commonly called "Freeze Trade") and making the victim unable to jump, preventing them from cancelling the trade. Another common method is "Auto Accept", which forces the victim to accept a trade automatically.

fruits.name: Trees
trivia: Fruits are able to spawn under cactuses in the Desert or even potted plants inside the Cursed Ship.
Control Fruit users are able to throw trees as an attack.
The largest breakable tree in the game is on the platform with Diamond.
Trees in raids, Treasure Islands, Mirage Island and Prehistoric Island cannot be broken.

fruits.name: Sea Events
trivia: Some Sea Events can spawn with another Sea Events, but this is very rare. For example, Mirage Island with a Rumbling Waters and a Terrorshark, making it a heavily guarded Island.
After the players' boat gets destroyed whilst exploring danger levels, the meter for it will be gone, unless another boat is nearby.
Though very rare, Sea Events such as Sharks can spawn in Sea Danger Level 0 outside of Tiki Outpost.

fruits.name: Water
trivia: While sailing in the First Sea, one will find a glowing red brick identical to the classic Roblox killbrick. The brick, however, does no damage and the player can't stand on it. This brick is found in front of Frozen Village, and near Jungle.
Players can get a title named "The Kraken" by dropping a fruit into the sea (only in Second Sea or Third Sea). Recommended that the player uses a low rarity fruit to obtain this.

Water appears everywhere, even in areas such as Portal's Dimensional Rift. There is also a glitch where if the player gets past the teleportation wall, they will fall into space and then into the water. Or simply, the player can see the water surface in Underwater City.

Enemies do not swim or take damage in water, instead, they immediately teleport back to their spawn point if they touch the water, an exception to this is sea event enemy.
Enemies using Ice or awakened Magma cannot walk on water, despite the player being able to do so.
In Buddha Raids, the Buddha users can walk in water for a medium distance before they get teleported back.
Enemies using Ice or awakened Magma cannot walk on water, despite the player being able to do so.
In Buddha Raids, the Buddha users can walk in water for a medium distance before they get teleported back.

fruits.name: Shop
fruits.description: The shop is an in-game store, accessible through the GUI Menu. Players can purchase numerous items/boosts for Robux   in this shop or gifts for other players.
trivia:
There used to be various types of limited-time packs for previous Christmas Updates, those being:
Beast Bundle
Holiday Special
Winter Combo
Holiday Essential
Ultimate Bundle
Beast Bundle
Holiday Special
Winter Combo
Holiday Essential
Ultimate Bundle
Designs of products, game passes, and chromatic artwork were created by @EGOTISMS_RBLX.
The player can store a game pass by clicking "Gift" and then clicking "Store in Inventory", This doesn't work with Respawn Bosses and Race Reroll, as of Update 21.

After Update 24, owners of the Permanent Dragon Token could briefly buy a discounted permanent dragon for   2400 Robux. Due to backlash and threats of legal action, the developers quickly fixed the issue. However, some users later spotted an unbuyable shop item labeled "Discounted Dragon" with a 500k money icon, but it turned out to be just a visual bug.
When used in trades, shop items allow the player to bypass the 40% maximum value difference requirement.

fruits.name: Factory
trivia:
Players can enter the Factory using Flash Step, however, they will not be able to damage the core. This trick can help to damage the core at its start.
Another way to enter the Factory is use Creation's V move near it, some of the pillars can teleport inside.
Another way to enter the Factory is use Creation's V move near it, some of the pillars can teleport inside.
The Cyborg NPC is located in one of the holes in the wall, where the player can buy the Lantern ship for   1,500.

The factory can be found on the third island of the Spider Raid because it is based on the Kingdom of Rose, however, the building appears to be destroyed. Cafe can also be found in the Spider Raid but it is also destroyed and half underwater.
It is best to do Factory Raids in Private Servers as there will be no interruption when attacking it.
The factory is one of the best ways to farm Bounty at Lv. 1500 since people over Lv. 1000 go here the most.

During the 30 seconds before the Factory opens which is displayed by the announcement, some enemies (including bosses) will completely freeze, they won't be able to attack or move which makes an easy kill for grinding Bounty or money, for example, Snow Trooper, Winter Warrior, and Order.
If the player joins a high difficulty raid (for example, a Buddha raid) and reaches the fifth island, the player can time it so that when the raid boss appears, the factory raid starts. This way, the player can deal a lot of damage within 30 seconds without losing too much health because all enemies in this raid will freeze completely.
If the player is not good at PvP, it is recommended to turn off PvP in some way before participating in a Factory Raid because the player will be damaged by other players trying to deal damage to the core (if the player's PvP is on).
It is possible to exit the Factory when five minutes have almost passed to escape death.
Sometimes, a glitch will occur that traps players inside the Factory after the raid has been completed.
The factory can drop Radioactive Material.

If the player joins a high difficulty raid (for example, a Buddha raid) and reaches the fifth island, the player can time it so that when the raid boss appears, the factory raid starts. This way, the player can deal a lot of damage within 30 seconds without losing too much health because all enemies in this raid will freeze completely.

If the player is not good at PvP, it is recommended to turn off PvP in some way before participating in a Factory Raid because the player will be damaged by other players trying to deal damage to the core (if the player's PvP is on).
It is possible to exit the Factory when five minutes have almost passed to escape death.
Sometimes, a glitch will occur that traps players inside the Factory after the raid has been completed.
The factory can drop Radioactive Material.

fruits.name: Castle on the Sea
trivia: The largest thing that can be levitated in Control X is one of the towers in the Castle on the Sea.
On top of the building in the middle, there is a book that can be read called "Echoes from the past".

fruits.name: Enemies
fruits.description: Enemies (also known as NPCs) can be found clustered together in certain areas, attacking the player when provoked. Defeating them is required for completing most quests, and by extension, for grinding. Some enemies utilize Aura, along Blox Fruits, fighting styles, swords, abilities or guns. They may use the moves of these weapons, or just the [M1] attacks. Most of enemies drop Money   or materials, while a few drop Fragments  .
trivia: Enemies are the main source of money, mostly from quests.

Many people often think that grinding Bosses will help players receive more Mastery. In fact, this is completely wrong. Players constantly jumping servers to grinding Bosses is slower than grinding enemies, so grinding is still the most effective and optimal method when needing a lot of Mastery.
Most enemies in Third Sea use Aura which disables Elemental fruits passive ability.
There are currently 108 enemies in the game.

fruits.name: Grand Brigade
trivia: In a raid, there will be a Grand Brigade waiting for the player after they complete the first island.
The Grand Brigade is a good option for Sea Beast hunting and Ship Raids since it has 2,500 Health.
This is a boat that usually spawn with two other Brigades in a Ship Raid, and the Grand Brigade has more health than a normal brigade (about 30,000 health).

fruits.name: Ship Raid
trivia: There's a bug in which the Grand Brigade gets stuck on the owner's ship and will not fire the cannons. This is a great opportunity to attack it.
In the Second Sea, the Grand Brigade in ship raids will not spawn when the ship is too large (e.g. Beast Hunter or Lantern).

fruits.name: Haunted Ship Raid
trivia:
The Haunted Ship Raid is a sea event that is very despised by the community because it causes a lot of damage to boats, and can easily destroy them.
Despite being hated by the community, the Haunted Ship Raid is one of the most important sea events as it drops the Fool's Gold which can be used to make important elements that can be used against sea events.

Despite being hated by the community, the Haunted Ship Raid is one of the most important sea events as it drops the Fool's Gold which can be used to make important elements that can be used against sea events.

The Haunted Ship Raid can drop any Blox Fruit in the game, each one of them with the same probability (e.g. Dragon and Rocket have the same chance of dropping from the Haunted Ship Raid).
Due to the fact that the majority of Blox Fruits in the game are Mythical or Legendary, there is a higher probability of getting one of these Blox Fruits instead of the more common ones.
Due to the fact that the majority of Blox Fruits in the game are Mythical or Legendary, there is a higher probability of getting one of these Blox Fruits instead of the more common ones.

fruits.name: Café
trivia:
The theme of The Café is Rule of Rose Track 06 - Backbiting, which is a part of the Rule of Rose OST.
The Café and the Mansion (Third Sea) share the same theme.
The Café and the Mansion (Third Sea) share the same theme.

King Toad's House used to be an open door, a clean-living room with money in suitcases.
Players will sometimes leave fruits inside the Wenlocktoad room.
Take note that they can also hide inside this room.
Players will sometimes leave fruits inside the Wenlocktoad room.
Take note that they can also hide inside this room.
On one side of the leg of every trade table is written "Chad is the king of blox fruits" and in the top left corner is written "it exists".
There are four paintings on the walls of the Café but two of them got deleted for an unknown reason, and are now white.
The Café is considered the most visited place in the Second Sea by many players.
There is also something written beneath the trading table at the right side of the Café from its entrance as an easter egg.

fruits.name: Mansion
trivia: The Vietnam Cone can be found behind a windmill near the Mansion, it's most likely an easter egg made by the developers to show their support towards Vietnamese Blox Fruits players, as it currently has no use besides decoration.
The Mansion and Café share the same theme.
Leaderboards for Bounty, Honor, and Fastest Raids are located in the Mansion.
The Inventory NPC was previously located next to the Blox Fruit Gacha, but was removed in Update 17.3.
The Citizen, which gives the citizen quest, is located in front of the Mansion.
The two huge bars at the center of the Mansion are actually hollow, the player can glitch into them using various skills, although it takes some effort.
Despite the Mansion having three floors, the third floor is not accessible.
If the player uses Unawakened Dough's [C] Carved Dough, they will get stuck on the roof.
The top corners of the Mansion are not Safe Zones. If a player jumps upto any one of the 4 top corners, they can notice that the Safe Zone text disappears.

fruits.name: Rocket
moves: — The user creates a small rocket in their right hand, then creates a target in the direction of the cursor and fires the rocket, which explodes on contact with an opponent or a barrier or if it reaches it's maximum range, dealing damage and knockback to any enemy hit.

— The user raises their right arm and then swings it, gradually creating 5 targets on the ground, before sending 5 rockets downwards on said targets, which explode on contact with the ground and deal decent damage to hit enemies.

— The user jumps high into the air at a rapid rate and then crashes to the ground where the cursor is pointing, dealing good AoE damage to any contacted enemies. This move is similar to T-Rex's F move (transformed) but slightly faster.
— The user does a backflip towards the sky and flies at a slow pace with an explosive trail.
trivia: Rocket is similar to Bomb, both having moves that show explosion effects.
Rocket is the cheapest fruit to have a flight ability.
Rocket, Blade, and Eagle are the only fruits in which the [F] move has the highest mastery requirements out of all the other moves.

A physical Rocket fruit can be purchased from Wenlock in Arowe’s room for   97 (it says Physical Kilo, but buying it still gives the Physical Rocket).
This makes Rocket the only fruit that can be purchased as a physical fruit for   . Interestingly, the permanent version of Rocket is cheaper, costing only   50.
This makes Rocket the only fruit that can be purchased as a physical fruit for   . Interestingly, the permanent version of Rocket is cheaper, costing only   50.
Rocket and Slingshot both cost the same price.
Rocket, along with Spin, are the only fruits to always be in Stock.
When the user is on a flat ground with no obstacles, Rocket has the fastest mobility out of all common fruits.
If the user uses [F] Blast Off and quickly change to another slot, they will be able to blast themselves to the sky.

fruits.name: Dog House (Wenlock)
trivia: Purchasing the physical Rocket Fruit is highly discouraged, as although the fruit can be used to complete Cyborg's V3 quest or traded for a Special Microchip, getting a fruit through the Blox Fruit Gacha is significantly cheaper and does not cost Robux  . Rocket is also considerably weaker when compared to other fruits.

When purchasing a Rocket, the product purchase screen that open still lists the name as "Physical Kilo Fruit" instead of a Rocket Fruit.
Prior to Update 20, when the Kilo fruit was removed, the Wenlock Dog House gave the player a Kilo instead of a Rocket.
Even though the product is outdated, the player will still receive a physical Rocket as promised.
Prior to Update 20, when the Kilo fruit was removed, the Wenlock Dog House gave the player a Kilo instead of a Rocket.
Even though the product is outdated, the player will still receive a physical Rocket as promised.

fruits.name: Events
fruits.description: Events are limited-time activities. Every year or visit milestone, Blox Fruits releases a special update that comes with a new limited currency, NPCs, titles and items or to organize a small event.

fruits.name: Death King
trivia: The Death King is similar to the Magic Elf.
From Update 17, players cannot roll a fruit from the Death King as it was easy to get bones. However, in Update 21, this feature was added back temporarily.
The Death King used to be in the First Sea but was moved in Update 17.
Players are allowed to spend up to 50 Bones at a time, and they can do this 10 times every 2 hours. This means the maximum amount a player can spend is 500 Bones every 2 hours.
Since the Ghost Event ended, players can no longer get fruits from the Death King.
Since the Ghost Event ended, the options of Refund stats and rolling race from the Death King were disabled.
The aura the Death King wears around his shoulder can be found in the Roblox Catalog.
If the player has bought all 10 of their random purchases, the Death King incorrectly states hours as minutes, e.g. "You currently have 0 purchases left. Come back in 1:59 minutes."

fruits.name: Tyrant of the Skies
fruits.description: "Wings of wrath descend upon intruders."
moves: — The Tyrant fires explosive feathers at a target. Often combined with Feather Storm for extra damage. This ability is Instinct-trickable.
— The Tyrant unleashes a close-range rapid slash attack that stuns and damages nearby targets. This move is very frequently used by the Tyrant.
— The Tyrant swiftly dashes towards a target, launching them into the air before unleashing a slash attack and slamming the target into the ground.
— The Tyrant unleashes explosive feathers in all directions, which explode and deal AoE damage. This ability breaks Instinct.
trivia: The Tyrant is seemingly inspired by Huītzilōpōchtli and the Aztec culture, as he is associated with a lot of Aztec-esque imagery.
The Tyrant has the highest health out of any Raid Boss. (This is false until they remove the Rip Commander with 10mil like they did with the Red Commander)
The Tyrant can fly, unlike many other NPCs.
The statues required to summon the Tyrant resemble falcons more than eagles, possibly referencing the Falcon fruit rework.

fruits.name: Azure Ember
trivia: A total of  10  is required to buy everything that requires this material.
The word "Azure" comes from the Spanish origin "Azureus" (also known as "Azul") which means blue.
The Azure Ember has striking resemblance to the Blaze Ember, with only a recolor and a minor shape change.
The Azure Ember, the Blaze Ember, the Dinosaur Bones, the Dragon Egg, the Leviathan Heart, the Fire Flower and all the Berries are currently the only materials that physically exist in the game.

fruits.name: Dragon Egg
trivia: The number of Dragon Eggs that spawn upon completion of the Volcano Event depends on player count, with a maximum of  4  if the event was started with four players. This amount does not increase further with more players.
A total of  8  Dragon Eggs is required to buy everything that requires this material.

Similar to the Kitsune Shrine where it has a very small chance to give the player a physical Kitsune fruit, there is a very small chance to obtain a physical Dragon fruit (East or West) upon interacting with the Dragon Egg to pick it up.

fruits.name: Eagle
moves: Eagle is unlocked and equipped by default.
The Velvet,  Falcon, Golden Moss, Blue Sky and Orange Creamsicle colors are unlocked crafting them with the Barista NPC, or buying them with Robux by owning the Permanent Eagle Fruit.
The Parrot chromatic skin could have been bought in the Shop with Robux   for a limited amount of time, which can be bought for   499.
The Glacier, Requiem and Matrix chromatic skins can be obtained for  500  at the Summer Gacha.
These [M1] attacks drain meter, regardless of being transformed or not.
The [M1] attacks can only hit opponents at a certain distance away from the user, being too close will cause it not to work.

If the [M1] is held, the user can still walk and run like usual, and can unleash the M1 at any point of time. They can use this to hover in the air (forever) by only being airborne (even at the height of one jump) and then holding the M1.
These [M1] attacks drain meter, regardless of being transformed or not.
The [M1] attacks can only hit opponents at a certain distance away from the user, being too close will cause it not to work.

If the [M1] is held, the user can still walk and run like usual, and can unleash the M1 at any point of time. They can use this to hover in the air (forever) by only being airborne (even at the height of one jump) and then holding the M1.

Feather Meter — The user begins with 50% of the feather meter. Unlike most transformations, the [F] move can be activated without a full meter. The meter regenerates quickly and passively when not using [F]. While in flight mode, feathers fall from the user's wings, slowly draining the meter. It also depletes when using [M1] attacks, the [F] dash, or when losing hp. The meter's duration can be extended via the Admin Panel.

Skins — The user can obtain color variations for their Eagle wings by crafting them. They can also be purchased with Robux  , but Permanent Eagle must be owned. Every owned color can be selected inside the inventory in the "Skins" category. The user can also use one chromatic color, which can be obtained from the CHROMATIC bundle in the shop, though more can be added in the future.
Eagle is unlocked and equipped by default.
The Velvet,  Falcon, Golden Moss, Blue Sky and Orange Creamsicle colors are unlocked crafting them with the Barista NPC, or buying them with Robux by owning the Permanent Eagle Fruit.
The Parrot chromatic skin could have been bought in the Shop with Robux   for a limited amount of time, which can be bought for   499.
The Glacier, Requiem and Matrix chromatic skins can be obtained for  500  at the Summer Gacha.
Images of the different colored Eagle wings can be found here.

— The user shoots out a glowing feather from their wings at the target, which later explodes when landed, dealing damage and some knockback. When held, the move deals more damage and has more range. This attack also can heat-seek, which means it can curve towards nearby enemies if the user aims slightly away from the target.
These [M1] attacks drain meter, regardless of being transformed or not.
The [M1] attacks can only hit opponents at a certain distance away from the user, being too close will cause it not to work.
If the [M1] is held, the user can still walk and run like usual, and can unleash the M1 at any point of time. They can use this to hover in the air (forever) by only being airborne (even at the height of one jump) and then holding the M1.
— The user blows a huge whirlwind of explosive feathers, dealing damage and knocking enemies backwards while leaving scorch marks on the ground.

— The user rapidly dashes around within a radius, slashing at and stunning opponents within the radius with their razor-sharp feathers. This move is similar of the [X] move of Dual Flintlocks but does not need to be held, which also means it cannot be cancelled by the user.

— The user launches themselves swiftly at the target. If hit, the user will grab the target, drag them up high in the air, before slamming them down to the floor with devastating amounts of force. This attack is single target, and the drag up in the air can be varied by the environment.

— The user propels themselves using explosive feathers, violently lunging at the target. As they pass through the opponent, they slash them with explosive feathers left behind from the attack. The initial grab is single target, dealing a lot of damage, but the afterwards explosion can hit multiple enemies.

— The user flaps their wings, gaining the ability to hover and soar in the air and sending out a few explosive feathers, dealing minor damage, passively draining their feather meter. Tapping this move again while flying will revert the user back to normal, dropping explosive feathers in the process. When upgraded, holding this move while in flight mode allows the user to dash forward. When HP falls below 30%, flight speed decreases and continues to scale down with HP, reaching up to a 60% reduction at 0 HP.
trivia: A physical Eagle Fruit can be obtained from defeating the Tyrant of the Skies at a relatively low chance.
Eagle is one of the four fruits that can be upgraded in the Admin Panel, the other being Gravity, Lightning, and Pain.
Eagle is the first Uncommon fruit to have a meter.
Eagle is also the only Uncommon beast fruit.
Eagle is one of the only fruits to have a skin, and the first uncommon to have one.
Eagle is the only Beast-type fruit that does not have a full transformation.
The physical eagle fruit is the smallest fruit model, this might be because the particle effects would cause lag when put at the scale of a regular fruit size.
Eagle is the only fruit that cost the same amount of money as a removed fruit in the game, Revive fruit. (Old Ghost fruit)

Parrot and Falcon skins are the only skins that do not actually depict a variation of Eagle, but rather another species of bird.
Falcon is a reference to the Falcon fruit, while Parrot was a chromatic concept for Falcon that the developers decided to add to the game as an Eagle skin.
Falcon is a reference to the Falcon fruit, while Parrot was a chromatic concept for Falcon that the developers decided to add to the game as an Eagle skin.
Eagle is the third fruit whose [F] ability requires the highest mastery, the first one being Rocket and the second being Blade.
Eagle's [F] Flight animation and sound are similar to awakened Phoenix [V] Full Transformation, as both make the scream of a Red-tailed hawk and spin in the air.
Eagle's feathers are similar to the Angel V3 particle effects.
Eagle is the only fruit which makes another accessory disappear (being Angel's wings, also for cyborg v4 wings ).

A real life bald eagle typically cruise at around 13.5 meters per second, and soar at speeds up to 45 meters per second. The in-game counterpart, however, flies at 10 meters per second with first upgrade or higher, and approximately 40-44 meters per second when lunging forwards with [V] Soaring Talon or upgraded [F] Flight (held).
Despite being one of the fastest flying creatures in the real world, Eagle's speed is considered slow in a universe where everything else has magical powers.
Keep in mind that an Eagle user is generally larger than an average bald eagle, decreasing the speed to body length ratio of an eagle user.
Body length to speed ratio means the top speed of an animal versus the size of the animal. For example, a transformed West Dragon flies at absurdly high speeds because it happens to be quite huge, maintaining the fair body length to speed ratio. However, a transformed Phoenix flies slightly faster than Eagle, despite being roughly the same size. This meant that Eagle has a slightly lower body length to speed ratio, making Eagle appear slow.

[Z] Wind Burst can cause enemies at Tiki Outpost to get stuck under the floor when aimed downwards.
[V] Soaring Talon move can cause the user to be flung very far away by unknown causes, most likely the occasional ragdolling.
If the user changes from an accessory that grants extra health while in flight mode, they will lose Feather meter according to the amount of health lost by switching from that accessory.
If Angel or Cyborg races are used with Eagle the wings will disappear instead of both of them overlapping.
The Shop description of Eagle remains the same despite being upgraded, for some reason it does not state any of the special abilities Eagle has such as [M1] attacks.
Rarely, [F] Flight will sometimes not work when held, thus using feather meter without dashing the player.

fruits.name: Kitsune
moves: The user can gain tails passively as well as by dealing damage. The user can transform when the tail meter reaches 3 (the meter will turn rainbow when the user has max tails). The meter will decrease if the user uses an ability and misses (this includes Kitsune's M1s, but these consume less of tails meter than abilities).

After transforming, the user will slowly drain one third of the tail meter (doesn't passively drain) and will slowly drain if the user takes any type of damage (including lava and water). The user will not passively gain any tail meter while transformed and can only increase the meter by dealing damage with Kitsune (including Kitsune's tick damage).
2 Tails: The user gets a speed boost (+100% [2x]) and a dash boost and now runs on all fours. (Air jumping, dashing, and walking will also now have a unique animation)

3 Tails: The user gets three glowing orbs floating around them, and when using the [F] move or a M1 attack, the enemy will deal tick damage by blue flames. The DoT effect lasts for 3 seconds, dealing 1 tick of damage every second.

If hit:
The user summons blue fire flames that circle the opponent for some time before hitting the opponent multiple times, dealing damage.
The user summons blue fire flames that circle the opponent for some time before hitting the opponent multiple times, dealing damage.

If not hit:
The user creates a small AoE that deals low damage to nearby targets.
The user creates a small AoE that deals low damage to nearby targets.
