If hit:
Targets up to 1-3 opponents, launching them backward and shooting a ball of blue flames per target (untransformed C is used), causing an explosion of blue flames as well as ticking damage.
Targets up to 1-3 opponents, launching them backward and shooting a ball of blue flames per target (untransformed C is used), causing an explosion of blue flames as well as ticking damage.

If not hit:
The user will spin and launch a flurry of blue fireballs around them, causing a large AoE explosion.
The user will spin and launch a flurry of blue fireballs around them, causing a large AoE explosion.

If hit:
Targets up to 1-3 opponents, launching them backward and shooting a ball of blue flames per target (untransformed C is used), causing an explosion of blue flames as well as ticking damage.
Targets up to 1-3 opponents, launching them backward and shooting a ball of blue flames per target (untransformed C is used), causing an explosion of blue flames as well as ticking damage.

If not hit:
The user will spin and launch a flurry of blue fireballs around them, causing a large AoE explosion.
The user will spin and launch a flurry of blue fireballs around them, causing a large AoE explosion.
The small damage when thrown can be dodged, but the explosion breaks Instinct.
The edge (if missed) can sometimes be dodged.

Kitsune Tails — Swift Tails
The user can gain tails passively as well as by dealing damage. The user can transform when the tail meter reaches 3 (the meter will turn rainbow when the user has max tails). The meter will decrease if the user uses an ability and misses (this includes Kitsune's M1s, but these consume less of tails meter than abilities).

Mythical Fox Fur — While transformed, the user gains a 20% damage reduction from all sources, improved attacks, reduced cooldowns, faster speed, jump twice higher than average, and increased dash distance.
Clever Fox's Spirit — When transformed, the user gains the ability to run on Water, but they are not able to idle on it.
Kitsune Mount — When transformed, the user can be mounted by another allied player, via their saddle.

— The user slashes the air, creating blue flame slashes. On the fourth slash, the user swipes in a whirlwind style. And with the last slash having two variations, on the ground the user swipes downwards, leaving a faint crack for a few moments, in the air the user kicks the opponent to the ground (Both variations deal the same amount of damage). Once at 3 tails, the slashes will inflict ticking damage and the opponent will be covered in blue flame for between 4-5 seconds and the base damage will increase too. Every slash drains the Tails meter by a bit. Jumping right before the slam will make the user perform a slash instead of a slam. This attack consumes 7.5% of the visible Tails meter if all 5 M1s are used.

— This move has two distinct variants: 
If hit:
The user summons blue fire flames that circle the opponent for some time before hitting the opponent multiple times, dealing damage.
If not hit:
The user creates a small AoE that deals low damage to nearby targets.
This move consumes 10% of the visible Tails meter.

— This move does damage in a zig-zag shape, first hitting one corner, then hitting another, and finally hitting the target. This move can hit up to three targets and stun the enemy for ~0.65s. This move consumes 12.5% of the visible Tails meter.

— The user summons a ball of blue flames and strikes it at the enemy when the key is released.  The ball of flames will erupt into a huge explosion, and flames will be present if landed near the ground. These break Instinct. The move deals slightly more damage if it is a direct hit. This move consumes 15% of the visible Tails meter.
— The user transforms into a full Kitsune. The user gains the ability to avoid all basic damage (for one second) while transforming. In total, this move consumes 30% of the visible Tails meter.

— The user dashes forward and, if they hit a target, slashes the target with its claws multiple times, similar to a mix of the True Triple Katana and Rengoku's [Z] move and the Kitsune M1's. This move consumes 10% of the visible Tails meter.
— Same as untransformed with 3 tails, but with slightly larger AoE, hitbox and damage. This attack consumes 7.5% of the visible Tails meter if all 5 M1s are used.

— The user summons three blue fireballs and dashes forward. This move possesses two distinct variations:
If hit:
Targets up to 1-3 opponents, launching them backward and shooting a ball of blue flames per target (untransformed C is used), causing an explosion of blue flames as well as ticking damage.
If not hit:
The user will spin and launch a flurry of blue fireballs around them, causing a large AoE explosion.
This move consumes 15% of the visible Tails meter.

— The user dashes forward in a zig-zag shape. If hits, the user will grab the enemy, carry them into the air, and then slam them to the ground hard. This move will break Instinct and blue flames will then rise from the ground along with several large tails. This move instantly slams an opponent if used in air. The face of a Kitsune will be printed on the ground when hit. This move consumes 20% of the visible Tails meter.

— The user launches a blue fireball and causes widespread damage. After impact, there will be blue flames that cause extremely large damage over time.
This move consumes 25% of the visible Tails meter.
— The user transforms back into their human form instantly and in turn restores their ability to use Fighting Styles, Swords, and Guns.

— The user dashes towards the enemy and swipes with their tail, similar to the True Triple Katana [Z] move, Rengoku [Z] move and Kitsune M1's.
This move consumes 15% of the visible Tails meter.
trivia:
Kitsune is the second fan-made fruit to be added to the game, with the first being Sound.
The original concept was created by @Kuzuryu_Kei (X Handle), one of the winners of the first fan fruit/art contest.
The original concept was created by @Kuzuryu_Kei (X Handle), one of the winners of the first fan fruit/art contest.
Kitsune is currently the second most expensive fruit in the game.
Kitsune is the first Beast fruit that allows allied players to mount, the second being Dragon.
It is worth noting that Agility (Rabbit's V3 ability) does not have nearly as much effect as when not transformed. While it is noticeable, it is mostly negligible.

Despite being based on a nine-tailed fox, Kitsune normally only has three tails and five tails when transformed; this is probably due to the design of the model, although it still has nine tails in the icon.
The same happens to Inventory Icon and Physical Fruit, while the Inventory Icon model has 4 tails, Physical Fruit only has 3 tails.
The same happens to Inventory Icon and Physical Fruit, while the Inventory Icon model has 4 tails, Physical Fruit only has 3 tails.
When walking whilst using Kitsune with two or more tails, the player animation will shift from crawling on all fours to an upright & happy skipping animation.

Kitsune used to have a move called "Tailed Beast Bomb" as its [C] move, which got changed into "Fox Fire Disruption" and the [F] move, "Wild Assault" , was called "Swift Assault" in the fruit's sneak peek.
All of Kitsune's moves (excluding [V]) can only be held for 12 seconds.
In the fan made design, the [X] move was called "Claws of Burning Agony" which was changed to "Tails of Burning Agony" in the game.
A physical Kitsune Fruit can also be obtained at a very low chance (0.1%) by offering Azure Embers to the Kitsune Shrine in the Third Sea.

There was a bug involving Love's [F] Flamingo Ride, where If an allied player mounted the Kitsune user, the Love user could "kidnap" the allied player, and that player would ride on the Flamingo. However, once the Love user cancelled their [F] Flamingo Ride, the player who was previously mounting the Kitsune user would teleport back into the saddle. This bug is now patched.
Kitsune's transformed [X] move can glitch through walls. Same can happen with its [F] move. (both untransformed and transformed)
Kitsune's [Z] move (untransformed) - hit version - can become invisible after hitting the target.
Strangely, upon heavy use of Kitsune, Swords, Guns and Fighting Styles lose their models and [M1] attacks (Likely when two tails are reached).
The allied player on the Kitsune user's saddle can use Dragonstorm M1s, even though all the other guns will dismount the allied player right after using their M1. This is most likely a bug.

Swapping to a different fruit with a Power Meter while Kitsune is at three Tails will retain the "rainbow" effects on the meter. In some cases, the meter will retain the "1 Tail" UI from Kitsune, carrying it over.

If the user has a Health boosting accessory equipped, use their [V] transform, and then unequip the accessory, they will lose Tails as if they had taken damage. The user can repeatedly equip and unequip the accessory to keep depleting their Tails. The same occurs with T-Rex.
If the transformed [X] move of Kitsune hits a target standing in front of a wall/sloped surface, it can launch the user absurdly high into the air.
If a player is riding on a transformed Kitsune user's back, they can teleport to places they haven’t unlocked as long as the Kitsune user has them unlocked, similar to Love's [F] move.

Using Portal [Z] on a transformed Kitsune user with another player riding on top will cause the riding player to die instantly, regardless of whether they are allied with the Portal user or not. The Portal user also receives bounty/honor from the kill.
Using Kitsune [X] (transformed) while on water will drag both the user and the target into the water which can be used in a deadly combo if used with Shark V2.

fruits.name: Dragon
moves: The user starts with a small "Fury Meter" that must be full to transform into a Dragon hybrid. The Orange meter refills slowly over time when not transformed and drains with any move used. The second Fury Meter fills only by dealing damage and must be full to transform into full Dragon Form. While transformed, the Fury meter begins draining for a short time, indicated by flames above it, and taking damage starts draining it again. However, the Fury meter doesn’t drain passively while transformed, allowing indefinite transformation as long as it is not emptied. When transformed, the Fury Meter will be fully restored upon killing an opponent within 50 levels. However, it will be drained 2× faster when hit in the head.
In Hybrid form, the user gains a 20% (34% against NPCs) damage resistance to all attacks, causes a burning effect with M1 attacks, and has their moveset greatly enhanced.
In Dragon form, the user gains a 53% damage resistance to all attacks and is able to fly. The user can still be affected by crowd control but still able to move.
Green is unlocked and equipped by default.
The Orange,  Yellow, Blue, Red, Purple, and Black colors are unlocked crafting them with the Barista NPC, or buying them with Robux by owning the Permanent Dragon Fruit.

The Blood Moon, Eclipse, Ember, Phoenix Sky, and Violet Night chromatic skins can be bought in the Shop with Robux   for a limited amount of time. (To date the only skin that has been sold in the shop is the Eclipse skin, which was sold for   1999.)

Draconic Dominance — Fury Meter
The user starts with a small "Fury Meter" that must be full to transform into a Dragon hybrid. The Orange meter refills slowly over time when not transformed and drains with any move used. The second Fury Meter fills only by dealing damage and must be full to transform into full Dragon Form. While transformed, the Fury meter begins draining for a short time, indicated by flames above it, and taking damage starts draining it again. However, the Fury meter doesn’t drain passively while transformed, allowing indefinite transformation as long as it is not emptied. When transformed, the Fury Meter will be fully restored upon killing an opponent within 50 levels. However, it will be drained 2× faster when hit in the head.

Draconic Blood
In Hybrid form, the user gains a 20% (34% against NPCs) damage resistance to all attacks, causes a burning effect with M1 attacks, and has their moveset greatly enhanced. —

Draconic Monarch's Scales
In Dragon form, the user gains a 53% damage resistance to all attacks and is able to fly. The user can still be affected by crowd control but still able to move. —

Strong Hair/Saddle — Can be unlocked after getting 500 mastery on Dragon and talking to the Dragon Tamer NPC and paying   5,000. When transformed, the user can be mounted by other allied players. Maximum is 4 for Eastern Form and 5 for Western Form. (The purchase only applies to the currently equipped variant, and the user will have to make another purchase in the other variant for obtaining the passive on both variants.)

Skins — The user can obtain other colors for their Dragon form by crafting them. They can also be bought using Robux  , but Permanent Dragon must be owned. Every owned color can be selected inside the inventory in the "Skins" category. The user can also use five chromatic colors which can be obtained from the CHROMATIC bundle in the shop.
Green is unlocked and equipped by default.
The Orange,  Yellow, Blue, Red, Purple, and Black colors are unlocked crafting them with the Barista NPC, or buying them with Robux by owning the Permanent Dragon Fruit.
The Blood Moon, Eclipse, Ember, Phoenix Sky, and Violet Night chromatic skins can be bought in the Shop with Robux   for a limited amount of time. (To date the only skin that has been sold in the shop is the Eclipse skin, which was sold for   1999.)
Images of the different colored Dragon forms can be found here.
— The user begins to scratch their opponent with fiery claws three times, each scratch with differing directions. This move is similar to the ones of Kitsune and T-Rex.

— The user fires a beam of scorching hot energy, knocking enemies back. Holding this move will make this move have more range and damage. It can be held for around 5-6 seconds. While using this attack, the user floats, so they won't fall.

— When held, the user prepares themselves to launch towards their opponent. As the key is released, the user will dash at their opponent and drag them before full on throwing them at their cursor smashing into the ground. This move deals 2 ticks of burn afterwards. This move is similar to Eagle's [C] Bone Crusher, except the user can aim the slam.

— The user leaps into the air and begins bombarding the ground with fiery projectiles. Upon impact, the projectiles explode, damaging enemies caught in the vicinity, knocking them back, and stunning them for a brief moment. Holding this move allows the user to shoot fireballs for around 2.5 seconds. After an individual enemy reaches a certain threshold of damage from fireballs, they will take greatly reduced damage from fireballs. This threshold is reached after about half of the total fireballs hit the enemy, meaning the user can miss some of their fireballs or end their skill early and still deal most of the damage. This move is similar to unawakened Light's [X] move.

— If the user has acquired all of the orange fury meter bar, they will proceed to evolve into hybrid form. But if the user has the red fury meter bar full, they will transform into a dragon depending on their choice of east or west. However, the user cannot use fighting styles, swords, and guns while transformed.

— The user grows dragon wings and lunges at their desired opponent. If the attack lands, the player will grab the opponent, damage them and dash away (the user can keep flying after hitting by holding the move). If not, they will be able to soar, hence the name. The user will fly faster when aiming downward.
— The user attacks their desired opponent with scorching scratches five times. The hybrid version's range is a lot better, and the slashes also set anyone hit on fire for a short period.

— The user violently fires a beam of scorching energy at their desired opponent (or their cursor), knocking enemies backward. If the key is held, the move becomes significantly more powerful, dealing even more damage and range.

— When held, the user will prep themselves to dash. Upon release, the user (depending on if they land the attack or not) will lunge towards their opponent accompanied by a trail of flames and slam them at their cursor. This move deals 2 ticks of burn afterwards.

— The user leaps into the air and bombards the ground with multiple fiery projectiles. Upon impact, the projectiles explode, damaging enemies caught in the vicinity, knocking them back, and stunning them for a brief moment. Holding this move allows the user to shoot fireballs for around 4 seconds. After an individual enemy reaches a certain threshold of damage from fireballs, they will take greatly reduced damage from fireballs. This threshold is reached after about half of the total fireballs hit the enemy, meaning the user can miss some of their fireballs or end their skill early and still deal most of the damage. The hybrid version lets the user hold it for longer, meaning more damage can be applied.
— Depending on if the user's fury meter is full or not, the user will transform into either their human form or their Dragon form.

— The user sprouts out draconic wings out of their back and lunge forward. If the attack lands, the user will grab said person and slash them away (the user can keep flying after hitting by holding the move). If nobody is hit, they will be able to continue their soar. The user usually flies faster when aiming downward, and if the move hits the flight won't be interrupted.
— The player opens their mouth and begins to blast fire at their cursor for around 2 seconds before completely depleting. (Can be held for longer, but the range will decrease rapidly.)

— The user, with great force, charges a beam from their mouth (depending on if the move is held) and will violently fire a beam of hot energy. Whereas if the beam is fully charged it causes the rings to glow purple. This move possesses an extreme range and big AoE. The user can move around while charging this move.
— The user spins in an upward motion, grabbing anyone unlucky enough to be within vicinity. The user then dives downwards, causing a massive explosion and leaving debris everywhere.

— The user spins upwards, albeit much slower and in a wider space than the previous move, during which a firestorm will accompany the user's spin. At the end, the user reaches peak altitude, and a purple explosion finishes off the move. The length of this move depends on how long it is held.
— The user turns back to their normal form (or hybrid if they were in that state before turning into a Dragon).

— The user aims at their cursor and begins spinning. The user gains speed aiming downward, and can even crash onto solid surfaces which causes an large, fiery explosion. Attempting to crash into the ocean will damage non-shark users, including the users themselves.
— The user creates fire out of its mouth, and it lasts for around two seconds before running out. (Can be held for longer, but the range will decrease heavily.)

— The user shoots a huge beam of fire from their mouth. When the move is fully charged it causes a ring of fire appear in front of the player's head. This move possesses a considerable range and big AoE. Unlike the East variant, the player is unable to move whilst charging this move.
— The user uses their claws to create huge slashes, similar to the classic Dragon's and Sanguine Art's X move but a lot better in visuals, speed, AoE and damage.
— The user shoots an orb which rains meteors downwards, doing very high damage and having an explosion at the end.
— The user turns back to their normal avatar (or hybrid if they were in that state before turning into a Dragon).

— The user picks up an opponent, slices them, throws them back to the ground, and then slams themselves onto them.
If not hitting an opponent, the user dashes, creating a cone of fire in front of them, propelling them forwards faster than their original flying speed.
trivia: The Dragon Fruit can also be obtained from the    Dragon Eggs at the Prehistoric Island with an extremely low chance, being able to get either the East or West variants.
Dragon is the most expensive and difficult-to-obtain fruit in the game.
Before Update 24, Dragon was the third most expensive fruit in the game, with the first being Kitsune and the second being Leopard.
Before Update 17.3, Dragon was once again the most expensive fruit in the game, valued   3,500,000. This is the second time that Dragon is the most valuable fruit.

Pre-rework, Dragon costed   2,600, which increased by 92.3% up to   5,000 post-rework, making it by far the highest Robux price increase of any purchasable item in the game.
Similarly, it also has the highest Money price increase of any reworked item, going from   3,500,000 to   15,000,000. According to the calculations, the price of that is increased by 328.57%.
Similarly, it also has the highest Money price increase of any reworked item, going from   3,500,000 to   15,000,000. According to the calculations, the price of that is increased by 328.57%.
Mastery gained will be common to both Dragon variations.
Dragon has the largest transformed model in the game.

The transformed Eastern form dragon resembles a creature commonly found in Chinese myths, specifically a long, whereas the Western represents a European folklore Dragon, specifically a wyvern. Additionally, the Eastern Dragon is supposed to be the ruler of seas and bodies of water, unlike its Blox Fruits counterpart, whose moves are mostly fire-based.
Dragon's Western version is also similar to a fan-made Wyvern fruit showcased in the 2024 fan art competition.
Additionally, in most Chinese myths, Eastern Dragons are depicted to have control over the weather, thus allowing them to wield water, thunder and wind.
Dragon's Western version is also similar to a fan-made Wyvern fruit showcased in the 2024 fan art competition.
Additionally, in most Chinese myths, Eastern Dragons are depicted to have control over the weather, thus allowing them to wield water, thunder and wind.
Dragon and Kitsune are the only beast fruits that, while transformed, can carry players on their backs. However, Dragon needs Saddle/Strong Hair to carry someone on their back.
Dragon and Kitsune are the only fruits that can be obtained from Sea Events such as the Kitsune Shrine and Prehistoric Island.
The user can measure how fast they are moving using the Dragon's Hybrid form. The higher the speed, the higher the volume and pitch of the footsteps of the hybrid.
Dragon is the first fruit to have two versions on its transformation and fruit model.
Dragon has the highest damage reduction in the game.
Using a Race Awakening transformation while using the hybrid form drains the user's Fury Meter.
Having the permanent version of Dragon allows the user to choose the version of the fruit used. (Either Western or Eastern.)

Sometimes, a bug can happen with the Western Dragon where if the user untransforms, they will not be able to move. In the case of the Eastern Dragon, this bug causes players who untransformed to have a larger hitbox, allowing them to collect items such as fruits and chests much further than supposed and makes users sit in chairs frequently. This can be fixed by resetting the character or transforming into the hybrid form.

Dragon is considered one of the best fruits for Leviathan hunt because the M1 hybrid form can deal insane damage. The reason it's better than Magma is because its ability is easier to target than moving targets like segment and limits knockback when spamming M1. However, for the head, Magma is still better.
Interestingly, Dragon's icon in the shop is the only icon that goes out of the margin.
Dragon is the second fruit that has two icons, the other being Control.
Dragon's untransformed [C] Scorching Downfall has a similar look to Light's [X] Barrage of Light.
The icon on inventory of the permanent dragon looks merged.
Dragon is the first fruit in the Stock menu to have a unique plaque, being changed in Update 24.
There is a glitch where discounted Dragon appears on the recommended fruits bar.
There is a glitch where if the player transforms, they are sometimes "invisible" to other players.
Dragon was the first fruit to receive the 'in-progress' status, followed by Gravity as the second, both Barrier and Falcon as the third, Pain as the fourth, and Rumble as the fifth.
Dragon (East)'s full transformation emits growling sounds, unlike the Western counterpart.
As of Update 27.1, Dragons are rollable for the first time since Updates 22-23.

Due to recent changes of the Dragon (especially East), Sea Beasts can drain the user's Fury Meter to negative.
Cyborg's Energy Core V3 ability can also drain Dragon (East)'s fury meter in seconds.
Cyborg's Energy Core V3 ability can also drain Dragon (East)'s fury meter in seconds.

fruits.name: Common
trivia: The carp is the lightest of all common fish (19kg).
The heaviest fish is the Grouper (44kg).

fruits.name: Legendary
trivia: Beast Hunter is the only boat to have a rarity.

fruits.name: Natural
fruits.description: Natural is one of the three classifications of Blox Fruits, alongside Elemental and Beast. Natural fruits grant the user a wide variety of powers that do not fall strictly into elemental control or beast transformations. These abilities are often considered “superpower” types, ranging from gravity manipulation and string control to barrier creation and sound waves. There are currently 24 Natural fruits in the game.
trivia: Natural-type Blox Fruits are not any different from other fruits; it is only a classification, unlike Elemental fruits, which provide the user with immunity to physical attacks.

fruits.name: Elemental
fruits.description: Elemental is one of the three classifications of Blox Fruits, alongside Natural and Beast. Elemental fruits grant the user powers tied to specific elements, allowing them to manipulate fire, ice, light, magma, and other forces of nature. There are currently 11 Elemental fruits in the game.
trivia: The Level that the player needs for Elemental Reflex to activate is set at about 2% more than their current level.
Smoke is the only common Elemental-type fruit.
Smoke, Blizzard, Lightning and Gas are the only elemental fruits without an awakening, considering that Lightning lost its awakening.
Elemental is the second largest category of Blox Fruits, ahead of Beast and behind Natural.
Uncommon has the most elemental fruits of every category.
Lightning is currently the only fully reworked Elemental fruit.
Lightning is also the only upgradable Elemental fruit via the Admin panel
Dough is notable for being the only fruit based on an artificial substance, rather than a naturally occurring one.
Gas is the only Elemental-type fruit that has a Transformation.
Gas is the most recent (and currently most expensive) Elemental fruit.
Dough is currently the most expensive Elemental fruit to awaken, costing   18,500 to fully awaken.
Magma has the most passive abilities of all Elemental fruits
Elemental fruits have the most fruits that can deal infinite damage which are Smoke, Lightning and Blizzard.
Elemental Fruits have the most fruits that are able to Awaken out of any category.

fruits.name: Beast
fruits.description: Beast is one of the three main classifications of Blox Fruits, alongside Natural and Elemental. Beast fruits allow the user to transform into powerful animals, mythological creatures, or divine beings, granting abilities that reflect the nature of the form they take. These fruits are often defined by their transformative power, enhanced mobility, and overwhelming presence in combat. There are currently 9 Beast fruits in the game.
trivia: Despite Venom, Rubber, and Diamond having a transformation, they are currently considered Natural fruits. Gas is currently an Elemental fruit, despite it having a transformation.
There are currently no Common or Rare Beast fruits in the game.
Beast fruits make up the highest amount of Mythical fruits in the game.
Every beast fruit except Eagle has a full transformation.
Only 2 Beast-type fruits have an awakening, those fruits being Phoenix and Buddha.

Spider is not a beast fruit. Despite the fact that it has changed its name, it has not changed its type: it is a Natural fruit. It is also because that the Spider fruit allows the user to control strings instead of turning them into a spider (because it used to be the String Fruit).
Mammoth and T-Rex cost the same amount of Money and have the same Permanent Value. Leopard and Yeti now share these too.
Eagle is currently the cheapest and least rare of all the Beast-type fruits in the game.
Dragon is the most expensive Beast-type Blox Fruit, costing   15,000,000, as well as being the most expensive Blox Fruit.
Buddha is the only Beast fruit that needs to have its transformation active to be able to use its moves.
Awakened Buddha, Phoenix, T-Rex and Dragon are the only Beast fruits to have a transformation move that is not named "Transformation".
As of Update 26, Eagle is the newest beast fruit in the game.
There are currently 8 beast fruits that have an M1 (left click), these fruits are: Dragon, Kitsune, Yeti, Leopard, T-Rex, Mammoth, Awakened Phoenix and Eagle.

Many of the Beast fruits do not allow the user to use their Fighting Styles, Swords or Guns while transformed except for Buddha and Dragon (Hybrid).
Eagle technically does not have a transformation, but the user is able to yield weapons while flying.
Eagle technically does not have a transformation, but the user is able to yield weapons while flying.
As of Update 26, Eagle and Dragon are the only beast fruits that have usable skins.
Beast has the least number of Blox Fruits, after Elemental with 11 and Natrual with 21.

fruits.name: Spin
moves: — The user spins their arms and makes many wind slashes that do damage and stun to anyone caught in the attack. This move can be held to deal more damage and stun enemies for longer. This move is similar to Oroshi's [Z] move.
— The user spins at high speeds and follows the cursor, stunning and slicing anyone in their path in a whirlwind-like fashion.
— The user spins and unleashes a barrage of sharp air slashes before unleashing a stronger slash that slightly knocks their opponent back. This move is very similar to Triple Katana’s Z move.
— The user spins their hands at a rapid rate to start flying toward their cursor at a slow pace.
trivia: Spin fruit is based on a twisted prism, a geometric design that helps reduce wind resistance.
Spin, along with Rocket, are the only fruits to always be in Stock.
Despite being more expensive than Rocket, many players regard Spin worse than Rocket as the damage dealt is slightly lower and it has less stun and combo potential.
Spin's pre-rework variant is used by the Marine Rear Admirals at Great Tree in the Third Sea.

fruits.name: Blade
moves: If an NPC is lower level than the user (If the user is 105%-106%  the NPC's level) and uses Sword attacks, it functions similar to an Elemental fruit. Unlike Elemental fruits, the immunity applies even when the attacks are Aura imbued. This is also applied to other players (no need to be lower level).

Blade Reflex — When attacked by Swords, the user will swiftly pull out a blade to block the attack. Blade users will be completely immune to all swords, including ones with Aura.
If an NPC is lower level than the user (If the user is 105%-106%  the NPC's level) and uses Sword attacks, it functions similar to an Elemental fruit. Unlike Elemental fruits, the immunity applies even when the attacks are Aura imbued. This is also applied to other players (no need to be lower level).
Exception: Bosses and Raid Bosses.

— The user creates sharp, pointed blades in their arm, before swinging it around, releasing purple slashes in quick succession that travel a good distance before dissipating. Upon contact, targets are knocked back slightly.

— The user creates blades on their arms, then launches themselves towards their cursor, cutting continually in a horizontal cyclone pattern. This move is similar to Dual-Headed Blade's [Z] Assassinate.

— After making blades on their arms, the user spins around and creates a radius of slashes, creating a whirlwind-like effect around themselves. After the animation ends, NPCs or Players will jump with medium distance.
— The user spins blades on their arms quickly before hurling them at their target. Upon contact, the user is propelled forward and slits the opponent in an X shape, slightly stunning the target.

— The user creates blades on their raised right arm before rotating it rapidly, propelling air downwards and achieving flight. It's flight speed increases the lower HP the player has, unlike most flight moves.
trivia:
Although Blade's passive function is to avoid damage from sword slashes, Blade can also automatically parry swords that can create fire, freeze, cause electric shock, and even magic damage.
However, some swords can still stun Blade users, specifically Saishi and Rengoku.
However, some swords can still stun Blade users, specifically Saishi and Rengoku.
Blade is mostly known for its sword immunity.
It is recommended to become a fruit main instead of a sword main when using Blade in the first sea.
Most attacks look weird with R15 and layered clothing since the user's body stretches and does not disconnect.

Blade is a very good replacement for Elemental fruits to use at a low level since most enemies use swords in the First Sea, although it gets bad quickly, getting outclassed in every way by higher rarity fruits because of its lack of abilities, and the fact that later NPCs (Second Sea and Third Sea) more commonly use Fighting Styles.

Blade is currently the only Common fruit to have an M1 attack.
Blade is also the cheapest fruit to have an M1 attack.
Blade is also the cheapest fruit to have an M1 attack.
Blade is useful for PvP due to most bounty hunters being sword mains and unable to damage Blade users.
When spamming the M1 move really fast on air while holding the forward button, the user will be able to glide. The movement speed of the glide is based on the run speed on land.
Blade's M1 can hit sea events like Sea Beasts, although it's not recommended to use it for sea events due to its bad overall moveset against sea events.
Due to Blade's fast M1s, passives and how easy it is to obtain, Blade can be considered one of the best early-game grinding fruits for First Sea players.
A small change to Blade is that now Blade deflects attacks instead of its past version (Chop) which separated the limbs of the user to dodge the sword.
[F] Turbine Flight is faster when the user's health is lower, similar to Venom's F move.
If the user sets an auto clicker to zero milliseconds, they can glide in the air with Blade's M1's.

Blade's current icon depicts multiple, purple, circular buzzsaws. This is shown in the rotating of blades in most attacks excluding the M1s, showing that Blade is more towards circular cuts than just plain slashing.
Blade is one of the best fruits for early level grinding because of the sword immunity.
The abilities of Blade are used by the Lv. 55 boss, Chef.

fruits.name: Spring
moves: — The user's right forearm becomes a spring, launching a punch at the target, and knocking them away.
— The user's knees become springs, leaping to where they aimed, dealing damage to enemies who got hit and knocking them back.
— The user turns their legs into springs, stretches a decent distance up, and then withdraws, causing a small-sized crater which deals decent damage to enemies and knocks them up into the air.
— The user turns their legs into springs, bouncing around a square-shaped AoE area, hitting the target various times before withdrawing and turning their legs back to normal.
— The user transforms their legs into springs and leaps. The user can bounce on walls, gaining speed and momentum while doing so.
trivia: Spring is used by the Lv. 850 Boss, Jeremy.

There was a glitch with Spring’s [F] Spring Leap ability when, if it leaps into a chair in under one second, it allows the ability to continue forever if the user doesn’t move.
This glitch is now patched.
This glitch is now patched.
Spring has the potential to have possibly the worst [V] move in the game.
Similarly to Awakened Buddha's [V] move, Spring's [V] Spring Emperor can deal very high damage if used in an enclosed space.
Spring's [F] Spring Leap can go fast if it bounces off the sides of Second Sea's Bridge and can go faster than Light's [F].

fruits.name: Bomb
moves: After a certain amount of time, the landmines will deactivate and disappear, and that amount of time depends on how long the move was held. When tapped, the landmines will last for around 15 seconds. When fully charged, the lamdmines will last for around 30 seconds.

After a certain amount of time, the landmines will deactivate and disappear, and that amount of time depends on how long the move was held. When tapped, the landmines will last for around 15 seconds. When fully charged, the lamdmines will last for around 30 seconds.

— The user charges a bomb at the location of their cursor. Once the [Z] key is released, the bomb explodes, dealing damage to enemies and launching them into the air. Holding this move allows the user to change direction and charge the bomb even more, dealing bigger damage, AoE and knockback after releasing the move. The bomb can only be seen by the user. Fully charging this skill requires holding the move for 3.5 seconds.
— The user dashes forward and, upon contact with an enemy, causes an explosion that flings the target away in an arc shape. This move is similar to Superhuman / Godhuman [C] moves.

— The user creates a minefield. The amount of mines, their size and the size of the minefield depends on how long the move is held, and if an enemy steps on a landmine, they will be damaged by an explosion. If tapped, the user will create only 6 landmines, and if held, up to 25 landmines can be created. The landmines can only be seen by the user. Fully charging this skill requires holding the move for 3 seconds.
After a certain amount of time, the landmines will deactivate and disappear, and that amount of time depends on how long the move was held. When tapped, the landmines will last for around 15 seconds. When fully charged, the lamdmines will last for around 30 seconds.

— The user's health begins to drain, and they begin charging up an explosion. Upon release of the move, an explosion occurs around the user, dealing immense damage and knockback. Holding longer will cause the move to deal more damage, and it can't be cancelled even if the user takes damage. Fully charging this skill requires holding the move for 4 seconds, and drains 25% of the user's HP if fully charged. This ability's health drain is percentage-based, similar to water (although it deals less damage).
— The user jumps into the air, creating two explosions while dealing low damage to any enemies caught in them.
trivia: Bomb was known as the cheapest fruit before Update 17.3, along with Spike as the second cheapest.
Before Update 17.3, Bomb only had two moves, which were [Z] Snipe and [X] Ultimate Explosion.

Bomb's [C] Land Mines move is said to be the [C] move that deals the highest damage in the game (if all landmines are totaled when held). Although, it is almost impossible for the enemy to hit all landmines in PvP.
However, the player could use Shark Anchor's [Z] Move to make the opponent spin around and result in them exploding on multiple landmines.
However, the player could use Shark Anchor's [Z] Move to make the opponent spin around and result in them exploding on multiple landmines.
The old version of Bomb is used by the boss Stone along with the enemies Sorcerer, and Factory Staff.

Bomb's [V] Self Destruct currently has the highest knockback in the entire game.
This move is also the only move in the entire game to drain the user's HP.
This move is also the only move in the entire game to drain the user's HP.
Bomb's [X] Bomb Grab is very similar to Superhuman's [C] move, with the same sound effect and animation when dashing forward.

fruits.name: Smoke
moves: Elemental Reflex — The fruit user is immune to all physical attacks (fighting style, sword, gun) from players unless the attacks are imbued with Aura. Against NPCs, this immunity applies only if the player is a certain level above them. This effect is only effective against non-boss enemies.
— The user turns their right arm into smoke, then slams it onto the ground, dealing damage and launching enemies up while doing so.
— The user shoots forward a cloud of smoke which on impact leaves a smoke effect slashing the enemy multiple times and dealing damage.
— The user summons a large smoke tornado that expands into a large AoE, stunning enemies in the process.

— The user turns both of their arms into smoke, gaining the ability to fly and release smoke bombs which fall and explodes on contact. If held above enemies, this move can deal an infinite amount of damage, as its usage is infinite.
trivia: Out of all fruits in the game, Smoke has the lowest mastery requirements to unlock all of its moves.
Smoke is currently the cheapest Elemental-type fruit.
Since the duration of [F] Smoke Bomber is infinite and the user can attack while flying, it is considered the best grinding move in Smoke's moveset.
Smoke is one of three Elemental-type Blox Fruits without an Awakening, the second being Blizzard, and the third being Gas.
Smoke is the only Common Elemental-type Blox Fruit.
Smoke is good for Sea Beast hunting due to the fact that every move can hit them.
The sound that plays during elemental immunity is the same as the Gas fruit.
NPCs cannot leave the AoE of [X] Smoke Blast until it ends.

fruits.name: Spike
moves: Once released, the direction at which the spikes summon can be controlled by the cursor.
Once released, the direction at which the spikes summon can be controlled by the cursor.

— When tapped, the user summons a singular spike from the ground at the location of their cursor, launching hit enemies into the air. The longer the ability is held, the bigger the spike gets, as well as summon more smaller spikes around it. Fully charging this skill requires holding the move for 1 second. The maximum amount of spikes summoned by this move is 6.
This move is quite similar to awakened Dough's X.

— The user rotates their arms in a spinning motion and starts slowly rising up, inflicting damage, and stunning anyone caught in the attack. The longer the move is held, the greater the amount of damage it will deal, the bigger the move's hitbox will get, and the longer the move will last. When tapped, the duration of the move is 1.5 seconds. This move can be held for 3 seconds.

— The user transforms into a spiky ball and starts rolling forward in the direction of the cursor, stunning any enemy they touch and pulling them along as they roll. This move has a duration of 3 seconds. 
This move shares characteristics with Dough's F move.

— The user conjures a row of spikes in the direction they are facing, each spike being bigger than the last. The damage and the amount of spikes increases the longer the ability is held. Tapping the move will summon 4 spikes, while fully holding the move will summon 7 spikes. Fully charging this skill requires holding the move for 3 seconds.
Once released, the direction at which the spikes summon can be controlled by the cursor.
trivia: Spike is infamously known as the "Walmart Dough" because of its moves being similar to awakened Dough, specifically [X] (on ground) and [F] moves that compare to Spike's [Z] and [C] moves.

Spike used to always be in stock, along with Bomb, but this was changed when Rocket and Spin became the new two cheapest fruits.
Before Update 17.3, Spike had only two moves, which were [Z] Rush and [X] Spiky Ball.
Before Update 17.3, Spike had only two moves, which were [Z] Rush and [X] Spiky Ball.
The Factory Staff and Sorcerer use old Spike's [X] Spiky Ball.
Spike is currently the most expensive Common Fruit.
Spike is one of the only fruits without a transformation whose [C] move has longer cooldown and higher energy requirement than the [V] move.
Spike is the only Common fruit without a [F] move.

If aimed correctly, and if lucky, the enemy can get hit by more than one spike from Spike's [Z] and [V] moves.
Enemies with bigger hitbox have a higher chance to get hit by multiple spikes. (e.g. Buddha)
Enemies with bigger hitbox have a higher chance to get hit by multiple spikes. (e.g. Buddha)

Spike's [X] Whirlwind move's hitbox seems to only have a horizontal reach represented by the spinning hands, but it actually resembles more of a "square". This is supported by the fact that, if a NPC is lured under a tree, and the user uses this move while being on the tree, fully holding this move will reach and hit the NPC.
During the [C] Spiky Ball move, the user is able to jump. However, they cannot use neither double jump or Air Jump.

There is a bug that sometimes when the [C] Spiky Ball gets canceled, the rolling animation will play, and the user will "roll" forward as if they executed the actual attack. During this, the user is able to freely use all other abilities, and the effects of the bug will last for only 3 seconds.
There was a bug that when a physical Spike was held, its eyes were behind the model, not in front where they were supposed to be.

fruits.name: Flame
moves: The bullets lose aim assistance the further they travel.
The bullets lose aim assistance the further they travel.
Can be held to deal slightly more damage and bigger AoE.
This move is similar to Lightning's V and Gravity's V.
Can be held to deal slightly more damage and bigger AoE.
This move is similar to Lightning's V and Gravity's V.

Elemental Reflex — The fruit user is immune to all physical attacks (fighting style, sword, gun) from players unless the attacks are imbued with Aura. Against NPCs, this immunity applies only if the player is a certain level above them. This effect is only effective against non-boss enemies.
— The user shoots several flaming bullets that explode, hitting multiple targets in the direction of the user’s cursor.
— The user fires a fast, fist-shaped, flaming projectile from their hand in the direction of the cursor, causing a devastating explosion when it lands.
— The user slams the ground, releasing a surge of fire around the user, pushing anyone caught in the pillar upward and dealing damage in an huge fire column.

— The user creates a large orb of fire and throws it, which explodes when it hits a surface or reaches its maximum range, dealing a high amount of damage to anyone within its radius. This can be charged to deal slightly more damage.
— The user's legs turn into flames, granting them the ability to fly.

— The user shoots forward seven explosive blue sparks of heat, which spread out and will navigate its way to the cursor. Upon hitting an enemy, the enemy will get stunned for a few moments. Deals good damage if every bullet hits the target.
The bullets lose aim assistance the further they travel.

— The user fires an extremely fast beam of fire from their hands in the direction of their cursor which explodes on contact with a surface, dealing damage and knocking back nearby enemies. It also leaves behind a fire effect that tick-damages enemies who enter its area, lasting for five seconds.

— The user launches themselves and nearby enemies into the air using a spiral of flames, dealing damage, pulling up caught enemies and leaving behind a fire effect that deals tick-damage to enemies who enter its area (if the move was done on the ground), lasting for five seconds.

— The player creates a massive ball of fire and throws it, which explodes when it hits a surface or reaches its maximum range, dealing a huge amount of damage to anyone in its radius, and leaves behind a fire effect that tick-damages enemies who enter its area, lasting for 5 seconds. 
Can be held to deal slightly more damage and bigger AoE.
This move is similar to Lightning's V and Gravity's V.

— The user launches forward, then flies at medium speed with a trail of fire burning along the user's back. The user leaves a loop of shockwaves afterward. Similar to Light's flight, the lower the user's health, the slower they will be.
trivia: Flame fruit is used as the symbol in the Blox Fruits game logo.

The awakened [V] move shares its name with the ultimate fire spell from Elemental Battlegrounds (a game developed by Gamer Robot). The difference is that Elemental Battleground's spell Hell's Core creates an explosion around the user, unlike the move seen in Blox Fruits, which is a launchable fire bomb.
Flame, along with Ice and Quake, were the first fruits which received an awakening.
The awakened [Z] move has been reworked twice.
Flames unawakened [X] has been reworked 3 times.
Despite having control over fire, the user does not have immunity to lava which can be found at the Magma Village, Flame and Magma Raids, and the hot side of Hot and Cold.
Flame is currently the cheapest fruit to have an awakening.

Pre-rework awakened [Z] move used to have a visual glitch, where even if it seemed like it had disappeared (due to not hitting), it was still moving, invisibly. (The projectile would still hit despite it seeming like it had vanished.)
Before the rework, Flame's [V] move did not have the ability to charge up and deal more damage, it would just take around one second before being able to cast it.
Flames [V] move used to spin before it got reworked.
Flames [Z] move shares the same effect with Ice’s [Z] move, Ice Spears, but has different colors.
Flame’s [X] Move is weaker awakened if all tick damage is avoided. Barely hitting the enemy can cause this to happen.
Flame’s awakened [X] Move can be bugged to knockback NPCs even if it doesn’t hit. This is due to the way the script is made and thus still deals damage and knockback, just no effects.
Flame is currently the cheapest Uncommon fruit in the game.
Flame's [V] move had a bug where before the rework in update 17. It used to disappear and move similar to Rumble's [V] move, giving it bad range.
Flame's [Z] move before getting reworked used to have burn effect. However, the projectile would have a glitchy hitbox and may not register the hit.
Flame's [X] move before the rework had a bug where if it hit a player would make a explosion but the beam kept moving and expanding. Then made a 2nd explosion before ending.
Players can find Flame fruit meshes of the explosions during update 17.3 called firewind. They are still existing in the Roblox studio catalog.
Pre-rework awakened [Z] used to grow in size as it traveled, and would cast a bigger burning area when hit.
flame fruit along with dragon are the only confirmed fruits to use free models before being reworked.

fruits.name: Fragments
trivia: On PS5, the player will still be able to see how many fragments they have even if they haven't entered Second Sea.
To see how much Fragments the player has, they need to hover over the Money value on PC. On console and mobile, it always displays.
The Rare Artifact used to fulfill some of the purposes of this currency, but it was then removed in Update 11.
Before Update 20, this currency didn't appear when the player was in the First Sea.
The maximum amount of Fragments a player can hold is   1,000,000,000

  10,000 to get the 2 Dragon seats (  5,000 each from the Dragon Tamer)
  15,800 to max the Shipwright subclass
  62,100 to upgrade Gravity, Eagle, Pain and Lightning fruits in the Admin Panel
  9,500 to get all Eagle skins from Barista

fruits.name: Ice
moves: Elemental Reflex — The fruit user is immune to all physical attacks (fighting style, sword, gun) from players unless the attacks are imbued with Aura. Against NPCs, this immunity applies only if the player is a certain level above them. This effect is only effective against non-boss enemies.
Ice Trident — Whenever Ice is selected, the user can slash with an icy trident by clicking the left mouse button or tapping on mobile. This can hit Blade users as it is part of the fruit.
Frost Walker — The user will create walkable ice platforms each time they touch the sea. Every ice platform the user creates takes up 4 energy. It will only take energy if the user walks on water.
— The user hits enemies with their Ice Trident, dealing damage as a fruit (can hit Blade users).
— The user fires a barrage of ice shards that rapidly travels to the enemy (Does not break Instinct if the projectiles do not touch the ground). This move is very similar to Diamond's X move.

— The user stomps and releases a medium-sized surge of ice from the floor below, which deals damage and knocks back anyone it hits (Does not break Instinct). The ice rapidly falls and vanishes within two to three seconds. The ice surge covers a distance of about five to six seconds of walking from its starting point to where it ends.
— The user creates a bird made of ice and launches it at where they are aiming, freezing whoever is hit. This move explodes on contact and stuns enemies for 1.5 seconds.

— The user casts the ground into ice, creating a huge AoE area that freezes and damages enemies. Often used by sword and gun users as their primary combo-starter. This move disables all attacks, dashes, and jumps from both enemies and the user for two seconds.
— The user hits enemies with their Ice Trident, dealing damage as a fruit (can hit Blade users).

— The user fires multiple glacial hurricanes that travel at slow speeds towards the cursor. Upon contact with the enemy, it will slowly deal damage and while stunning them for the duration of the move. This move breaks Instinct on startup, but it can be easily prevented by Instinct-Tricking.
— The user unleashes a huge surge of ice, which launches enemies away and deals good damage. (Does not break Instinct).
— The user launches a large, high-speed ice dragon into the air, which then crashes down at the aimed area, causing a huge AoE cold explosion and freezing enemies.

— The user unleashes a gigantic wave of piercing ice around them, freezing everyone in its radius and causing damage. This move disables all attacks, dash, jump from enemies and the user for two seconds.

— Along with the ability to passively walk on water, the user gains the ability to skate at high speeds. When the user unlocks this ability, the ice patterns under their feet when they walk on water will change into a brighter blue color.
trivia: [Z] Ice Spears used to be the Awakened [Z] move before it got reworked.
The user can wall run on an inclined walls by holding down [F] Ice Skating, and will run faster than usual if they try running straight on them.
[Z] Cold Storm is similar to Blizzard’s [X] White Out but slower.
It is possible to glitch through thin walls (for example: Mansion or Café walls) with [F] Ice Skating.
[C] Ice Bird is better than [C] Frozen Dragon for combos.
The player can use Flash Step onto the trail of ice on water.
Some skins can cause the trail of ice on water to be generated more slowly as players run.
[V] Absolute Zero shares the same name with the Aura Skin, Absolute Zero.

Ice and Light are the only fruits that have a unique weapon that can be used when equipped (Gas and Blade could be considered yet another one with a weapon of its own, just not visible to the naked eye).
[C] Frozen Dragon's stun time depends on how far the enemy is (i.e. the further the enemy is from the user, the longer the stun).
Ice shares the Frost Walker passive with Yeti, with both having the same purpose and similar path models.
Sometimes, [V] Absolute Zero can make the animation in air, but the AoE does not appear in the floor.
Ice’s Elemental Reflex sound is the same as Blizzard's.

fruits.name: Sand
moves: Elemental Reflex — The wielder is immune to all physical attacks (fighting style, sword, gun) from players unless the attacks are imbued with Aura. Against NPCs, this immunity applies unless they are of a higher level. This effect is only effective against non-boss enemies.

Sand Dissolve — Sand users will take twice as much damage in Water and take regular water damage with Shark V1, and none if they are a Shark V2, V3, or V4 user.
(Top image: Standard Health drain in water. Bottom image: Sand user Health drain in water)
— The user creates a burst of sand in front of themselves, launching anyone hit by it up in the air and dealing a decent amount of damage.
— The user conjures a circle of quicksand that pulls a target once stepped on, pulling them into the air and crushing them, dealing a decent amount of damage.

— The user creates a small sand tornado in front of them that sucks up players in its radius while stunning them and carrying them upwards in the air and then back down, while dealing decent damage. This move is similar to Twin Hooks Z move.
— The user gathers a ball of sand in their hand and shoots it at an opponent. This attack has high knockback and inflicts a good amount of damage.
— The player turns their legs into sand, allowing them to fly at a slow pace.

— The user creates a long-range high-speed burst of sand in a straight line in front of themselves, launching anyone hit by it up in the air and dealing good damage, while slightly stunning them in the process. This move can be used in the air, but will form on the ground.

— The user throws two piles of sand that can be aimed in the air. If it hits an opponent, it will levitate the enemy higher and higher into the air while trapping them inside a sphere of dust. Then the sand will finally explode and deal good damage to the opponent. This move is good for combos.

— The user creates a large cone-shaped tornado made of sand that slowly moves forward. Anyone caught within its radius will get stunned and pushed higher into the air while receiving continuous damage. This move can be used midair.

— The player creates a lightning-infused vortex-like ball of sand from their hands, and throws it towards an opponent. This orb explodes upon contact, causing a large AoE shockwave of sand and purple electricity within a large radius and dealing heavy damage to anyone within its hitbox.
— The player’s legs turn into a little sand tornado, allowing them to fly at a pace faster than Sand Flight.
trivia: Sand is the one of the only Blox Fruits that has a passive which gives a disadvantage to the user in the game, along with Control.
Awakened Sand's [F] move shares the same name as Blizzard's [F] move - Tornado Flight.
The [Z] and [X] move's (both awakened and unawakened) range increases depending on the mastery.
Sand currently has the slowest flight in the game.

fruits.name: Dark
moves: Elemental Reflex — The fruit user is immune to all physical attacks (fighting style, sword, gun) from players unless the attacks are imbued with Aura. Against NPCs, this immunity applies only if the player is a certain level above them. This effect is only effective against non-boss enemies.
— The user pushes their hand forward, grabbing rocks from the ground and leaving a crater as rocks with a black aura are fired towards the direction they aimed at.

— The user creates a black hole on their cursor, trapping anyone caught in it and dealing damage to them before they are launched away. This move does more damage and causes longer stun the longer it is held, and can be held for 3 seconds.
— The user opens up a large black hole around them, causing damage to anyone who gets trapped in it. This move also levitates its target.
— The user manifests a large orb of darkness, launching it towards their cursor, dragging targets inside of it, and dealing damage.
— The user summons a dark sword and launches a small vertical slash toward their cursor that applies a small blinding effect, teleporting the user near the target, and dealing damage.
— The user creates a black hole that lashes out dark tentacles in front of them, stunning and pulling in targets when holding the move, dealing damage.
— The user creates a large black hole that stuns targets, dealing rapid damage while getting bigger the longer it is held.
— The user manifests a ravenous, spikey, dark sphere and launches it at their cursor. Afterwards, the sphere pulls targets towards it before imploding and launching them away, dealing damage.
— The user teleports, leaving behind a purple afterimage of themselves, allowing them to avoid incoming attacks.
trivia: Dark is not great for aerial combat (unawakened), thus Angel race would be an effective counter.

The Dark raid NPCs have low damage but the player will have a high chance of death if they get stuck in a Dark user's Black Hole move, since it keeps them in place and allows the rest of the Raid NPCs to attack them freely. It is recommended to have a Buddha user.

To the average eye, there is only one mobility move. However, skilled players can take advantage of another potential mobility move, which is the awakened [Z] move, Dimensional Slash. In a fight, the user can confuse enemies by using Dimensional Slash on an NPC to quickly teleport away.

Dark's [X] Black Spiral move instantaneously teleports to its maximum range when it is aimed at an open space in the air. It is especially dangerous when using shift-lock (whose default direction is forward) during aerial combat.
[F] Ghastly Step has a much shorter range than Flash Step though can be used in the air.

There is a glitch involving Dark [C] not allowing itself to hit Buddha users. This could be most likely due to the confusing hitbox of Buddha. To deal with this, aim it at the body of the Buddha user as that is where the main hitbox mainly is located.

The old version of Dark is used by the Raid Boss, Darkbeard, the Dark Raid NPCs (Darkness/Dark users), the Possessed Mummy NPCs and the Elite Pirate, Diablo (the awakened version), as well as the NPCs and Boss in the Hell Dimension in the Cursed Dual Katana Puzzle.
The Dark users in the Dark Raid are not called Dark Users, instead they are called Darkness Users.
Pre-rework unawakened [V] used to have a bigger explosion.
Awakened Dark [Z] Dimensional Slash have same sound effects with Dark Blade [X] Dark Air Slash.
There's a bug where if the user uses Unawakened [Z] Dark Rocks and unequips/switches to another item in their hotbar after releasing the move, they'll be able to move around while throwing the rocks.

fruits.name: Fire Feather
trivia: A total of  26  is required to unlock everything that uses this material.

fruits.name: Electric Wing
trivia: A total of  37  is required to buy everything that requires this material. (Excluding Rare Scroll and Legendary Scroll because they can be crafted multiple times.)

fruits.name: Fool's Gold
trivia: Fool's Gold is a real mineral called Pyrite.
As of Update 20, it is one of the most required materials, mostly for the new accessories and upgrades.

In a regular Ship Raid, the large ship drops  3  Fool's Gold, while the small ships do not drop any of this material. However, it does not notify the player upon receiving Fool's Gold from the large ship for it is a glitch.
A total of  82  Fool's Gold is required to craft everything that requires this material (excluding all Scrolls as they can be crafted an indefinite number of times).

fruits.name: Angel Wings
trivia: A total of 95 Angel Wings is required to craft everything that requires this material (including Eagle upgrades).

fruits.name: Diamond
moves: Tapping the move will cause the user to fire diamond shards in all directions.
Hold down the move while transformed to untransform.
Tapping the move will cause the user to fire diamond shards in all directions.
Hold down the move while transformed to untransform.
It shares similar visuals to Ice's Ice Spears and mechanically resembles Leopard's Z move, Finger Revolver, and even comes with the final blast, just like Leopard.
It shares similar visuals to Ice's Ice Spears and mechanically resembles Leopard's Z move, Finger Revolver, and even comes with the final blast, just like Leopard.

Encrustation — The user gains the ability to envelop themselves in a shimmering coat of diamonds, providing a 23% damage reduction. While transformed, the user is able to use the rest of Diamond's moveset while also retaining full access to their swords, guns, and fighting styles.
— The user lunges themselves in the direction of their cursor, damaging any enemies caught in their way. Upon contact with a surface, the tackle creates a crater that explodes with diamonds.

— The user's skin transforms into solid diamond while growing out two diamond spikes on their back, giving a 23% defense boost. Upon transformation, the user releases a large AoE blast of light.
Tapping the move will cause the user to fire diamond shards in all directions.
Hold down the move while transformed to untransform.

— The user fires a storm of diamond shards from their hands, with the amount of shards fired depending on how long the move is held down for, before releasing a large, final shard that explodes on the opponent, dealing great damage.
It shares similar visuals to Ice's Ice Spears and mechanically resembles Leopard's Z move, Finger Revolver, and even comes with the final blast, just like Leopard.

— The user uses their body to reflect concentrated light, releasing a large AoE blast of light and dealing medium damage while simultaneously blinding hit enemies for 3 seconds, soft stunning them. This move can be held to slightly increase size and damage.

— The user creates a barrage of floating diamond mirrors in the air surrounding themselves. Each mirror releases a blue beam of concentrated light, dealing continuous damage to enemies caught in their radius.
trivia: [TAP] Radiant Lunge is similar to an old move prior to the revamp, Beaming Tackle. Similarly, the revamped [X] Shard Storm is a rework of Diamond Hail, and [C] Shimmering Disruption is the newer Solar Flare.
The [Z] Encrust move, when used against a wall or corner, will deal around 3.5x more damage.
Diamond is one of the few fruits in the game that can actively distort enemies. Others are Gravity, Quake and Venom.
Diamond has one of the largest differences between its physical model and its fruit icon (both the face, stem, and overall shape).
Diamond is one of the two Uncommon fruits that is not Elemental and does not have an awakening.
Diamond is the only Natural Uncommon Blox Fruit.
Diamond is one of the only non-beast type fruits that can transform, the others being Rubber, Venom and Gas.

For some reason, if the user's character does not have skin, [Z] Encrust will not turn their character blue.
This may be because the new Diamond changes the color of the user's skin, like Rubber, instead of coating their avatar with a diamond texture, which was the old Diamond.
This may be because the new Diamond changes the color of the user's skin, like Rubber, instead of coating their avatar with a diamond texture, which was the old Diamond.

There's a glitch that can make the user avatar fling very far by using the [TAP] ability while using a certain Roblox avatar. This can also be done by jump-dashing and tapping if you have a weak device with high ping.
The eyes of the fruit in inventory are different from physical model.

fruits.name: Light
moves: Elemental Reflex — The wielder is immune to all physical attacks (fighting style, sword, gun) from players unless the attacks are imbued with Aura. Against NPCs, this immunity applies unless they are of a higher level. This effect is only effective against non-boss enemies.

Light Spear — The user gains a spear made of light to use as their M1 attack similar to the Ice Trident. However, this can hit Blade users as it is a fruit attack. Note that the user does not need to put stats in sword to make the spear more powerful because increasing the fruit stat alone makes the fruit do more damage, including the M1 light spear. The user can also enable Aura on the light spear (It is only visual, the damage does not change).
— The user hits enemies with their Light Spear, dealing damage as a fruit (can hit Blade users).
— The user shoots a high-speed beam of light from their leg in the direction of the cursor, knocking back enemies.
— The user teleports upwards and shoots about 15 small light beams that explode upon impact in an area around their cursor. Holding the aforementioned hotkey will send more projectiles.

— The user creates a series of mirrors with beams of light between them, which teleport the user to a point above where their cursor was, after which the user shoots a beam of light downwards, creating a large explosion beneath them (AoE).

— The user kneels and sends a large amount of light from their palm, which then causes multiple beams to be summoned from the sky in a radius shown by a circle that appears upon activating the move. These rays explode and stun enemies upon impact.

— The user turns into light and flies at a fast pace. The user cannot change the direction of the flight manually, but they can still change direction if they hit a surface (such as a wall, the ground or even an enemy). Its speed is dependent on the player's remaining health.
— The user hits enemies with their Light Spear, dealing damage as a fruit (can hit Blade users).

— The user summons a bow and an arrow made out of high-pressure light. The arrow has a long range and good stun (only stuns on precise hit, not AoE). The move can be held to generate more arrows, having a maximum of 3 arrows when fully charged which do AoE damage. The longer it's held, the more arrows will generate and the more damage it does. If it is fully held and all 3 arrows hit the enemy, it will do 2x more damage than the tap version (1 arrow).

— The user shoots a beam of light from their right hand, which they can move around. If aimed correctly, it stuns the target for as long as the skill lasts and does high damage. This move can be held with the aforementioned hotkey, similar to the unawakened [X] move (multi-hit).

— The user turns into light and dashes forward. If they touch an enemy while dashing, the player consecutively kicks them around and then smashes them back onto the ground, similar to Electric Claw's [C] move. This move can be used as a combo finisher, or sometimes, a combo extender.

— The user summons a huge barrage of light beams on their cursor, falling from the air that create explosions upon impact in a radius shown by a circle that appears upon activating the move. This move can be Instinct tricked, but it will drain an opponent's Instinct dodges in less than 2-3 seconds. Also, this move stuns (only soft stun) while draining Instinct, so the user can line up another move, for example, the C move, and then follow it up with the [X] move.

— The user turns into light and flies extremely fast, slightly faster than its unawakened counterpart. Unlike the unawakened version, this move can change direction mid-flight, but the maneuverability is poor due to its snappy nature.
trivia: The light spear was extremely glitchy the first time it was updated. For instance, running against a low wall like the one in Jungle can make the user fall down while their character glitches. This was fixed a few hours or days later, during the Christmas Event.
In the first few updates, Light's sword (which is now a spear) used to be a separate item instead of being within the fruit.
Awakened Light has the second fastest flight speed in the game if the user is at full Health, behind Western Dragon.
Unawakened Light's flight move is uncontrollable and only flies straight. Fortunately, the awakened version can be controlled but can only make ~45 degree turns.

When flying with Light, if the user collides with any solid object, the user will bounce off it. This is because of the properties of light in real life, which make it bounce off of surfaces. This is also known as specular reflection.

If the player were using [C] Lightspeed Destroyer and get teleported (like during trials) or opponent out the server, the player will transform into a star (literally). The user still can use their abilities, but in the appearance of a star.
Light can be more effective in AFK grinding than Magma due to the light spear. Since the user can use an auto-clicker with it, Ice also works in this case.

Strangely, [V] Sky Beam Barrage is better in the matter that it breaks Instinct, though it lacks in the large AoE that the Awakened version has. The start-up lag of the unawakened version is also more noticeable like Lightning's [C] move.

[C] Lightspeed Destroyer, acts somewhat similarly to Portal's [Z] Portal Dash, as both moves involve the player teleporting to the enemy, dealing damage by kicking the target around, and smashing them down to the ground.
[X] Barrage of Light is very similar to Dragon's [C] Scorching Downfall.

Although Portal [C] World Warp is faster than [F] Shining Flight, [F] Shining Flight is good for getting to specific places on islands, like the top of the Great Tree, rather than the default spawn point of that island.
Despite light realistically having no stationary mass, Light Ray is able to knock targets into midair.
Due to a bug, Elemental Reflex doesn’t function at random times for an extended period, although this is extremely rare.
In the early days of Blox Fruits's development, the [V] move used to be the flight move instead of the [F], which was changed for release.
There is a bug with [C] Lightspeed Destroyer move in which it makes the user's accessory invisible (ex. Holiday Cloak, Kitsune Ribbon etc.)
The Light Raid's final island has a structure that is also used in Elemental Battlegrounds' light map. (a game also made by Gamer Robot)

If the user lands [C] Lightspeed Destroyer at high attitude, the enemy will fall more slowly than at low or on land because there's no ground for the final hit (which makes lag and screenshake). This makes it easier to combo but also does less damage.
Rarely, in some servers, if players use [X] Hand of the Emperor on ground, it will leave a permanent dust effect where it passed. This can make lag when looked.

Due to a bug, if the player commences a friendly match in colosseum or friendly arena and lose the match, the light spear will disappear. To get it back, the player needs to reset character (respawn).

fruits.name: Rubber
moves: This applies to Gun Users and NPCs if the NPC is lower level than the user as if it worked as an Elemental.
Exception: Shocker, Mythological Pirate, Bosses and Raid Bosses.

Rubber Body — Similarly to Elemental Reflex, Rubber users will have complete immunity to all guns, Lightning and Electric fighting style, even those with Aura. However, it does not grant immunity to Electric Claw, Pole (1st Form) and Pole (2nd Form).
This applies to Gun Users and NPCs if the NPC is lower level than the user as if it worked as an Elemental.
Exception: Shocker, Mythological Pirate, Bosses and Raid Bosses.
— The user stretches their arm using their right hand, dealing damage to whoever is in the direction of the arm.
— The user pulls their arms backward, stretching them as they do so. Upon releasing the respective button, the user springs their arms forward, dealing knockback as well as damage.
— The user stretches their right leg upwards, and upon releasing the respective button they launch their leg down, dealing damage as well as a small amount of knockback.
— The user does a barrage of punches towards the direction they are facing, dealing continuous damage. Holding down the respective button for this move causes it to last longer.

— Upon activation, the user gains a pink-like texture on their skin and begins to emit steam. While having this move active, all animations change to be faster and all moves gain a damage increase, but the user's energy regeneration is reduced by 25%. This ability will last as long as the user does not die or run out of energy.

— The user stretches both their arms in the direction of the cursor. If they hit an object, the user will be launched at a fast speed towards the object. This can be used to launch the user beyond or above the object. If they hit a player/NPC, the user will launch towards the player/NPC, dealing damage and slight knockback. If held, the user can charge it up to four stages, which is seen by rings appearing around the user. Each stage allows the user's arms to go a bit farther upon release. The further the user is from said object, the further the user goes.
— The user quickly stretches their arm, dealing damage in the cursor's direction.
— The user pulls their arms backward, resulting in them being stretched. Upon releasing the respective button, the user quickly springs their arms forward, dealing knockback as well as damage.
— The user teleports above the location of their cursor and quickly throws a heavy punch in its direction, breaking the ground below them and dealing damage to targets as well as knockback.
— The user launches a barrage of high-speed punches in the direction they are facing, dealing continuous damage. Holding down the respective button for this move causes it to last longer.

— The user's skin goes back to its normal state and they stop emitting steam, causing the abilities gained while transformed to be removed, but restoring the user's energy regeneration back to normal.

— The user stretches both their arms in the direction of the cursor. If they hit an object, the user will be launched at a fast speed towards the object. This can be used to launch the user beyond or above the object. If they hit a player/NPC, the user will launch towards, dealing damage and slight knockback. If held, the user can charge it up to four stages, which is seen by rings appearing around the user. Each stage allows the user's arms to go a bit farther upon release. The further the user is from said object, the further the user goes.  Although this version goes much further than the untransformed version, the sudden speed of this move sometimes makes the anticheat system think the player is hacking and will be teleported back.
trivia: Rubber is the only fruit having a resistance against three attack types. (Fruits, Guns and Fighting Styles)
Previously, Pole (1st Form) could not damage Rubber, which may have been a bug as it was changed in Update 20.
Rubber [F] is the highest impulse dash move in the game.
If used properly, the [F] move can be faster than Dragon's [F] at the start.
Rubber is one of the Blox Fruits to have gotten a rework in Update 17.3.
Rubber used to only cost   100,000, however, it now costs   750,000. (Maybe due to its Transformation buff)

Rubber was originally named Gum.
Rubber used to have a move called "Gum Rocket" which would function as a great mobility tool. This was replaced with "Transformation".
Some of Rubber's old moves used to be able to pick up physical fruit when dropped on the ground.
Rubber used to have a move called "Gum Rocket" which would function as a great mobility tool. This was replaced with "Transformation".
Some of Rubber's old moves used to be able to pick up physical fruit when dropped on the ground.
Despite being immune to Lightning, Rubber does not provide immunity to the attacks used by the Thunder God, due to him being a boss.
If Rubber's M1 attack is held while in the air and released while the user's mouse is on a menu button, they'll be able to stay in the air for a long time and then fall down.
Permanent Rubber costs the same amount of Robux   as Dark Blade.
