If the player holds  or tap Cursed Dual Katana's [X] move, then quickly switch to [X] or [C] move of the Rubber Fruit when it is released, the transformed variant of the [X]/[C] move will be used, regardless of whether the player is in their transformed state.
The [Z] skill has the same name as the Phoenix unawakened [Z] move.
Rubber is the first ever fruit to have a M1 outside of a transformed or unawakened state.
Rubber M1, Z, X, and C changes color depending on the user's aura color, similar to Spider's V move (Heavenly Punishment).
Rubber is the only fruit to only have an M1 before unlocking an actual move, make this is the only fruit with a [Z] move mastery requirement of over 1.
Rubber is the first fruit to be a non-beast type fruit with a transformation, followed by Diamond and Venom in second, and Gas in third.
Rubber is based on the Gum-Gum fruit from One piece

fruits.name: Ghost
moves: Note: The user can make the two ghosts stop attacking others by not pressing any icon (fighting style, fruit, sword and gun). This means when the user takes damage, or the ghost takes damage but don't press any icon, the ghost won't do anything.

Note: The user can make the two ghosts stop attacking others by not pressing any icon (fighting style, fruit, sword and gun). This means when the user takes damage, or the ghost takes damage but don't press any icon, the ghost won't do anything.

Resurrection First Life Resurrected (Final life) — Once the user dies, they will resurrect with 50% HP. When this ability activates, the user will receive a message saying "You have been given an extra life!" The user's physical in-game avatar will become translucent with a green glow.

— The user dashes forward, leaving a turquoise trail behind them. Any enemies hit with this move are covered in ectoplasm and frozen, causing the enemy to get stunned for 1.3 seconds before exploding.
— The user shrieks, creating a whirlwind of ghosts which revolve around them, trapping the enemy and pushing them back slightly.

— The user starts screaming, spitting ghosts that stun and push the enemy back. This move can be held to deal more damage and last longer. The first hit deals the most damage, which decreases over time. If the enemy takes continuous damage, their screen turns green with ghosts and a skull appearing at the center.

— The user creates two ghosts (also called a clone) versions of themselves who imitate their attacks, including front dash and jumping. The ghost uses their fighting style, and sword if held out. These ghosts also can use Ghost moves, which will aim at the point the user aims at. After a while (slightly shorter than the cooldown - 20 seconds) they will disappear.
Note: The user can make the two ghosts stop attacking others by not pressing any icon (fighting style, fruit, sword and gun). This means when the user takes damage, or the ghost takes damage but don't press any icon, the ghost won't do anything.
— The user turns into a ghost and flies, leaving a blue trail surrounded by ghosts.
trivia: Ghost is the third fruit to have a change in rarity, the first being Portal, the second being Love and the fourth being Creation.

The resurrection effect will last forever even if the user switches to another fruit. It only disappears when they die or exit the game. Also, the green effect can affect transformed fruits or moves like unawakened Dough's [F] move.
If the user dies by Water, the resurrection passive will not work.
[V] Ghost Busters does not stack damage from skills, but it does increase the hitbox.
[V] Ghost Busters masters up the fighting style or sword of the user no matter what they are using.
The ghosts in [V] Ghost Busters can sometimes be named "Elf". (Exclusive to Christmas Updates)
[C] Cries of the Underworld is similar to Sound's [X] Fortissimo but holdable.
[V] Ghost Busters can hit Ice Admiral with its moves.
Permanent Ghost's icon when stored in the inventory uses Revive's icon.
As of Update 26, when Ghost is equipped, the (slightly modified) Revive icon will be shown instead of the new icon.

fruits.name: Magma
moves: Elemental Reflex — The wielder is immune to all physical attacks (fighting style, sword, gun) from players unless the attacks are imbued with Aura. Against NPCs, this immunity applies unless they are of a higher level. This effect is only effective against non-boss enemies.
Lava Immunity — The user is immune to the Lava puddles found on the Hot and Cold and Magma Village islands, as well as in Flame and Magma raids.

(Awakened) Magmatic Feet — When the player awakens at least one of the Magma skills, it grants the user the ability to walk on water by passively creating small magma puddles to walk on, similar to the Ice Fruit, each creation consumes about 4 energy.
Scorching Puddles — Almost all of Magma's moves leave pools/puddles of lava, these can be bigger or smaller each use. Similar to Venom's Puddles of Poison, they can deal tick damage over time.

— The user creates two hands, and after a very short delay will clap into each other dealing damage to any enemy within the vicinity. The hitbox of the hands is larger than it seems considering the small hand size.

— The user will create an eruption below them. If an enemy is standing right on top of it, they will be launched into the air, dealing damage. A lava pool will also stay for a few seconds and deal damage over time to enemies standing on it. There can be 1-3 lava pools that can spawn at a time.

— The user creates a large ball of magma and launches it to the direction of the cursor. If it hits the ground, it will explode and will also leave a bigger lava pool that will stay for a few seconds.

— The user creates 4-5 "meteors" that will launch in the direction of their cursor. Hitting the ground will cause these projectiles to explode into smaller pieces that look like lava pools but don't do damage. Out of all the attacks the Magma's moveset has, this is likely to be the most devastating skill out of all of them.

— The user goes into the ground and create lava pools that last for about one second. Spinning around can deal a lot of damage to the enemy because the lava pools stack on each other. Keep in mind that the player can still get damaged while using Magma Floor. If released, the player will jump out of the floor, dealing damage and knocking enemies high up if they are above them.

— The user unleashes a massive amount of melting hot magma rocks dealing heavy damage when everything hits and leaving behind multiple magma puddles. The move can be aimed freely, allowing the projectiles to fall naturally if fired upward.
Holding the move will release more magma rocks.

— The user dashes, leaking magma onto the ground and if they hit an opponent, they will fire multiple continuous blasts of searing hot magma from their palm, and then finish it off with a stronger blast that deals knockback and great damage. The opponent's screen will turn to a shade of dark orange and both the opponent's screen and the user's screen will have continuous shaking.

— The user launches a large hound-like magma projectile that deals large damage and leaves magma puddles under it. This move can drag enemies or NPCs for a certain distance and stuns for a brief amount of time if directly cast on an enemy.

— The user amasses a great amount of scorching-hot magma on their right hand, before throwing it all out towards the cursor as all of the magma hits a surface and causes a great explosion of magma puddles while dealing extreme damage to anyone they hit. Anyone near the explosion will have their screen's color change to a shade of dark orange.

— The user creates a beast crafted from magma below then sits on top of it and takes off, leaving trails of burning hot magma behind. If released, the beast turns into puddles of lava that deal good damage on contact. The user can only fly for 26 seconds, however. This move can be used as an attack (if near the enemy and aimed properly) and a good means of transportation.
trivia: The reworked, unawakened version of Magma was created by Kio, also known as @LegendOfKio on X, a contributor who played an important role in remaking the entire fruit in Update 17.3.
If a boat collides with a magma puddle, it will immediately stop. If the player using Magma stands close to the boat, it'll move the player as well.
Magma is known to be one of the highest damage-dealing fruits in the game, when ignoring moves that require all or infinite damage.

The Magma Admiral and the Lava Pirates use the old unawakened version of Magma, both using only the [Z] (Magma Fist) and [X] (Magma Column) move. The Elite Pirate, Deandre, also uses the new awakened version of Magma.
Awakened Magma's [F] Beast Ride move has the same sound effect as a Sea Beast when spawning or deadly roar skill.
Magma used to take no energy when walking on water but this has since been changed.
Air Jumping and aiming [X] Volcanic Assault at the opponent from above removes knockback from the move, which can be useful to start a combo.
If lucky, and if aimed properly, Awakened Magma's [Z] Magma Shower move can do almost as much damage as the awakened [V] Volcanic Storm move.
[Z] Magma Shower has an incredible range, as the projectiles do not despawn even at 2500+ meters.
For some reason, Magma puddles reappear and disappear faster when the player is holding a move.

If the user uses Awakened Magma's [F] Beast Ride, jump, and then switch to another item after that (e.g. a fighting style) they will be flung very far. Although this is a glitch, it can be very useful while hunting Sea Beasts and Terrorsharks as it allows the player to sky camp above them and use the effect of gravity on their moves to kill them while taking minimal to no damage. The direction you go depends on your mouse (PC). Not switching to another weapon/item will make you still go fling, but less distance. To go up, simply look up. putting your mouse right at your avatar doesn't work.

If a player holds a Magma fruit for about a second, and unequips it (not dropping), and then re-equips it in a different area, a singular magma droplet (from the special effect of the physical fruit) will appear in the area where the fruit previously was.
Sometimes Magma's [V] Volcanic Storm glitches, causing the attack to stay in held form.

fruits.name: Quake
moves: — The player charges an energy ball and cracks the air, dealing decent damage. This move also shakes the enemy's screen and has high knockback. However, the hitbox is relatively small and has a small startup, making it harder to land on players.

— The player charges an energy ball on their hand and launches a huge quake sphere towards the target that does decent amount of damage. The move shakes the opponent's screen in the process. The sphere is slow-moving and pushes away enemies slightly. This is similar to [Z] Quake Punch.
— The player holds two quake spheres on their hands and smashes the ground, doing great damage in an area around them. This move has a small startup.
— The player creates a quake sphere in their right arm and then cracks the air. After a while, two tsunamis from both sides will come, dealing high damage to anyone in their way.

— The user pulls their opponent towards them, dealing very low damage at first, then punches them, leaving cracks on both parties' screen and turning their screen blue, and then finally launches the opponent away from them (similar to Sharkman Karate [C]), dealing high damage to the target and shaking both parties' screen. When the user launches the target away from them, the screen will turn red for both players and will also leave cracks on their screen.
— The user charges an energy ball in their left hand and then launches a large spherical orb of energy at the target, dealing medium-high damage and shaking the opponent's screen.

— The user grasps two balls of energy in their hands. After 0.75 seconds, the user creates a large shockwave around themselves which deals heavy damage and high knockback. This move causes intense shaking to anyone within the move's hitbox.

— The user smashes the ground, stunning the opponent(s) and dealing damage while also bringing forth four slightly bigger tsunamis, each coming from every direction (causes stuns and shaking). If this move is used in the air, the user will come down onto the ground at a high speed and then smash the ground, pulling anyone in their way down with them. If the user isn't able to touch the ground (e.g. if they're above the Sea), the tsunamis and ground smash won't show, thus making the move useless.
trivia:
Quake's [V] move has the largest AoE in the game.
This move can be used to grind efficiently many enemies at once in large areas such as the Cursed Ship or the Haunted Castle.
This move can be used to grind efficiently many enemies at once in large areas such as the Cursed Ship or the Haunted Castle.
The old and unawakened version of Quake is used by Greybeard.
Quake is good for raids because of the [V] move that deals massive damage and has a large AoE on both awakened and unawakened. It also has two skills that can stun the boss (if awakened).
Although Quake's awakened [V] Seaquake has two extra tsunamis, they do less damage than Quake's unawakened [V] Dual Tsunami. Seaquake does extra damage and stuns with the ground smash.

Quake is the only awakened fruit with only four moves instead of five, due to the fruit's lack of the [F] move, mainly known to be a method of mobility. It is also the only legendary fruit to not have a [F] move.

Quake is the most common Legendary fruit due to it being the cheapest of its rarity. As such this fruit is commonly used to buy Phoenix and Dough raids and given to Trevor to gain access to Don Swan's room.
Quake is the first Legendary fruit to have an awakening.
Quake has unique fragment costs due to it only having four moves when fully awakened.
This is the third most expensive fruit to awaken. Additionally, its [V] Seaquake is the most expensive move to awaken.
Quake is one of the only fruits to get its icon changed.
Quake's unawakened [V] move has a glitch when used in raids since frequently, it can move very slow and despawn not dealing any damage or sometimes even submerge below the ground/water.

fruits.name: Buddha
moves: Awakened moves cannot be used in this form.
If the user's avatar does not have any skin, the user will just become a bigger version of themselves.
Awakened moves cannot be used in this form.
If the user's avatar does not have any skin, the user will just become a bigger version of themselves.

Seismic Jump — V2 only, When jumping, the user will create a small AoE shock wave that does relatively small damage to enemies, breaks Instinct and has a cooldown of two seconds. The user will also jump at least 2x as high. (Stacks with Angel jump height boost)

Divine Aura — While transformed, the player gains a 35% (46.4% against NPCs), or 45% if awakened (54.6% against NPCs), damage reduction against all attacks, and can hit enemies with their melee and sword M1s 5× (8× if V2) farther than a normal player. In V2, the player's hitbox is above water and thus has the water-walking passive ability. If dragged underwater, the user will still take damage (unless the user has Shark V2 or above). Although, the user's offense is not amplified while in Buddha form.

— The user gets engulfed by a yellow column of light, before transforming into a huge, yellow, glowing Buddha that bases off the user's roblox avatar, becoming approximately 3x bigger than their normal form. 
Awakened moves cannot be used in this form.
If the user's avatar does not have any skin, the user will just become a bigger version of themselves.

— The user charges a shining ball of light, then touches the ground with their palm, creating a large explosion that blows nearby enemies away. A large amount of startup time renders the user vulnerable. This move can only be used in Buddha form.

— The user leaps into the air, landing where the cursor is pointed. This creates a shock wave that damages enemies on impact, unless landed in water This move has a one second end-lag. This move can only be used in the Buddha form. Similar to Mammoth and T-Rex's [F] move

— The user charges themselves for 0.5 seconds inside their body, then lets out a large explosion around them, dealing heavy damage to all enemies nearby and launching them away. This move can only be used in the Buddha form.

— The user transforms into a giant golden Buddha, which has three rings and two squares with symbols that surround the user, with the squares having Chinese Hanzi. At the same time, a thunder light strikes the ground where the user is, knocking away any enemies nearby and dealing damage. While transformed, the player is big enough to stand on the floor of the sea, allowing them to dash, Flash Step, and reset their Air Jumps. This move increases the size of the player's melee and sword range hitboxes, and grants them a 45% damage reduction against other players. The user will also gain a significant jump boost, but in exchange, their overal walking speed will be reduced.
— The user slams the ground with their right fist and an explosion occurs as light erupts from the place hit. This move breaks Instinct and cannot be held.
— The player gathers energy, then explodes with a big explosion, shooting a light beam out of their mouth, dealing damage. This move breaks Instinct.

— The user rises up and fires a huge barrage of golden beams that make a big golden explosion, then finishes by bringing down a golden ray and a golden wave that knocks people away and causes damage. This move breaks Instinct and cannot be held.
— The user dashes forward, creating a trail of golden light behind. If they touch an enemy when dashing, they will grab the enemy up and then slam them into the ground.
trivia: Although this fruit is named Buddha, its icon is actually Budai, the laughing monk often mistaken for the real Buddha.

Buddha used to grant the user twice their health during transformation, which was then removed in order to balance it.
Buddha was the actual first fruit (the "second-first" fruit being Phoenix) to grant the user health benefits.
Buddha was the actual first fruit (the "second-first" fruit being Phoenix) to grant the user health benefits.

The Japanese Kanji/Traditional Chinese characters around the aura of the awakened version of [Z] Shift mean: 草 (grass), 体 (body), 心 (heart), 魂 (soul), 火 (fire), 水 (water), 風 (wind), and 岩 (stone).
Similarly, the symbols in the outer circle are derived from Elder Futhark runes, and they represent ᛓ (wealth), ᚨ (god), ᚷ (gift), ᛖ (horse), ᛟ (heritage), ᛈ (pear-tree), ᛝ (the god Ingwaz), ᛗ (man), ᛢ (yew-tree), ᛉ (elk), ᛃ (good year), ᚹ (joy), ᛋ (sun), ᛞ (day), ᚱ (journey), and ᛒ (birch). It's the language of the symbols of the Colosseum Quest.

Similarly, the symbols in the outer circle are derived from Elder Futhark runes, and they represent ᛓ (wealth), ᚨ (god), ᚷ (gift), ᛖ (horse), ᛟ (heritage), ᛈ (pear-tree), ᛝ (the god Ingwaz), ᛗ (man), ᛢ (yew-tree), ᛉ (elk), ᛃ (good year), ᚹ (joy), ᛋ (sun), ᛞ (day), ᚱ (journey), and ᛒ (birch). It's the language of the symbols of the Colosseum Quest.

A glitch can be done where if the user starts any Raid and use awakened Buddha’s [V] Twilight of the Gods, the final column after the user teleports to the raid island will appear there, and will not disappear before the final explosion reaches Hot and Cold (Raid room).
The player will get similar result when they use the move when they get teleported away after the raid ends.
The player will get similar result when they use the move when they get teleported away after the raid ends.
Buddha and Control are the only fruits that buff weapons. Additionally, this is the only fruit that buffs Fighting Styles.
Due to the animation of [Z] moves (awakened) being under the ground, the user can use this move to collect fruits that are put under tables
Buddha's [X] and [V] moves (unawakened) have the same sound effect as one of the Sea Beast's Water Beam moves (while charging).
Buddha's [Z] move (unawakened) has the same sound effect as the Shocker's Electrical Floor but modified (pitched down).

The player can perform a speed glitch by first holding any fruit in Buddha form, then initiating shift lock and finally holding the D or S keys whilst pressing the 'jump' button.
A similar glitch can be performed with Skull Guitar, by holding it while in Buddha form, then initiating shift lock and using its M1 while holding the D or S key whilst jumping.
However, the anti-cheat can put the player back in place if they go too fast while using this glitch.
A similar glitch can be performed with Skull Guitar, by holding it while in Buddha form, then initiating shift lock and using its M1 while holding the D or S key whilst jumping.
However, the anti-cheat can put the player back in place if they go too fast while using this glitch.

There used to be a well known glitch/bug where if the user untransformed and quickly switched to other item in their hotbar (fighting style, sword or gun), their weapon would retain its size and, more importantly, its M1 reach buffs of their fighting style and sword, making this fruit the best fruit for grinding. Unfortunately, this was patched in Update 24.
Buddha's [C] move (unawakened) won't stop falling until it hits a surface of any kind (including walls).
It is possible for the user to be immune to water whilst in the awakened transformed state by simply using the Z move while on the sea.
If the user is in Buddha's [Z] move (unawakened) form while using Race Awakening as Rabbit or Shark race, the user's hair will turn golden instead of white.
When using Buddha and turning Aura on, the user's head will not be affected by the aura. If the user de-transforms with aura active, their head will sometimes still not be affected.

Buddha is sometimes regarded as 'unskilled' in PvP due to how easy it is to use with high damage output and how players only need to click the screen to get this massive amount of damage, meaning that players don't really need to do anything to get the massive damage.

Although Buddha generally makes the user very powerful, its main weaknesses are its huge hitbox, slow speed, and low range, since most Buddha users use swords as their main damage output, so some fruits can easily counter Buddha, either by using long and inescapable combos, or by simply out-ranging. A great example is Gas, as its transformation fixes most issues Buddha has, mainly with speed, range, and stuns, and is even considered by some people as a superior option for both grinding and PvP.
Buddha's [V] Twilight of the Gods, when used in enclosed space (e.g. Mansion), can deal extremely high damage of 10k - 12k to NPCs.
In the shop, Buddha is labeled as a fruit that "can M1" despite the fruit itself not having an M1. It could be taken that it can M1 because sword/fighting styles can be used while transformed.

When using fighting styles to deal damage through M1 while transformed, the player is not able to damage enemies behind the area the player is facing, unlike swords where the player can hit all nearby enemies when using M1 regardless of direction.

By looking at the player's Buddha aura from the top, the player can see their fighting style's M1 max range. This is now no-longer the case, as the M1 range extends inconsistently further away than the aura.

The physical fruit icon's shadow casted by the stem doesn't match the shape of the stem - the shadow seems to have a shape of a normal, two-leafed or four-leafed stem, similarly to Spin's stem, but the actual Buddha's stem has a shape of a ring.

fruits.name: Love
moves: The NPC will always resemble someone in the user's friends list. Four friends are randomly selected for this role per server, so only four friends will spawn per server.
The summoned NPC can damage Blade users, but not Elemental users.

The user can prevent the spawned NPC from attacking others by having no Fighting Style, Fruit, Sword or Gun selected. This means the Besto Friendo won't attack players or enemies even when the user takes damage.
The NPC will always resemble someone in the user's friends list. Four friends are randomly selected for this role per server, so only four friends will spawn per server.
The summoned NPC can damage Blade users, but not Elemental users.

The user can prevent the spawned NPC from attacking others by having no Fighting Style, Fruit, Sword or Gun selected. This means the Besto Friendo won't attack players or enemies even when the user takes damage.
If activated near an ally/hostile enemy or a "friend", they will be picked up as a passenger on the flamingo. This does not work on Bosses, Raid enemies and Sea Event enemies.
The user can hold moves while flying, but it will make it fly slower.
If activated near an ally/hostile enemy or a "friend", they will be picked up as a passenger on the flamingo. This does not work on Bosses, Raid enemies and Sea Event enemies.
The user can hold moves while flying, but it will make it fly slower.

Lovestruck — If an enemy is hit by Love's [Z] or [C] move, it will make the enemy "fall in love" with the user, temporarily decreasing their damage against the user by 25% (33% against NPCs) for 6 seconds. At the same time, it fills the enemy's screen with pink hearts, causing their screen to pulse like a heartbeat, and highly distorting the enemy's screen.

— The user shoots a heart-shaped arrow towards the cursor, which grabs any enemies in its way when released and explodes upon contact, or when the maximum range is reached. It leaves a small trail behind if shot close to the ground.

— The user shoots an arching pink arrow of perfume into the air aimed towards the cursor. The arrow  then explodes into a cloud of perfume with a shining heart on top. This creates a tick-damage type move that deals damage to all enemies inside the "Zone" and lasts for 3 seconds, dealing roughly 1 tick of damage every 0.2 seconds. Additionally, all enemies within the zone will be unable to dash, Air Jump, and use their Flash Step.

— The user kneels down and creates a pink beating heart above them, while simultaneously creating a large pink circle area around them. Once the key is released, the heart explodes and the user spins around, pulling any enemies within the circle towards the user and briefly stunning them. This move can be held down to make the circle bigger and increase its damage. This move can be held for 1 second to fully charge.

— The user shoots a heart-shaped arrow which explodes into a large heart explosion, dealing decent damage. The explosion creates a "Friend", a friendly NPC wielding the Canvander sword. They can jump, dash, attack, and swim. The damage dealt by this NPC and its health scales off the user's level.
The NPC will always resemble someone in the user's friends list. Four friends are randomly selected for this role per server, so only four friends will spawn per server.
The summoned NPC can damage Blade users, but not Elemental users.
The user can prevent the spawned NPC from attacking others by having no Fighting Style, Fruit, Sword or Gun selected. This means the Besto Friendo won't attack players or enemies even when the user takes damage.

— The user creates a flying flamingo to ride on, allowing them to fly freely in any direction. All of the Love's moves can be used without freezing up while riding on the flamingo, but not other weapons' moves.
If activated near an ally/hostile enemy or a "friend", they will be picked up as a passenger on the flamingo. This does not work on Bosses, Raid enemies and Sea Event enemies.
The user can hold moves while flying, but it will make it fly slower.
trivia: Love previously was not very rare but had exceptionally high combo potential if used correctly.

Love is one of the few fruits that have abilities that resemble Transformation. While the user doesn't technically "transform" into the respective thing the fruit is named after, the [F] Flamingo Ride ability disables all weapons except for the fruit, similar to many other transformations. The other fruit that can "transform" is Ghost.
While Ghost indeed does transform into the respective thing, the transformation is only triggered by death, as the [V] move doesn't really count.
While Ghost indeed does transform into the respective thing, the transformation is only triggered by death, as the [V] move doesn't really count.

Love's [X] move had the longest range in the game (even more than Pain) if the user aimed it correctly at another player's body (this did not apply to NPCs). Unfortunately, this was patched in Update 24.
Love is widely considered to be one of the most annoying and difficult fruits to fight against, mainly due to its Lovestruck passive, high range, and skycamping capabilities.

The NPC spawned from [V] Besto Friendo can sometimes trick exploit scripts and make exploiters follow the NPC in an attempt to kill it but won't deal any damage if their PvP is off, effectively rendering the script useless, unless the exploiter is online while farming, but it is very unlikely.
If the user has spawned a Friend from Love's [V] Besto Friendo and dies, the Friend will die as well.

The Friend's health and damage scale off the user's current level. Their health is user's level multiplied by 2, and their M1 damage is user's level divided by roughly 1.65 (ex. user's level is 2650, so the Friend's health will be 5300 HP, and their M1 will deal around 1609 damage.)
Love's [X] and [C] move can only be held for 7.5 seconds.

There's a bug/glitch where, if the user uses Love's [F] Flamingo Ride move and has console mode active, the user is able to use their Fighting Style, Sword, and Gun while riding on the flamingo. This is most likely patched.

Love's flight ability is one of the only fruits that allows the player to stop moving in mid-air and heal naturally while in flight. The other fruits that can do this are Eagle, Phoenix, Gravity and Dragon.
Love's [F] Flamingo Ride previously was able to fly in boats.
The former Lv. 1675 boss (Island Empress) used the Z, X, and V moves of old Love fruit.

There is a glitch/bug that allows more than four players in the same raid at a time by using Love's [F] Flamingo Ride and having an allied player on the flamingo and both in the raid tube at the same time. However, mounted players cannot deal damage in raids, and they don't get rewards. This can also be done with Kitsune, by having an allied player mount on the Kitsune user while transformed.
Love is the only fruit that uses an In-game friend's Avatar.

There is a glitch where if someone uses Love's [V] move, Besto Friendo, perfectly on a chair like in Mansion or Café (the ones utilized for Trading), other players will not be able to sit on that chair for the rest of the duration of the server.
This can be used for trolling people, by using Besto Friendo on a chair on each pair of chairs, making trading impossible.
This can be used for trolling people, by using Besto Friendo on a chair on each pair of chairs, making trading impossible.
The flamingo on the [F] move wears the Heart Shades accessory.
This is the first ever fruit to be able to carry other players (on the flamingo).

fruits.name: Creation
moves:
If tapped:
The user creates a huge hand and swings it, crushing any enemies caught on the ground. If facing upward, the hand punches the enemy into the sky and sends them flying.
The user creates a huge hand and swings it, crushing any enemies caught on the ground. If facing upward, the hand punches the enemy into the sky and sends them flying.

If held:
The giant hand will now rush forward. The player can control the hand based on their mouse cursor. The target cannot escape once caught. If the user releases the held key or after a certain amount of time, the hand will act similarly to a tap.

The giant hand will now rush forward. The player can control the hand based on their mouse cursor. The target cannot escape once caught. If the user releases the held key or after a certain amount of time, the hand will act similarly to a tap.

If tapped:
The user creates a huge hand and swings it, crushing any enemies caught on the ground. If facing upward, the hand punches the enemy into the sky and sends them flying.
The user creates a huge hand and swings it, crushing any enemies caught on the ground. If facing upward, the hand punches the enemy into the sky and sends them flying.

If held:
The giant hand will now rush forward. The player can control the hand based on their mouse cursor. The target cannot escape once caught. If the user releases the held key or after a certain amount of time, the hand will act similarly to a tap.

The giant hand will now rush forward. The player can control the hand based on their mouse cursor. The target cannot escape once caught. If the user releases the held key or after a certain amount of time, the hand will act similarly to a tap.

Master of Creation — When the user activates [F] Fortify, they gain a building bar, indicating how many pieces can be placed down. The limit for public servers is 40 and for private servers is 200. The user starts with an empty bar, and whenever the user builds with it, the bar increases, and when the user deletes pieces, the bar goes down.

— Creates a pink wall of cards that moves based on the user's facing direction—upward or downward. Deals decent damage to nearby enemies if come close. When released or damaged by an enemy, the wall shatters and the cards fall. Move can be held to do repeated damage to an enemy. this move lasts only for around 20 seconds.

— The user fabricates a cannon, which they launch themselves from once the 'Z' key is released. Upon contact with an enemy, the user creates a wall behind them, before smashing the target into the barrier with a mace. This move distorts the enemy's screen with a "dizzy" effect, similar to Venom, although the enemy's screen doesn't darken.

— This move possesses two variations, each of which has 2 identical attacks:
If tapped:
The user creates a huge hand and swings it, crushing any enemies caught on the ground. If facing upward, the hand punches the enemy into the sky and sends them flying.
If held:
The giant hand will now rush forward. The player can control the hand based on their mouse cursor. The target cannot escape once caught. If the user releases the held key or after a certain amount of time, the hand will act similarly to a tap.

— The user creates a cube with an incredibly large AoE before several swords manifest around the structure, piercing any targets within continuously while stunning them. The cube dissipates after a few seconds.

— The user summons 15 giant pillars that fall onto the ground. Enemies will be damaged and bounce away when touching these, meanwhile, the user will phase through them and teleport to another pillar upon contact.

— The user summons stairs if facing up or down, and if facing forward, they create a floor instead; these objects will disappear over time. If held while moving, the user will create a continuous path in the direction of movement. If held while standing, the user enters the build mode.

— The user creates a wall which has 6 variants. These variants include a normal wall, a doorway, a small window, a flat slab, and flat stairs facing left and right. Using this move while having it already activated will switch the type of wall to be placed down.

— The user creates a floor which has 5 variants. These variants include a basic floor, and 4 variants of halved floors in every direction. Using this move while having it already activated will switch the type of floor to be placed down.

— The user creates a ramp which has 4 variants. These variants include a basic ramp, two halved ramps facing left and right, and a pyramid. Using this move while having it already activated will switch the type of ramp to be placed down.
— The user lifts their hands up and the nearest Wall/Floor/Ramp is highlighted in red. Clicking will get rid of the part highlighted in red, while holding will get rid of all the placed parts.
— The user throws their hat into the air and the hat disappears into thin air, then leaves the build mode.
trivia: Creation is the fourth fruit to get a rarity change, the first being Portal, second being Love, and third being Ghost.
Creation has the lowest Mastery requirements to get all the moves in the Legendary rarity.

When the physical Creation fruit breaks apart during its animation, the broken pieces will fall to a nearby surface. If the player teleports while holding out the fruit, the pieces will teleport back to within the vicinity of the fruit.
Creation is the first fruit to gain a different moveset, via Build Mode, without being awakened or transformed.
If the user leaves the server, all the buildings they have created will vanish.

Interestingly, allied players can just walk through the towers from [V] Magic City, instead of teleporting or being bounced back.
This may have been a balancing feature to make the towers not so obstructing for allies that are trying to help.
This may have been a balancing feature to make the towers not so obstructing for allies that are trying to help.
Creation is the only fruit with abilities that specialize in blocking attacks, which makes it extremely unique.
When used on a physical fruit, [V] Magic City will move the fruit away from its original location.

Creation's held M1 cannot be used on mobile normally. Instead, there is an alternative button located above [Z] Batter Up that functions just the same as tapping, although resembles an activation of a move instead. This feature is also present in Gravity, although it's held M1 can be used normally.

fruits.name: Spider
moves: — The player swipes at the opponent and summons a claw to knock back the player. Its hitbox and range is very small.
— The player impales their target from above with five strings, dealing medium AoE damage and also briefly stunning anyone hit by it.

— The user shoots a thick rope made of condensed strings from their palm which deals great damage. The damage for this move depends on how far they are from their opponent(s). The further away the user is from their opponent(s), the higher the damage they will receive. This move has the second best range in the game, leaving a short invisible tripwire effect, which will deal damage when stepped on and breaks Instinct no matter what.
— The player creates multiple strings weaved together (covered in Aura) and sends them at enemies in a piercing formation. This move deals damage in a sharp cone-shaped hitbox and stuns targets.
— The player summons a lot of threads under their body and levitates.

— The user slashes forth up to four fiery blades of hot strings that deal good damage (the number of strings and their damage varies depending on how long the user holds the move), with the fourth one resembling the shape of the letter 'X'.

— The user shoots out strings upwards from their hand and creates a large circular cage that when held, traps targets inside. Then, the cage quickly shrinks and slashes whoever is inside of it, dealing instant damage. If held, the size of the cage increases by a fair amount, although it does not affect the damage.

— The user summons large, white spears of strings that leave the ground and hit wherever the cursor is located. If the cursor is close enough, the move will auto-target nearby enemies. Damage gets smaller over time and most of the damage is dealt during the early stage of the move (a string will do less damage than the string that came before it). This move holds the player down in place until the end of the move.

— The user shoots out hundreds of dark red and maroon strings rapidly, in a more cylindrical hitbox. This move has a small start-up time, however, it stuns while dealing massive damage to anyone it hits. Its color changes according to the user's aura colour, like Dough due to the webs being covered in Aura this time.
— The user shoots out a string and swings to where the user is faced. Speed scales with user's health. Holding this move can allow the user to swing slightly farther, although not very noticeable.
trivia:
Spider is used by Swan and Don Swan.
Swan has a unique move, the move being Multi-directional Silk.
With that, Don Swan has another version aside from the awakened and unawakened version of Spider. However, this version is only available in the second stage. It is an improved Spider [V] and [X], the [V] is a triple version of the unawakened [V], tripling the range, AoE and damage in the process, and the [X] shoots more Multi-String Attacks in an X pattern. However, due to this version being only available to a boss, it is impossible to find out whether there are any other differences.
Swan has a unique move, the move being Multi-directional Silk.

With that, Don Swan has another version aside from the awakened and unawakened version of Spider. However, this version is only available in the second stage. It is an improved Spider [V] and [X], the [V] is a triple version of the unawakened [V], tripling the range, AoE and damage in the process, and the [X] shoots more Multi-String Attacks in an X pattern. However, due to this version being only available to a boss, it is impossible to find out whether there are any other differences.
Despite it being called "Spider", it is not a Beast type fruit because it allows players to control strings rather than transform into a spider.
Spider is the second fruit that has a Beast themed Natural type fruit, the first one being Venom.
The current unawakened [F] Spider Path is actually the pre-rework awakened String's [F] Spider Highway.
Every awakened move of Spider can be held to deal more damage, but that does not mean it can be held indefinitely.
Many consider Spider's [C] Over-heated Sniper move to be better than the awakened version because of its range, Instinct break, and damage.
Spider has the biggest fruit model.
Spider's [Z] Spider Wraith uses the same sound effect as Cyborg V4's Energy Control Super Jump.
Spider's [C] Over-heated Sniper has a longer lasting tripwire effect than Buddy Sword's [X] Lightning Wave.

fruits.name: Sound
moves: Tempo Aura — All moves that are used while in the golden mode, turn gold. The Tempo Meter can be filled by either holding [F] Tempo: Prestissimo or hitting an enemy with Sound's abilities. The Tempo Meter decreases rapidly when a player is not dealing damage, and runs out after 10 seconds. When the meter is maxed, the user and nearby allies gain a shield that reduces incoming damage by 15%, increases speed by 50%, and increases move damage by 10%.

— The user shoots out three projectile notes on the first use horizontally, five on the second use horizontally, and five on the third use vertically at the location of the cursor. Projectiles explode and deal damage to enemies on impact.
— The user generates a large cone of music notes, dealing AoE damage and knocking back enemies.

— The user generates a disco ball that fires beams which auto-aim at all nearby enemies in a large area. After that, the disco ball fires itself to where the cursor is aimed, exploding on impact. Damage dealt to an enemy is multiplied by ×0.85 each time a beam hits them.

— The user releases five small projectiles, and then a large one, which explodes on impact. The larger projectile will summon a black hole, attracting nearby enemies and dealing damage for a short time after exploding.
— The user flies using a music staff, which regenerates Tempo Meter. Health and energy regeneration is disabled while the move is activated, like almost all mobility moves.

— The user shoots out three gold projectile notes on the first use horizontally, five on the second use horizontally, and five on the third use vertically at where the cursor aims at. Projectiles explode and deal damage to enemies on impact.
— The user generates a cone-like-shaped note attack, dealing AoE damage and knocking back enemies.

— The user generates a disco ball that fires lasers which auto aim at all nearby enemies at a large range. After that, the disco ball fires itself to where the cursor is aiming at and explodes on impact. Damage dealt to an enemy is reduced by about 15% each time the move hits them. But if enemies do not take any laser damage, they will take about 80% of the total skill damage from the disco ball.

— The user releases five small, gold projectiles, and then a large one, which explodes on impact. The larger projectile will summon a black hole, attracting nearby enemies and dealing damage for a short time after exploding.

— The user flies using a music staff, which regenerates Tempo Meter. Health and energy regeneration is disabled while the move is activated, like almost all mobility moves. When the Tempo passive is activated, users fly 50% faster.
trivia: Sound is the first fan-made fruit to be added to the game. The original concept was created by @Aqu4G (on X/Twitter), one of the winners of the first fan fruit/art contest. The second is the Kitsune fruit.
Many of Sound's moves contain musical vocabulary, such as Tempo (rate of speed of music played), Prestissimo (very fast) or Fortissimo (very loud).
While using [F] Tempo: Prestissimo, the user can fly faster (or even faster with the Tempo Meter activated) when their health is low, but not as fast as Venom (it also has the same flight mechanic).

Sound now allows for the newest, highest potential speed for a player in the game, by combining the following: Maximum Tempo Meter + Rabbit V4 (and Agility) + Pilot Helmet. However, this is still not the fastest transportation method, as Portal has the ability to instantly teleport to most islands in any sea.

Sound is the second least expensive fruit to have a meter, but also a variable meter.
Sound is also one of the fruits that have meters that are not intended for transformation, with the others being Gravity, Shadow, Creation, and Spirit.
Sound is also one of the fruits that have meters that are not intended for transformation, with the others being Gravity, Shadow, Creation, and Spirit.

fruits.name: Phoenix
moves: Awakening this skill will reduce damage a little compared to V1, but the attack range is doubled and the hitbox is about x1.5 larger.
Awakening this skill will reduce damage a little compared to V1, but the attack range is doubled and the hitbox is about x1.5 larger.
An exception to this is players who are currently allied to the user, who will also heal along with the user.
Health regeneration does not increase with Fruit stat because it heals based on max HP, with ~2% healing based on max HP per tick, and the time between each healing tick is ~0.24s.
An exception to this is players who are currently allied to the user, who will also heal along with the user.
Health regeneration does not increase with Fruit stat because it heals based on max HP, with ~2% healing based on max HP per tick, and the time between each healing tick is ~0.24s.

However, the move can be dodged with Instinct, though this will only negate the damage, and the enemy will still get stunned, similar to Control's [C] move. Even though this move is short ranged and has a tiny hitbox, it is easy to hit people with because the user can move freely while holding the move, similarly to Love fruit.

However, the move can be dodged with Instinct, though this will only negate the damage, and the enemy will still get stunned, similar to Control's [C] move. Even though this move is short ranged and has a tiny hitbox, it is easy to hit people with because the user can move freely while holding the move, similarly to Love fruit.
Using unawakened [X] move drains the users energy in around 22 seconds, consuming approximately 606 energy per second.
Using awakened [X] move drains the users energy in around 23.75 seconds, consuming approximately 562 energy per second.
Breaks Instinct if too close. Can be dodged if far enough or if on the edge.
Nothing changes except for the projectile - the projectile's explosion can be dodged on the edge.
Cannot break Instinct in any way, but the player will still get stunned, and the move drains a lot of dodges.

Reincarnation Feathers — The user gains the ability to transform into a blue and yellow phoenix. While transformed, the user passively consumes 10 energy per second. In return, the user gains 15% damage reduction and is able to fly freely. All attacks are enhanced in range, damage and hitboxes. The user's transformation will be canceled if their health or energy gets below 33%.
Blazing Phoenix's Flames (V2) — While using the awakened [F] move, small blue and yellow flames appear and descend from the user, and damage anything beneath them.
— The user charges up a flaming blow and releases them forward to make a powerful mid-range attack with high knockback, similar to Gravity's old [Z] move.
— The user evokes blue and yellow flames around themselves to regain health in a certain radius (can also heal any player, ally or not), whilst rapidly consuming energy.
— The user pulls back their leg and dashes forward, releasing a quick kick in the direction the user is facing. It has a very fast cooldown.

— The user fully transforms into a blue and yellow Phoenix. This transformation takes around 10 energy every second. The only moves that take away energy in this transformation are Transformation and Regeneration Flames.
— Allows the user to fly in hybrid form. Does not drain any energy, but the player must hold the [F] key, or d-pad right on Console. The player will gain fiery blue wings with yellow borders.

— The user swiftly shoots a long ranged blast farther range than its untransformed version, dealing a large AoE explosion damage. This move has two hitboxes, first is a medium range burst of flames and second is a long range projectile.

— The user evokes a bigger bubble of blue and yellow flames around themselves to regain health, however, just like the untransformed, it drains energy. Note that, similar to its untransformed version, it can heal any players (including Marines) inside the bubble.
— The user lunges forward to perform a kick, just like the untransformed variant, it is single target. It has a very fast cooldown.
— The user transforms back into their human form. This can also happen automatically if the health or energy of the user is below 33%.
— The user dashes forward in the direction of the cursor, slightly stunning enemies in their way, and creating an small AoE explosion after the dash.

— The user swiftly shoots a rift of flames toward their cursor that explodes on contact, or when it reaches its maximum range. It can leave flames on the ground that deal tick damage. 
Awakening this skill will reduce damage a little compared to V1, but the attack range is doubled and the hitbox is about x1.5 larger.

— The user covers themselves in a huge bubble, healing themselves based on how long the move is held, while also draining their energy. The bubble will also act as a barrier that damages and knocks back anything that comes close enough.
An exception to this is players who are currently allied to the user, who will also heal along with the user.
Health regeneration does not increase with Fruit stat because it heals based on max HP, with ~2% healing based on max HP per tick, and the time between each healing tick is ~0.24s.

— The user dashes forward in a rift of flames. If the user comes into contact with an enemy, they will bring them up into the air using a tornado-like attack made out of phoenix flames, then crash back onto the enemy, slamming them to the ground, dealing AoE explosion damage with a large hitbox. Launching forward without the attack being performed means that an enemy has not been caught in the attack.

— The user transforms into a blue and yellow Phoenix, drastically improving their abilities. While transformed, the user passively drains 10 energy per second. The user can also fly passively once in transformation, but they will be unable to use any other weapons aside from their fruit. Once activated, this ability leaves a spot of blue and yellow flames on the ground that deal considerable damage.

— The user turns their arms into blue and yellow phoenix wings, gaining the ability to fly freely using the movement keys, and can also stop mid-air. However, their energy regeneration will be temporarily stopped until they exit this form. If the user stops mid-air, blue and yellow flames will rain down from their wings, doing small tick damage. Additionally, all of Phoenix's moves can be used in this form.
— The user spins and lunges forward, grabbing any opponent in their way and causing a small AoE blast of blue and yellow flames.

— The user swiftly shoots three rifts of flames toward their cursor that explodes on contact, or when they reach their maximum reach. This move can leave flames on the ground or in the air that deal tick damage. This move has around 3x more AoE.

— The user covers themselves in a massive blue bubble, healing themselves based on how long the move is held. The bubble will also act as a barrier that damages and knocks back anything that comes close enough, albeit with much more AoE. Using this move will significantly slow down flight speed.

— The user dashes forward in the direction of the cursor. If they make a contact with an enemy, they will bring them up into the air using a tornado-like attack made out of phoenix flames, then crash back onto the enemy, leaving flames on the ground. If any enemies are not hit by the initial hit, they can still take damage from the crash if they are within range.
— The user transforms back into their human form, this also happens automatically if the health or energy of the user is below 33%.

— The user dashes forward. If they come in contact with an enemy, they will slash the enemy in a barrage of claws, setting them on yellow fire, stunning them, before causing a small blue and yellow explosion.
However, the move can be dodged with Instinct, though this will only negate the damage, and the enemy will still get stunned, similar to Control's [C] move. Even though this move is short ranged and has a tiny hitbox, it is easy to hit people with because the user can move freely while holding the move, similarly to Love fruit.
trivia: Currently, Buddha and Phoenix are the only Beast-type fruits to have an awakening.

Because of the Phoenix Flames and Feathers' Immortality passive on the [F] move, the user can stall above enemies and damage them, making it an ideal way to AFK farm money/mastery.
Smoke and Blizzard also technically have infinite damage moves, but their moves need to be held.
Smoke and Blizzard also technically have infinite damage moves, but their moves need to be held.
Phoenix is the first fruit to have a Mastery Requirement in order to obtain a chip for a raid.
Currently, Phoenix is one of the few fruits to have ranged M1s.

The unawakened [X] move somehow heals faster than the awakened version.
Phoenix is the first ever fruit to possess HP benefits. (excluding pre-nerf Buddha)
Phoenix is the first ever fruit to possess HP benefits. (excluding pre-nerf Buddha)

The transformed Phoenix resembles a creature found in Chinese myths known as Fenghuang. The Phoenix is supposed to be a symbol of grace and virtue, an immortal bird that represented beauty. Its Blox Fruits counterpart, however, depicts the Phoenix as a violent and fiery beast. This depiction is closer to the Western Phoenix, despite having the traits and features of the Fenghuang.
[F] Swift Flight can be used to damage Sharks or the Leviathan while other players are attacking just by still staying on top.

If the player uses awakened [C] or [Z] while using the unawakened transformation, the transformation will be cancelled.
Interestingly, the awakened version loses the earpiece on the flight move, and attacks.
Interestingly, the awakened version loses the earpiece on the flight move, and attacks.
If the player starts using the transformed [X] move before being kicked out of transformation via low energy, they will shoot the transformed version instead of the normal [X] move.
Awakened Phoenix's [X] move can be used with the V1 [V] move. If used with transformation, it will make the user's speed become a little slower.
Holding the unawakened [X] move is a highly recommended way to get the title "Empty Vessel".
Phoenix is the first fruit that can transform without a fury meter, the second being Leopard, the third being Mammoth and the fourth being Yeti.

Sea Beasts will appear in a Phoenix raid, specifically on the 4th and 5th islands. These Sea Beasts do not drop anything and are optional to fight during the raid, as only the enemies on the raid island are required to progress to the next island. However, it is advised to defeat these Sea Beasts if possible, as they pose as extreme threats to those on the raid island. Fruits such as Buddha and Yeti are recommended against these Sea Beasts.

When paired with Blood Siphon (Gear 2), the Lei accessory, gathering 5–8 enemies then using Skull Guitar [X] with the Vampiric III enchant, and activating [X] Blue Flames can result in the fastest health regeneration within the game.
Although Phoenix and Portal share the robux price of (  2,000), they do not share the same Money   value. Phoenix is valued at   1,800,000 and Portal is valued at   1,900,000.
In awakened form, due to the 33% hp rule, if the player resets their character or dies while transformed, they will untransform before dying, unlike other beast fruits.
Phoenix is the only fruit with a transformation that can be ended in a way other than emptying a fury meter. (This way being having below 33% hp or energy).
Phoenix (V2) is a balance between hunting bounty/PvP and grinding, as of short cooldown for most skills.

fruits.name: Portal
moves: After entering the rift, if the user stays idle, along with natural energy regeneration, the rift will last for around 278 seconds (4 minutes and 38 seconds), consuming approximately 0.36% of the user's energy per second, or 48 energy per second.

If the user were to hold down a move while inside the rift for as long as the rift lasts, the user's energy would be drained in around 120 seconds (2 minutes), losing approximately 0.83% of the user's energy per second, or 111.2 energy per second.
— When tapping or clicking, the user jumps forward with great speed while backflipping, and leaps off of any nearby objects. This move does not deal damage and does not collide with NPCs or players.

— The user dashes forward, in a manner closer to a teleport than a dash. If it hits an enemy, it sends them through multiple portals throwing them around, and finally smashing them to the ground. This move does not break Instinct on the final smash. This move also has slight auto-aim.

— The user enters a separate dimension that lasts for a few seconds. During this state, the user becomes invisible and invincible and is able to move around freely, and it also makes the user immune to water, but not lava. However, if the user uses any skill or M1, it exits them out of the dimension immediately. If the user uses this move next to an enemy, it damages them and stuns them for a little bit. This move can break Instinct.

— Upon usage, an interface having locations corresponding to their own seas shows up. After choosing the desired destination, a portal forms, with chaining wrapping the user and nearby enemies/allies. After full formation, if the user is close enough, they are teleported to the destination alongside their allies (which also need to be in range), and enemies are stunned and damaged. Up until the portal lasts, the user, their allies and enemies can repeatedly go from the origin to the destination back and forth. Afterwards, the portal disintegrates.

— Main article: Dimensional Rift
The user creates a rift to a separate dimension that attracts and pulls in the user along with other enemies, only if they are within proximity. Everyone who is absorbed into it will be put into a flat dimension, while the only escape is by entering through the portal above. While in the dimension, the user's energy slowly drains. The rift lasts until the user's energy is fully drained, or until the user has left/closed the rift by reusing the ability, or died.

— The user makes a portal at their cursor and another where they stand. This is a short-range teleport move. If it is opened on an enemy, it will deal some damage (also deals damage if the user is right next to them when using the skill). If the enemy walks towards any of the two portals, they will be teleported to the location of the other portal and it will deal damage every time the enemy walks into any of the two portals. The portals last for around 12 seconds.
trivia: The teleport moves do not teleport people if they have PvP disabled or if they are in a Safe Zone and not allied to the user.
Portal is the first fruit that has a teleport move that other players can access.
Although Portal and Phoenix share the robux price (  2,000), they don't share the same value. (Portal is valued at   1,900,000, while Phoenix is valued at   1,800,000).
Portal is the first fruit that is able to bring up a separate GUI.
Alongside the teleport move, Portal has the most mobility moves at four. (Phoenix is second at three)
The permanent version of Portal has a lot of value, mostly because of its [C] move as it can teleport nearly anywhere.
Midnight Blade and Bizarre Revolver creates portals similar to those created by Portal.
None of Portal's moves have destructible physics
Can be used to glitch through some walls (Ex: Igloo entrance on the cold side of Hot and Cold in the Second Sea).
Shortest cooldown at 2–2.5 seconds, but it has since been nerfed to 4 seconds.
The user may use any ability in the game in this state, but it will end this move.
When using this ability and passing through [C] World Warp from the enemy, the invisible duration will reset upon teleportation, causing the user to become invisible again.

The user can also teleport to the cursed ship without reaching Lv. 1000 through the use of this move. The enemies will still drop Ectoplasms and the user will be able to talk to the NPCs, however, the Cursed Captain will not drop the Hellfire Torch to the player, and they will not be able to accept any quests (because of the level requirement).
This is a great move for escaping Portal [V] loopers as this move cannot be canceled when used no matter what damage is taken.

This move could actually deal damage, even to the user. However, the amount of damage dealt was 1 damage or less, which is also why when the user teleported through the portal, the health bar on the top right appeared instead of being hidden.

This move could teleport the user out of a raid and still keeps the timer. This means if the raid was beaten, they would still be awarded the fragments even if they did not actively participate in the raid. When outside the raid, the user was immune to the attacks of other players. (This has been patched in Update 27.0)
The new reworked Portal C Gui shows how each teleport location looks making it easier for new players to understand Dock 1, 2, 3, 4 more easily.

There's a bug that could happen by someone letting the player enter [V] Dimensional Rift and then immediately quit the game. This leads to players being able to turn off fog, which effectively helps to clarify vision.
If the player is launched out of the dimension through the top portal by a high-knockback move, such as Godhuman [C], a bug may cause them to end up in a void far away from the islands.
Sometimes, when the dimension despawns and a player is in it, they will fall from the sky, high above the islands.
The user can use this to "swap places" with an enemy. However, if they use this when the enemies are really close to them, they will be at the portal where the user exits.
The portals can still be used while in the void from Parallel Escape, which means that the user can use this move for transporting/escaping quickly on the battlefield.

Can be opened up at any position and distance between each other, so the user can essentially trap NPCs/bosses/players in an infinite loop dealing massive damage to them along with the minor stun damage dealt from entering the portal.

fruits.name: Lightning
moves: The user shoots one of their charged orbs toward the aimed area. Consecutive orbs deal reduced damage. This variation uses 1 orb.
Upon holding the move for at least 0.5 seconds, the user creates an electrified sphere and throws it toward the cursor, pulling enemies in before exploding. This variation uses 1 orb.

Upon holding the move for at least 1.5 seconds, the user summons an electric dragon that circles around them. After releasing the move, the user dashes with the dragon toward the cursor. This variation uses 2 orbs. Depending on the situation, one of two variations will occur:
If hit (upgraded): If the user comes into contact with an enemy while dashing, the user grabs them, performing a 5-strike combo before knocking them away.
If missed: The user launches the dragon forward, which explodes on contact, or when it reaches max distance, dealing decent damage.
If hit (upgraded): If the user comes into contact with an enemy while dashing, the user grabs them, performing a 5-strike combo before knocking them away.
If missed: The user launches the dragon forward, which explodes on contact, or when it reaches max distance, dealing decent damage.

Explosion breaks Instinct most of the time. Can rarely be dodged on the edge.
The first and last strike breaks Instinct. The middle strikes can be dodged.

Elemental Reflex — The wielder is immune to all physical attacks (fighting style, sword, gun) from players unless the attacks are imbued with Aura. Against NPCs, this immunity applies unless they are of a higher level. This effect is only effective against non-boss enemies.

Orb Charge — The user has 4 electric orbs that spawn behind them. [Z] Lightning Orb, [V] Thunderball Destruction and [F] Electric Flash all consume an orb. Orbs take 5 seconds (3 seconds if upgraded) to recharge. [Z] Lightning Orbs and [F] Electric Flash cannot be used without them.
— Wielder continuously shoots out short bursts of lightning that deal low damage and stun. This attack can chain through multiple enemies.

— This move possesses three variations, each using a certain amount of orbs:
If tapped (Z1):

The user shoots one of their charged orbs toward the aimed area. Consecutive orbs deal reduced damage. This variation uses 1 orb.
If short-held (Z2):

Upon holding the move for at least 0.5 seconds, the user creates an electrified sphere and throws it toward the cursor, pulling enemies in before exploding. This variation uses 1 orb.
If fully held (Z3):

Upon holding the move for at least 1.5 seconds, the user summons an electric dragon that circles around them. After releasing the move, the user dashes with the dragon toward the cursor. This variation uses 2 orbs. Depending on the situation, one of two variations will occur:
If hit (upgraded): If the user comes into contact with an enemy while dashing, the user grabs them, performing a 5-strike combo before knocking them away.
If missed: The user launches the dragon forward, which explodes on contact, or when it reaches max distance, dealing decent damage.

— The user conjures a thundercloud from the sky. Shortly after, lightning bolts start striking the ground, stunning those hit. This move has two variations that can be activated by using [Z] Lightning Orb on the cloud:
Z1 (tap): Each orb extends the duration of the ability by around 5 seconds.
Z3 (hold): The user summons an electric dragon that bursts out from the cloud and crashes to the ground in the direction of the cursor. When used from higher altitudes, its targeting range increases.

— The user conjures a thundercloud from the sky that shoots down a harmless beam as a warning before discharging electricity in a bigger beam about 0.75s later. Enemies affected are pulled upwards and are stunned for 1 second.

— The user compresses multiple clouds into a ball made out of lightning that can be dropped like a bomb. Holding the move down consumes orbs and can be charged up to 4 times, increasing the hitbox and damage significantly.

— This move posseses two variations: 
If tapped: The user zaps forward, consuming an orb. Any enemies in the user's way will be briefly stunned and damaged.
If held The user performs continuous teleporting strikes if multiple enemies are standing close to each other.
trivia: Currently, there are many players taking advantage of the update to sell Lightning skins at exorbitant prices compared to reality.
Lightning is the fourth most expensive Elemental fruit, the third being Blizzard, the second being Dough and the most expensive being Gas.
Lightning is easy to use on mobile due to its AoE attacks. However, [X] and [V] may cause lag, and [F] may be difficult to use.
Lightning is often paired with many gun and sword main builds due to its versatility.
Lightning battled with the Pain fruit to have an awakening in the Blox Fruits Discord server. Lightning won and then received an awakening (Pre Update 27.1).
The old unawakened version of Lightning is used by the Lv. 575 boss, Thunder God. He uses [Z] Rumble Dragon and [X] Sky Thunder.
The Elite Pirate, Urban, uses the old version of Awakened Lightning. He uses [Z] Lightning Beast, [X] Thunderstorm and [V] Thunderball Destruction.
Lightning is the only fruit that does not display a full cooldown with its move [Z] (Lightning Orb) and [F] (Electric Flash).
Before the release of Update 27.1, players who had Rumble fully awakened (V2) received three upgrades on the Admin Panel for free.

Lightning raids are the first and only raids to be removed from Blox Fruits entirely (Previously the Item Pole (2nd Form) was inaccessible after the removal of Lightning raids, but now it can be obtained by getting struck by a lightning in Rough Sea while holding Pole (1st Form).)

Lightning has three reskin variants — Yellow, Purple, and Green. Each one is considered a separate fruit and has its own distinct physical appearance.
Upon eating any Lightning fruit skin, the user is granted the corresponding permanent CHROMATIC skin.
Upon eating any Lightning fruit skin, the user is granted the corresponding permanent CHROMATIC skin.
[V] Thunderball Destruction is the first ever ability in Blox Fruits to have five variants; all scaled between orb usage from 0-4 orbs.

Charging [X] Thunderstorm with 3-4 Z1 orbs can stun NPCs for over 10 seconds, allowing the user to use fighting style M1s on them to deal extra damage, or use the fruits M1 to recharge orbs. This is good for grinding since it can easily kill a group of enemies.
When using [F] Electric Flash, a distinct 'pop' sound effect, almost like a bubble, can be heard.
A fully charged [V] Thunderball Destruction can almost cover the entirety of the Jungle.

Pain Meter — The user has a passive meter bar that fills up with damage taken and Pain Ghosts absorbed. Having a full meter will unlock the user's inner pain, buffing Normal Attack's damage, reducing skill cooldowns and increasing speed. The amount of Pain Meter received when taking damage is percentage-based on user current HP, rather than max (lasts 1 minute).

Last Stand — Upon losing all health, the user enters a berserk state with a screen-shattering effect, emitting a red aura and standing in a crooked stance. During this state, dashes longer, Air Jumps higher, and both gain cloud-like VFX, movement speed is increased, holdable abilities charge faster, damage taken is reduced by 60%, and M1 damage is nearly doubled. However, only Pain moves can be used. The state lasts for 30 seconds (60 If upgraded), when the Pain Meter runs out, the user will die instantly, regardless of being in Combat or not.

Pain Ghosts — Each time the user misses the Z, X, C [Held], F [Held] moves, it spawns in a Pain Ghost possessing a sinister smile or sad frown that has a cloud-like appearance. These can be absorbed by the user to fill up their Pain Meter and instantly resets the cooldown of [F] Torment Warp. They can also heat seek towards nearby enemies and deal damage if the user has the third upgrade, Torment Conductor unlocked.

— This move has 2 variants:
If tapped:
The user releases a quick, large ball of dense energy, showing evil pareidolia. If hit, the enemy suffers tick damage in quick succession, and experiences screen shake and distortion, having an image similar to the ball's "face". This move is single-target.
If held:
The user holds out an enlarged throbbing ball of dense energy, having a similar design to its tapped variant, surrounded by the fog of Pain Ghosts. If hit, the enemy is dragged forward and suffers with the same effects as the tapped variant. The size of the ball is based on how much full is the pain meter. This move is multi-target.

— This move has 2 variants:
If tapped:
The user launches forward with a longer range than other fruits.
If held:
The user launches into the air, then dashes toward the cursor in a chosen direction. When used mid-air, the user immediately dashes toward the cursor. This summons four Pain Ghosts, regardless of whether or not the move hit or missed. The second upgrade, Agony Surge is required to be unlocked to use this.
trivia: Along with a few other fruits, Pain (named Paw at the time) was in the Fruit Awakening straw poll of Update 14. However, Rumble received the most votes, resulting in Pain getting no awakening.
Pain has its own death animation when Last Stand is activated.
Pain is the second fruit to have revive/second life mechanic, the first being Ghost Fruit.
[V] Torturing Pulse has the same mesh as Sanguine Art's [C] Devourer of Worlds.

fruits.name: Ectoplasm
trivia: A total of  565  is required to buy everything that requires this material.
The Ship Stewards and Ship Deckhands are the best enemies for Ectoplasm grinding.
Ectoplasm can also be obtained in the Third Sea by killing Cursed Ship enemies that spawn in a Pirate Raid.
The Ectoplasm is one of many other materials that can be obtained in Pirate Raids.
The player can see how much Ectoplasm they have by talking to Guashiem.
If the player has Dragon (West), they can enter the Cursed Ship and continuously use the [C] Scorching Downfall ability, almost covering the entire area.
If the player has Quake V awakened, they can hit every enemy in the ship.

fruits.name: Blizzard
moves: Elemental Reflex — The wielder is immune to all physical attacks (fighting style, sword, gun) from players unless the attacks are imbued with Aura. Against NPCs, this immunity applies unless they are of a higher level. This effect is only effective against non-boss enemies.

— The user throws snow shurikens that explode on impact, or when they have reached their maximum distance, causing damage to enemies in midair or on the ground. When the move is tapped, two shurikens will be launched. If the move is held for longer, then six shurikens will be released.

— The user creates a medium-sized snow tornado, carrying and pushing enemies before launching them up into the air. This tornado spins around for a few seconds and stuns any enemies caught in it, even if it is Instinct-tricked.
— The user creates a large and powerful whirlwind with their hand, stunning and damaging enemies while slightly sending them up. The position of the tornado can be controlled with the cursor.
— The user charges and sucks in nearby enemies before summoning a massive snow dome, causing high damage to enemies within its boundaries. This move will last for seven seconds.
— The user rides on a snow tornado that damages and slightly stuns while pushing enemies away. This move can be sustained indefinitely.
trivia: Blizzard is the third most expensive Elemental fruit, with Dough being the second, and Gas being the first.
Blizzard is the most expensive Legendary Fruit.
[V] Blizzard Domain has the largest AoE damage over time in the game, excluding Full Transformed Dragon [C] Scorching Downfall.
A distinct sound effect will play if the player holds one of Blizzard's moves for at least a second, which is the same as Ice.
Every move of Blizzard can break objects with Destructible Physics.
[F] Tornado Flight has the same name as Awakened Sand's [F] Sand Flight.
[F] Tornado Flight is highly recommended for Ship Raids as it does a lot of continuous damage.
Blizzard's mastery requirements have the same amount as Rumble's and Phoenix's.
Blizzard is one of the three Elemental Fruits which do not have an awakening, alongside Smoke and Gas.

fruits.name: Gravity
moves: If the user has only unlocked the 3rd upgrade, nothing special will happen when completely filled up.
If the user has unlocked and equipped the 4th upgrade, the bar will light on fire when completely full, similar to Kitsune and Dragon's meter upon transformation.
The user summons a small gravitational vortex at their cursor with a limited range, which explodes shortly after, dealing minor damage. Upgraded version has higher damage and a wider radius.
The user makes a swiping motion with their hand, creating a large gravitational sweep to the left, right, up and down. Upgraded version has higher damage and very high knockback.
The user summons a meteor from beyond the skies, landing at the location of their cursor, dealing high damage. Upgraded version summons more meteors, dealing higher damage.
The user summons a small gravitational vortex at their cursor with a limited range, which explodes shortly after, dealing minor damage. Upgraded version has higher damage and a wider radius.

If tapped:
The user creates a large black hole in their hands, quickly releasing it in the direction of their cursor whilst pulling in enemies caught in its path. It then explodes, dealing substantial AoE damage. The black hole can be controlled using the cursor.

The user creates a large black hole in their hands, quickly releasing it in the direction of their cursor whilst pulling in enemies caught in its path. It then explodes, dealing substantial AoE damage. The black hole can be controlled using the cursor.

If held:
The user uses 75% of their Gravitational Force meter to send a black hole into the sky, which starts absorbing matter and debris from the ground, pulling anyone unlucky enough to get caught in the pull. Once it has absorbed enough of the matter, the boulder will then expand under the pressure caused by the black hole and then explode, causing a very big explosion, after which chunks of debris will fall on the ground in a huge radius, dealing massive AoE damage alongside damage from the debris chunks. This move ignores all types of enemy armor except Shark V4's shield.

If tapped:
The user summons 3 meteorites that is then shot in the direction of their cursor.
The user summons 3 meteorites that is then shot in the direction of their cursor.

If held:
On ground, the user summons materials from within their vicinity, forming a spherical orb of different materials upon which they can ride on. In air, the user creates an additional two meteorites that the user then shoots out. When released, this orb is launched in the direction of the user's cursor, dealing minor AoE damage. Additionally, all other Gravity moves can be used while this move is being used. The user is immune to water and lava during either of these forms.
