Additionally, all other Gravity moves can be used while this move is being used. The user is immune to water and lava during either of these forms.

Singularity Shift — Whenever the player uses Flash Step, a lingering gravitational effect appears, dealing minor damage if a target comes near the initial teleportation area. This passive is quite similar to Yeti passive but does not last as long.

Gravitational Force — Upon unlocking and equipping the 3rd upgrade from the Admin Panel, Mysterious Scientist, a purple meter called "Gravitational Force" will be shown above the user's moveset. The meter fills up only by doing damage with Gravity's moves, and it very slowly depletes when the user is not dealing damage for a few seconds. The meter does not affect the damage or range of the moves, but it enables the use of [C] and [V] Ultimate moves when having  a certain proportion of the meter filled up. On players, the bar will fill up twice as much when dealing damage to them, possibly because of allowing the user to be able to fill up the meter and use the ultimate within the duration of the fight.
If the user has only unlocked the 3rd upgrade, nothing special will happen when completely filled up.
If the user has unlocked and equipped the 4th upgrade, the bar will light on fire when completely full, similar to Kitsune and Dragon's meter upon transformation.

Defensive Rift — Using the F move, "Shooting Star" will defend the user by making a pulse of gravity that knockbacks and damages nearby enemies whilst simultaneously backing away when they consecutively lose 20% of their HP. Using the F move multiple times before this passive takes effect will increase the amount of pulses made, increasing the damage caused by the knockback. The F move will be put on cooldown once the passive activates.

— This move possesses three variations:
The user summons a small gravitational vortex at their cursor with a limited range, which explodes shortly after, dealing minor damage. Upgraded version has higher damage and a wider radius.
The user makes a swiping motion with their hand, creating a large gravitational sweep to the left, right, up and down. Upgraded version has higher damage and very high knockback.
The user summons a meteor from beyond the skies, landing at the location of their cursor, dealing high damage. Upgraded version summons more meteors, dealing higher damage.

— The user creates a singularity within their hand, distorting spacetime, pulling in and stunning enemies whilst simultaneously distorting both parties' screens. The singularity then explodes in an AoE blast, knocking the enemies back.

— The user creates a black hole right above them, which picks up and spews out countless debris in the direction of their cursor, dealing minor AoE damage to enemies. This move can be held down forever, however, after a few seconds the speed debris that strikes begins to slow down, causing both the damage and stun to weaken.

— This move possesses two distinct variations:
If tapped:
The user creates a large black hole in their hands, quickly releasing it in the direction of their cursor whilst pulling in enemies caught in its path. It then explodes, dealing substantial AoE damage. The black hole can be controlled using the cursor.
If held:
The user uses 75% of their Gravitational Force meter to send a black hole into the sky, which starts absorbing matter and debris from the ground, pulling anyone unlucky enough to get caught in the pull. Once it has absorbed enough of the matter, the boulder will then expand under the pressure caused by the black hole and then explode, causing a very big explosion, after which chunks of debris will fall on the ground in a huge radius, dealing massive AoE damage alongside damage from the debris chunks. This move ignores all types of enemy armor except Shark V4's shield.
Note, the held version of this move requires the user to be out of the flight move, and have the 3rd upgrade(see upgrading above)'

— This move possesses two distinct variations:
If tapped:
The user creates a black hole in their hands before shooting it up towards the sky in a beam of gravitational force, summoning a large meteor that lands at the user's cursor, leaving a massive crater behind. If held without the upgrade on the ground for roughly 5 seconds, rocks start floating around and disappearing continuously around the user until the move is let go.
If held:
The user uses all of their Gravitational Force to try trapping enemies in a specified area. If the attack hits, a cutscene plays to both the user and the enemies, bringing down airborne enemies and stunning both parties with the sky darkening in the process, showing the user ripping out pieces of the moon and sending them down on The Planet of Blox Fruits. The meteors then fall on the specified area, causing huge explosion and damage upon impact with the ground. This move ignores all types of enemy armor except Shark V4's shield.
Note: to execute the held version, you need to be on the ground, out of the Flight move, and have the 4th upgrade(see upgrading above).'

— This move possesses two variations:
If tapped:
The user summons 3 meteorites that is then shot in the direction of their cursor.
If held:
On ground, the user summons materials from within their vicinity, forming a spherical orb of different materials upon which they can ride on. In air, the user creates an additional two meteorites that the user then shoots out. When released, this orb is launched in the direction of the user's cursor, dealing minor AoE damage. Additionally, all other Gravity moves can be used while this move is being used. The user is immune to water and lava during either of these forms.
trivia: Gravity is the cheapest Mythical fruit in the game.
The second rework concept of the Gravity moves was created by concept artist @crazy_rtx.
Gravity is the only fruit in the game to have 3 variants of its [M1] attacks.
As of now, Gravity is the only fruit with 13 abilities, making it the fruit with the highest number of skills in the game (including [M1] clicks).
The boss Orbitus uses a slightly altered version of Gravity, though the style of the moves resemble the old one.
Gravity is one of the first two fruits that could obtain upgrades through the Admin Panel, the other being Eagle and soon, Creation.
Gravity is one of six fruits to have a meter that is not intended for a transformation.
Gravity is the only fruit in the game that requires the most tasks and items to fully upgrade it through the Admin Panel.
Gravity is the second fruit to have a cutscene, the first being Control.
Gravity currently has the longest cutscene of any fruit, being roughly 13.79 seconds.
Gravity has been reworked two times and has two moves that are uncancellable.
When going through doorways while flying, the boulder will purposely lower into the ground to allow the user to enter.
[C] Gravitational Prison's upgraded version is very similar to an admin ability called "Tensei".
The users are unable to use the max upgraded [TAP] Normal Attack while flying with Gravity. However, it still works even if they stop without ending the flight mode.
Removing the stage 2 [M1] shortens the time to reach stage 3, however removing the stage 1 [M1] causes the stage 3 animation to play for a short time before becoming normal.
A physical Gravity fruit can be dropped from defeating the Tyrant of the Skies, at a very low chance.
Gravity and Blade are the only fruits that have had their entire moveset reworked twice.
Gravity's [M1] has an alternative button on mobile located above [Z] Singularity that functions just the same as tapping, although resembles the activation of a move instead.
Unlike other M1 attacks on mobile, 2 clicks are required to activate the [M1] ability.
[C] Gravitational Prison's upgraded version seems to be inspired by Chibaku Tensei (Planetary Devastation) From the Naruto franchise
[V] Asteroid Crash's upgraded version also appears to have taken heavy inspiration from a scene in the Battle of Titan from Avengers: Infinity War[1]
[F] Shooting Star has a glitch when if flown onto the ground (in which it is stuck) can cause the move to automatically end.

Gravity’s “Defensive Rift” Passive can be stacked permanently, meaning the player can deal an infinite amount of damage and one shot anything if done at close range once 20% damage is received. (This is likely to be patched quickly.)
Sometimes, when using a move while flying, the user will start to ragdoll.
In rare cases, while using [F] Shooting Star in water/sea, the user instantly dies due to an unknown glitch. (It is recommended to use [F] Shooting Star while staying out of water.)
If the user gets teleported to a raid island with the use of the [F] Shooting Star, they get flinged around the map and do not get teleported to the raid thus wasting the money/fruit.

If the user uses other Gravity skills and then uses the tap version of [Z] Singularity, there is a chance that when the circle of [Z] Singularity explodes, a negative colors circle can appear, and will disappear after 1-2 seconds.
Randomly, the held variant of [V] Asteroid Crash will not work and the player will have to talk to the Mysterious Scientist in order to unequip and reequip the ability to use it again.
If the user misses the held variation of [V] Asteroid Crash, their hands will have a glowing effect until they die or leave the game. This can also stack.
If the user is too high (about 300 meters) when they use [V] Asteroid Crash, sometimes the move will not trigger but will still go on cooldown.
Gravity's [M1] doesn't work on controller.

Before entering the rift that unlocks Draco Race V4, hold [F] Shooting Star and enter the rift. From the moment user enter the rift until the end or failure of the trial, the player will remain in the flying state. Players will not cancel a flight when delivering a specific item.
Due to an oversight, the Singularity Shift overrides the flashstep of the Draco race, it also however overrides the Human v4 psycho gear flashsteps, making using human with this fruit unviable.

fruits.name: Meteorite
trivia: A total of  7  is required to craft everything that requires this material.
The icon of this material resembles the old Gravity's icon.

fruits.name: Mystic Droplet
trivia: A total of  102  Mystic Droplets is required to buy everything that requires this material.
The Mystic Droplet can be obtained in the Third Sea through enemies that spawn in the Pirate Raid.

fruits.name: Radioactive Material
trivia: A total of  42  Radioactive Materials is required to buy everything that needs this material.

fruits.name: Mammoth
moves: Prehistoric Leap — When pressing the "jump" button or space key while transformed, the user creates a small AoE shockwave that does no damage, but the landing generates a crater that deals damage. This jump is estimated to be three times higher than Buddha's Seismic Jump. Note that this heightened jump only occurs on the first attempt, while subsequent jumps will reach a normal height.

Ancient Armor — The user is able to transform into a hulking, armored Mammoth. While transformed, the user is granted a 50% (58.75% against NPCs) damage reduction. Being transformed also gives the user a jump boost and dash boost, at the expense of their overall walk speed.
— The user gets engulfed by a dark mammoth-shaped shadow with shining red eyes, and stomps on the ground, sending three large red strikes an exceedingly high distance forward.
— The user is engulfed by a dark mammoth, then bolts to the aimed area. Upon hitting a target, the mammoth springs its head up, jabbing the target and sending them up.
— The user dashes forward akin to the [X] move enshrouded in a dark, mammoth-shaped shadow, but upon striking a target, they are forcefully slammed down.
— Upon transformation into an armored mammoth, the user emits a thunderous, wrathful uproar.

— The user pounces up into the air and falls down, causing a massive crater. The longer the move is held, the farther the user jumps. The distance of the move increases only once and roughly doubles, which could be seen by a slight change in the holding animation.

— The user unleashes a four-hit combo sequence, incorporating two trunk slaps, a powerful stomp with the front legs, and culminating with a blazing wrathful roar. After executing the roar, there is a moderate cooldown period for the combo. However, the cooldown can be bypassed by either performing only three hits (intentionally excluding the roar), executing [C] immediately after the combo, or waiting for half a second after the combo and then executing [Z], [X], or a held [F].

— Initially, the user lashes out three large strikes akin to the untransformed version, followed by three additional slashes launched at a wider angle. However, this version targets a single enemy once per set of slashes. If a single enemy is struck by two sets of slashes, the damage inflicted by the second set is significantly reduced, approximately 15% of the damage from the first set.
— The user bolts forward to the target. Upon impact, the target is thrusted upwards, soaring to great heights and sustaining significant damage.
— The user darts forward. Upon contact, the target is forcefully crashed into the ground while sustaining an exceedingly high amount of damage.
— The user returns to their human form.

— The user lunges forward to their cursor, unleashing a thunderous raging stampede that inflicts continuous damage as long as the key is held. The first five enemies struck directly by the stampede are forcefully dragged along. Additionally, this ability grants immunity to stun.
trivia: The impact from jumping works the opposite way from Awakened Buddha. Buddha's jump damage applies on the initial jump from the ground, as for Mammoth, it applies on its landing. The impact from jumping can reset air jumps. This can be useful in evading water for players not of the Shark race by touching the surface of the water to reset air jumps while taking little to no damage.
The silhouette of its beast form can be seen when using its untransformed skills (excluding the [V] move).
The [X] move on Twin Hooks, Prehistoric Punt, parallels the [X] move on Mammoth, True Prehistoric Punt.

If the player pairs Bear Ears and Shark race with Mammoth, their damage reduction will be increased from 50 to about 70%. With Water Body, the player's damage reduction will increase from about 70% to about 80% due to Water Body boosting their defense by 65% for 4.5 seconds. (Recommended to get Race Awakening due to Shark V3 being heavily nerfed)

If the player pairs Bear Ears and Cyborg race (V2 and above) with Mammoth, its passive damage reduction will be raised from 55% to about 62% for any attack, and for attacks by Melee, Sword or Gun the player will have 85.5%. With the [T] ability active, the player will have ~69% in any attack and for attacks by Melee, Sword and Gun the player will have ~72%.

Mammoth is one of three pairs of fruits to share the same monetary value. The other two pairs are Control and Gas at   3,200,000 or   2,500, Yeti and Leopard at   5,000,000 or   3000.
(Shared with T-Rex at   2,700,000 or   2,350)
(Shared with T-Rex at   2,700,000 or   2,350)
Mammoth is the third fruit that doesn't need a Fury Meter to transform. (The first being Phoenix, second being Leopard, fourth being Yeti)

When getting hit by a move that has a grabbing animation while transformed, such as Dragon [X], the user will fly in weird ways that should be normal when at the size of a regular player, making it look comical in some sorts.

fruits.name: T-Rex
moves: Fury Meter — The user starts with 0% of the "Fury Meter" bar when spawned. The user's Fury Meter needs to be full to be able to transform into a T-Rex. Fury is regained over time while not transformed. Being transformed does not passively drain Fury Meter. Using moves or taking damage while transformed decreases the user's Fury Meter by a certain amount. When dealing damage while transformed, the Fury Meter will increase. The fury meter takes 1 minute and 30 seconds to fill to full from 0% to 100%.
Prehistoric Scales — When transformed, the user gains approximately 43% damage reduction (55% against NPCs) from all sources, 2x increased dash range and jump height, 20% speed increase.

Prey Mark — During transformation, the user's attacks will apply a prey mark to the hit opponents, the farther they are from the user, the higher the tick damage. However, damage from the prey mark does not contribute to the regeneration of the Fury Meter.

— The user initiates a set of four attacks: first, alternating strikes with the left and right claws forward; then, both claws tearing into the opponent simultaneously; finally, sweeping the surroundings with the tail as a finishing move. This move is similar to Kitsune's M1s. The damage can be doubled if hit fast enough right after the previous hit.

— The player sweeps forward with the tail, creating a broad deep-green projectile that cuts through objects ahead (similar to Yama [Z] And Longsword [Z]) as well as a pair of deep-green jaws that have a large, yet close-range, hitbox.
— The user pulls opponents from a frontal cone-shaped area towards them with the force of a raging wind, then roars and repels, similar to Sharkman Karate [C] and Awakened Quake's [Z] move.
— The user pounds forward, with a dark aura embracing them resembling a ferocious predator, before tearing apart opponents with razor-sharp claws. This move is very similar to Tushita [X].
— The player roars skyward, transforming into a Tyrannosaurus Rex as meteorites fall in their vicinity, an orange atmosphere is created for the player (and those nearby), and the ground shakes.

— The player leaps high into the air and, upon descending, smashes down onto the opponent, similar to Mammoth [F], Buddha's [C] move (unawakened), and Rocket's [C] move, adopting the same holding mechanic as said move.

— The user initiates a set of four attacks: A bite to the left and right with a green slash effect, then a bite, and finally a roar that creates a medium-sized AoE around the user. All 4 M1 attacks can damage Sea Beasts as well as Factories, but not the Leviathan.
— The user sweeps forward with the tail, cutting through the air ahead before launching five verdant slashing strikes.

— Bowing down, a whirlwind rises before the user, engulfing everything inside a vortex with the force of a raging wind, then briefly letting out a wrathful outcry repelling the enemy. The user inhales much more air if the move is held, pulling in the enemy closer with the same result.

— The user bolts forward to the opponent, tightly biting the opponent with sharp fangs, shaking the target, and finally crashing them forcefully onto the ground causing the opponent's screen to disorient for 4.5 seconds. Similar to Rengoku Z, Mammoth C and Shark Anchor X.
— The user reverts to their human form, allowing them to use their swords, fighting styles and guns.

— The user bounds high up into the air and performs a front flip. Upon hitting the ground, a ring of scorching, piercing magma ignites around the impact, dealing a decent amount of AoE damage. Similar to Mammoth [F], Buddha's [C] move (unawakened), and Rocket's [C] move.
trivia: T-Rex has been nominated to be added to the game since Update 7.

T-Rex has the same price as Mammoth, both costing   2,700,000 or   2,350.
This also makes T-Rex one of the only fruits that share a monetary value with another fruit, with the second being Control and Gas, and the third being Leopard and Yeti.
Even though T-Rex has the same value as Mammoth, however, T-Rex has more demand in terms of trading.
This also makes T-Rex one of the only fruits that share a monetary value with another fruit, with the second being Control and Gas, and the third being Leopard and Yeti.
Even though T-Rex has the same value as Mammoth, however, T-Rex has more demand in terms of trading.
T-Rex is one of the few fruits to leave effects on nearby users' screens when using a move/transformation.

The player has a tail while they have T-Rex equipped. This is only cosmetic and does not add anything, unlike Kitsune's Tails.
This also adds to the fact that T-Rex is one of the only Beast fruits to add cosmetics to the user, along side Eagle.
This also adds to the fact that T-Rex is one of the only Beast fruits to add cosmetics to the user, along side Eagle.

Due to the infliction of tick damage on enemies during the transformation, T-Rex can excel in PvP, being able to damage the enemy even at exceedingly high distances. It can also let the user see where the opponent is, making it very hard for them to escape.
The Prey Mark's tick damage works best when inflicting damage and then getting teleported to Portal's [V] (Dimensional Rift).
This also works surprisingly well with it's [C] (World Warp).
The Prey Mark's tick damage works best when inflicting damage and then getting teleported to Portal's [V] (Dimensional Rift).
This also works surprisingly well with it's [C] (World Warp).

For some reason, using T-Rex will grant a higher chance of marking the user's kill as a "Suspicious Kill" (which doesn't reward bounty for the kill and doesn't make the killed player lose bounty), even if all moves are used during the fight and are not spammed.

T-Rex, along with Dragon and Gas, are the only unawakenable Blox Fruits that have unique transformation names ([V] Reptilian Scales for T-Rex and [V] Imperial Evolution for Dragon and [V] Vapour Condensation for Gas ).

T-Rex has a glitch that allows to go through the sea in transformation by using [C] Hunter's Rage skill while aiming down in the water, though they will die instantly. The user will keep falling through the map if they have Shark race and teleport back at the spawn point of the last island they stepped on.
If the opponent stays at the edge of T-Rex's [X] move, they could walk out of it as they are not fully stunned.

The in-game T-Rex's design bears resemblance to transformed Dragon's western variant, due to the curved, backwards facing horns on both their heads. Their relation is further implied by the fact that both T-Rex and Dragon are linked to the Prehistoric Island.

fruits.name: Dough
moves:
If used on the ground:
The user kneels down and, upon releasing the move, summons a tall spiky statuette of dough from the ground at where the cursor is pointing, impaling and stunning any enemies in its way upwards. After a moment, the statuette plummets back into the ground with the enemies, stunning them. This move can be held for 1 second to increase its overall size.

The user kneels down and, upon releasing the move, summons a tall spiky statuette of dough from the ground at where the cursor is pointing, impaling and stunning any enemies in its way upwards. After a moment, the statuette plummets back into the ground with the enemies, stunning them. This move can be held for 1 second to increase its overall size.

If used in the air:
The user turns their arm into stretchy and sticky dough  and, upon releasing the move, stretches their arm forward in the direction of the cursor. If an enemy is hit, the user grabs them and then sends them through a barrage of donuts, finishing off by punching the enemy into the ground. Holding the move for at least 1 second will significantly increase its range and hitbox. This version deals slightly more damage than the ground version.

The user turns their arm into stretchy and sticky dough  and, upon releasing the move, stretches their arm forward in the direction of the cursor. If an enemy is hit, the user grabs them and then sends them through a barrage of donuts, finishing off by punching the enemy into the ground. Holding the move for at least 1 second will significantly increase its range and hitbox. This version deals slightly more damage than the ground version.

If used on the ground:
The user kneels down and, upon releasing the move, summons a tall spiky statuette of dough from the ground at where the cursor is pointing, impaling and stunning any enemies in its way upwards. After a moment, the statuette plummets back into the ground with the enemies, stunning them. This move can be held for 1 second to increase its overall size.

The user kneels down and, upon releasing the move, summons a tall spiky statuette of dough from the ground at where the cursor is pointing, impaling and stunning any enemies in its way upwards. After a moment, the statuette plummets back into the ground with the enemies, stunning them. This move can be held for 1 second to increase its overall size.

If used in the air:
The user turns their arm into stretchy and sticky dough  and, upon releasing the move, stretches their arm forward in the direction of the cursor. If an enemy is hit, the user grabs them and then sends them through a barrage of donuts, finishing off by punching the enemy into the ground. Holding the move for at least 1 second will significantly increase its range and hitbox. This version deals slightly more damage than the ground version.

The user turns their arm into stretchy and sticky dough  and, upon releasing the move, stretches their arm forward in the direction of the cursor. If an enemy is hit, the user grabs them and then sends them through a barrage of donuts, finishing off by punching the enemy into the ground. Holding the move for at least 1 second will significantly increase its range and hitbox. This version deals slightly more damage than the ground version.
Initial grab by the spike breaks Instinct most of the time, but it can rarely be dodged on the edge. The damage from the spike going down can also be dodged.
The initial grab breaks Instinct no matter what, but the barrage can be dodged (will still stun). The AoE ground slam can be dodged on the edge. (The player will still get knocked back.

Elemental Reflex — The fruit user is immune to all physical attacks (fighting style, sword, gun) from players unless the attacks are imbued with Aura. Against NPCs, this immunity applies only if the player is a certain level above them. This effect is only effective against non-boss enemies.

— The user's arm turns into a reddish-orange, oval-shaped blazing piece of dough and shoots it in the direction of the cursor. If the dough hits the ground or is at its max range, it will explode, dealing AoE damage. Landing this move directly on the player's hitbox will push them back.

— The user creates a long lasso made out of dough. If the lasso is launched at a nearby enemy, the target will get grabbed, lifted up and then slammed down. The lasso can be aimed while holding the enemy.

— The user turns into a big donut and starts rolling forward, and when the [C] key is released, the user turns their right hand into a black spiked and fried, dough-like club and slams down on the target, knocking their target up. Although it can be used to travel, it’s not recommended because of the short travel time of just 3.5 seconds.

— The user creates multiple rings around their cursor. After a short while, Aura-imbued fists start coming out of said rings, punching in the direction of the cursor and stunning any enemy caught in the barrage for the duration of the move. The user can slightly change the position of their victims caught in the attack. This move can be cancelled either if the user stops holding the move, of if the users gets damaged. This move lasts for 4.5 seconds when fully held. This attacks is not affected by Aura colors.
— The user turns into a donut and starts rolling at a decent pace, being able to travel for 30 seconds.

— When held, the user pulls one of their arms back slightly and summons a tendril of dough from the ground by their correlating arm and loops it into a donut. The user then punches, and as they do that, a sticky dough fist comes out of said donut and punches at the direction of the cursor, knocking back any enemies in its way. The user can perform this attack 3 times in total until it restarts. When the donuts are not used, they will float around the user for 20 seconds, before dissipating. The longer the move is held, the further the punch goes and the more damage it deals. Having Aura active makes the attack get imbued with the user's Aura, and slightly increases the attack's range and damage. If an enemy is pushed against a solid surface (like a wall or floor), they will be stuck to the surface and briefly stunned. Fully charging this attack requires holding the move for 1 second, and while held, the user can move and jump, but they cannot dash, Air Jump, and Flash Step.

— The user's right arm turns into a chunk of dough, and when released, the user fires a hot dough missile in the direction of the cursor, dragging any enemy in its way and then causing an AoE explosion upon contact with a solid surface, or when it reaches its maximum range. Holding the move for at least 1 second will increase the missile's size, range, AoE and damage - enemies dragged by the projectile will receive more damage than enemies hit by just the explosion. The user will also get launched back upon releasing the move, depending on how long it was held. Having Aura active will increase its damage by around 10%.

— This move offers two distinct variations:
If used on the ground:
The user kneels down and, upon releasing the move, summons a tall spiky statuette of dough from the ground at where the cursor is pointing, impaling and stunning any enemies in its way upwards. After a moment, the statuette plummets back into the ground with the enemies, stunning them. This move can be held for 1 second to increase its overall size.
If used in the air:
The user turns their arm into stretchy and sticky dough  and, upon releasing the move, stretches their arm forward in the direction of the cursor. If an enemy is hit, the user grabs them and then sends them through a barrage of donuts, finishing off by punching the enemy into the ground. Holding the move for at least 1 second will significantly increase its range and hitbox. This version deals slightly more damage than the ground version.

— The user turns into a big spiked donut, rolling at great speeds, and if they collide with an enemy, the opponent will stick to the user's spiked dough forearm and be stunned. Then, the user swings their arm around through the air, picking up any enemies nearby, then smashes it down from a great height, crushing enemies and launching debris, as well as launching both parties into the air. The move can only be held for 4 seconds, and the entire swing-to-smash animation lasts around 3 seconds. This is one of the best combo extenders in the game.

— The user summons multiple donuts around their cursor and starts punching, and after a short while, the donuts start rapidly punching at the direction of the cursor, pummeling anyone unfortunate enough to get caught in the barrage. While the move is performed, neither the user nor the stunned enemy may move unless the move is stopped by the user, or if their move gets cancelled if the user gets damaged. The user can also change the direction at which the donuts punch, and therefore can change the position of their victims caught in their attack. This move has a duration of around 5 seconds when fully held. This move is good for opening or closing combos.

— The user turns into a spiked donut that starts rolling at fast speeds. This move is great for traveling, as it can roll on both water and lava, climb walls and damage anyone that it touches while moving (unlike its unawakened version). This skill can stun forever, as long as the user keeps hitting them (although the enemy can attack while they are getting stunned).
trivia: Dough is the second most expensive fruit to awaken, behind Lightning which costs 21,500 fragments

All of the awakened abilities are affected by Aura Colors, changing the outline in all the moves and "electricity" effects (the only other fruits in which the moves are affected by the Aura Color being Rubber and Spider).

Dough is the only fruit in the entire game who's attacks are buffed by Aura, specifically its [TAP] Normal Attack and [Z] Missile Jab when awakened.
Additionally, depending on whether the user has Aura activated or not, the sound effects of Dough's [TAP] Normal Attack and [V] Dough Fist Fusillade will be different.
Additionally, depending on whether the user has Aura activated or not, the sound effects of Dough's [TAP] Normal Attack and [V] Dough Fist Fusillade will be different.

There are multiple glitches with Dough, including:
The [X] Pastry River ability can get the user stuck in place and make them unable to move until they get killed or reset, and using the ability mid-air can sometimes result in the opponent getting glitched out of the map.
When the user uses [X] Pastry River (Air) on the player with at least 1 hp left, after respawning (if fist barrage is still going) when the downslam occurs, that player will be teleported in EXACT same place as the center of the downslam.
If the user is getting hit by the [V] Dough Fist Fusillade ability and someone attacks the Dough user, they will be locked in place until death or leaving.
This can also happen if the user is holding the ability and then exits the game.
If the user dashes, jumps, and uses the [TAP] Normal Attack all at the same time, they will dash further than normal, similarly to Skull Guitar, but less effective.

The [X] Pastry River ability can get the user stuck in place and make them unable to move until they get killed or reset, and using the ability mid-air can sometimes result in the opponent getting glitched out of the map.

When the user uses [X] Pastry River (Air) on the player with at least 1 hp left, after respawning (if fist barrage is still going) when the downslam occurs, that player will be teleported in EXACT same place as the center of the downslam.

If the user is getting hit by the [V] Dough Fist Fusillade ability and someone attacks the Dough user, they will be locked in place until death or leaving.
This can also happen if the user is holding the ability and then exits the game.
This can also happen if the user is holding the ability and then exits the game.
If the user dashes, jumps, and uses the [TAP] Normal Attack all at the same time, they will dash further than normal, similarly to Skull Guitar, but less effective.
When the user uses the [Z] Missile Jab or [X] Pastry River (Air variant) abilities, they can see that their arm disappears but rebuilds itself with mass.
Dough's unawakened [X] Sticky Dough and [C] Carved Dough abilities bear a visual resemblance to an ability from an old game made by mygame43, Elemental Battlegrounds.
If the user uses Dough's [C] Piercing Clothesline while not using any Aura Colors, the effects will be red by default.
If two Dough users use [C] Piercing Clothesline against each other, both of them will hit, but no one would take damage.
Dough’s [C] Piercing Clothesline (awakened/unawakened) can be used as an alternative for its [F] Scorching Donut move (awakened/unawakened), but only for up to four seconds.
[V] Dough Fist Fusillade will appear with bigger hands when used with aura, while without it will appear significantly skinnier.
Dough is the only Mythical fruit that can be awakened.

Dough is the first Mythical Elemental fruit, while the second is Gas.
Dough used to be a Natural fruit that had the Elemental Reflex passive only if the user's Instinct was turned on, but this was later changed, and Dough was made entirely Elemental.
Dough used to be a Natural fruit that had the Elemental Reflex passive only if the user's Instinct was turned on, but this was later changed, and Dough was made entirely Elemental.
Awakened Dough's [Z] Missile Jab ability projectile is actually a small aura-covered fist after being fired.
If the player uses the [C] Piercing Clothesline ability with Ghost's Resurrection Passive active, the swinging arm will appear translucent.

Repeatedly using awakened [TAP] Normal Attack and/or aiming the [V] Dough Fist Fusillade move in the same spot will leave a crack on the ground, which increases in size the more the user punches in that spot. When using [V] Dough Fist Fusillade, the crack will briefly appear "scorched".
As of update 27.1, if the user uses [C] Piercing Clothesline or [F] Scorching Donut in the Submerged Island, they will begin to rapidly accelerate upwards, either forcing them to exit or even drown.

fruits.name: Shadow
moves: — The user will always have an Umbra Meter bar on their screen. The meter fills up by dealing damage with Shadow abilities to enemies, and it fills up automatically at night. The Umbra Meter can only be drained by using [V] Corvus Torment. The user will also get a shadow aura surrounding themselves that will be bigger and darker, depending on the amount of Umbra Meter they have. (Note: the Shadow aura does not deal damage to anyone, and is purely cosmetic.)

— The user turns into a small dark orb of shadow, then dashes towards their cursor. Upon contact with an opponent, the user will turn into a swarm of bats and damage the enemy, then launch themselves upward, leaving the enemy on the ground. the user will receive i-frames during the duration of the move if they land it. This move is similar to Godhuman's Z (Soaring Beast) move.

— The user shoots a swarm of bats towards the cursor. Upon surface contact, the swarm will explode, dealing damage and sending a few small bats which will then fly to a nearby enemy and damage them. The bats have slight auto-aim, and will attempt to fly towards the target if close enough. 
(Note: Multiple bats can attack the same target).

— The user lunges forward. If the user makes contact with an enemy, the user will regain 20% of their max health and deal good damage to the enemy, knocking them back. This move is similar to Sanguine Art's [Z] (Bloodbane Drain) but the range is shorter and high end-lag. This move has a finisher variant, it makes the victim instantly explode on contact. (Health must be maximum half the damage of the move to activate)

— The user inflates their body into a giant dark sphere, after which, they will explode, draining the entirety of their Umbra Meter and forming an "umbral" cloud. The explosion will do extreme damage and leave behind a swarm of bats which will deal passive damage to any enemies inside of the cloud. The enemies' vision will also get slightly distorted if they get hit by the explosion. The size of the black hole and explosion is based on how high the user's Umbra Meter is. The remains of the explosion doesn't really stun. Instead, it pulls the enemies back inside the remains of the move. However, it is possible to escape the explosion's remains using certain teleportation moves.

— The user transforms into a swarm of bats, giving the user the ability to fly at a medium pace. Flying close to enemies will project bats into them, causing damage. After 10 seconds, the user will return to normal.
trivia: Shadow is the only fruit that allows the user to utilize the life drain mechanic (just like Ghoul's life leech) by using [C] Nightmare Leech.
Shadow is the only fruit with the Umbra Meter as it was designed only for itself.

"Umbra" in Latin means "shade" and/or "shadow", and "Corvus" in Latin refers to a "raven" or a "crow", both being types of birds. This ties into how many of the fruit's abilities have to do with crows/ravens flying at the enemy.
Shadow's [Z], [X], [C] moves are quite similar to Godhuman's [Z], [X] (Tap Variant) and [C].
Shadow is the rarest and most expensive fruit obtainable from a Fruit Box.
This fruit has low value in trading due the low versatility and overall negligence.

fruits.name: Venom
moves: Note: Only one target per head, if there’s only one enemy near, one head will target them, and the other two will despawn after they hit the ground.
Note: Only one target per head, if there’s only one enemy near, one head will target them, and the other two will despawn after they hit the ground.

Fury Meter — The user starts with 50% of their "Fury Meter" bar filled upon spawning. The user's Fury Meter needs to be full to be able to transform. Fury is regained over time and drains while the user is transformed. Using moves while transformed also decreases the user's fury meter by various amounts. When transformed, the user gains a 50% defense buff with enhanced attacks.

Hazardous Puddles — The user can make poisonous puddles by certain attacks (Z, X and transformed C). Every player within the radius of these puddles will be inflicted with a poisonous miasma, which deals a hefty amount of tick damage. If caused by attack [X] or [C] (Transformed), the enemy's screen will turn dark purple and wobble. The puddles also deal damage to enemies, but they will not be affected by miasma and will not be damaged if they walk out from the puddles.

Venomous Drop — While transformed, Air Jumping two or more times or going up to a good height and then falling to the ground will cause a small explosion and leave poison puddles. The duration of the user's fall does not affect the spread of the puddles. This passive is similar to Mammoth's Prehistoric Leap and Awakened Buddha's Seismic Jump passive.

— The user fires a barrage of poisonous blades in the direction of the cursor, stunning any enemy in the attack if multiple blades simultaneously hit the target, and leaving puddles of Venom Miasma on the ground if used close enough to it. Holding this move will make the user launch more blades. This move is similar to Dragon C, Light X (unawakened) and Magma Z.

— The user gathers venom in their hands, creating a big poison ball. The user then launches three bolts of venom at the same time in the direction of the cursor, which explode and leave multiple puddles of Venom Miasma on the ground if used close enough to it. Any enemy who got hit by the explosion will be poisoned and their screen will be distorted for a short period of time. This ability has aim-assist/auto-aim.

— The user produces a deadly smoke, surrounding them completely until its duration ends. The smoke will continually damage the opponent (5-6 ticks) if they stay within the proximity of the Venom user. Interestingly, once the opponent is damaged by only one tick of this move, or damaged until the smoke ends, they will still take poison damage, meaning that this move inflicts extra poison damage (3-4 ticks), which is pretty much similar to the [X] move.

— The user gathers a large amount of venom and then transforms, taking the form of a giant three-headed draconic monster, resembling a hydra. This move tremendously boosts damage for all of its attacks in the moveset, and massively increases poison damage (from puddles). Additionally, all of Venom's moves gain a different color scheme. This move grants the user 50% defense against all attacks, and is immune to basic LMB attacks from NPCs (note that players could still hit the user with M1s). The user also gains a jump boost, but their dash distance and walking speed is significantly reduced. While transformed, the user cannot use any other moves and attacks besides Venom's. This move consumes 15% of the Fury Meter.

— The user surrounds themselves with venom that resembles a long serpent before beginning to fly. The user's movement speed is quite slow in this form, but their speed increases as their health gets lower. Anyone who goes through the serpent will take continual poison damage. When the user stops holding the [F] key, it creates a small purple explosion, dealing AoE damage and high poison tick damage. This move lasts for 40 seconds.

— The user fires a barrage of venom projectiles. This time, the user is able to shoot more projectiles, deal more damage and leave much more puddles on the ground. This move also has a larger hitbox and longer range. This move consumes 7.5% of the Fury Meter.

— The user gathers a large amount of venom, creating a large sphere of poison. The user then spits out three bolts of venom at the same time in the direction of the cursor, which explode and leave multiple puddles of Venom Miasma on the ground. Any enemy who got hit by the explosion will have their screen distorted and will be poisoned, dealing four ticks of damage. This version has bigger hitbox and longer range, while also retaining it's aim assist/auto-aim feature. This move consumes 10% of the Fury Meter.

— The user breathes out a massive cloud of venomous gas that surrounds the player and deals massive damage to anyone in its radius. Players who are inside the fog and are taking damage will be unable to dash, use their Air jumps and Instinct until they either go out of the fog or the fog dissipates. Each cycle deals three ticks of damage, the user can do two cycles with this skill. Once enemies take one tick of poison, they will take the next two ticks. This move consumes 15% of the Fury Meter.
— The user absorbs the venom in a sphere and returns back to their human form, regaining the ability to use their Fighting Style, Sword and Gun.

— The user surrounds themselves with venom that resembles a long serpent before taking to the sky. This time, the serpent is much larger, and moves much faster based on how much damage the user has taken in total. Three smaller dragon heads spin around the serpent. Once the user hits a target or stops pressing F, the serpent explodes, dealing damage and leaving a poison puddle if near the ground. The three heads will also be released, homing in on any nearby targets and dealing more damage. Unlike the untransformed version of this move, moving into the enemy while using this move does not affect them with the poisonous effect. This move lasts for 10 seconds. This move consumes 5% of the Fury Meter.
Note: Only one target per head, if there’s only one enemy near, one head will target them, and the other two will despawn after they hit the ground.
trivia: Venom's transformation model was made by Mary (@Marubravery on X).
Venom is the only fruit that starts with the letter "V".
Venom shares similarities with Magma, as both have abilities that create puddles that cause damage over time. Their damage stacks as well, making them deal incredible amounts of damage.

When transformed, the user is "immune" to all environment lava puddles, such as those found in Raids or on the island Hot and Cold (this is because the hitbox when transforming is above the lava, preventing the user from taking damage). The user, however, can be harmed by the lava puddles by being dragged down by an ability such as Awakened Flame's [V].

There was a glitch when if the user transforms and immediately sits on a chair, the multi-headed dragon's walking, jumping and idle animation is replaced with a T-Pose that appears one second before the animations load in. Doing this does not drain the user's Fury Meter and jumping will make them Air Jump instead. After pressing [V] again, the game still believes the player is sitting and does not allow them to jump but they will be able to move. To be able to jump again, the player needs to either reset, get killed, or leave the game. This glitch has been patched.
Venom transformation works similarly to the Awakened Buddha, gaining reduced dash and acceleration buffs from accessories.
It is recommended to use Ghoul V3, Shark V2/V3 passive, or Human V3 while using Venom. Ghoul reduces cooldowns even more for Venom, Shark takes no damage in water and Human buffs the damage.
Venom has the one of the largest AoE in the game, which is [C] Toxic Fog when transformed. (The other being Awakened Quake [V], Blizzard [V], and transformed Eastern/Western Dragon [C] and [Z]).
Sometimes, transformed [C] Toxic Fog only does one cycle of poison damage. This could be a bug.
Despite Venom having a transformation and having a Meter mechanic, it is not a Beast fruit, making it the first and only Natural fruit with a transformation and a meter mechanic.

Venom is a good counter to Awakened Dough, as most of Dough's moves need to be held to deal maximum damage. Venom is able to interrupt Dough moves and combos very well, mainly Dough's [X] and [V] moves. However, using T-Rex transformation would be more effective.
Just like Dragon and T-Rex, Venom's Fury Meter needs 1 minute and 30 seconds to fully recharge.
Venom is the only Natural fruit to have a Fury Meter.
Venom is currently one of the Blox Fruits that are very outdated. (The other fruits being Control, and Shadow )
Venom, Spirit and Classic Dragon are the only fruits not to receive a model rework in Update 20.
Venom's flight move is one of the flight moves that, instead of getting slower the lower the user's health is, it gets faster, much like Sound.
Untransformed [C] is one of, if not, the quietest attacks of a fruit.

fruits.name: Control
moves: Area Bound — Control's abilities are confined within the Area it establishes, which remains active for approximately 55 seconds. While inside the Area, the moves of the Koko sword are greatly buffed. The longer that the key is held the bigger it is.

— The user creates an Area. Holding Z will make the Area bigger. When used with the Koko sword, both the Z and X moves of the sword will be massively buffed. This also turns the icon of the fruit in their hotbar green until the area disappears.
— The user levitates an object, or part of an object within range of the Area, and can then fling it by releasing the X key. The user cannot dash while holding this move.

— The user holds out a purple/blue-ish sword, then performs a laido strike. If hit, a cutscene will trigger where the user performs multiple slashes on the target and then finishes them off with the final blow, launching them into the air.

— The user holds out a green-ish sword, then launches a green projectile towards their cursor. If it hits an enemy, a cutscene will trigger where the user begins to launch green slashes all over the Area, damaging everyone inside of it. When the slashing ends, the user goes back to their physical form and does one final slash, dealing the most damage on a specific enemy who gets hit by it.
— The user teleports to where their cursor is. The user can only teleport onto surfaces inside of their Area. Placing the cursor on a player makes them teleport behind that player.
trivia: Control is seen by the community as a fun, though skilled, fruit to use.
Control is used by the Lv. 1250 Raid Boss, Order.

Control is one of the fruits that have two icons, the other being Dragon. The other icon can be shown in the inventory when the Control Area move is activated, instead of its usual blue, it will be green.
Control and Buddha are the only fruits that buff weapons.
Control is the only fruit that cannot deal damage to large object with any of its moves.
Control is the first fruit with cutscenes in its move, being [C] Echo Knife and [V] Gamma Rush. The second being Gravity, with [V] Asteriod Crash.
Control is one of the fruits that needs to have its [Z] move active before being able to use the other moves, others being Buddha and Diamond.
If the user holds down to make an Area while in the air, they can stay mid-air for a short while.
This move used to last for 35 seconds.
Holding it below a boss would cause the boss to be stuck on the boulder that is held until it is being released.
Its ability to levitate boats is what makes Control a fun trolling fruit.
This move, when combined with the Choppa accessory, Ghoul's V3 ability (Heightened Senses) and Ghoul V4 Domain Expansion gear, has the shortest skill cooldown out of all of the other moves.
Despite being rocks, the rocks that spawn when going to any Sea Danger Level (except During Rough Sea) aren't usable.
When used on trees, the player will cut the tree horizontally and use the upper slice like normal.
Yeti's ice layer on water can also be used. Although this is not very helpful.

This move used to shrink the Control Area to its minimum size and the area disappears immediately after the move finished, if it does not hit anyone, the Control Area still disappears immediately after that. This leads the opponent to escape the area. This feature was later removed from the game.
If the user holds for 10~13 seconds, they can move while holding the move and use it outside their control area.
This move has very high mastery requirement for a fruit alongside Dragon and Spirit, which is 350.
There is a bug where the user can increase the damage slightly by holding a weapon with a higher mastery than the Control. This is not necessary if the Control's mastery has reached 600.
There is a bug where if the user uses the move while stunned, there is small chance that they disappear and the cutscene also disappears.

fruits.name: Gas
moves: The damaging variant of this move also activates if there are any players nearby, even if the user can't attack that player.
The user moves at an increased speed based on how low their health is at, similar to Venom.
The damaging variant of this move also activates if there are any players nearby, even if the user can't attack that player.
The user moves at an increased speed based on how low their health is at, similar to Venom.
Each slash drains a certain amount of Gas Meter, so aiming before hitting is recommended to preserve and regenerate the Gas Meter.

This ability can infinitely stun enemies if the user brings them to a tall enough wall and runs backwards while spamming them. This also works on Terrorsharks, making it extremely effective in killing them.
Each slash drains a certain amount of Gas Meter, so aiming before hitting is recommended to preserve and regenerate the Gas Meter.

This ability can infinitely stun enemies if the user brings them to a tall enough wall and runs backwards while spamming them. This also works on Terrorsharks, making it extremely effective in killing them.
When the user's cursor hovers over a very far away piece of land, the fumes can still land on that surface, indicating that this has a lot of range.

This move can be used in the air, making it a good counter to slow moving Dragons that will most likely stand still in the fumes trying to aim a move, and get their move canceled by the fumes, giving the user an opportunity to strike back with the [X] or [C] move.

This move can be used in the air, making it a good counter to slow moving Dragons that will most likely stand still in the fumes trying to aim a move, and get their move canceled by the fumes, giving the user an opportunity to strike back with the [X] or [C] move.
If the user uses this move in the air, they cannot hit enemies below or above them. Enemies that stand very close to the user can also dodge the explosion.
When used in a tight space, the beam will bounce off the wall and overlap the area of the explosion it had just passed through.
If the user uses this move in the air, they cannot hit enemies below or above them. Enemies that stand very close to the user can also dodge the explosion.
When used in a tight space, the beam will bounce off the wall and overlap the area of the explosion it had just passed through.
The user also loses the ability to stand on water when this happens, so be careful when using this in the ocean.
The user also loses the ability to stand on water when this happens, so be careful when using this in the ocean.

Gas Meter — The user passively gains gas. Additionally, the user gains gas by dealing damage to any NPC/player. The user can transform when the gas meter is full. In the untransformed state, the user cannot lose any of their gas meter. However, in the transformed state, the user passively consumes gas, consumption increasing when taking damage or using any attacks including the [M1] attacks. The consumption also increases while walking on water. This passive feature is very similar to the Fury Meter.

Elemental Reflex — The fruit user can turn themselves into purple gas and smog, thus being unable to be hurt by any physical attacks (fighting style, sword, gun) from players unless the attacks are imbued with Aura. Unlike other transformations, this passive also applies when transformed as a Gas Knight. Against NPCs, this immunity applies only if the player is a certain level above them. This effect is only effective against non-boss enemies.

Condensed Vapor — When Transformed as a huge Gas Knight, The user receives a 50% damage reduction. 33% speed increase and double jump height, double dash distance, and double movement speed. The user also gains the ability to stand and walk on water, similar to awakened Buddha.

— The user manifests a sword of gas, then swings it left and right, creating pink, circular slashes. The third and fourth swings are flurries of gaseous strikes that damage and pull in enemies, and the cycle ends with a final blue, fiery blast that knocks the target away, leaving a black soot mark on the floor.

— The user dashes forward, amassing cylindrical purple fumes that deal minor damage. If the target is hit within the vicinity of the initial fumes, the user will hold on to and slash them violently with a sword (akin to that of the normal attack), piercing through them and dealing substantial damage.

— The user summons rings of violet gas and vapor around them to form a rotating cage of gas, flinging around the target aggressively within the range and simultaneously suffocating them. Then the gas rings combust, blasting the target away.

— The user summons multiple smog demons with huge mouths and red tongues, before launching them towards their target, dealing poison damage over time. When tapped, a small number of demons appear and fire quickly at the target. More demons are summoned if this move is held down, and the demons can auto aim to some extent.

— The user amasses violet gas around them into a spinning vortex as they turn into a gas knight, wielding a vapor sword, while pulling around any enemies nearby, similar to the [X] move. The transformed Gas user will have a ring of smog around them, as gas is released out of the user while transformed, draining the user's gas meter passively. The user also leaves behind bluish smog when dashing or sky jumping.

— The user transforms their legs into gas and launches themselves in the air to fly. This move has a variant in a small time frame where if the user points their cursor at an enemy. it will instead launch the user at a high speed towards the victim, damaging them upon impact and then reverting back to normal flight. This variant can be triggered and used only during the start of the flight.
The damaging variant of this move also activates if there are any players nearby, even if the user can't attack that player.
The user moves at an increased speed based on how low their health is at, similar to Venom.

— The user does a series of attacks: two slashes from their sword that vary from left to right, and finally collecting a huge amount of gas that combusts, launching the enemy very far away.
Each slash drains a certain amount of Gas Meter, so aiming before hitting is recommended to preserve and regenerate the Gas Meter.
This ability can infinitely stun enemies if the user brings them to a tall enough wall and runs backwards while spamming them. This also works on Terrorsharks, making it extremely effective in killing them.

— The user sets suffocating and combustible fumes onto a large area that will deal tick damage to those standing in the area, disabling dashing, jumping and abilities as the enemy is too busy being suffocated, slightly healing the user. This also disorients any victim's screen.
When the user's cursor hovers over a very far away piece of land, the fumes can still land on that surface, indicating that this has a lot of range.
This move can be used in the air, making it a good counter to slow moving Dragons that will most likely stand still in the fumes trying to aim a move, and get their move canceled by the fumes, giving the user an opportunity to strike back with the [X] or [C] move.

— The user fires a huge beam of gas that combusts, quickly sweeping it to the left, causing a large explosion and thrashing the screen of anyone nearby, leaving behind a scorch mark on the floor. If the Beam from [X] travels through the fumes of the [Z] move, it will violently explode dealing extra AOE damage.
If the user uses this move in the air, they cannot hit enemies below or above them. Enemies that stand very close to the user can also dodge the explosion.
When used in a tight space, the beam will bounce off the wall and overlap the area of the explosion it had just passed through.

— The user raises their sword, creating several smog demons before they plunge toward their cursor. When held, this move summons more smog demons, dealing even more damage. The victim will also take damage over time if the move connects. This move functions almost exactly the same as the untransformed variation.

— The user amasses a purple gas to engulf them while they return back to their original form, gaining the ability to use Fighting Styles, Swords and Guns.
The user also loses the ability to stand on water when this happens, so be careful when using this in the ocean.

— The user propels themselves forward and pulls any nearby enemy to the front of their sword, before stabbing them violently, knocking them back a great distance while tinting the screen with a dark blue color.
trivia: Gas has been nominated to be added to the game since Update 13.

Gas has the same price as Control, with both costing   3,200,000 or   2,500.
They are the second pair of fruits to share a price. The first being Mammoth and T-Rex and the third being Leopard and Yeti.
They are the second pair of fruits to share a price. The first being Mammoth and T-Rex and the third being Leopard and Yeti.
There is a bug where if you look up and use travelling gas while swimming, you will instantly teleport high up the map, leading to unfair escapes
Gas is the most expensive Elemental fruit in the game as of Update 24.
Gas' Elemental Immunity SFX is the same as Smoke's Elemental Immunity SFX.

Gas is the first and only Elemental fruit that has a transformation.
Gas is also the fourth non-beast type fruit to have a transformation, the others being Venom, Rubber, and Diamond.
Gas is also the fourth non-beast type fruit to have a transformation, the others being Venom, Rubber, and Diamond.
Gas is the second Mythical fruit that is Elemental, the first one being Dough.
Gas can infinitely stun Terrorsharks and other difficult bosses such as Cake Queen with its M1s, though a corner is needed for this to work on normal bosses and NPCs.
Gas is one of the two fruits that grants a transformation large enough to walk in water without taking damage, the other being awakened Buddha.
Gas is regarded as one of the best fruits for Raids, though the M1 for this fruit will severely slow down a Raid if not used correctly.
It takes 5 minutes and 30 seconds to fill the Gas Meter without doing any damage.
Gas's transformation lasts for 10 minutes (a full day cycle) if the user did not deal any damage to other enemies/players.
Gas is one of the three Elemental fruits to not have an awakening, along with Smoke and Blizzard.

When used [C] untransformed move against a Sea Beast, they heat seek to the bottom of it, indicating that right below the water in the area below its chin is its main hitbox, explaining why they cannot be hit when they are about to dive.
Gas is the only Elemental fruit to have a Power Meter. The Gas meter is equivalent to Kitsune's Tail meter in terms of how long it takes to fill up, which is about 3 normal fury meters.
The transformed version has air jump bugs, which makes the user unable to jump.

fruits.name: Spirit
moves: Clicking while the meter is in the cyan area will summon a supportive helper.
Clicking while the meter is in the red area will summon an offensive helper.
Star, which heals the user every 2-5 seconds. (the user can tell by seeing a green glow around them).
Flying Pig, which gives a temporary speed boost to the player (the user can tell by seeing a small golden orb around them).
Toxic Mushroom, which spouts out poisonous gas similar to Venom's C skill, passively damaging enemies.
Toad, which pulls nearby enemies with its tongue and deals damage.
Cursed Tree, which can summon roots that stun nearby enemies.

— The user will have a Spirit counter above their moveset and a line that constantly moves between each color. Spirits are collected over time after the bar goes to the end and get used when the user summons a buddy. The buddy summoned depends on the color the bar is in. The maximum amount of spirits that the player can summon is nine.

Heaven and Hell Angel (Shu) Demon (Ra) — The user will always have 2 certain Buddies around them, the Angel (Shu) and Demon (Ra). Clicking while the meter is in the cyan area will summon a supportive helper. Clicking while the meter is in the red area will summon an offensive helper.

Buddies — Spirits can be used by the user by clicking on the ground which will randomly summon unique and random buddies. The "Heaven" zone buddies support the player, and the "Hell" zone buddies offend enemies. Heavenly Buddies: Star, which heals the user every 2-5 seconds. (the user can tell by seeing a green glow around them). Flying Pig, which gives a temporary speed boost to the player (the user can tell by seeing a small golden orb around them). StarFlying Pig Hellish Buddies: Toxic Mushroom, which spouts out poisonous gas similar to Venom's C skill, passively damaging enemies. Toad, which pulls nearby enemies with its tongue and deals damage. Cursed Tree, which can summon roots that stun nearby enemies. Toxic MushroomToadCursed Tree
— Summons Heavenly Buddies if the bar is on the blue side and Hellish Buddies if the bar is on the red side.
— The user mounts on the Angel Buddy (Shu) and flies towards the position of their cursor. The user then summons an ice block that damages and stuns people.

— The user sends the Demon Buddy (Ra) to the position of the cursor (this move can be held to reach further). The Demon Buddy (Ra) then explodes into a pillar of fire, damaging enemies and launching 4 fiery balls into the air. This move has burn damage.

— The user mounts onto the Angel Buddy (Shu) and swiftly dashes to the cursor's location, then stomps on the Angel Buddy (Shu). This creates ice around the user as an AoE move. It also freezes enemies that get damaged by it.

— The user commands both their Angel Buddy and their Demon Buddy (Shu and Ra) to shoot a beam of ice and a beam of fire towards their cursor, stunning enemies. The two beams will then merge, creating a large AoE ice explosion that shakes the user's screen.
— The user mounts on one of the two Buddies, depending on if the user used Demon Buddy (Ra) or Angel Buddy (Shu) last. The Angel Buddy (Shu) is set by default.
trivia: Cursed Tree is the only buddy whose form was not changed during the rework in Update 17.3.

Due to the nerf in update 24 to Angel's V3 ability, the healing ability of the stars offers a great alternative for those looking to heal in a pinch. Much like Angel's V3 ability, making it ideal in the heat of battle.

There was a bug where if the user activated the flying pig's speed and then switched to another permanent fruit, they could keep the speed from the flying pigs. This glitch could be stacked and therefore abused, as continuous repeating of it would lead to tremendous amounts of speed. Some YouTube videos even state that 2 dashes were enough to go across Castle on the Sea. (Patched in Update 20)
The [X] move has a visual bug that makes it slightly hard to land from afar, but it is easier to use when aiming under the user's avatar.
Spirit is also sometimes used in skilled builds as it requires moderate aim to use.

fruits.name: Leopard
moves: Ferocious Feline — The wielder is able to transform into a Leopard-Human hybrid. While in this form, they will gain a large speed boost (~67%), reduced cooldowns and 10% damage reduction, but they will be unable to use their Fighting style, Sword or Gun and activate Race V4.
Jump Boost — While transformed, the user gains a jump boost, making their jumps slightly higher.

— The user shoots a fireball from their finger. If the key is held, it will send a barrage of ghostly index pointing hands first, firing the blazing projectile after a short moment. If damage is taken while the move is held, the final projectile will be fired early.

— The user creates and sends a large, powerful air-blade in the shape of a swirl with their legs, which is impelled at the cursor like a razor blade and slashes the target several times upon hitting while dragging them along for a few moments, and then shoots them upward in an updraft. The updraft remains there after the move is finished and walking in the path of it with Instinct disabled or holding a move will cause the user to be blasted up. This move is great for combos.

— The user teleports a couple times in their cursor's direction then lets out a roar that deals damage and knockback. If the user is on the ground then they will smash the ground instead, breaking Instinct in the process.
— The user transforms into a Leopard-Human hybrid, unleashing a roar which does damage and breaks Instinct.

— The user moves forward a short distance very fast (like a mini Flash Step) and if there is a target in front of the user, they knock them back with a swift kick and deal a good amount of damage. This move breaks Instinct.
— The user swings and hits with the claws three times before letting out a roar which breaks Instinct and deals AoE damage.

— The user shoots out a blazing projectile out of the user's hand (supposedly their finger) where their cursor is aiming. After a while this projectile explodes. If the key is held down, it will send a barrage of ghostly index-pointing hands where their cursor is aiming, then after a short moment the blazing projectile will be fired. If the user takes damage while holding this move, they will automatically shoot the final projectile, similar to other held moves.

— The user produces a slice of wind with their leg. If this ability hits, it will send out a thin, saw-like blade hitting their opponent multiple times, then shoots them upward in an updraft. The updraft remains there after the move is finished, and walking in the path of it with Instinct disabled or holding a move will result in the enemy being caught in the updraft.

— The user teleports towards the location of the user's cursor, then lets out a furious roar. If this move is used on the ground, the user also smashes the ground with a great slam at the end of it. This move also adds a fire effect (cosmetic) which increases speed by 40% for 3-4 seconds.

— The user transforms back into their human form instantly, sending out a shower of particles. This reverts the user into their normal state, removing their ability to use Leopard's transformed moves, but in turn restores their ability to use Fighting Styles, Swords and Guns.

— The user teleports forward a short distance in the blink of an eye (Sort of like a mini flash-step.) Anyone hit by this move will be hit with a swift kick which deals good damage and high knockback. This move is faster than it's untransformed counterpart. This move breaks Instinct.
trivia: During Leopard's Transformation ([V]), the user will gain a moderate speed boost/buff. Using Rabbit V3 and the Pilot Helmet add up even more speed buffs. Combining all of them can make the user surpass the speed of Awakened Light's [F] (Shining Flight), which is the second fastest flight move in the game.

When transformed, the user is "immune" to all environment lava puddles, such as those found in Raids or on the island Hot and Cold (This is because the hitbox when transforming is above the lava, preventing the user from taking damage). The user, however, can be harmed by the lava puddles by being dragged down by an ability such as Flame's V move.

After the usage of [C] Afterimage Assault, the user will gain a temporary but strong speed boost/buff and giving them slightly faster M1's while being lit on fire. Keep in mind that this effect will not change any other attribute/aspect of the user. (Damage, Defense, Health, etc.)
This move can also be added onto the transformation combination to make it even faster.
This move can also be added onto the transformation combination to make it even faster.

Mammoth, Eagle, Buddha, Yeti, Phoenix, and Leopard transformations do not have a time limit or Fury Meter unlike fruits such as Dragon, Venom, T-Rex, Gas or Kitsune without getting damaged, which means the user can stay transformed for as long as they like.
The exception is Phoenix's transformation, since it depends from amount of energy and HP the player has.
The exception is Phoenix's transformation, since it depends from amount of energy and HP the player has.
Jumping into [X] Spiraling Kick while it is moving will cause it to carry the player forward for a short distance. Do note that this most often works on devices with poor connections.

When transforming, a faint leopard ghost appears above the user with red glowing eyes for a few milliseconds. If the player is entering the server for the first time, the leopard model may sometimes appear T-posing.
Leopard's [M1] attacks (Roar) can damage Sea Beasts.

Leopard is widely considered a spammable fruit. Using the combination of Zebra Cap, Ghoul V3/V4, which has the ability to reduce cooldowns, will massively contribute to the fruit's spammability, so much that if used properly, the player can almost use the moves continuously.
When transformed, the player keeps their hair/hat.
Yeti and Leopard are the third pair of fruits to share the same price, the second being Gas and Control, and the first being Mammoth and T-Rex.
Yeti is considered the rival of this fruit.
[Z] Finger Revolver and [X] Spiraling Kick can fling fruits on the ground.

The user charges forward and grabs the enemy, slamming them into the ground two times, creating ice explosions and ice ground spikes on the floor, and then knocks them away.
