Cryogenic Beast — The user is able to transform into a Yeti. While transformed, the user gains:
35% defense from all damage.
Approximately 25% speed increase, 2x jump boost and dash distance.
Approximately 25% cooldown reduction, along with several enhancements to the fruit's abilities.
Draco V2's Flash Step buff does not take effect while transformed.

Frost Walker — Similar to Ice, the user will create walkable ice platforms each time they touch the sea (only applied while transformed). Every ice platform the user creates takes up 4 energy. It will only take energy if the user walks on water.

Frozen Afterimage — While transformed and after using Flash Step, the user leaves an ice clone of themselves behind. This clone explodes upon contact with enemies, or when 3 seconds have passed, dealing medium damage.

— The user's hand will attract icy energy and cause the screen to shake a little. When released, the user compiles a large amount of snow on their hands and slams them together, causing a straight-line explosion of ice, knocking away enemies a good distance. This ability cannot be aimed vertically, and has quite a small range. When used in the air, this attack will appear as a powerful gust of cold wind instead.

— The user formulates a huge snowball from their hand. When released, the user hurls the snowball towards the cursor, exploding after crashing into any surface, damaging enemies caught in the impact with a snowy blast while leaving traces of snow behind. Unlike other ball-shaped moves such as Flame's V, the speed of which the snowball is thrown is extremely fast, akin to a bullet. When the snowball lands in water, it will create an ice platform at where it landed.

— The user launches themselves towards the cursor, and upon contact, they exhale a breathe of freezing air that encases the opponent, before dashing to behind them and blasting them forwards with a devastating amount of force. This move is single-target and not immune to attacks while the animation, so it is not recommended to use this skill for grinding. When aimed towards water, a small ice platform will form in the water where the user is supposed to land.

— The user roars, causing ice spikes to pierce out of the ground, dealing damage and knockback to any nearby enemies, before transforming into an upright, huge Yeti with red, glowing eyes. The user gains the ability to walk on water, but loses the ability to use Fighting Styles, Swords and Guns.
The size of the Yeti transformation is about as tall as a transformed T-Rex.

— This move posseses two variations.
If used on the ground:
The user charges forward and grabs the enemy, slamming them into the ground two times, creating ice explosions and ice ground spikes on the floor, and then knocks them away.
 If used in the air:
The user charges forward and grabs the enemy, then spins with the enemy and finally throws them away. This variant deals slightly less damage.
— The user strikes with a pair of ice claws twice, followed by a stomp on the third one, and then unleashes a roar that can knock the enemy backwards on the final one.

— The user attracts even more energy to their hands, causing the screen to tremble, before launching a bigger straight-line ice explosion that knocks targets backwards, albeit with ice spikes all over the floor pointing towards the cursor, similar to Awakened Ice's X move. When used on water, it will create ice blocks underneath. In the air, it will create an even bigger burst of wind from a cold storm.

— The user hurls a massive snowball that, upon landing, splits into smaller snowballs, damaging enemies within the impact. When used on water, it will create a large ice block at where it landed, making a temporary platform for teammates to stand on while fighting Sea Events.
The large ice block created by the snowball can stop enemy boats in its tracks, and the same goes for the transformed's frostwalk passive.

— The user charges at the enemy, freezing them, charging their fist, and then pushing them backwards with a devastating cold thrust of the wind, along with a lot of snow and ice. This move has significantly more knockback than the untransformed version. When aimed towards the water, it will also create an ice platform at where the user should land.
— The user transforms back into their normal form, allowing the user to use fighting styles, swords and guns. Keep in mind that the user also loses the ability to walk on water by doing this.

— This move posseses two variations.
If used on the ground:
The user charges forward and grabs the enemy, slamming them onto the ground two times and then knocking them backwards.
If used in the air:
The user charges forward and envelops their target in ice, then performs a side-flip and starts falling towards the ground, slamming their target into the ground, and then finally knocks them away.
trivia:
Multiple of Yeti's skills have had their name changed after the Yeti Fruit Showcase video.
Those being, Ice Clap to Arctic Clap, Glacial Toss to Frostbite Boulder, Afterimage Assault to Glacial Execution and Arctic Tackle to Tundra Rush.
The [Z] Move, Arctic Clap, is very similar to unawakened Magma's [Z] move, Magma Clap, which is further reinforced by the fact that Arctic Clap's original name was Ice Clap. Moreover, Yeti transformed [C] move is somewhat akin to Magma awakened [X] move, in that both moves are basically harnessing their respective elements into their fist and then blast the foe away with tremendous forces.
Additionally, the old [C] move (Afterimage Assault) had the same skill name as Leopard's [C] move, meaning that the fruit was copy-pasted as a placeholder from Leopard when it was in development.
The 2 following statements above heavily reinforce the fact that Yeti might have been a rushed fruit for the winter Christmas update in 2024.
Those being, Ice Clap to Arctic Clap, Glacial Toss to Frostbite Boulder, Afterimage Assault to Glacial Execution and Arctic Tackle to Tundra Rush.

The [Z] Move, Arctic Clap, is very similar to unawakened Magma's [Z] move, Magma Clap, which is further reinforced by the fact that Arctic Clap's original name was Ice Clap. Moreover, Yeti transformed [C] move is somewhat akin to Magma awakened [X] move, in that both moves are basically harnessing their respective elements into their fist and then blast the foe away with tremendous forces.
Additionally, the old [C] move (Afterimage Assault) had the same skill name as Leopard's [C] move, meaning that the fruit was copy-pasted as a placeholder from Leopard when it was in development.
The 2 following statements above heavily reinforce the fact that Yeti might have been a rushed fruit for the winter Christmas update in 2024.

Yeti's [C] ability rotates the camera best if the user has shift-lock enabled, making it quite annoying for people who don't usually play Shift-lock because sometimes it doesn't rotate. If the player teleports on water, it will create a ice platform for them. This platform lasts longer than the Frost Walker ability, similar to the [Z] and [X].
Yeti and Leopard are the third pair of fruits to share the same price, the second being Gas and Control, and the first being Mammoth and T-Rex.

Yeti is the second Beast-type fruit that allows its user to walk on water, with the first being Kitsune. (Since Awakened Buddha doesn't actually walk on water). In addition, it is also the third fruit in the game, as of Update 25, to create its perspective elemental platforms, being ice, similar to the fruit with the same name and Magma.
Yeti in its transformed state is the only Beast-type fruit that doesn't have both landing and swimming animations while also not granting the user a flying passive.
The player will teleport to the other side of a wall if they use [C] Glacial Execution on an enemy that is behind a wall/obstacle. Please note that this only the case when you enable Shift-lock
Yeti also shares the same name with the Yeti boss from the First Sea's Frozen Village.
Yeti with Pilot Helmet while dashing moves at the same speed as the Beast Hunter.
Yeti serves as an effective counter to hybrid and untransformed Dragon users, due to the incredibly low cooldown of its moves.
Yeti is good against Buddha users as the high knockback can push them away rendering their M1 useless.
Yeti is the first and currently the only fruit in the game to start with the letter 'Y'.
Yeti is considered as one of the best fruits for Sea Events alongside Magma, Gas, Phoenix, Blizzard, Mammoth and Dragon, since all of the attacks can damage Sea Beasts.
Depending on where the user is positioned, [X] Frostbite Boulder can have nearly unlimited range, as the projectile's premise is just like a catapult boulder.
The [X] Frostbite Boulder move can be held for only 30 seconds.

It may not be apparent, but the [C] Glacial Execution move (when hit) actually has Destructible Physics. The weird part is that only the untransformed version has Destructible Physics, the transformed version doesn't.

The ice platforms last a different amount of time depending on their size. The smallest ice platform (Untransformed [C]) lasts for around 8 seconds, and the biggest ice platform (Transformed [X]) lasts for around 58 seconds.

Yeti can be really good against Rumbling Waters as the user only needs to m1 spam at the center of the rumbling waters to hit all three Sea Beasts. It is also very good against Piranhas when they sneak up from behind as this fruit is quick with AoE attacks that can push them away. On top of that, it can create ice platforms, allowing teammates to stay above the water even without the Shark race.
Other players can step on the ice passively created by the Yeti user's feet, thus being able to continuously follow a Yeti user while staying above the water. This can be useful as the Yeti can help others travel across the ocean without needing a boat.

Other players can step on the ice passively created by the Yeti user's feet, thus being able to continuously follow a Yeti user while staying above the water. This can be useful as the Yeti can help others travel across the ocean without needing a boat.

fruits.name: Kilo
moves: — Changes the user's weight to 10,000 KG, causing damage with an area of effect (AoE).

— Changing the weight of the user's legs to 20,000 KG, performing a stomp on the ground, resulting in a shockwave directed forward. This sends boulders into the air, knocking back enemies in front of the user and dealing damage.
— Changes the user's weight to 50,000 KG, the user performs a ground slam, inflicting damage in an area of effect (AOE). Additionally, this attack stuns all enemies hit with it.
— Reduces the user's weight, making the user available to float in the air. This flight is achieved by an umbrella. Unlike other flight moves, this move can only go upwards (and slightly forwards).
trivia: This was the cheapest Blox Fruit in game.
The Kilo Admiral uses Kilo.
A physical Kilo Fruit could be obtained by purchasing it from the Doghouse next to Arowe in the Second Sea or near of Forest Pirates, for   97, exclusive for trading with the Mysterious Scientist.
Kilo was the only Blox Fruit available for purchase in its physical form.
The notion of this Blox Fruit being "The best fruit in Blox Fruits" is often joked about due to its affordability and ease of acquisition.
Unique among Blox Fruits, Kilo possessed a mobility ability that enabled vertical movement, with a slight forward component in the case of the [F] move.
Previously, this fruit inflicted increased damage when used from a high altitude and descending. However, it no longer received a damage buff from this particular maneuver.
The player could use the [F] move to get up to the Mysterious Force in Great Tree very easily for Race Awakening.
Kilo is not able to be used by players after it got reworked to Rocket. However, the Kilo Admiral still uses this fruit, similar to how the Smoke Admiral uses the old Smoke.

fruits.name: Chop
moves: This applied to Sword Users and NPCs if the NPC was lower level than the user as if it worked as an Elemental.

Body Separation — Similar to an Elemental, Chop users had complete immunity to all swords, even those with Aura.
This applied to Sword Users and NPCs if the NPC was lower level than the user as if it worked as an Elemental.
Exception: Bosses and Raid Bosses.
— The user separated their upper torso and launches it forward, dealing damage to enemies it hit.
— Separated the user's entire body except their torso and their head for an attack that dealt chip damage and stunned all enemies in a circular radius around the user.
— The user attacked their opponent with a barrage of floating fists. This move lasted longer if held. This move was similar to Rubber C move.
— The user separated their arms and legs and started spinning them to achieve flight, similar to Spin flight. The flight did not constantly decrease Energy.
trivia: Although Chop's passive function was to avoid damage from sword slashes, Chop could also avoid swords that can create fire, freeze, cause electric shock, and even magic damage.
Chop was mostly known because of its sword immunity.
It was recommended to become a sword main instead of a fruit user when using Chop.
Most attacks looked weird with R15 and layered clothing since the user's body stretched and did not disconnect.

Chop was a very good replacement for elemental fruits to use at a low level since most enemies use swords in the First Sea, although it got bad quickly, getting outclassed in every way by higher rarity fruits because of its lack of abilities, and the fact that later NPCs (Second Sea and Third Sea) more commonly use Fighting Styles.
Chop's X move was similar to Shark Saw's [X] move.
Bobby, a Lv. 55 Boss, used Chop before Update 26.
Chop and Rocket were the only fruits in which the [F] move has the highest mastery requirements out of all the other move.
Chop is one of the only fruits whose reworks completely removed it from the game as Bobby/Chef no longer uses it.

fruits.name: Falcon
moves: Jump Boost — While transformed, the user gained a jump boost that made them jump slightly higher.
— The user grew a pair of wings from their back. This move had to be active to use other moves.
— The user launched a blast of wind in the direction of the cursor by flapping their wings.

— The user charged at the enemy. If the attack landed, they would grip the opponent with their feet and slam them into the ground, causing debris to fly up and cracks to appear. This move targeted a single enemy and caused a slight stun after the impact.
— The user dashed through the enemy, slashing them several times and dealing damage, momentarily stunned the target(s).
— The user flapped their wings to achieve flight.
trivia: Falcon was one of two Blox Fruits to have "Bird:" in their name, along Phoenix.
Falcon was the only Uncommon Beast-type fruit.
Falcon was the cheapest Beast Blox Fruit in money and value.

If the player used [Z] Plumage and switches to another Blox Fruit, they would keep Falcon's wings, along with the buffs.
The player would lose these wings when they died, switched teams, or left the game.
The player would lose these wings when they died, switched teams, or left the game.

Falcon was sometimes considered half-beast by the community, as it did not have a full transformation.
This was slightly justified, as it could see some use in most cases, though its moves were not very powerful by most measures.
This was slightly justified, as it could see some use in most cases, though its moves were not very powerful by most measures.

fruits.name: Revive
moves: Resurrection — Revive had an ability which enhanced the user's soul to the point where they could come back to life at half health after dying once, remaining alive until their body was sufficiently damaged, and using several other soul-based abilities.

— The user seemingly left its body and transformed into a translucent, green ghost. Any entity that came in contact would be frozen and damaged. If their main body took damage, they would be teleported to where their soul was last at.
— The user unleashed a green mist with the shape of a skull around themselves, causing an explosion and stun to enemies within the proximity.
— If the user died while [C] Resurrection was active, they would be resurrected at 50% of their original health and transformed the user to a skeleton.
— The user's soul left their body, being able to fly in 8 seconds. The users original body was left behind and if attacked, they would be forcefully removed from their flight.
trivia: Revive was the only fruit that could revive players.
Revive was one of the only three fruits that can freeze opponents (the others being Ice and Spirit).

When the user revived as a skeleton from Resurrection, the skeleton was actually a Roblox Rthro package called Skelly. It also removed the hair from the package.
The skeleton was normal without clothes, however, if they used jackets from Roblox, the jacket would have stayed, this was a Roblox bug that happens in most games. This only works in specific Roblox accessories.

The skeleton was normal without clothes, however, if they used jackets from Roblox, the jacket would have stayed, this was a Roblox bug that happens in most games. This only works in specific Roblox accessories.

When Revive F move was used, the user's physical body could be harmed and if they used it when they were right above water, they would take damage. However, there was a bug where they were able to spam jump (during the flight) and their body would keep jumping on the sea giving them free time to use their flight.

fruits.name: Barrier
moves: — The user fired a medium-sized rectangular barrier that damaged opponents and blocked certain incoming attacks.
— The user teleported to their cursor and slammed down on the ground, dealing high AoE damage. If used inside a building, the player would teleport out of it.

— The user fired a sphere that can be controlled with their mouse, which trapped opponents while damaging them. The player was uninterruptible and invincible while using this move. If the player "threw" the opponent (by aiming the cursor at a wall) it had a chance to slam into the wall and do extra AoE damage. If aiming upwards, it would fling the enemy. This move could be used to drag/throw opponents into the water and make them take damage.
— The user summoned five large barrier towers in front of them that slammed onto the ground and dealt high damage. This move buried opponents and could trap them in the ground.

— The user summoned a constantly growing staircase in the direction their character was facing that would continue to go up until the player ran out of energy or released the key. This move took around one energy per step created. It was decent in aerial mobility as it allowed the user to reset their Air Jumps without touching the ground, helping the user reach higher elevation.
trivia: Previously, Barrier was the only fruit capable of changing color cycling between green and blue repeatedly.

fruits.name: Door
moves: — The user dashes forward. If an enemy is hit, their head will spin and the dash will stun them a little.

— The user opens a door in front of them and enters a different dimension that lasts for around 4 seconds. During this state, the user becomes invisible and invincible and can move around freely. However, if the user uses any skill, it exits them out of the dimension immediately.

— The user opens a door that allows them to teleport to a place of their choice. Other players can go through the same portal unless it is a safe zone. Players allied with the user can be teleported, in safe zone or not. When a player enters the door, they will be in a dimension, granting invincibility and invisibility for around one second.

— The user opens a door in front of them and exits through another at their cursor. This is a short-range teleport move. If it is opened on an enemy, it will deal some damage. (Also deals damage if the user was right next to them when using the skill)
trivia: Door was the first fruit that had a teleport move that other players could access.
Door was the first fruit that was able to bring up a separate GUI.

fruits.name: Spider
moves: — The player swipes at the opponent and summons a claw to knock back the player. Its hitbox and range is very small.
— The player impales their target from above with five strings, dealing medium AoE damage and also briefly stunning anyone hit by it.

— The user shoots a thick rope made of condensed strings from their palm which deals great damage. The damage for this move depends on how far they are from their opponent(s). The further away the user is from their opponent(s), the higher the damage they will receive. This move has the second best range in the game, leaving a short invisible tripwire effect, which will deal damage when stepped on and breaks Instinct no matter what.
— The player creates multiple strings weaved together (covered in Aura) and sends them at enemies in a piercing formation. This move deals damage in a sharp cone-shaped hitbox and stuns targets.
— The player summons a lot of threads under their body and levitates.

— The user slashes forth up to four fiery blades of hot strings that deal good damage (the number of strings and their damage varies depending on how long the user holds the move), with the fourth one resembling the shape of the letter 'X'.

— The user shoots out strings upwards from their hand and creates a large circular cage that when held, traps targets inside. Then, the cage quickly shrinks and slashes whoever is inside of it, dealing instant damage. If held, the size of the cage increases by a fair amount, although it does not affect the damage.

— The user summons large, white spears of strings that leave the ground and hit wherever the cursor is located. If the cursor is close enough, the move will auto-target nearby enemies. Damage gets smaller over time and most of the damage is dealt during the early stage of the move (a string will do less damage than the string that came before it). This move holds the player down in place until the end of the move.

— The user shoots out hundreds of dark red and maroon strings rapidly, in a more cylindrical hitbox. This move has a small start-up time, however, it stuns while dealing massive damage to anyone it hits. Its color changes according to the user's aura colour, like Dough due to the webs being covered in Aura this time.
— The user shoots out a string and swings to where the user is faced. Speed scales with user's health. Holding this move can allow the user to swing slightly farther, although not very noticeable.
trivia:
Spider is used by Swan and Don Swan.
Swan has a unique move, the move being Multi-directional Silk.
With that, Don Swan has another version aside from the awakened and unawakened version of Spider. However, this version is only available in the second stage. It is an improved Spider [V] and [X], the [V] is a triple version of the unawakened [V], tripling the range, AoE and damage in the process, and the [X] shoots more Multi-String Attacks in an X pattern. However, due to this version being only available to a boss, it is impossible to find out whether there are any other differences.
Swan has a unique move, the move being Multi-directional Silk.

With that, Don Swan has another version aside from the awakened and unawakened version of Spider. However, this version is only available in the second stage. It is an improved Spider [V] and [X], the [V] is a triple version of the unawakened [V], tripling the range, AoE and damage in the process, and the [X] shoots more Multi-String Attacks in an X pattern. However, due to this version being only available to a boss, it is impossible to find out whether there are any other differences.
Despite it being called "Spider", it is not a Beast type fruit because it allows players to control strings rather than transform into a spider.
Spider is the second fruit that has a Beast themed Natural type fruit, the first one being Venom.
The current unawakened [F] Spider Path is actually the pre-rework awakened String's [F] Spider Highway.
Every awakened move of Spider can be held to deal more damage, but that does not mean it can be held indefinitely.
Many consider Spider's [C] Over-heated Sniper move to be better than the awakened version because of its range, Instinct break, and damage.
Spider has the biggest fruit model.
Spider's [Z] Spider Wraith uses the same sound effect as Cyborg V4's Energy Control Super Jump.
Spider's [C] Over-heated Sniper has a longer lasting tripwire effect than Buddy Sword's [X] Lightning Wave.

fruits.name: Lightning
moves: The user shoots one of their charged orbs toward the aimed area. Consecutive orbs deal reduced damage. This variation uses 1 orb.
Upon holding the move for at least 0.5 seconds, the user creates an electrified sphere and throws it toward the cursor, pulling enemies in before exploding. This variation uses 1 orb.

Upon holding the move for at least 1.5 seconds, the user summons an electric dragon that circles around them. After releasing the move, the user dashes with the dragon toward the cursor. This variation uses 2 orbs. Depending on the situation, one of two variations will occur:
If hit (upgraded): If the user comes into contact with an enemy while dashing, the user grabs them, performing a 5-strike combo before knocking them away.
If missed: The user launches the dragon forward, which explodes on contact, or when it reaches max distance, dealing decent damage.
If hit (upgraded): If the user comes into contact with an enemy while dashing, the user grabs them, performing a 5-strike combo before knocking them away.
If missed: The user launches the dragon forward, which explodes on contact, or when it reaches max distance, dealing decent damage.

If hit (upgraded): If the user comes into contact with an enemy while dashing, the user grabs them, performing a 5-strike combo before knocking them away.
If missed: The user launches the dragon forward, which explodes on contact, or when it reaches max distance, dealing decent damage.

Z1 (tap): Each orb extends the duration of the ability by around 5 seconds.
Z3 (hold): The user summons an electric dragon that bursts out from the cloud and crashes to the ground in the direction of the cursor. When used from higher altitudes, its targeting range increases.

If tapped: The user zaps forward, consuming an orb. Any enemies in the user's way will be briefly stunned and damaged.
If held The user performs continuous teleporting strikes if multiple enemies are standing close to each other.
If tapped: The user zaps forward, consuming an orb. Any enemies in the user's way will be briefly stunned and damaged.
If held The user performs continuous teleporting strikes if multiple enemies are standing close to each other.
Explosion breaks Instinct most of the time. Can rarely be dodged on the edge.
The first and last strike breaks Instinct. The middle strikes can be dodged.

Elemental Reflex — The wielder is immune to all physical attacks (fighting style, sword, gun) from players unless the attacks are imbued with Aura. Against NPCs, this immunity applies unless they are of a higher level. This effect is only effective against non-boss enemies.

Orb Charge — The user has 4 electric orbs that spawn behind them. [Z] Lightning Orb, [V] Thunderball Destruction and [F] Electric Flash all consume an orb. Orbs take 5 seconds (3 seconds if upgraded) to recharge. [Z] Lightning Orbs and [F] Electric Flash cannot be used without them.
— Wielder continuously shoots out short bursts of lightning that deal low damage and stun. This attack can chain through multiple enemies.

— This move possesses three variations, each using a certain amount of orbs:
If tapped (Z1):

The user shoots one of their charged orbs toward the aimed area. Consecutive orbs deal reduced damage. This variation uses 1 orb.
If short-held (Z2):

Upon holding the move for at least 0.5 seconds, the user creates an electrified sphere and throws it toward the cursor, pulling enemies in before exploding. This variation uses 1 orb.
If fully held (Z3):

Upon holding the move for at least 1.5 seconds, the user summons an electric dragon that circles around them. After releasing the move, the user dashes with the dragon toward the cursor. This variation uses 2 orbs. Depending on the situation, one of two variations will occur:
If hit (upgraded): If the user comes into contact with an enemy while dashing, the user grabs them, performing a 5-strike combo before knocking them away.
If missed: The user launches the dragon forward, which explodes on contact, or when it reaches max distance, dealing decent damage.

— The user conjures a thundercloud from the sky. Shortly after, lightning bolts start striking the ground, stunning those hit. This move has two variations that can be activated by using [Z] Lightning Orb on the cloud:
Z1 (tap): Each orb extends the duration of the ability by around 5 seconds.
Z3 (hold): The user summons an electric dragon that bursts out from the cloud and crashes to the ground in the direction of the cursor. When used from higher altitudes, its targeting range increases.

— The user conjures a thundercloud from the sky that shoots down a harmless beam as a warning before discharging electricity in a bigger beam about 0.75s later. Enemies affected are pulled upwards and are stunned for 1 second.

— The user compresses multiple clouds into a ball made out of lightning that can be dropped like a bomb. Holding the move down consumes orbs and can be charged up to 4 times, increasing the hitbox and damage significantly.

— This move posseses two variations: 
If tapped: The user zaps forward, consuming an orb. Any enemies in the user's way will be briefly stunned and damaged.
If held The user performs continuous teleporting strikes if multiple enemies are standing close to each other.
trivia: Currently, there are many players taking advantage of the update to sell Lightning skins at exorbitant prices compared to reality.
Lightning is the fourth most expensive Elemental fruit, the third being Blizzard, the second being Dough and the most expensive being Gas.
Lightning is easy to use on mobile due to its AoE attacks. However, [X] and [V] may cause lag, and [F] may be difficult to use.
Lightning is often paired with many gun and sword main builds due to its versatility.
Lightning battled with the Pain fruit to have an awakening in the Blox Fruits Discord server. Lightning won and then received an awakening (Pre Update 27.1).
The old unawakened version of Lightning is used by the Lv. 575 boss, Thunder God. He uses [Z] Rumble Dragon and [X] Sky Thunder.
The Elite Pirate, Urban, uses the old version of Awakened Lightning. He uses [Z] Lightning Beast, [X] Thunderstorm and [V] Thunderball Destruction.
Lightning is the only fruit that does not display a full cooldown with its move [Z] (Lightning Orb) and [F] (Electric Flash).
Before the release of Update 27.1, players who had Rumble fully awakened (V2) received three upgrades on the Admin Panel for free.

Lightning raids are the first and only raids to be removed from Blox Fruits entirely (Previously the Item Pole (2nd Form) was inaccessible after the removal of Lightning raids, but now it can be obtained by getting struck by a lightning in Rough Sea while holding Pole (1st Form).)

Lightning has three reskin variants — Yellow, Purple, and Green. Each one is considered a separate fruit and has its own distinct physical appearance.
Upon eating any Lightning fruit skin, the user is granted the corresponding permanent CHROMATIC skin.
Upon eating any Lightning fruit skin, the user is granted the corresponding permanent CHROMATIC skin.
[V] Thunderball Destruction is the first ever ability in Blox Fruits to have five variants; all scaled between orb usage from 0-4 orbs.

Charging [X] Thunderstorm with 3-4 Z1 orbs can stun NPCs for over 10 seconds, allowing the user to use fighting style M1s on them to deal extra damage, or use the fruits M1 to recharge orbs. This is good for grinding since it can easily kill a group of enemies.
When using [F] Electric Flash, a distinct 'pop' sound effect, almost like a bubble, can be heard.
A fully charged [V] Thunderball Destruction can almost cover the entirety of the Jungle.
