This summons four Pain Ghosts, regardless of whether or not the move hit or missed. The second upgrade, Agony Surge is required to be unlocked to use this.

The user launches into the air, then dashes toward the cursor in a chosen direction. When used mid-air, the user immediately dashes toward the cursor. This summons four Pain Ghosts, regardless of whether or not the move hit or missed. The second upgrade, Agony Surge is required to be unlocked to use this.

Pain Meter — The user has a passive meter bar that fills up with damage taken and Pain Ghosts absorbed. Having a full meter will unlock the user's inner pain, buffing Normal Attack's damage, reducing skill cooldowns and increasing speed. The amount of Pain Meter received when taking damage is percentage-based on user current HP, rather than max (lasts 1 minute).

Last Stand — Upon losing all health, the user enters a berserk state with a screen-shattering effect, emitting a red aura and standing in a crooked stance. During this state, dashes longer, Air Jumps higher, and both gain cloud-like VFX, movement speed is increased, holdable abilities charge faster, damage taken is reduced by 60%, and M1 damage is nearly doubled. However, only Pain moves can be used. The state lasts for 30 seconds (60 If upgraded), when the Pain Meter runs out, the user will die instantly, regardless of being in Combat or not.

Pain Ghosts — Each time the user misses the Z, X, C [Held], F [Held] moves, it spawns in a Pain Ghost possessing a sinister smile or sad frown that has a cloud-like appearance. These can be absorbed by the user to fill up their Pain Meter and instantly resets the cooldown of [F] Torment Warp. They can also heat seek towards nearby enemies and deal damage if the user has the third upgrade, Torment Conductor unlocked.
— The user rushes and throws 2 hook punches followed by an uppercut, initiating airborne combat and ending it with a barrage of energy, knocking the enemy very far away.

— This move has 2 variants:
If tapped:
The user shoots out a Pain Ghost, that explodes upon contact with a surface or a player hitbox. Missing will spawn in Pain Ghosts.
If held
The user shoots out a barrage of Pain Ghosts, with them lowering in damage output with each succession of hits. Likewise, missing will spawn Pain Ghosts. This move gradually slows down over time.

— This move has 2 variants:
If tapped:
The user dashes forward. Upon connection with an enemy, the user grabs them and starts a short combo, with an energy burst that knocks the enemy away.
If held:
The user builds up an aura and dashes forward. Upon connection with an enemy, the user grabs them, taking them upward and launches an energy beam that drags the enemy to the aimed area.

— This move has 2 variants:
If tapped:
The user releases a fast, concentrated ball of energy that drags nearby enemies in, which quickly expands upon contact, with Pain Ghosts fueling it, exploding soon after and knocking pulled enemies away. This move is quite similar to Awakened Sand's [V] Deep Sand.
If held:
The user covers their face and is surrounded by a blazing red aura. Upon release, a large Pain Ghost roars out a powerful beam of red energy, deal damage and pulls enemies to the end of the beam and stuns them. Holding the move for longer will result in an even larger Pain Ghost shooting out a larger energy beam, which deals more damage. The fourth upgrade, Spectral Assimilation is required to be unlocked to use this.

— This move has 2 variants:
If tapped:
The user releases a quick, large ball of dense energy, showing evil pareidolia. If hit, the enemy suffers tick damage in quick succession, and experiences screen shake and distortion, having an image similar to the ball's "face". This move is single-target.
If held:
The user holds out an enlarged throbbing ball of dense energy, having a similar design to its tapped variant, surrounded by the fog of Pain Ghosts. If hit, the enemy is dragged forward and suffers with the same effects as the tapped variant. The size of the ball is based on how much full is the pain meter. This move is multi-target.

— This move has 2 variants:
If tapped:
The user launches forward with a longer range than other fruits.
If held:
The user launches into the air, then dashes toward the cursor in a chosen direction. When used mid-air, the user immediately dashes toward the cursor. This summons four Pain Ghosts, regardless of whether or not the move hit or missed. The second upgrade, Agony Surge is required to be unlocked to use this.
trivia: Along with a few other fruits, Pain (named Paw at the time) was in the Fruit Awakening straw poll of Update 14. However, Rumble received the most votes, resulting in Pain getting no awakening.
Pain has its own death animation when Last Stand is activated.
Pain is the second fruit to have revive/second life mechanic, the first being Ghost Fruit.
[V] Torturing Pulse has the same mesh as Sanguine Art's [C] Devourer of Worlds.

fruits.name: Soul
moves: Performing the X move will increase the Calm meter.
Performing the Z and C move will increase the Fury meter. (Not to be confused with the Fury Meter of some transformation fruits)
If the marking on the meter was in the middle, the user would be in Neutral mode which provided no effect.
If the marking is on the Blue side of the meter, the user would be in Calm Mode. Calm mode increased the AoE of X move.
If the marking is on the Red side of the meter, the user would be in Fury mode. Fury mode increased the damage of C move.
If the marking was at the limit of increasing on any mode, the user's V move would get a significant boost in damage.
Toxic Flower, which spouted out poisonous gas similar to Venom's C skill, passively damaging enemies.
Cursed Tree, which could summon roots that stunned nearby enemies.
Candy, which healed the user a little every 2-5 seconds, could be useful when the user received damage.

— The user always had a Soul counter on their screen. Souls could be collected using the Z move on enemies, or by killing someone with any soul move. It could then be used to summon Buddies. The maximum amount of Souls was nine. Following the revamp, the user could collect a maximum of two souls at any given time when using the Z move on multiple NPCs/players. Performing the X move will increase the Calm meter. Performing the Z and C move will increase the Fury meter. (Not to be confused with the Fury Meter of some transformation fruits) The Calm and Fury mode were unique features of the Soul Fruit. Soul counter would be shown above the Soul fruit UI that would indicate what mode the user was currently in. If the marking on the meter was in the middle, the user would be in Neutral mode which provided no effect. If the marking is on the Blue side of the meter, the user would be in Calm Mode. Calm mode increased the AoE of X move. If the marking is on the Red side of the meter, the user would be in Fury mode. Fury mode increased the damage of C move. If the marking was at the limit of increasing on any mode, the user's V move would get a significant boost in damage.

Sun and Cloud Sun and Cloud (Phase 2) Sun and Cloud (Phase 3) — The user would always have 2 certain Buddies around them, the Sun and Cloud. When the Calm meter reaches its maximum, The sun will have a softer light, the cloud will float lightly and be white. When The Soul counter reaches half, The sun will become brighter, the cloud will darken, and there will be purple lightning. When the Fury meter reaches its maximum, The sun will be brighter and looks more serious, The cloud will be dark purple, and lightning rods will appear.

Buddies — The user could use souls by left-clicking anywhere on the ground which would randomly summon one out of three Buddies: Toxic Flower, which spouted out poisonous gas similar to Venom's C skill, passively damaging enemies. Cursed Tree, which could summon roots that stunned nearby enemies. Candy, which healed the user a little every 2-5 seconds, could be useful when the user received damage.
— The user mounted the Cloud, and flew towards the position of their cursor. The user then summoned a sphere that damaged and stunned the target. The user would gain 1 soul per NPC/Player grabbed.

— The user would send the Sun to the position of the cursor (which could be held for more range). The Sun would then explode into a pillar of fire, which damaged enemies and launched four fiery balls into the air. This move had burn damage and increased the Calm meter. If the user was in Calm mode, the AoE of this move will be increased. This move's range increased if it was held.

— The user mounted onto the Cloud and swiftly dashed to the cursor's location, then stomped on the Cloud. This created lightning around the user, as it was an AoE move. It also sent electricity to enemies close by, even if they were on the ground, which would stun them, and left a short DoT lightning area. This move increased the Fury meter. If the user was in Fury mode, the damage of this move would increase.

— The user commanded both Buddies to shoot a beam of lightning and a beam of fire toward their cursor, which would stun the enemies. The two beams would then merge, creating a large AoE explosion that brightened nearby players' screens. This move would get an increase in damage if the mood Meter completely maxed out on either the Calm side or the Fury side.

— The user would mount on one of the two Buddies, depending on the user's Mode they were in. If they were in the Calm side, they would mount on the Cloud. If they were in the Fury side, they would mount on the Sun, allowing the user to fly around.
trivia: The "Cannon" buddy so far only appeared last in the leaked version. Currently, no one knows what ability the buddy has.
The shape of the glasses on the Roblox marketplace can be found here.
[X] Wrath of Ra refers to Ra, the sun god in the Egyptian mythology.

fruits.name: Dragon (Classic)
moves: Green, Blue, and Red are unlocked by default.

Fury Meter — The user starts with 50% of the "Fury Meter" bar when spawned. The user's Fury Meter needs to be full to be able to transform into a dragon. Fury is regained over time while not transformed and drains while transformed. Using moves while transformed decreases the user's Fury Meter. When taking damage while transformed, the Fury Meter will increase. The fury meter takes 1m 30s to fill to full from 0% to 100%.
Dragon Armor — In Dragon form, the user gains a 65% damage resistance to all attacks and is able to fly.

Multicolored — The user can change the color of their wings and Dragon form by flying through colored hoops. However, various mastery levels are needed.
Green, Blue, and Red are unlocked by default.
Orange is unlocked at 100 mastery.
Purple is unlocked at 200 mastery.
Brown is unlocked at 300 mastery.
Yellow is unlocked at 400 mastery.
White is unlocked at 500 mastery.
Black is unlocked at 600 mastery.
Images of the different colored Dragon forms can be found here.
— The user fires a beam of energy from their mouth, knocking enemies back.

— The user harnesses a ball of fire in their right hand, then dashes toward where the cursor is. Upon reaching an enemy, the user grabs them and drags them along, leaving a trail of fire behind. If used in the air, the user drags the enemy caught to the ground. The drag ends early upon colliding with a wall. The affected enemy is left with a burn DoT for 9 ticks equal to 5% of the damage of the grab, for a total of 45% grab damage. The first tick starts immediately upon ending the grab.

— The user jumps up into the air and begins shooting fireballs towards the ground. Upon impact, the projectiles explode, damaging enemies caught in the vicinity, knocking them back, and stunning them for a brief moment. Holding this move allows the user to shoot fireballs for around 2.5 seconds. After an individual enemy reaches a certain threshold of damage from fireballs, they will take greatly reduced damage from fireballs. This threshold is reached after about half of the total fireballs hit the enemy, meaning you can miss some of your fireballs or end your skill early and still deal most of the damage.
— If the user has a maxed Fury meter, they transform into a dragon.
— The user grows dragon wings and is now able to fly (The user will fly faster when aiming upward).
— The user shoots a huge beam of fire from their mouth.
— The user opens their mouth wide open then proceeds to shoot three crescent-shaped projectiles in three directions from its claw, damaging and burning enemies it hits for a short time.
— A ball of raging flames forms within the user's mouth and is then unleashed. Upon hitting anything, this ball explodes and burns anything it comes into contact with.
— The user reverts back to their avatar.
trivia: If the player attempted to purchase Dragon (Classic) from the Blox Fruit Dealer or Shop during Update 23, they would get the message: "The king of fruits is temporarily off sale for enhancements. Stay tuned for its powerful return!", instead of the normal Robux purchase screen.
Before Update 24, Dragon (Classic) was the third most expensive fruit in the game. But, from Updates 13-17.2, it was the most expensive.

After Update 24, people who ate Dragon (Classic) before the update still had it in their inventory. However, after the developers fixed the bug, the players who ate the Dragon (Classic) got either Eastern or Western Dragon.
Dragon (Classic) had the biggest transformed model in the game.
[C] Fire Shower was similar to Light's Unawakened [X] Barrage of Light.
In addition to the colors above, there was a pink color in game exclusive to admins.
The transformed dragon is an Eastern mythological dragon.

fruits.name: Meme
moves: — The player spawns a single traffic cone at their cursor while doing a clap animation. The cone has similar physical effects to the Blox Fruits. This move has infinite range and can one shot other players, but they have to be allied with the player, or else it won't kill them.
trivia: Meme was first revealed to the community in a video published by Axiore. You can see the video here.

Meme is tradable and has infinite value, which was shown by KittGaming.
To trade for Meme, the player will need a specific trade, as shown by KittGaming.
To trade for Meme, the player will need a specific trade, as shown by KittGaming.

Meme is typically impossible to obtain in gameplay, as it is not sold from the Blox Fruit Dealer or the Blox Fruit Gacha, cannot be found underneath trees, and cannot be obtained from the Ship Raid, the Pirate Raid, or the Core. The only way to obtain it is to be an admin or to have it given to the player by an admin.
Marines can attack each other or damage each other using Meme, including anyone in Safe Zones.

The previous owner of Meme was Zioles, but soon Uzoth stole it from his "secret base" and gave it to KittGaming. Right now, it is impossible to remove it from the player's inventory, which is proven by KittGaming.

fruits.name: Trees
trivia: Fruits are able to spawn under cactuses in the Desert or even potted plants inside the Cursed Ship.
Control Fruit users are able to throw trees as an attack.
The largest breakable tree in the game is on the platform with Diamond.
Trees in raids, Treasure Islands, Mirage Island and Prehistoric Island cannot be broken.

fruits.name: Permanent Blox Fruits
fruits.description: Permanent Blox Fruits are Blox Fruits purchased through the Blox Fruit Dealer or the Shop menu. They may be obtained at any time, in any sea via Robux   or through gifting. When purchasing a Permanent Fruit, players have the option to gift to others, causing immediate activation on the receiving end, or to store the fruit in the Inventory, allowing the fruit to be traded at a later date. Permanent Fruits in the Inventory will be assigned the Premium rarity regardless of price.
trivia: With the release of revamped fruits, Permanent Fruit prices changed, with the most notable being Bomb, Spike, Rocket, and Spin.
Dragon had the most drastic change in price, spiking up from   2,600 to   5,000 (a 92.3% increase).
In older updates, Permanent Fruits were the only reliable way to own multiple fruits at once, as the Fruit Storage gamepass was not yet available.
The total cost of every Permanent Fruit is   68,880.
Permanent Fruits are generally known as Perm Fruits or Perms.
Permanent Fruits can be bought from the Dealer even when not in stock.

fruits.name: Remove Blox Fruit
trivia: Remove Blox Fruit used to have some glitches with fruits such as Kitsune, Dough or Love.
If the player removes their fruit while using Dragon's transformation, they will be frozen in place.
Remove Blox Fruit was added because players previously needed to remove their fruit before equipping a new one. At the moment, when equipping a different fruit, the old one is removed automatically.

fruits.name: NPCs
fruits.description: NPCs, or Non-Player Characters, are entities ingame that the player can interact with in some way. They can be found on almost every Island. They provide Quests, sell Items, or teach the player Fighting Styles.
trivia: Some NPCs are based on developers of Blox Fruit or popular Blox Fruits Youtubers.
There are currently 146 NPCs in the game.
Sometimes when joining the game, some NPCs will load slowly or stop loading costumes, making them wearing nothing.
Dog House (Indra) is the first NPC in the game.
The Arena Trainer and Horned Man are the only Quest NPCs to ever reward the players Fragments.

Blox Fruit Dealer Cousin, Norp, Wenlocktoad Over Heaven, Layandikit12, Treasure Inventory, Colors Specialist are NPCs that have been removed from the game or will not return in the future. As for Party Shop, Valentine Shop, Magic Elf, Greedy Elf, and Santa Claws NPCs can only appear during the event.
Among them, Treasure Inventory is the only NPC whose glowing circle color is purple.
Among them, Treasure Inventory is the only NPC whose glowing circle color is purple.

fruits.name: Second Sea
trivia: Second Sea contains the most Easter Eggs in the game.

fruits.name: Third Sea
trivia: The Third Sea holds the title of having the least number of islands (8); however, more are to come. It also could be counted as 12 islands, as there are several mini-islands in the Sea of Treats or 17 if the Mirage Island, Kitsune Island, Treasure Island, Frozen Dimension and Prehistoric Island are included.
The enemies past the Ice Cream Land (Sea of Treats) use Aura, nullifying Elemental Reflex even if the player surpasses the required Level.

fruits.name: Awakenings Expert
trivia: The Awakenings Expert used to be inside the secret Wenlocktoad room. However, in Update 14, the room was closed, and the NPC can instead be found right outside of it.

When unawakening the player's fruit, it does not unawaken every single move. The player can select which moves they'd like to be awakened and which they would like to not be awakened if they have the move awakened.

If the player uses the Awakenings Expert to unawaken their fruit moves, they will not need to do a raid or pay any fragments. They can just talk to the Awakenings Expert then reselect the move and it will be re-awakened once again. (The player can only do this if that move was awakened once before)
This makes awakenings permanent.
This makes awakenings permanent.
The Awakenings Expert has a connection with Wenlocktoad. Through this, Toad calls him Tommy.

fruits.name: Bosses
fruits.description: Bosses are a type of enemy that is significantly stronger than a normal enemy. They drop more EXPEXP and Money  , as well as item drops such as swords, materials, accessories, and guns. They can often attack the player using not only M1 attacks but also abilities. Bosses reward bounty/honor upon being defeated. Additionally, immunities don't work against them (e.g. Blade's Passive, Elemental Immunities). For more information, see Tips for Bosses.
trivia: There are currently 34 bosses in the game.

Most older bosses use the legacy version of their respective Swords or Blox Fruits. For example, Stone uses the old version of the Bomb fruit.
An exception to this is Don Swan, who has been updated to use modern moves from Spider, and Hydra Leader, who uses the first two moves of Venom.
An exception to this is Don Swan, who has been updated to use modern moves from Spider, and Hydra Leader, who uses the first two moves of Venom.
Longma was the only boss to not be able to be seen with Instinct. That was changed later after Update 20.
The average spawn time of every boss is around 20 to 45 minutes (except Raid Bosses).

The First Sea has the most bosses out of all seas, with the number of 16. Third Sea is on the second place after Third Sea with the amount of 10, and last place being Second Sea with the amount of eight (Although 4 of the Third Sea bosses are quest-specific.)
Killing all of the bosses with the quest will give about   165,000 in the First Sea,   170,000 in the Second Sea, and   247,500 in the Third Sea (without 2x Money).

fruits.name: Don Swan
moves: Cross-Spider Attack — Don Swan summons dozens of strings to impale his opponent from above.
Ultimate Thread — Don Swan summons multiple strings weaved together covered in Aura and sends them at the target in a piercing formation.
Over-heated Sniper — Don Swan shoots a thick rope made of condensed strings from his palm.
Flash Step — Don Swan Flash Steps towards the user.
trivia: The Ice Admiral mentions Don Swan (as Swan) in his dialogue being defeated by the player. (In order to access the Second Sea through the Military Detective's quest.)
Don Swan is the only boss to have 2 in-game accessories equipped at once, those being the Pink Coat and Swan Glasses.
Don Swan's room is right under Jeremy's spawn.
Sometimes, a glitch occurs where the player gets teleported to the Café when they try to enter Don Swan's room.
Don Swan, Longma, Saber Expert, Ice Admiral and Mob Leader are the only bosses that don't have a defeat Quest.
Don Swan, Fishman Lord, Beautiful Pirate and rip_indra True Form are the only Bosses with two forms.
Don Swan is the only boss that gives the player a boat upon defeat, which is the Guardian. He once gave the Swan Ship, but as of Update 20, it was replaced by the Guardian instead.
Don Swan does the most damage out of all the bosses in the Second Sea as his [V] Ultimate Thread ability in its second form can deal up to 5,000 damage.
Unlike normal bosses, the player needs to meet certain requirements to enter Don Swan's room.

If the player uses the Flash Step to enter Don Swan's room without meeting certain requirements, the player will not be able to damage him but they will be damaged by him.
The player can use the Flash Step to exit his room too.
The player can use the Flash Step to exit his room too.

fruits.name: Inventory
trivia: Before Update 17.3.5 players could not un-store fruits in First Sea.
The inventory was added to replace the Treasure Inventory.

fruits.name: Fishing Rods
fruits.description: Fishing Rods are gear that can be used for Fishing.
moves: Fishing Rod Protector: Prevents line snap once per catch. Instead, boosts progress by 30% and calms the fish.
Curse of the Leviathan: Catching a specific species may trigger an unknown event.
Curse of the Terrorshark: Start with 20% extra progress, but fish panic much faster.
Curse of the Whale: Final fish weight increases by 15%, but may consume 2 bait instead of 1.
Blessing of Bait Efficiency: 20% chance to not consume materials when crafting bait.
Blessing of an Angler’s Treasure: Increases daily treasure limit by 3. (This enchantment is bugged and currently doesn't work.)

fruits.name: Fish
trivia: Giving fish to the event fisherman with max tokens will give nothing.
If the player consumes the last type of fish they have and then captures the same fish it will appear as captured for the first time even though it is not.

The player can only have 301 fish in their inventory. If they try to catch another fish with a full inventory, a message will display saying: "Your fish inventory is full! If you catch any fish, you won't be able to carry them! Release them manually or visit the Fisherman to sell them".

In the Update 27.1 trailer, Admin Uzoth is shown fishing in the pond at Dragon Dojo and catch a Dragon Koi. However, it is actually unknown where to fish for it, and what rods and baits are required for it. It is thought to be unobtainable as of now.

Fishing for making Money is not recommended as it is slow and Rarities does not matter (only weight does).
Fishing is recommended for crafting Foods and Potions, or completing Events, such as RIP Event and Red King Event.
Fishing is recommended for crafting Foods and Potions, or completing Events, such as RIP Event and Red King Event.
The higher the weight, higher the rarity. Therefore a gold fish, which weights 12kg, is a rare.

fruits.name: Items
fruits.description: Items are objects or weapons that can be carried in the hotbar and held or simply stored in the inventory bar.

fruits.name: Consumables
fruits.description: Consumables are items that can be consumed to gain special effects. They can be obtained from the campfire.

fruits.name: Foods
fruits.description: Foods are consumables that grants their consumer effects.

fruits.name: Skins
fruits.description: Skins are wearable cosmetics that change the visuals of certain abilities and transformations.
trivia:
Collecting all Legendary colors (excluding limited variants) requires   22,500,  15 ,  10 , and  15 .
Collecting all Rare colors requires   15,000,  3 ,  8 ,  3 ,  2 ,  2 ,  2 ,  2 , and  4 .
Collecting all Rare colors requires   15,000,  3 ,  8 ,  3 ,  2 ,  2 ,  2 ,  2 , and  4 .
Unlocking all aura skins requires a total cost of   37,500 or   1,830,  3 ,  8 ,  6 ,  2 ,  2 ,  25 ,  12 ,  25 ,  1000 ,  1000 , at least  15 ,  250 and  250
During Update 17.3.5, a bug occurred where the Party Hat and the Aquamarine aura color could not be equipped.

There is a known glitch where the aura color on the avatar does not exactly match the aura color on Swords, Guns or Electric Claw.
This happens when you activate an aura, then you switch to another, without reactivating.
This happens when you activate an aura, then you switch to another, without reactivating.
Equipping Rainbow Saviour causes the color cycle to stop when zooming out. The effect resumes once zooming back in.
Mythical Aura Skins, (Rainbow Saviour, Dragon, Kitsune, Oni and Celestial), are the only with shifting animations.
Before Update 24, Hoops were required to change the color of the Dragon (Classic).
After Update 24, all players who had purchased an Aura color prior to the update were automatically awarded the Hakaishin title due to a glitch.
Three Blox Fruits currently have attacks that change color depending on the equipped aura color: Rubber, Spider, and Dough.
Skins for Portal are already listed in the Barista Menu but are not yet craftable. They are planned for release in a future update.

stats.Notes: Currently having 2750 stat levels on Gun, Sword, and Blox Fruit stats will give an 88.4x multiplier. Each stat level adds a x1.0346759259 (3.46759259%) buff.

fruits.name: Levels
trivia: Uzoth reached Lv. 2550 (the max level for Update 20)  in just 7 minutes and 45.92 seconds.

It would take around 23 years of non-stop playing to reach Lv. 2750 by doing only Bandit or Trainee quests every three seconds. The player would need to grind the quest 375,909,459 times and need 112,772,837,596 EXPEXP total.

fruits.name: Health
fruits.description: Health (also known as HP, hit points, health points) is a fundamental feature in Blox Fruits. Once a player has zero health, they will die and respawn a few seconds later , with the exception of the Ghost and Pain fruits which can resurrect you one time before you can be killed. The more health the player has, the more durable they will be from other attacks. Health deduction can be reduced by activating Aura. Full body Aura reduces damage taken by 30% before subtracting it from the player's health. Health scales off the current Defense stat, with 5 HP being added for each stat point put, the amount of health one has can be measured by using the following equation:
trivia:
The max health a player can have is 16512. It can be obtained by having 2750 Defense point stats and using the Leviathan Shield accessory, and having at least Draco v3. With no accessories or buffs, the max amount of health would be 13845.
20483 when using the Leviathan Shield accessory and Shark V4's (upgraded) Leviathan Armor ability.
With just the Leviathan Shield accessory, the max health would be 14845.
20483 when using the Leviathan Shield accessory and Shark V4's (upgraded) Leviathan Armor ability.
With just the Leviathan Shield accessory, the max health would be 14845.
Leviathan Crown, Pilot Helmet, Kitsune Ribbon, Lei and Feathered Visage (dropped from the 'Tyrant of the Skies' Raid Boss) are the only accessories that increase health regeneration speed.

Players can get the following two Titles in Second or Third Sea for losing health:
The Undefeated One (#080): Receive damage from a player and survive with less than 50 HP left
Immortal Being (#081): Receive damage from a player and survive with 1 HP left
The Undefeated One (#080): Receive damage from a player and survive with less than 50 HP left
Immortal Being (#081): Receive damage from a player and survive with 1 HP left
Every time the player levels up or completes a quest with low health and/or energy, their health and energy will automatically be restored unless the player is in combat.

The [F] (mobility) moves of Flame, Ice, Spider, Light and Eagle go faster with the higher Health the player has.
Opposite to that, the [F] (mobility) moves of Blade, Sound and Venom move go faster the lower the Health the player has.
Opposite to that, the [F] (mobility) moves of Blade, Sound and Venom move go faster the lower the Health the player has.
Bomb's [V] move exchanges the player's health for damage.

fruits.name: Energy
fruits.description: Energy is a fundamental feature in Blox Fruits. Once a player has zero energy, they have to wait until their energy bar is no longer empty or else the player cannot dash or use certain moves. It is essential for performing most actions in Blox Fruits, such as using moves, dodges, Air Jumps, Flash Steps, and others. Energy scales off the current Melee stat, with 5 Energy being added for each stat point allocated. The amount of energy one has can be measured by using the following equation:
trivia: The regeneration of energy scales with the players stats, being faster the higher their energy stats are. (2x faster on the ground)
One dash consumes 30 energy (unless the player is using the Rabbit race, which allows only 15 energy to be consumed).

The max amount of energy a player can have is 17930, with 2750 stat points in Melee, using the Kitsune Ribbon accessory, whilst being in an awakened form of their race. With no accessories or buffs, the max energy would be 13845. With just the Kitsune Ribbon accessory, it would be 16345.

Trying to use a move that requires more energy than the player currently has will make a message appear saying "Low energy! [Amount of energy the move requires] energy required." and the move will not activate.

Normal M1 attacks, such as kicking, punching, swinging a sword, firing a gun, using abilities such as the V3/V4 of a Race, Summon Sea Beast, and Admin Abilities will not drain energy.
The only exceptions are Skull Guitar, Rubber, Dough (V2), Phoenix (V2)'s M1 and Diamond M1.
The only exceptions are Skull Guitar, Rubber, Dough (V2), Phoenix (V2)'s M1 and Diamond M1.
Other players' and enemies' energy bars can be seen by using Instinct and Instinct V2
The Masterpiece enchantment can remove the energy cost for the attacks of the item it is on.
If the player completely runs out of energy, they are given the title “Empty Vessel” (#067).  It is recommended to use Phoenix's [X] move for the most efficient energy drain.

fruits.name: NPCs
fruits.description: NPCs, or Non-Player Characters, are entities ingame that the player can interact with in some way. They can be found on almost every Island. They provide Quests, sell Items, or teach the player Fighting Styles.
trivia: Some NPCs are based on developers of Blox Fruit or popular Blox Fruits Youtubers.
There are currently 146 NPCs in the game.
Sometimes when joining the game, some NPCs will load slowly or stop loading costumes, making them wearing nothing.
Dog House (Indra) is the first NPC in the game.
The Arena Trainer and Horned Man are the only Quest NPCs to ever reward the players Fragments.

Blox Fruit Dealer Cousin, Norp, Wenlocktoad Over Heaven, Layandikit12, Treasure Inventory, Colors Specialist are NPCs that have been removed from the game or will not return in the future. As for Party Shop, Valentine Shop, Magic Elf, Greedy Elf, and Santa Claws NPCs can only appear during the event.
Among them, Treasure Inventory is the only NPC whose glowing circle color is purple.
Among them, Treasure Inventory is the only NPC whose glowing circle color is purple.

fruits.name: Quests
trivia: The Forgotten Quest Giver and the Kingdom of Rose Area 2 Quest Giver have a similar appearance.
There are two Mole Quest Givers. One is located near the Skylands next to the temple that teleports to the Upper Skylands. The other is found in the Upper Skyland itself.
The Deep Forest Quest Giver 1 looks similar to the Tiki Quest Giver 2.
Most quest givers have a yellow exclamation mark on above or even behind them, which makes it easier to find them while searching.
The Arena quest giver is the only quest giver that rewards the player with   fragments.
There is currently a total of 116 quests in the game (including side quests).

fruits.name: Allying
trivia: There was a glitch where if the user is a Marine and joins the Pirates team through the Pirate Recruiter, the ally button will disappear.
Allied players can only be damaged with Meme.

Allying is the only way for the player to ride a Love user's flamingo, a transformed Kitsune or a transformed Dragon with Strong Hair/Saddle. To get teleported by Portal's [C] World Warp without getting allied, the player needs to be outside safe zone. (The player can also get teleported if both are in combat in safe zone.)

fruits.name: Abilities
fruits.description: Abilities are various unique effects and bonuses that the player can learn and use to gain advantages in Blox Fruits.

fruits.name: Damage Counter
trivia: Currently, the YouTuber/admin Uzoth is the record holder for the greatest amount of damage the game has ever recorded, at 988 septillion (9.88 x 10²⁶). The video can be found here.
The most amount of damage done by a non-admin player is imFiji, with 127,518,285. The video can be found here.

fruits.name: Fast Mode
fruits.description: Fast mode is a mode that reduces lag for Blox Fruits on devices. It works by removing the textures in models, making all parts have a smooth plastic texture. It normally takes around 20 seconds to completely execute, and the player can still play during the execution time. However, on some devices, it could take longer.
trivia: Fast mode can be used for finding the hidden texts on the trading tables at mansion. It could still be found without fast mode but using it makes it easier.
Fast mode does not change a lot of FPS in heavy/powerful devices such as PCs or gaming tablets/phones, but it is recommended if the player has a weak phone, old computer.
Some V3 or V4 abilities might not show up. An example for it is the Cyborg V3 ability where the player does not see the particles but they still receive the buffs.

Since update 24, there's a bug where turning on Fast Mode on the menu before choosing a team doesn't fully disable all textures in the game, and the Fast Mode button through the Settings appears as if it wasn't even turned on at all.
This is especially noticeable in the Third Sea, as far areas like Temple of Time may appear fully/partially textured, even when Fast Mode was turned on beforehand. (In this case, turning on Fast Mode through the Settings while being in the Temple of Time will fix this issue.)

This is especially noticeable in the Third Sea, as far areas like Temple of Time may appear fully/partially textured, even when Fast Mode was turned on beforehand. (In this case, turning on Fast Mode through the Settings while being in the Temple of Time will fix this issue.)

fruits.name: Upgrading
trivia: Upon upgrading an item, a white star will appear at the top left corner of the item in the player's inventory.

In order for the player to upgrade every single weapon from the First Sea, they have to be at least in the Third Sea because of Soul Cane, Pole (1st Form), and Saber needing Radioactive Material, and Bazooka needing Dragon Scales.

In total, to upgrade every weapon (excluding Triple Dark Blade), a player would need exactly:
 800  Bones
 432  Scrap Metals
 399  Leathers
 149  Magma Ores
 104  Dragon Scales
 79  Angel Wings
 79  Fish Tails
 69  Mystic Droplets
 58  Mini Tusks
 49  Vampire Fangs
 40  Ectoplasms
 30  Radioactive Materials
 18  Demonic Wisps
 16  Conjured Cocoas
 10  Azure Embers
 10  Blaze Embers
 5  Dark Fragments
 4  Meteorites
800  Bones
432  Scrap Metals
399  Leathers
149  Magma Ores
104  Dragon Scales
79  Angel Wings
79  Fish Tails
69  Mystic Droplets
58  Mini Tusks
49  Vampire Fangs
40  Ectoplasms
30  Radioactive Materials
18  Demonic Wisps
16  Conjured Cocoas
10  Azure Embers
10  Blaze Embers
5  Dark Fragments
4  Meteorites
Weapons that are obtained in the First Sea have a higher upgrade output than those in the Second or Third Sea, which might be due to the betterment of weapons as the player progresses through seas.

fruits.name: Safe Zone
trivia: If the player is already in Combat with another player, the Safe Zone will not protect the player from that person until their Combat indicator disappears. This is to prevent players immediately running to a Safe Zone when losing in PvP or when getting attacked.

The first location of every sea is a safe zone (e.g Pirate/Marine Starter, Kingdom of Rose Docks and Port Town Docks). This is to prevent the player getting attacked immediately while they are spawning in.
The Safe Zone has a delay of about one second before it activates. That means it is possible to be attacked when the player first joins the game.
There is a glitch where after dying in combat the player can be attacked even in a safe zone if other player's combat is still on.
The safe zone near the Blox Fruit Gacha in Jungle was added in Update 20.
The player's speed gets slower by roughly 37.5% whenever they enter a safe zone.

Now in Update 24, if the player is on a private server and the PvP mode is set to "Friendly PvP", the player can be attacked anytime even on Safe Zone places, but they can't lose honor/bounty if they die to another player (that player also can't get honor/bounty).

fruits.name: Titles
fruits.description: Titles are labels that appear next to the player's name when they speak in the Roblox chat.
trivia: “Sugar Rush”, “Christmas Spirit” and “Loco Verde” were only available during the Presents event.
The titles "Death King" and "Undead Lord" are only available during Halloween events.
There was a glitch where upon killing the Leviathan’s head, the title was not awarded. This has recently been fixed.
There is a glitch where if the player is the last person standing in a raid and run out of time, they will still receive the "Last Hope" title.
Unlocking the Rainbow Saviour Aura Color without unlocking any other Aura Colors will wrongfully award the player the "The Collector" title.
Getting the Kitsune Aura skin does not unlock the "The Enhancer" title.
Blox Fruits Staff members who can drop the "Equal to the Heavens" title cannot turn it off unlike normal YouTuber titles.
The "Hakaishin" title #147 means "God of Destruction" in Japanese.
The "Loco Verde" title #156 means "Crazy Green" in Spanish.
The "Shinigami" title #169 means "Soul Reaper" or "God of Death" in Japanese.
Uzoth's title, "Doragontarontorēnā", is a Japanese anglicism which means "dragon talon trainer", likely a reference to the NPC that sells Dragon Talon being based off him.
The "LA FLEUR DU MAL 悪の華" title means "THE FLOWER OF EVIL (French), before Flower of Evil (Japanese)."

fruits.name: Wanted Posters
trivia: If the player is alone in a server as a Pirate, all the posters will only have them displayed, if  there aren't any pirates in the server the wanted posters will not spawn at all.
Upon completion of the quest, the message "<QUEST COMPLETED> Earned   " will appear.
Unlike the Player Hunter, the player can choose whoever they want to hunt down.
Unlike the Player Hunter, kills with quests from wanted posters don't count and don't give exp.
If the target's level has max level, the reward will be stuck at   50,000.
Every couple of minutes the wanted posters will change and the quest will disappear.
If the player dies, the wanted poster will change to another player.

fruits.name: Pictures
trivia: Some pictures do not have official names.
There is a glitch with the pictures "Staff Photo" and "Dragon Talon Trainer" where they fail to load and appear blank. This could possibly be due to a bug or Roblox deleted them.

fruits.name: Sea Exploration Group
trivia: Sea Exploration Group appears only in the Third Sea.
The 20 required sea events for Frozen Dimension include only those that spawn enemies. Events like islands, Haunted Shipwrecks, or Rough Seas do not count.

fruits.name: Experience
trivia: EXPEXP is currently the most abundant quantity in the game, easily reaching into the hundreds of millions for a single level, while other Stats and currencies are rarely seen above ten million.
Roblox Premium allows the user to gain more experience on a quest/kill than a normal player.
It took Uzoth 7 minutes and 45.92 seconds to reach Update 20's MAX level (2550).
The amount of EXPEXP needed per level is defined by [2 x Level^2.3 + 84] = EXP to level up.
It takes a total of 119,938,274,162 EXP119,938,274,162 EXP to reach level 2650.

fruits.name: Mastery
trivia:
Currently, the maximum amount of mastery a fighting style, fruit, sword, or gun can have is 600.
The maximum amount of mastery for fishing rods is 100.
The maximum amount of mastery for fishing rods is 100.

The amount of EXPEXP needed per mastery is defined by this formula:
54 + ((2 * mastery ^ 2.26 + 30) * 0.5)
EXP Calculator
EXP Calculator
The total amount of EXP needed to reach mastery 600 is 348,679,374 EXP348,679,374 EXP.
Getting mastery can be doubled by using the gamepass 2x mastery.
When the player reaches MAX mastery, the item's stats is increased to 425.

fruits.name: Gifting
trivia: Game passes can be stored in the inventory (by "gifting" their inventory), allowing them to be traded (excluding the Respawn Bosses and Change Race game passes).

fruits.name: Update Log
fruits.description: The Update Log is a feature in Blox Fruits that lets players see the planned upcoming updates. It can be accessed by clicking on "Settings", then on "Open Log".

fruits.name: Campfire
fruits.description: The campfire can be crafted through the user's inventory by using one Wooden Plank. It allows the player to craft Potions and other consumables using unlocked recipes, obtained from the Note in a Bottle through fishing.
trivia: Campfires can be available for beginners since wooden planks can be obtained with a lower chance without Shipwright subclass as of Update 27.
When the campfire is going to disappear, you will be notified, saying "Your campfire's flames have been extinguished..." a few seconds before it disappears.
Other players can use your campfire, and so can can you.
If you open the Craft Menu, then walk away from the campfire, the Craft Menu will disappear.
There are currently only 6 available recipes as of Updates/27.1.
The player need 18 Fishes (1 Rare, 4 Uncommon And 13 Common), 1 Leather, 1 Scrap Metal, and 1 Fish Tail to craft every recipe once.
The Player can craft a Fish Kebab, Lava Potion, Aggro Elixir, Loot Seeker, Berserkers Elixir, and Fortune Elixir.
Monk Potion, Invisibility Potion, and Oni Soul potions were limited to Oni Campfire.

fruits.name: Valor
trivia: Valor is currently the only currency that is exclusively obtainable in the Third Sea.
It takes a total of   17,300 and   12,800 to unlock and fully level up all the abilities.

fruits.name: Rules
fruits.description: Thank you for coming to the Blox Fruits Wiki. We have rules set in place to make this place as friendly as possible. Discussion/post rules can be found here, it's probably best that you read those as well.

fruits.name: Wiki Staff Page
fruits.description: Information on the roles and permissions that these users possess can be found at the Roles page.

stats.Senbo to Kami100:
Fandom: Senbo to Kami
Discord: enVi#7952

fruits.name: Manual of Style
fruits.description: Hi, and welcome to the Blox Fruits Wiki. This page is a manual, complete with guidelines and etiquette when editing/creating basic articles on this wiki. This page is a standard that you should seriously consider following, so that people know how and what to edit.

fruits.name: History of Stock
fruits.description: This page is dedicated to writing down the "Stock" of every month, going as far back as December of 2020. Current stock can be seen on the Blox Fruits "Stock" page.

fruits.name: History of Stock/Year
fruits.description: This is the Blox Fruits Stock History, going as far back as December of 2020.

fruits.name: Rarities
fruits.description: Most items that are found in Blox Fruits are given a rarity, which is indicated by a tag of colored text. They are applied to Blox Fruits, swords, guns, accessories, materials, scrolls, fishing rods, and various paid items.

fruits.name: Premium
fruits.description: Premium is a special rarity for paid items in the inventory.

fruits.name: Private Servers
fruits.description: Private servers are an integrated part of Roblox that Blox Fruits uses. They can be purchased for   200 which renews every 30 days for the same price.
trivia: Only 2 fruits can spawn inside of a private server since its start.
Bosses will not immediately spawn at the start of a server. They'll instead spawn when their respawn period is over.
Upon start, servers start on a half moon, with the sun halfway in the sky.
The Player Hunter will refuse to give the player a quest while in a private server, stating "Sorry, you must join a public server for PvP tasks."
Inside private servers, the build limit of the Creation Fruit increases from 40 to 189.

fruits.name: Server Browser
trivia: Server names use the old version of fruit names. For example, a server may be named "Weak Soul", despite the fact that it was renamed to Spirit.
Server names can also contain usernames of developers, like "Large TAWG", which was one of mygame43's previous usernames.
Some servers like England, Hong Kong, etc. have been removed.
The Server Browser button can also be a circle with no text.

fruits.name: System Messages
fruits.description: System Messages are notifications of specific events such as the spawning of Raid Bosses, high-bounty player joins, questline quotes, event messages, etc.
trivia: When the Stored <Sword> message appears, instead of Stored Fox Lamp , it shows the words of another sword. It can even display swords that users do not own or already own, or admin-exclusive swords like Triple Dark Blade.

fruits.name: Soundtracks
fruits.description: Soundtracks are an indispensable part of every game. Blox Fruits has many soundtracks, these soundtracks in game all contribute to increasing highlights in certain locations, creating atmosphere or sometimes improving the experience.

fruits.name: Codes
fruits.description: Codes can be redeemed by clicking the  icon on the bottom left side of the player's screen and entering the code.

swords.name: Blox Fruits
trivia: It would cost   68,880 to buy every permanent fruit, and   84,432,500 to buy every fruit from the Blox Fruit Dealer.

Most bosses use the older versions of their fruits.
Don Swan is the only one who uses Spider with its updated moveset.
Don Swan is the only one who uses Spider with its updated moveset.
Many Blox Fruit moves have Destructible Physics, as with many other types of attacks.

swords.name: Fighting Styles
trivia:
All fighting styles have three different moves, except Combat, which has two, and Death Step and Dark Step, which have four.
However, the extra moves on the four-skill fighting styles exist mainly to boost damage of the other abilities.
However, the extra moves on the four-skill fighting styles exist mainly to boost damage of the other abilities.
Dragon Breath is currently the only fighting style having a fragment-only price.
Sanguine Art and possibly Combat are the only fighting styles in the game without a "V2".
Godhuman and Sanguine Art are the only fighting styles that require Materials.
On each fighting style other than Combat, there is the letter M at the bottom left corner of their icon, along with a white or black border surrounding the icon.
All First Sea fighting style teachers are Shop NPCs, but in the Second Sea and the Third Sea, all Fighting Style Teachers are Misc. NPCs.

swords.name: Guns
trivia:
Guns can have many different types of projectile weapons, such as:
The Venom Bow being a bow,
The Skull Guitar being a guitar,
The Refined Slingshot, the Kabucha and the Slingshot being slingshots.
The Venom Bow being a bow,
The Skull Guitar being a guitar,
The Refined Slingshot, the Kabucha and the Slingshot being slingshots.

In order for the player to upgrade every single weapon from the First Sea, they have to be at least in the Third Sea because of Soul Cane, Pole (1st Form), and Saber needing Radioactive Material, and Bazooka needing Dragon Scales.

In total, to upgrade every weapon (excluding Triple Dark Blade), a player would need exactly:
