swords.name: Blacksmith
trivia: The Blacksmith is also the only NPC that holds an item in their hands (a hammer).

When the player first enters the Second Sea and the Third Sea, the Blacksmith will be at the island when they first enter them. However, this is not the same for the First Sea, since he is at the Pirate Village.

If the player steps away or moves their camera far enough from the Blacksmith, they will freeze in his position. This is similar to the Rainbow Saviour Aura color, which stops changing colors when the player's or their camera moves far away enough.

swords.name: Enchantments
moves: Fishing Rod Protector — Prevents line snap once per catch. Instead, boosts progress by 30% and calms the fish.

swords.name: Dragon Talon Sage
trivia: The Dragon Talon Sage is based on Uzoth, who is an admin, YouTuber and the Dragon Talon trainer.

swords.name: NPCs
swords.description: NPCs, or Non-Player Characters, are entities ingame that the player can interact with in some way. They can be found on almost every Island. They provide Quests, sell Items, or teach the player Fighting Styles.
trivia: Some NPCs are based on developers of Blox Fruit or popular Blox Fruits Youtubers.
There are currently 146 NPCs in the game.
Sometimes when joining the game, some NPCs will load slowly or stop loading costumes, making them wearing nothing.
Dog House (Indra) is the first NPC in the game.
The Arena Trainer and Horned Man are the only Quest NPCs to ever reward the players Fragments.

Blox Fruit Dealer Cousin, Norp, Wenlocktoad Over Heaven, Layandikit12, Treasure Inventory, Colors Specialist are NPCs that have been removed from the game or will not return in the future. As for Party Shop, Valentine Shop, Magic Elf, Greedy Elf, and Santa Claws NPCs can only appear during the event.
Among them, Treasure Inventory is the only NPC whose glowing circle color is purple.
Among them, Treasure Inventory is the only NPC whose glowing circle color is purple.

swords.name: Bosses
swords.description: Bosses are a type of enemy that is significantly stronger than a normal enemy. They drop more EXPEXP and Money  , as well as item drops such as swords, materials, accessories, and guns. They can often attack the player using not only M1 attacks but also abilities. Bosses reward bounty/honor upon being defeated. Additionally, immunities don't work against them (e.g. Blade's Passive, Elemental Immunities). For more information, see Tips for Bosses.
trivia: There are currently 34 bosses in the game.

Most older bosses use the legacy version of their respective Swords or Blox Fruits. For example, Stone uses the old version of the Bomb fruit.
An exception to this is Don Swan, who has been updated to use modern moves from Spider, and Hydra Leader, who uses the first two moves of Venom.
An exception to this is Don Swan, who has been updated to use modern moves from Spider, and Hydra Leader, who uses the first two moves of Venom.
Longma was the only boss to not be able to be seen with Instinct. That was changed later after Update 20.
The average spawn time of every boss is around 20 to 45 minutes (except Raid Bosses).

The First Sea has the most bosses out of all seas, with the number of 16. Third Sea is on the second place after Third Sea with the amount of 10, and last place being Second Sea with the amount of eight (Although 4 of the Third Sea bosses are quest-specific.)
Killing all of the bosses with the quest will give about   165,000 in the First Sea,   170,000 in the Second Sea, and   247,500 in the Third Sea (without 2x Money).

swords.name: Puzzles
swords.description: Puzzles are a frequent game mechanic the game that is normally found for some items such as Cursed Dual Katana and Dark Blade V2. Puzzles are similar to quests, but players have to think to them. A puzzle is usually found to unlock powerful items or other game mechanics such as the Saber or Race V4. This page does not show all instructions, but it shows the player the link to each puzzle in every sea. This page also has a trivia and tips for the puzzles mentioned below.
trivia: The Second Sea has the most puzzles in the game.

Despite its difficulty, the Race V4 puzzle is not as hard as many people say it is. The mirage part was relatively peaceful and easy before Update 20. Now, it can be deemed even harder than the Leviathan because of the low spawn chance and high chance of spawning Terrorsharks.
The first puzzle that should be completed is the Saber Expert Puzzle since it allows the player to use Instinct, and the Second Sea Puzzle as soon as they reach Lv. 700.
Every puzzle has its own requirements. Such as the Colosseum Quest, which requires the player to kill 50 Swan Pirates and Jeremy, then do a puzzle for the Warrior Helmet.
The Cyborg Puzzle and the Race V4 Puzzle are the only Puzzles to not have a level requirement.

swords.name: Dark Blade
moves: While held: The same move occurs, but the user dashes along with the slashes.(NOTE: This effect only applies after evolving via The Son Quest)
While held: The same move occurs, but the user dashes along with the slashes.(NOTE: This effect only applies after evolving via The Son Quest)
While held: The same move occurs, but the slash goes faster, and farther. (Note: This effect also only applies after evolving via The Son Quest)
While held: The same move occurs, but the slash goes faster, and farther. (Note: This effect also only applies after evolving via The Son Quest)

— The user executes a near instantaneous barrage of several green slashes, dealing high damage, hitting enemies, and stunning them for a short amount of time. This breaks Instinct if the first attack hits the opponent.
— The user launches a thin, tall, vertical slash of green energy towards the direction the are facing, which deals high damage and has a little knockback. This move doesn't break Instinct.

— The user executes a near instantaneous barrage of several green slashes, dealing high damage, hitting enemies, and stunning them for a short amount of time. This breaks Instinct if the first attack hits the opponent.
— The user launches a thin, tall, vertical slash of green energy towards their cursor, which deals high damage and has a little knockback. This move doesn't break Instinct.

— The user execute a near instantaneous barrage of several green slashes that travel forward slightly, dealing high damage, hitting enemies, and stunning them for a short amount of time. This breaks Instinct if the first attack hits the opponent.
While held: The same move occurs, but the user dashes along with the slashes.(NOTE: This effect only applies after evolving via The Son Quest)

— The user launches a thin, tall, vertical slash of green energy toward the direction they are facing, which deals high damage and has a little knockback. This move doesn't break Instinct.
While held: The same move occurs, but the slash goes faster, and farther. (Note: This effect also only applies after evolving via The Son Quest)
This move does break Instinct but does not break objects.
— The user executes a near instantaneous barrage of several black and white slashes, dealing high damage, hitting enemies, and stunning them for a short amount of time.

— The user launches a thin, tall, vertical slash of black energy toward their cursor which deals high damage and has a little knockback. If held, the same move occurs, but the slash travels much faster and goes farther, this effect also only applies after evolving via The Son Quest.
trivia: The Dark Blade makes the user spin when they do an Air Jump or side dash. The user will also do a roll when they back dash.
The Dark Blade was previously called the "Yoru" which was then changed to Dark Blade.

There is a triple version of the Dark Blade, named the Triple Dark Blade.
This version is only usable by admins or people they granted it to.
This version is only usable by admins or people they granted it to.
The Dark Blade is the only sword that requires obtaining a Game Pass to obtain.
The Dark Blade is technically the only sword that can be traded, because the player can store it in the form of a Game Pass.
The Brazil Cube allowed the first player who touched it to receive Dark Blade. However, it could only be spawned in by an admin.
The Dark Blade is the only sword that has an alternate skin.
The Dark Blade is one of the swords that are difficult to use, due to requiring decent aiming and prediction skills.
The [X] Dark Air Slash from its V1 has higher stun duration than its V2 counterpart and smaller AoE.
The Dark Blade is one of the few items in the game to have its rarity altered.
The Dark Blade is often abbreviated as "DB". Check Dictionary for more info about such abbreviations.
The Dark Blade is recommended for all seas as it has high damage and low mastery requirements and are comparable to swords like Cursed Dual Katana, True Triple Katana, or Shark Anchor.

swords.name: Shop
swords.description: The shop is an in-game store, accessible through the GUI Menu. Players can purchase numerous items/boosts for Robux   in this shop or gifts for other players.
trivia:
There used to be various types of limited-time packs for previous Christmas Updates, those being:
Beast Bundle
Holiday Special
Winter Combo
Holiday Essential
Ultimate Bundle
Beast Bundle
Holiday Special
Winter Combo
Holiday Essential
Ultimate Bundle
Designs of products, game passes, and chromatic artwork were created by @EGOTISMS_RBLX.
The player can store a game pass by clicking "Gift" and then clicking "Store in Inventory", This doesn't work with Respawn Bosses and Race Reroll, as of Update 21.

After Update 24, owners of the Permanent Dragon Token could briefly buy a discounted permanent dragon for   2400 Robux. Due to backlash and threats of legal action, the developers quickly fixed the issue. However, some users later spotted an unbuyable shop item labeled "Discounted Dragon" with a 500k money icon, but it turned out to be just a visual bug.
When used in trades, shop items allow the player to bypass the 40% maximum value difference requirement.

swords.name: Common
trivia: The carp is the lightest of all common fish (19kg).
The heaviest fish is the Grouper (44kg).

swords.name: Levels
trivia: Uzoth reached Lv. 2550 (the max level for Update 20)  in just 7 minutes and 45.92 seconds.

It would take around 23 years of non-stop playing to reach Lv. 2750 by doing only Bandit or Trainee quests every three seconds. The player would need to grind the quest 375,909,459 times and need 112,772,837,596 EXPEXP total.

swords.name: Twin Hooks
moves: — The user swings their hooks in front of them, briefly creating a cyclone of red wind at the point of their cursor, which deals damage to nearby enemies and drags them downwards. If enemies are on the ground, they will slightly rise to the air. This move is similar to True Triple Katana X.

— The user throws their hooks at the direction of their cursor, which are connected to them via ropes. After throwing the move towards the cursor it will also somewhat auto-aim moving to any non allied person or enemy. Upon hitting an enemy, the user pulls themselves towards the target as a large dark spectral mammoth head with red glowing eyes appears behind them and rushes forward, launching the target into the air after dealing damage. This move is similar to Mammoth's [X] True Prehistoric Punt.
trivia: The X move on Mammoth, True Prehistoric Punt, parallels the X move on Twin Hooks, Prehistoric Punt.
The Twin Hooks has an unusually low rarity, since all Third Sea swords are at least Legendary.
The Twin Hooks has the most mastery requirements needed to unlock all the moves out of any Uncommon Sword.
Despite not being one, the Twin Hooks is nevertheless classified as a Sword.
The Twin Hooks is the only Uncommon sword that can be obtained in the Third Sea.
The X move on Twin Hooks has the same sound as Dragon's Z Move.
The Twin Hook's X move's startup looks similar to Rubber's [F] Slingshot.

swords.name: Legendary
trivia: Beast Hunter is the only boat to have a rarity.

swords.name: PvP mechanics
swords.description: There are several PvP mechanics implemented into Blox Fruits. Some PvP mechanics allow players to get on a more even playing field, while other mechanics make a certain player overpowered. These mechanics mostly do not apply to NPCs and bosses and only apply to players fighting each other, as PvP means Player Versus Player.

swords.name: Cutlass
moves: — The user dashes forward, swiftly attacking enemies in their path in a teleportation-like fashion.
— The user slashes through the air, unleashing a short-range air slash that strikes all enemies in its path, forcefully knocking them back.
trivia: The Cutlass has the same move set as the Katana.
The Cutlass used to cost   5,000 instead of   1,000.
Chef and many other enemies use the Cutlass.
Prior to Chef using the Cutlass, Bobby used to use it. Chef replaced Bobby as of Update 26.
The Cutlass also appears as the 2x Mastery icon in the shop.

swords.name: Sword Dealer
trivia: The swords sold by the Sword Dealer are the exact same, with the only difference being the appearance.

The swords sold by the Sword Dealer are also among the most effective for aura grinding, thanks to their low damage output. As the first swords players obtain in the game, they provide an optimal starting point for accumulating aura points.
The Sword Dealer likely serves as one of the initial NPCs players encounter within the game.

swords.name: Leather
trivia: A total of    354 is required to craft everything that requires this material.

Farming Leather at Pirate Village in the First Sea is recommended.
Quake's [V] or any other large AoE move can be used to easily obtain Leather.
Quake's [V] or any other large AoE move can be used to easily obtain Leather.

swords.name: Angel Wings
trivia: A total of 95 Angel Wings is required to craft everything that requires this material (including Eagle upgrades).

swords.name: Dual Katana
moves: — Sends out a medium-range, spherical slicing attack formed by arcs that carries and knocks back its targets.
— Unleashes a violently rotating whirlwind attack that damages all enemies within its radius and flings them away.

swords.name: Sword Dealer of the West
trivia: A total of   37,000 is needed to purchase both of the swords.

swords.name: Katana
moves: — The user dashes forward, swiftly attacking enemies in their path in a teleportation-like fashion.
— The user slashes through the air, unleashing a short-range air slash that strikes all enemies in its path, forcefully knocking them back.
trivia: The Katana used to have a price of   5,000 instead of   1,000.

The Katana is functionally identical to the Cutlass, sharing the same moveset, damage values, and cooldowns even though granted, they are different swords. The only distinction between the two weapons is their model design.
The Katana and Cutlass are the first obtainable swords a normal player can get.
The Katana has a bug, when you use [Z] Quiet Rush and quickly unequip it, it wil cause the user being in a weird animation.

swords.name: Iron Mace
moves: — The user smashes the mace on the ground, generating a powerful shockwave that inflicts damage to nearby enemies as well as three deep cuts in the ground.
— The user rapidly swings the mace, dealing damage multiple times to enemies in front of them.
trivia: The Iron Mace is the only sword that has visible spikes on it.

When the player holds [X] Killer Combo then rapidly unequips the Iron Mace right before the move finishes its animation, they will be rendered immobile until the player resets or leaves the game. This glitch can be useful for AFK grinding enemies by preventing the player from moving or perhaps taking knockback from attacks. (This can prove useful for lower leveled players with Elemental fruits, but doesn't really help that much with general grinding.)
The Iron Mace, despite being classified as a sword, is a Mace.
The Iron Mace, alongside Shark Saw and Bisento are the only swords that slam on the ground on the last M1.

swords.name: Shark Saw
moves: — The user swings the sword two times diagonally before releasing a heavy slash vertically, knocking the enemy back. The slashes have a black and dark red aura.

— The user spins around in a circle while moving towards the cursor, slashing the sword around them. When hitting an enemy, they get pulled in and receive continuous damage. When the move finishes, the player does a small horizontal slash, dealing knockback and damage to the enemies caught in by the attack.
trivia: The Shark Saw, alongside Iron Mace and Bisento are the only swords that slam on the ground on the last M1.
Fishman Raiders use the Shark Saw with the old version of [X] Execution.

swords.name: The Saw
swords.description: "The Saw has spawned in the game! You have 15 minutes to kill him and possibly get a rare reward!"
trivia: The Alternate Saw was a re-skin of The Saw that alternated with the original Saw skin on occasion. It was only a change in appearance. Alternate Saw is now The Saw's default skin as of Update 13.
The Saw and Darkbeard both have the same face decal.
The Saw is the lowest level boss that can drop a sword (Shark Saw).
The Saw is the only enemy that spawns in Middle Town.
Ever since Update 24, a bug can occur where The Saw's weapon floats above him as he uses Execution.
Unlike other bosses, The Saw is the only boss that has a system message when it appears.
The Saw is the first 'event-based' boss in the game as he has a system message on its respawn time similar to the raid boss Greybeard.
Even though the system message speaks of a Rare reward, the Shark Saw is an Uncommon sword.

swords.name: Triple Katana
moves: — The user swings their swords in front of them, releasing blue air slashes in the direction of their cursor. These air slashes will damage enemies upon contact.
— The user lifts their swords and charges forward, leaving behind a trail of blue-colored air slashes. These slashes will damage enemies upon contact.
trivia: The Vice Admiral, Fishman Commandos, Marine Captains, and Cake Guards use the Triple Katana as their weapon.
The Triple Katana is one of the only three Swords in the game that have three Swords combined to form one. (Triple Katana, True Triple Katana and Triple Dark Blade).

swords.name: Scrap Metal
trivia: Scrap Metal is the most common and most used material in the game.
A total of  432  is required to buy everything that needs this material (excluding Volcanic Magnet, which may be crafted several times).
Farming at the Pirate Village (in First Sea) with an AoE fruit is recommended.
This is the most used material, as a high amount of it is required to do everything the material has to offer.

swords.name: Captain Elephant
moves: Sky Cyclone — Captain Elephant swings his hooks in front of him, briefly creating a cyclone of red wind at a direction.

Prehistoric Punt — Captain Elephant throws his hooks at the target, which are connected to them via ropes. Upon hitting an enemy, he pulls himself towards the target as a large dark spectral mammoth head with red glowing eyes appears behind him and rushes forward, launching the target into the air after dealing damage.
trivia: As seen in the dialogues of Citizen, the Captain Elephant is the leader of the Forest Pirates.
Captain Elephant has the Jaw Shield equipped, however he does not have the buffs and does not drop it when defeated.

When Captain Elephant is defeated in the Citizen’s quest, it will have a dialogue that states a man stronger than him will avenge him, Similar to Jeremy in the Second Sea, who says Don Swan will avenge him. The Captain Elephant is referring to the Beautiful Pirate as the man who will avenge him soon. But not being too much of a bad guy, the Captain Elephant accepts his defeat nicely.
Captain Elephant is the first and only boss to ever get its abilities reworked.

swords.name: Fish Tail
trivia: A total of  99  is required to upgrade/obtain everything that requires this material.

swords.name: Mini Tusk
trivia: A total of  68  Mini Tusks is required to buy or craft everything that requires this material.
The Mini Tusk is considered one of the most annoying and difficult materials to obtain due to the enemy's long distance and low drop chance.

It is recommended to use Buddha fruit to farm the Mini Tusks in order to group NPCs up and kill them quickly. Another way is to use Angel V4 ability as King's Rule gear does damage and stuns the opponent/NPC if they get too close.

swords.name: Dragon Trident
moves: — The user fires a large beam of water with a dragon's head at the direction of their cursor, damaging and pushing away enemies in its path similar to Magma awakened C move. This move has high knockback.
— The user summons a rain of water dragons with a large AoE. This has a really short knockback, producing an effect almost like a stun.
trivia: If the player uses the Dragon Trident's [M1] dash attack in mid-air, they will go very far.
The Tide Keeper uses the old abilities of Dragon Trident.
The Dragon Trident is the only Rare sword to have its [X] move mastery requirement being 350.

swords.name: Tide Keeper
moves: Sea Dragon Fury — The Tide Keeper fires a large beam of water with a dragon's head, damaging and pushing away players in its path.
Water Dragon Prison — The Tide Keeper swings the trident, releasing a wave of water that creates a sphere of swirling water in front of them, damaging and briefly trapping players within it.

Summon Sea Beast — The Tide Keeper has the ability to spawn a Sea Beast, similar to players when they've reached 10,000,000 bounty/honor. The Sea Beasts Tide Keeper spawns only have 20,000 health but do just as much damage as a normal Sea Beast. They do not give any rewards upon being defeated.
trivia: The Water Key can be given to Daigrock, the Sharkman to buy Sharkman Karate for   2,500,000 and   5,000 once the player meets all the requirements (getting 400 mastery on Water Kung Fu), for more information, click here.
The Tide Keeper spawns every 30 minutes.
The Tide Keeper's Sea Beast has less health than a normal Sea Beast and does not drop anything.
For grinding mastery, it is recommended to kill Awakened Ice Admiral instead because he gives 750k-950k, while the Tide Keeper only gives 800k-900k.
A Silver, Gold and Diamond chest can be found near the Tide Keeper boss, on raised platforms.

swords.name: Dragon Scale
trivia: Dragon Scales are considered extremely difficult to obtain since the enemies are extremely few or far apart. Even with Buddha or Dragon, it is still hard to farm due to massive land elevation and nearly having zero destructible physics decorations. It is recommended to use awakened Quake's [V] Seaquake for AFK farming since it is one of the only abilities that could hit all enemies.
A total of  124  Dragon Scales are required to acquire to buy or upgrade everything that requires this material. ( 223  if including the Triple Dark Blade.)

swords.name: Dual-Headed Blade
moves: — The user dashes forward in a slow spinning motion, slashing enemies in their path and leaving a glittering trail behind them.
— The user propels three small tornadoes towards the direction of their cursor, damaging enemies upon impact.
trivia: In the moveset, the Dual-Headed Blade is called "Headed Blade" (due to the lack of wording space).
The X move appears to be an upgraded version of the Wardens Sword X move.
The Dual-Headed Blade is the third most expensive sword in the First Sea behind Soul Cane and Bisento.

swords.name: Master Sword Dealer
trivia: The player can upgrade Bisento by killing Greybeard while having Bisento in their inventory.
It is not advised to buy Dual-Headed Blade, as it is generally considered horrible for grinding and PvP.

swords.name: Flail
moves: — The user launches a leopard-like blast of smoke in the direction of their cursor that travels for a long distance, briefly stunning, blinding, and damaging enemies hit.

— The user teleports to their cursor's location and releases billowing smoke, damaging and blinding nearby enemies for approximately two seconds. Smoke is left at both the original and destination points, dealing damage in both areas.
trivia: The Flail is used by the Lv. 1150 Boss, Smoke Admiral and a Lv. 2600 Raid Boss, Tyrant of the Skies.
The Flail is the only weapon used by two bosses, but only dropped by one.

A special glitch can be done with the Flail to make it look like the player is using /opfun, an admin command which allows a player to spam abilities even when they are still doing the ability. (Maybe patched)
Flail is not a typical sword but actually a spin-off of Morning Star, it was typically used by the cavalry in the medieval times.

swords.name: Smoke Admiral
moves: Smoke Cloud — The Smoke Admiral blasts a Smoke Tornado with decent AoE, blinding and stunning the player for a moment if hit.
Smoke Tackle — The Smoke Admiral turns into smoke and dashes forward, while also dealing damage and dragging the player along with him.
Smoke Barrage — The Smoke Admiral fires smoke that lingers, stunning, blinding, and doing damage over time.
trivia: The Smoke Admiral takes no damage from lava, like other NPCs.
The Barista Cousin can spawn on top of the same building as the Smoke Admiral.
Although the Smoke Admiral's room is on the hot side of Hot and Cold, his corresponding quest giver is on the cold side.

swords.name: Vampire Fang
trivia: The Vampire Fang is considered as one of the most annoying and difficult materials to obtain, having an extremely low drop chance, despite being dropped from only one NPC.
A total of  74  Vampire Fangs is required to buy and upgrade everything that needs this material.

swords.name: Gravity Blade
moves: — The user attracts all nearby enemies in the direction of the cursor, mustering a lavender aura before releasing it in an explosion.
— The user reverses gravity and flings the target in the air, slashing them and dealing constant damage, before finally slamming them back into the ground.
trivia:
Gravity Blade is based on the Chokutō, which is a traditional Japanese sword.
In real life, the way this sword is held is known as the "reverse grip". While this grip reduces the power and precision of attacks, it allows for quicker and less predictable movements in close quarters, making it ideal for surprise strikes.

In real life, the way this sword is held is known as the "reverse grip". While this grip reduces the power and precision of attacks, it allows for quicker and less predictable movements in close quarters, making it ideal for surprise strikes.
[X] Lunar Blitz is quite similar to Awakened Dough's grounded [X] Pastry River, with both sharing a lift-and-drop mechanic.
Gravity Blade's old [Z] (Gravity Push) was identical to Gravity's old [Z], with both sharing names, VFX and move purpose. (Other than the direction of the move.)
Gravity Blade's old moves were similar to Orbitus' moves with the [Z] being the same as one of his moves and the [X] being a shorter version of his other move.

swords.name: Orbitus
moves: — Orbitus uses the force of gravity and pushes the player away. This ability breaks Instinct.
— Orbitus releases the energy of gravity and causes a large number of meteorites to rain down. These meteorites explode upon collision, and this ability also breaks Instinct.

swords.name: Meteorite
trivia: A total of  7  is required to craft everything that requires this material.
The icon of this material resembles the old Gravity's icon.

swords.name: Longsword
moves: — The user dashes towards their cursor, then sends out a green slash that deals damage and creates temporary grass as it flies near a surface. If an enemy is hit by the dash, they become briefly stunned, take some extra damage and deal decent knockback.

— The user jumps over the enemy, dealing damage and creating a grassy area launching the target upwards. If there is a player on top of them at the start of the leap, the user will drag the player that is in contact with them alongside the leap.
trivia: Despite the description saying that the Longsword has a hexagonal cross-section, the older model used to look like a pentagon.

swords.name: Diamond
moves: Annihilate — Diamond slashes rapidly around himself, stunning and damaging nearby targets.

Glorious Smash — Diamond teleports a short distance in the direction of the target, leaving behind a white blur. Upon teleporting, he forcefully slams the sword into the ground, generating a shockwave that inflicts damage to nearby targets and propels them into the air.
Air Slash — Diamond launches a thin but small vertical white air slash that deals a small amount of damage.
trivia: Diamond can drop Longsword even though his sword's model is Cutlass.
Diamond is a part of Human V3's quest.

swords.name: Radioactive Material
trivia: A total of  42  Radioactive Materials is required to buy everything that needs this material.

swords.name: Pipe
moves:
If it hits:
The user does short and swift dash towards the enemy. Upon contact, the user stuns the enemy before gathering flames in the shape of a dragon head and creating an explosion, dealing damage and releasing embers.

The user does short and swift dash towards the enemy. Upon contact, the user stuns the enemy before gathering flames in the shape of a dragon head and creating an explosion, dealing damage and releasing embers.

If it does not hit:
The user does a short and swift dash before expelling embers that deal low damage.
The user does a short and swift dash before expelling embers that deal low damage.

If it hits:
The user does short and swift dash towards the enemy. Upon contact, the user stuns the enemy before gathering flames in the shape of a dragon head and creating an explosion, dealing damage and releasing embers.

The user does short and swift dash towards the enemy. Upon contact, the user stuns the enemy before gathering flames in the shape of a dragon head and creating an explosion, dealing damage and releasing embers.

If it does not hit:
The user does a short and swift dash before expelling embers that deal low damage.
The user does a short and swift dash before expelling embers that deal low damage.

— This attack has two variants:
If it hits:
The user does short and swift dash towards the enemy. Upon contact, the user stuns the enemy before gathering flames in the shape of a dragon head and creating an explosion, dealing damage and releasing embers.
If it does not hit:
The user does a short and swift dash before expelling embers that deal low damage.

— The user shoots a small dragon-like blast of flame towards where their cursor is. Any enemy caught in the projectile will be dragged with it. When it reaches its cursor's point or goes far enough, it explodes and releases a fiery burst similar to awakened Flame X, causing burn damage to those that are in it.
trivia: Even though the Pipe is a sword, its shape and name have no sword-like characteristics at all.
[X] Earth Smash (old move) was similar to Iron Mace's [X] ability.

The Pipe's model prior to Update 24 was an actual pipe. The name for the weapon after the update had remained unchanged which makes the item description make no sense, despite its updated appearance. This can be confusing for new players who are unfamiliar with the old Pipe model.

swords.name: Soul Cane
moves: — The user shoots a thin white beam in the direction of their cursor, which explodes after travelling a short distance. The explosion damages and freezes enemies hit by it for around 1.5 seconds, similar to unawakened Ice's [C] Ice Bird.

— The user rapidly slashes with their sword, launching several air slashes that travel a short distance in the direction of their cursor, damaging enemies hit by them and stunning them for two seconds.
trivia: The Soul Cane is well known because of its combo potential and good stuns. However, it is hard to use due to small hitboxes, which is why this sword is mostly seen in skill builds, usually paired with Acidum Rifle and others.
Even though it is thought to be for low level players, it is still good in PvP.
The Soul Cane is the second most expensive sword in the First Sea, the first being Bisento.
The way Soul Cane is held is known as the "reverse grip" (in real life combat), which is often not practiced due to the technique lacking range, protection and power in ranged combat.
The way soul cane is held is the exact same as the Gravity Blade.

swords.name: Living Skeleton
trivia:
The Living Skeleton has the same model as Reborn Skeleton.
The only difference is that the Living Skeleton has hair, unlike the latter.
The only difference is that the Living Skeleton has hair, unlike the latter.
Like the Water Kung Fu Teacher, the Living Skeleton is very well hidden.
If the player talks to the Living Skeleton, the dialogue box will show their name as "Hidden Sword Dealer".

swords.name: Trident
moves: — The user throws the trident in the direction of their cursor, which is connected to the user's right hand via a black rope. Upon hitting an enemy, the target is damaged and pulled towards the user. Upon hitting terrain, the user is pulled towards the trident. This move can be very deadly if used correctly. It acts similar to Spikey Trident's [X] Flying Trident Pull move but slower.

— The user spins the trident, creating a suction force that pulls nearby enemies towards them. Simultaneously, a blue circle appears in an area around the player and explodes in a burst of bubble shortly after, knocking enemies back.

swords.name: Fishman Lord
moves: Trident Throw — The Fishman Lord throws the Trident in the direction of the target, which is connected to his right hand via a black rope. Upon hitting an enemy, the target is damaged and pulled towards him. Upon hitting a terrain, he will be pulled towards the Trident.
Water Pulse — The Fishman Lord spins the Trident creating a suction that will pull nearby enemies, then explodes and knocks them back.
trivia: The Fishman Lord, Don Swan, and Beautiful Pirate are the only bosses with a second phase. (rip_indra True Form also has a second phase, but is considered as a raid boss.)
The Fishman Lord was the first boss to have a second form and the only boss in the First Sea with a second phase.

swords.name: Wardens Sword
moves: — The user smashes their blade into the ground, creating a blue shockwave that damages all enemies around them and knocks them back.
— The user launches a tornado in the direction of their cursor that launches any enemy it hits into the air.
trivia: The Cookie Crafters use the Wardens Sword in the sea of treats
The X move is similar to Blizzard's X move, White Out.
The item description states that the Wardens Sword has a ring, but due to the revamped model, The ring is now gone.
Despite the sword being called the "Wardens Sword", it actually drops from the Chief Warden, not the Warden himself, who uses the Dual Katana.

swords.name: Bisento
moves: — The user raises their Bisento, then slams it down onto the ground, releasing a powerful shockwave with medium damage. This move is quite similar to Dark Blade's [X] Dark Air Slash.
— The user slams the end of Bisento's hilt onto the ground, creating an AoE shockwave in a small range. This move is extremely similar to Wardens Sword’s Z move.
— The user raises their Bisento, then slams it down onto the ground, releasing 3 slashes that do good damage. This move is similar to Triple Dark Blade's [X] move.
— The user creates a white sphere on the tip of their Bisento and then launches it. It pulls in nearby enemies and does minimal damage when hit, then expands and does good damage.
trivia: Bisento has one of Quake's old abilities (Quake Sphere) as one of its moves.
This sword has the second highest damage per click in the game. (The first being Triple Dark Blade and third is True Triple Katana.)
Bisento, Dark Blade, Katana, and Cutlass received an animation update in Update 17.2.
Bisento is the most expensive sword in the First Sea.
Bisento, Dark Blade, Saber, and Pole are the only four swords to have a V2.
Before Update 24, if the player activated an auto-clicker right as the impact effect appeared, there was a chance the sword would have double its range.
Bisento V2’s [Z] move is similar to Mammoth [Z] but smaller.
For some reason, the fourth M1 doesn't work in Buddha transformation.

swords.name: Buddy Sword
moves: — The user slashes their sword, launching a single flaming sword slash at the direction of their cursor. Upon hitting an enemy, they will be rapidly damaged as they are enveloped in a flaming sphere that then explodes, knocking them back while burning them, which deals tick damage over time.

— The user fires a purple lightning beam at high speed in the direction of their cursor that deals damage and knocks back enemies in its path. This attack deals more damage the further the enemy is from the user.
trivia: [X] Lightning Wave can be dodged if the target is currently dodging another hit concurrently (e.g. the target is shot with Skull Guitar [Z], turns on Instinct, and later be shot with Lightning Wave while dodging, thus making them dodge out of the way of the wave).
[X] Lightning Wave has a glitch if the player uses the tab glitch, they can aimbot the lightning wave hitting it no matter where they are. This glitch does not always 100% work.

The Buddy Sword can be hard to combo with, because the [X] move launches the enemy pretty far away and the player can't continue the combo. The solution for this is to have the player face downwards and do the combo, causing the enemy to not go anywhere but get stuck at the ground for an open combo.

swords.name: Cake Queen
trivia: Despite being the final Boss in the game, Beautiful Pirate (which is the second final boss in the game, at Lv. 1950) has more HP than Cake Queen.

swords.name: Conjured Cocoa
trivia: A total of  16  Conjured Cocoas is required to buy everything that requires this material. (Excluding Sweet Chalice because it can be crafted multiple times.)

swords.name: Mystic Droplet
trivia: A total of  102  Mystic Droplets is required to buy everything that requires this material.
The Mystic Droplet can be obtained in the Third Sea through enemies that spawn in the Pirate Raid.

swords.name: Canvander
moves: — The user dashes in the direction of their cursor, rapidly slashing enemies in their path, dealing damage and scattering purple-white flower petals.

— The user dashes forward, scattering purple-white flowers and launching five purple air slashes in the direction of their cursor. If the slashes hit an enemy, their and the user's screen will cover in a purple tint for a second.
trivia: Canvander is used by the "friend" NPC summoned by Love's [V] Besto Friendo.
The Musketeer Pirates use Canvander, but don't have access to using the special abilities, therefore being restricted to the M1's instead.

There is a glitch that when Canvander's [TAP] Normal Attack do not load in and the player uses an auto-clicker set to 1 millisecond intervals between each click, the player will fly in the air (this also works with other swords with dashes on [M1] attacks, such as Koko.
There is a glitch that will make the petals in [X] Scattering Gust go in different directions if the player turns their camera (or moves their cursor) fast enough.

swords.name: Beautiful Pirate
moves: Piercing Dash — The Beautiful Pirate dashes towards the player, rapidly slashing them, dealing damage and scattering purple-white flower petals.
Scattering Gust — The Beautiful Pirate dashes forward, scattering purple-white flowers and launching five purple air slashes towards the target.
trivia: The Beautiful Pirate must be defeated to complete the Horned Man's quest to unlock the Rainbow Saviour Aura skin per last questline.
The Beautiful Pirate is one of the only bosses that has a second form, the others being rip_indra True Form, the Fishman Lord and Don Swan.
Previously, dying inside the domain would respawn the player at the Hydra Island, since the Beautiful Pirate's lair was under it
The Beautiful Pirate is regarded as the boss with the highest amount of health, barely surpassing Cake Queen by 59,000 HP.
The Beautiful Pirate is fast in both forms, being capable of outrunning players without the Rabbit race or a speed boosting accessory such as the Pilot Helmet or Hunter Cape.
The Beautiful Pirate is a part of the Captain Elephant's dialogue after defeating him in the Citizen's Quest.

swords.name: Dark Dagger
moves: — The user initiates a stance before rushing forward, creating an impact of green electrical-like shock when an entity is hit. This attack breaks Instinct.
— The user shoots a short, green, electrical, glowing dagger. If it comes in contact with an entity, the user will teleport behind and slash them.
trivia: The Dark Dagger is currently the smallest sword in the game in terms of its model size, although it does not have a small hitbox in its click attacks.
The Dark Dagger has the same click animation as the Dark Blade, but smaller.
If the user times it right, they can land a melee attack during [Z] Proficient Impale.
Before Update 24. While the Dark Dagger is worn, it seems to take the appearance of a golden cross or crucifix.

swords.name: rip_indra True Form
swords.description: "A barrier has been broken."
moves: One Thousand Slices — rip_indra launches an instantaneous barrage of multiple green slashes, dealing high damage, hitting players, and stunning them for a very short period of time. This will be white and black when he's in his true form.

Dark Air Slash — rip_indra launches a thin, tall, vertical slash of green energy toward players, which deals high damage and has a little knockback. When in his true form, this slash will be black and appear to be larger.

Black Pillar — rip_indra sends out 12 black-colored pillars (with the same mesh as the old unawakened Flame [C] (Fire Column) move) in a 180-degree blast, damaging anything within range. Only used when in true form.

Black Blast — rip_indra launches 3 Dark Air Slashes with bigger size, and farther range. Each air slash can be stacked if the player stands too close, making it deal a massive amount of damage. Also used only when in true form.
trivia: While Indra is spawned, the Castle on the Sea will be temporarily renamed to "Battle of the Gods" and the theme will change to Lizard Bandit Clan, which was composed by @DTF.
rip_indra is the third boss to make an appearance in two separate seas, the first being Ice Admiral/Awakened Ice Admiral and the second being Swan /Don Swan.

rip_indra is the Boss that rewards the highest Bounty/Honor in game upon defeat, being 125,000.
Because of this, the player can skip directly to 2.6M bounty by killing Indra if they have a little lower bounty than 2.5M (around 2.49M), because bounty is no longer rewarded if the player has 2.5M bounty or more, but it can be bypassed if the player gains one large bounty reward before hitting 2.5M.

Because of this, the player can skip directly to 2.6M bounty by killing Indra if they have a little lower bounty than 2.5M (around 2.49M), because bounty is no longer rewarded if the player has 2.5M bounty or more, but it can be bypassed if the player gains one large bounty reward before hitting 2.5M.
Upon summoning, everyone in the same server as Indra being spawned in will have their screen shake.
rip_indra is the only Raid Boss to have a second form.
rip_indra, Fishman Lord, Don Swan and Beautiful Pirate are the only Bosses with two forms.
Before Update 20, when the player turns on Instinct, it shows "rip_indra True Form Lv. 5000 [Raid Boss]", but when they go close, it shows "rip_indra".
rip_indra in both forms are shown in "rip_indra True Form Lv. 5000 [Raid Boss]" in the boss bar. This might be a glitch or might be intentional as well.

rip_indra's health bar changes to the second form when its health reaches about 100,000.
If dealt an amount of damage greater than 100,000 while being in the first form, he will not be immediately destroyed, the excess damage will be converted for Indra's second form.
If dealt an amount of damage greater than 100,000 while being in the first form, he will not be immediately destroyed, the excess damage will be converted for Indra's second form.

rip_indra actually uses nerfed versions of Black Blast and Black Pillars, as he'll only launch three air slashes, and send out about 12 black pillars. The real Black Blast launches 11 Dark Air Slashes, and Black Pillar sends out 36 pillars.
The mist effect caused by rip_indra is cancelled out by Sea Danger Level 6's dark fog.
Currently only one other npc shares the same extreme level as rip_indra, that being the Red commander.

swords.name: Dark Fragment
trivia: A total of  9  is required to craft, purchase, or upgrade everything that requires the Dark Fragment ( 34  if the Triple Dark Blade is included).

swords.name: Dragonheart
moves: — The user summons a dragon that swirls in an almost zig-zag path, which is carried by the user as they lunge forward, carrying the enemy as well whilst the dragon burns away and crackles, similar to an ignited fuse.

— The user holds Dragonheart upwards, creating a large flaming ball similar to Flame's [V] move, then launches it at the aimed position, resulting in an extreme shockwave and fiery explosion, leaving a trail of flames and dealing massive damage. The user's screen shifts into a red-like tone while the move is being held, and the ball of fire getting bigger with embers swirling around and a circle of flames surrounding the user, dealing damage to any enemies within it. A bigger fire ball means more damage  and a larger hitbox. The explosion also tends to "latch onto" walls if it makes contact with one.
trivia: Dragonheart was initially considered to be included in the new kit of the reworked Dragon fruit.
Dragonheart is the only sword in the game that requires the player to craft it.
Despite the recipe being available after obtaining Dojo Belt (Red), Dragonheart cannot be obtained until the player has Dragon Tether as it requires a Dragon Egg.
500 Mastery is needed on this sword to light one of the lamps on Hydra Island, which is required to obtain Draco V4.
The sound of the M1 when hitting an enemy is the exact same as Dragon Talon, Dragon Breath, and Fox Lamp's M1 sound effects.

Similar to Dragonstorm, this is the only sword having a compound noun as its name. The word "Dragonheart" is not an English word and is a compound/combination of the words, "dragon" and "heart". (Another example of a compound noun would be "moveset".)
Dragonheart's [X] Infernal Catastrophe's fire ring stays in place while moving on boats.

swords.name: Dragon Egg
trivia: The number of Dragon Eggs that spawn upon completion of the Volcano Event depends on player count, with a maximum of  4  if the event was started with four players. This amount does not increase further with more players.
A total of  8  Dragon Eggs is required to buy everything that requires this material.

Similar to the Kitsune Shrine where it has a very small chance to give the player a physical Kitsune fruit, there is a very small chance to obtain a physical Dragon fruit (East or West) upon interacting with the Dragon Egg to pick it up.

swords.name: Dinosaur Bones
trivia: A total of  49  is required to craft everything that requires the Dinosaur Bones. Excluding Random Mythical Dragon Skin Recipe, there are mainly 4 Dragon Skin Recipes, so in total it would add up to  60 .

Upon completing the Volcano Event, five Dinosaur Bones for each player involved fall onto the floor near the skull/relic used to start the event.
Ironically, player can pick up other's Dinosaur Bones, even they already picked up their five bones before.
Ironically, player can pick up other's Dinosaur Bones, even they already picked up their five bones before.

swords.name: Blaze Ember
trivia: A total of  137  Blaze Embers is required to upgrade and craft everything that requires this material (excluding Volcanic Magnet as they can be crafted an indefinite number of times).
The Blaze Ember is very similar to the Azure Ember.

swords.name: Fox Lamp
moves:
When pressed:
User swiftly dashes toward the target and unleashes a beam of intense blue fire, pushing the target backward.
User swiftly dashes toward the target and unleashes a beam of intense blue fire, pushing the target backward.

When held:
User releases a massive beam of fire, pushing the enemy away. The user then finishes the move by dashing through the opponent and landing a single slicing attack. This move is similar to Ghost [C], awakened Flame [X], and Sound [X].

User releases a massive beam of fire, pushing the enemy away. The user then finishes the move by dashing through the opponent and landing a single slicing attack. This move is similar to Ghost [C], awakened Flame [X], and Sound [X].

When pressed:
User swiftly dashes toward the target and unleashes a beam of intense blue fire, pushing the target backward.
User swiftly dashes toward the target and unleashes a beam of intense blue fire, pushing the target backward.

When held:
User releases a massive beam of fire, pushing the enemy away. The user then finishes the move by dashing through the opponent and landing a single slicing attack. This move is similar to Ghost [C], awakened Flame [X], and Sound [X].

User releases a massive beam of fire, pushing the enemy away. The user then finishes the move by dashing through the opponent and landing a single slicing attack. This move is similar to Ghost [C], awakened Flame [X], and Sound [X].

— The user has the ability to summon a rotating ring of blue letters that envelop the player. Once released, the azure embers swiftly move towards the target aimed at the cursor's location. Upon contact with an enemy, the azure embers inflict multiple slashing attacks before propelling the enemy into the air, resulting in a powerful explosion. If held, the letters transform into blue spheres that rotate around the player, though this is just a visual change and does not affect damage.

— This ability consists of two variations:
When pressed:
User swiftly dashes toward the target and unleashes a beam of intense blue fire, pushing the target backward.
When held:
User releases a massive beam of fire, pushing the enemy away. The user then finishes the move by dashing through the opponent and landing a single slicing attack. This move is similar to Ghost [C], awakened Flame [X], and Sound [X].
trivia: The Fox Lamp is known for its extremely powerful high stun ability, extremely fast attacks and especially really good in the air.
The Fox Lamp is more recommended for grinding by pairing it with Buddha.
The Fox Lamp does not turn black when Aura is active, though Aura colors still appear. (Similar to Shark Anchor)
Despite being a sword, the Fox Lamp resembles a lamp rather than a common blade.

The Japanese symbols (キツネ) shown when charging [Z] Scorching Azure and [X] Infernal Firestorm (The player can briefly see the symbols as it is spun at a very fast speed), mean "Kitsune" which when translated means "Fox" in English ("Kitsune" can also be written as the kanji character "狐").
The [X] move, when tapped, bears a slight resemblance to Dragon Talon's [Z] move, Talon Lighter.
Fox Lamp's [M1] attacks' sound effect is similar to Dragon Breath and Dragon Talon, but with a slightly lower pitch.

swords.name: Azure Ember
trivia: A total of  10  is required to buy everything that requires this material.
The word "Azure" comes from the Spanish origin "Azureus" (also known as "Azul") which means blue.
The Azure Ember has striking resemblance to the Blaze Ember, with only a recolor and a minor shape change.
The Azure Ember, the Blaze Ember, the Dinosaur Bones, the Dragon Egg, the Leviathan Heart, the Fire Flower and all the Berries are currently the only materials that physically exist in the game.

swords.name: Koko
moves: — The user charges forward with the power of electricity, damaging and shocking any opponents in the way, and launching them upwards.

— A rotating crosshair appears in front of the player. When released, a swift lightning projectile shoots out of the sword (does not have projectile mechanics), which damages and shocks any opponents hit by it, while also knocking them back slightly.
trivia: Koko isn’t seen much in builds, but it’s actually a really good sword for hybrids. Especially when paired with Control, where it gets heavily buffed, making it a versatile option.
Koko is used by the Lv. 1250 raid boss, Order.
Both moves deal the exact same damage.
Despite being called a katana, Koko itself is an ōdachi, which is longer and larger than a normal katana.
[Z] Electric Stab can be used to no-clip through thin walls and doors.
Koko is the first sword to be buffed by a fruit other than Buddha, which is Control.

The hitbox of [X] Injection Shot is at the player's cursor, not the visual, meaning if the player moves the cursor to somewhere else, then the move's hitbox will move as well. For instance, if the player first aimed the [X] Injection Shot in front of themselves but aimed to the right after releasing the move, the target(s) to the right will be affected. (Does not work if the player held the move instead of tapping the move.)

Koko is not curved like a normal ōdachi, instead it is straight. This suggests that after forging koko was not drenched in water, rather it was left to cool off, which ideally would result in a weaker katana.

swords.name: Order
moves: Control Area — Un-cancellable move from Order which creates an area where Order's moveset is able to be used inside. He will not use this move unless the user has damaged him.
Levitate — Order levitates a boulder of the ground or wall, and then flings it at a player.

Echo Knife — Order slices the air with a blade. If the blade makes contact with a player, Order will begin slashing them continuously, and then finish off with a heavy blow, sending them into the air.

Injection Shot — In front of Order, a rotating crosshair appears as the attack is held and aimed. Once released, a small, yet fast projectile shoots out of the sword effect along with medium-sized knockback if landed.
Teleport — Teleports Order to a random location in the room or near a specific player. Has a short cooldown and can be used to escape a combo.
trivia: There is no level requirement to purchase a Microchip from Arlthmetic. The player can buy a chip as soon as they enter the Second Sea and have  1000.
His moves can make sounds very far away, even people at the Cafe can hear them.
The Order raid will end about 7:20 minutes after started, if not finished.
Mastery is not given upon defeat of this boss.
Sometimes Order may bug out and disappear, giving no rewards.

Sometimes Order would attack players who are outside the lab, making it impossible for people who are actually in the raid to kill Order. However, if the player resets or dies, everything continues as normal.
The player has to deal damage equal to at least 10% of Order's health to obtain rewards. This makes long-range M1s, such as Leopard or Buddha's M1 amplification, suggestible fruits.

swords.name: Midnight Blade
moves: — The user shoots a virtual image of themselves in the direction of the mouse, which the user will then slash (which the virtual version of themselves copies), and on hit will trigger a small AoE domain of quantum energy, pulling enemies in range in and barraging them for the duration of the ability. Interestingly, this move stuns Blade users through the entire animation, although does not deal damage.

— The user dashes forward, leaving behind a blue trail, which on hitting an enemy will pull in nearby enemies before making the player spin around then creating an AoE explosion and throwing the enemies forwards.
trivia: The old version of the Midnight Blade is used by the Lv. 1325 Raid Boss, Cursed Captain.
The afterimage that the [Z] move creates holds the unreleased redesign of the Midnight Blade.

swords.name: Ectoplasm
trivia: A total of  565  is required to buy everything that requires this material.
The Ship Stewards and Ship Deckhands are the best enemies for Ectoplasm grinding.
Ectoplasm can also be obtained in the Third Sea by killing Cursed Ship enemies that spawn in a Pirate Raid.
The Ectoplasm is one of many other materials that can be obtained in Pirate Raids.
The player can see how much Ectoplasm they have by talking to Guashiem.
If the player has Dragon (West), they can enter the Cursed Ship and continuously use the [C] Scorching Downfall ability, almost covering the entire area.
If the player has Quake V awakened, they can hit every enemy in the ship.

swords.name: Oroshi
moves: — The user rapidly slashes with the sword, creating a flurry of white sword slashes in front of them that continuously damages enemies within the area. The duration of this attack can be extended by holding the associated key, with a maximum duration of 5 seconds. After the move concludes, the sword slashes expand, knocking back enemies. This ability is similar to Spin's [Z] and Superhuman’s [Z] move.
— The user dashes forward, grabs the player and shoots a ball of wind that deals slight knockback upon impact.
trivia: Oroshi, along with Shizu and Saishi are required (and with 300 mastery on each respectively) to obtain the True Triple Katana.
Oroshi's pre-rework [X] move (Scatter Shot) was much similar to that of pre-rework Bisento's.
Oroshi is often used in skilled builds, together with Bizarre Revolver and Rumble.

[Z] Continuous Slashing is similar to both Spin's and Dark Blade's [Z] moves, although it is smaller and lasts longer.
[Z] Continuous Slashing had a larger hitbox before it was reworked.
[Z] Continuous Slashing had a larger hitbox before it was reworked.

swords.name: Legendary Sword Dealer
trivia: Once the player has all three legendary Swords, the "Gone." dialogue will trigger when spoken to.

The player can purchase a legendary Sword at any time, they only need Manager to tell when the Legendary Sword Dealer spawns.
This means that the player can collect all three Swords without using Manager. This may waste time, though it can be a better option as sometimes one might miss the Legendary Sword Dealer while waiting on the Manager.

This means that the player can collect all three Swords without using Manager. This may waste time, though it can be a better option as sometimes one might miss the Legendary Sword Dealer while waiting on the Manager.
Legendary Sword Dealer bears a resemblance to the old version of Blox Fruits Dealer Cousin.

Portal is highly recommended for searching for Legendary Sword Dealer, due to its [C] move, World Warp, which allows for a quick teleport. Light is an excellent alternative. Without one of these Blox Fruits, searching for Legendary Sword Dealer can be troublesome.

The Manager will say, "Meh, he left not too long ago." when a private server is first joined by a player. After three hours, the NPC will reply with its 3rd dialogue (A man in here...), which means that the Legendary Sword Dealer will be spawning after around an hour and 15 minutes, hence it takes around 4 hours and 15 minutes for the NPC to spawn in a fresh/new server.

swords.name: Pole (1st Form)
moves: — The user waves the pole in the air, shooting out an invisible cloud from the top in the direction of their cursor. Once it reaches its maximum distance or hits a surface, it will create an electric explosion that deals decent damage and stuns the enemy for a bit.
— The user waves the pole in the air, creating a small cloud at their cursor. The cloud will then strike down three bolts of lightning which hits enemies below it, which deals decent damage.
trivia: The Pole (1st Form) can be upgraded to its second form (Pole (2nd Form)) by getting struck by a lightning in Rough Sea while holding Pole (1st Form).
The inventory description states the Sword is blunt, but due to the revamped model, it appears sharp, like a spear.

swords.name: Thunder God
moves: Rumble Dragon — The Thunder God unleashes a ferocious lightning dragon that beelines towards the target before exploding upon impact. If the ability does not hit anything within a certain range, it will detonate on its own. Breaks Instinct at direct hit.

Sky Thunder — The Thunder God summons massive lightning bolts that rain down upon their enemies, causing significant damage and temporarily stunning those who are hit. The lightning strikes are randomized, making each unique.
trivia: The Thunder God's walk-speed is 1.25x faster than a non-Rabbit user, making it harder to outrun him.
Despite the Thunder God having the Tomoe Ring equipped, he does not drop the Tomoe Ring. It is instead sold by Yoshi on the castle. (Beside the location of the Sky Bandits)
The Thunder God is a boss, which means Elemental Reflex or Rubber will not work against him. (Same for any other bosses).
The area where the Thunder God spawns is said to be the largest of all the areas where the player must fight a boss (Except for Raid Bosses).

swords.name: Pole (2nd Form)
moves: — The user fires three lighting beams from the pole towards the direction of their cursor, which deals damage to nearby enemies and stuns them. Blue lightning strike marks are left where the beams hit.
— The user forms a small electric sphere at the location of their cursor, stunning enemies and pulling them in towards the center of the sphere.

swords.name: Fragments
trivia: On PS5, the player will still be able to see how many fragments they have even if they haven't entered Second Sea.
To see how much Fragments the player has, they need to hover over the Money value on PC. On console and mobile, it always displays.
The Rare Artifact used to fulfill some of the purposes of this currency, but it was then removed in Update 11.
Before Update 20, this currency didn't appear when the player was in the First Sea.
The maximum amount of Fragments a player can hold is   1,000,000,000

It costs   667,450 to fully max everything the player can buy with Fragments (excluding Race Reroll and Stat Reset)
  187,300 to fully Awaken all fruits
  187,250 to fully awaken V4 on every race
  2,500 to buy the Cyborg race for the first time (excluding potential re-purchases)
  31,500 to unlock all Fighting Styles
  30,000 to unlock all crew slots
  1,500 to purchase the Lantern boat from Cyborg
  1,500 to get Kabucha
  37,500 to get all Aura colors from Barista
  91,000 to get all Dragon skins from Barista (both East and West variants)
  10,000 to get the 2 Dragon seats (  5,000 each from the Dragon Tamer)
  15,800 to max the Shipwright subclass
  62,100 to upgrade Gravity, Eagle, Pain and Lightning fruits in the Admin Panel
  9,500 to get all Eagle skins from Barista

187,250 to fully awaken V4 on every race
2,500 to buy the Cyborg race for the first time (excluding potential re-purchases)
