10,000 to get the 2 Dragon seats (  5,000 each from the Dragon Tamer)
15,800 to max the Shipwright subclass
62,100 to upgrade Gravity, Eagle, Pain and Lightning fruits in the Admin Panel
9,500 to get all Eagle skins from Barista

swords.name: Thunder God (NPC)
trivia: If the player loaded in from something very quickly (e.g. clear a raid), they would've been able to see a shadow of the Thunder God's island.
If the player went through the door next to the Thunder God, they would have been teleported to l'Église de Prophétie (Awakening Room).

The Mini Sky Island actually exists outside of Raids, just like the awakening room, and Light's flight move can be used to fly to it. It's very high up, though, and it takes around five minutes to fly up to it.
As the player needed to have fully awakened Rumble equipped, alongside which the player also needs to have completed a final Rumble Raid (no longer exists) in order to have bought the weapon itself, the player cannot really buy it using the method given above.
The Thunder God was the second NPC that would appear after completing the Rumble raid. (The first one being the Mysterious Entity.)

As the player needed to have fully awakened Rumble equipped, alongside which the player also needs to have completed a final Rumble Raid (no longer exists) in order to have bought the weapon itself, the player cannot really buy it using the method given above.
The Thunder God was the second NPC that would appear after completing the Rumble raid. (The first one being the Mysterious Entity.)
The design of the Thunder God is almost identical to the Thunder God boss, except it has hair.
Due to the change in obtainment methods for Pole (2nd Form) and complete removal of rumble raids, the Thunder God npc is now effectively useless.

swords.name: Rengoku
moves:
If tapped:
The user releases a horizontal slash of flame, which leaves a trail of flame on the ground. If the slash hits an enemy, it damages them and causes burns that cause tick damage over time.
The user releases a horizontal slash of flame, which leaves a trail of flame on the ground. If the slash hits an enemy, it damages them and causes burns that cause tick damage over time.

If held:
The user's screen will first turn red like flame, then release a huge wave of flame that deals widespread damage. Deals tick damage over time, similar to the tap variation.
The user's screen will first turn red like flame, then release a huge wave of flame that deals widespread damage. Deals tick damage over time, similar to the tap variation.

If tapped:
The user releases a horizontal slash of flame, which leaves a trail of flame on the ground. If the slash hits an enemy, it damages them and causes burns that cause tick damage over time.
The user releases a horizontal slash of flame, which leaves a trail of flame on the ground. If the slash hits an enemy, it damages them and causes burns that cause tick damage over time.

If held:
The user's screen will first turn red like flame, then release a huge wave of flame that deals widespread damage. Deals tick damage over time, similar to the tap variation.
The user's screen will first turn red like flame, then release a huge wave of flame that deals widespread damage. Deals tick damage over time, similar to the tap variation.

— The user dashes forward, leaving a trail of orange and red flames. If the user hits an enemy, the user slashes the enemy rapidly and finally releases three fire-like slashes, dealing tick damage with a burn effect. The burn lasts around 2 seconds.

— This move offers two distinct variations:
If tapped:
The user releases a horizontal slash of flame, which leaves a trail of flame on the ground. If the slash hits an enemy, it damages them and causes burns that cause tick damage over time.
If held:
The user's screen will first turn red like flame, then release a huge wave of flame that deals widespread damage. Deals tick damage over time, similar to the tap variation.
trivia: Rengoku is an easter egg that the devs added at Update 13.
Before the rework in Update 20, the [Z] move did not do burn damage.
Rengoku's moveset post-rework is similar to the Pipe.

swords.name: Saber
moves: — The user charges up, then dashes forward into enemies, damaging everything in their path with blood-red slashes.
— The user sends three red air slashes in the direction of their cursor, dragging enemies back slightly whilst doing so.

— The user charges up, dashes forward, and this time sends two air slashes flying. This move is, in theory, V1's [Z] combined with V1's [X]. There's an area where the two moves combine, and once the user manages to land it on the enemy, will deal extremely high damage due to it being the equivalent of two sword moves at once.
— The user sends a red projectile made out of four beams in the direction of their cursor, doing more damage than its V1 counterpart and having a larger hitbox.
trivia: While the Saber can be great for PvP, it can only really work if the opponent is not using Instinct. Since this sword does not have any abilities that break Instinct, it is suggested to have another weapon equipped that can break Instinct easily.
It is recommended to bounty hunt with Ice or Dark along with the Saber, as the player can pull enemies with Dark's [X] ability to the critical [Z] ability range.

The player should aim accurately to deal a critical hit on their opponent. (V2)
It is possible to do a one-shot combo using just the Last Resort ability along with the [Z] and [X] abilities, if done right.
It is possible to do a one-shot combo using just the Last Resort ability along with the [Z] and [X] abilities, if done right.

Due to its incredible damage, the Saber V2 is still considered to be a fairly decent sword in PvP in the Second Sea. However, it is recommended that the player upgrades to a better sword as they progress out of the Second Sea and enter the Third Sea.
The Saber is one of the best swords the player can obtain in the First Sea.
The Saber is one of the best swords for grinding, as its M1 deals high damage, with little to no knockback, and has a low cooldown.
The Saber's handguard model cuts into the hilt.
[Z] Deadly Rush is a good combo extender so always try to combo with that (for low level).
The Saber has the fastest one-shot combo, being one second to eliminate an enemy if pairing it with Godhuman and Portal, and using the right combo.
The Saber is required to obtain Instinct.
Saber Expert uses the old moves of Saber.

The [Z] Deadly Rush ability (V1 or V2) can be used to go through thin walls, such as the igloos at the cold side of Hot and Cold. The user needs to get close to the igloo entrance, but don't touch the wall, then use the [Z] Deadly Rush ability forwards to the wall.
The Saber, along with Bisento, Dark Blade and Pole (1st Form) are the only swords with a V2.

swords.name: Saber Expert
moves: Air Slash — The Saber Expert swings his sword to release a red air slash towards the player.
trivia:
The Saber Expert can get stuck on the square bump in between the stairs, which can also make him considerably easier to beat.
Both of these methods still allow him to hit the player using his ranged move, so be careful.
Both of these methods still allow him to hit the player using his ranged move, so be careful.
The Saber Expert’s secret room could originally only be accessed by players of Lv. 700 or higher but was then later changed.
The Saber Expert can be glitched out of his room by using certain moves, such as Dough's X move.

Despite using the Saber, the Saber Expert does not use any of the moves of the V1 or V2 version of the sword. He releases a red slash attack, which could have been part of Saber V1's moveset during early development of the game.
The Saber Expert is one of the only bosses to have a guaranteed drop, so players only need to defeat him once to get the Saber sword.

The Saber Expert can walk out of his secret room to continue to attack a player, but he can only travel a small distance before teleporting back and being reset to 100% health, like how other NPCs cannot stay too far from their spawn.
The Saber Expert, The Saw, Longma, Don Swan and Mob Leader are the only bosses that don't have a defeat Quest.

swords.name: Saishi
moves: — The user dashes forward, leaving behind a golden trail. When in contact with an enemy, the user performs multiple vertical slashes before launching them upwards.
— The user launches a large, golden air slash in the direction of their cursor, which damages and pushes back enemies hit by it.
trivia: Saishi, along with Shizu and Oroshi are required (and with 300 mastery on each respectively) to obtain the True Triple Katana.
The user can grab Besto Friendos (Love's [V] move) with [Z] Swords Dance.
Saishi is debated to be the best sword in the Second Sea, with its main competitors being Rengoku, Dragon Trident, and Midnight Blade.
[Z] Swords Dance will lock the user in place for a second after dealing damage to big targets such as Sea Beasts.
[Z] Swords Dance and [X] True Air Slash deal the same amount of damage. (Only if [Z] is used close to the target)

swords.name: Shark Anchor
moves: — The user starts to rapidly rotate the anchor with a chain, similar to awakened Dough [C] then the user shoots a fast water shark in the direction of the mouse. When this projectile makes contact with something, a water tornado is formed and explodes throwing it upwards. This attack gets bigger if the user charges this skill.

— The user dashes forward, performing an uppercut with the sword. Enemies hit will be dragged along and slammed down, creating an anchor symbol on the ground if performed close to it. Creates a pink shatter and red slash effect and deals more damage if used against big targets. These include: Sea Beasts, ships, Terrorsharks, Factory Core and Leviathan and reduce armor from transformed players as Buddha users, Mammoth users, Dragon users, etc.
trivia: The Shark Anchor is the third water-related sword, the first being Trident and the second being Dragon Trident.
It is recommended to use close-ranged fruits like Portal to increase combo effectiveness instead of using long ranged Blox Fruits like Lightning.
The Shark Anchor's M1s have a similar sound and VFX to that of Sharkman Karate and Water Kung Fu. This does not mean that the M1s does not have any delays.
When used near a wall, gold marks will appear on the wall.
The projectile launched resembles a Terrorshark.
This skill causes 3 explosions; Water Tornado -> Splash -> Final Explosion.
If used on a moving boat, the animation of this ability will keep repeating.
Acts quite similar to Cursed Dual Katana's [Z] and Dough's [C] move.
Aiming this move at the ground instead of away will briefly stun the enemy, making combos easier and more damaging.

This move increases the damage on a large enemy, but that does not mean it completely ignores the defense of some transformed fruits. (Such as Buddha, the untransformed user will take 300 damage with one stat level, but in the transformed form it is reduced to 200.)
Transformed Phoenix, Venom, Leopard, Kitsune, and Eastern Dragon users do not trigger the special effect.

swords.name: Terrorshark
moves:
— The Terrorshark jumps out of the water to attract every player nearby and splashes back down. This move breaks Instinct and deals a huge amount of damage.
This attack is used when it's close to the player, can't be tricked with Instinct, and will deal a decent amount of knockback. Also, this move has an explosion similar to Shark Anchor's [Z] Typhoon Toss move but bigger and can attract players more easily.

— When the player is close enough, the Terrorshark will do a tail swipe combo, knocking the player down to the sea.
This attack is used when the player is swimming or is close enough, and can be very dangerous if the player is fighting a group of Terrorsharks since they can spam this move on them and make it extremely difficult to keep a distance. This move is similar to the Shark Anchor [X] move but has much more AOE.

— Dashes at extremely high speed in the direction of a player. Upon contact, the Terrorshark will perform an explosion. Unlike the other Terrorshark moves, this move is not included/similar to the Shark Anchor weapon.
trivia: Terrorsharks are sometimes abbreviated as "TS".
Anchored Terrorshark are sometimes nicknamed "Anchorshark"

Terrorsharks can despawn if the player out of range from the Terrorshark's Area. As long as the Terrorshark is still chasing them and taking damage in close range, they will not despawn.
If the player runs away for long enough, the Terrorshark has a chance of getting stuck.
If the player runs away for long enough, the Terrorshark has a chance of getting stuck.

2 or more Terrorsharks can spawn at once, which will make the fight way harder, as both Terrorsharks will attack right after another one does. This makes the splash attack way more deadly as it can stun lock the player.
The player can also air camp while using their ranged attacks, enabling them to kill any quantity of Terrorsharks without taking any damage.
Terrorsharks can spawn in multiple colors such as red, green, blue, and gray.

This is the most annoying sea event, as it constantly disturbs the player and knocks them out of the boat, making it so they can't escape it, for example: If the player wants to do Kitsune Shrine then the Terrorshark spawns, they are unlikely to do the Kitsune Shrine event, therefore wasting their time.
The Terrorshark can actually growl. However, in the test, it could only be heard when the Terrorshark music stopped after the player went out of range. While growling, it also shakes.
The Terrorshark wears the Terror Jaw's model but bigger.

There is a small chance that the player can craft the Monster Magnet while having Shark Anchor at the same time. (The players current Shark Anchor's mastery, enchants and moves will not disappear completely, nor be obtainable back from an Anchored Terrorshark, if the player ever happens to spawn one.)
Terrorshark is one of the most hated sea events by the community as it can ruin hunts for the Kitsune Island, Prehistoric Island or even the Frozen Dimension.

swords.name: Shizu
moves: — The user dashes in the direction of their cursor, dealing damage to enemies in their path. Purple energy bursts from the user after their dash. This slightly stuns the enemies that were hit, similar to Katana's [Z] move.
— The user swiftly fires an extremely fast purple projectile followed by a purple trail in the direction of their cursor. It slightly stuns and causes knockback when hit.
trivia: Although Shizu is considered out meta by the community because of its bad hitbox and does not break Instinct, its combos are still extremely fast and the sword itself deals good damage.
Shizu, along with Oroshi and Saishi are required (and with 300 mastery on each respectively) to obtain the True Triple Katana.

Shizu is much like Canvander or Koko.
Many people refer to Shizu as an improved version of Cutlass and Katana.
Many people refer to Shizu as an improved version of Cutlass and Katana.

swords.name: Spikey Trident
moves: — The user dashes forward. If the user collides with an enemy during the dash, they will start burrowing/drilling dough into the enemy's chest while continuing the dash, dealing damage and stunning the enemy. The enemy will receive a fair amount of knockback afterwards.

— Using the trident, the user expels a stream of lengthy dough. Upon connection between the dough and any surface, the user will "pull" themselves towards that specific surface. If the dough connects with another player/NPC, then instead of the user, the player or NPC with whom the dough was connected with will be pulled towards the user. This move is very similar to Trident's [Z].
trivia: As of Update 20, while using transformed Buddha, [Z] Dough Hurricane moves the user a very short distance. [X] Flying Trident Pull is harder to hit with transformed Buddha since it will aim parallel to the ground if aimed downward while standing on the ground. However, if the player does the Big Sword Buddha glitch, the hitboxes are the same, except their sword's range will increase.
The player can perform a glitch if they and another individual use [Z] Dough Hurricane and aim it downward, which results in both users being knocked back a great distance if done correctly.
Interestingly, there is one "Trident" sword in each sea, the Trident in the First Sea, the Dragon Trident for the Second Sea, and the Spikey Trident for the Third Sea.

swords.name: Cake Prince
swords.description: "A dimension has spawned."

swords.name: Dough King
swords.description: "A dimension worthy of a god has spawned."
trivia: The Dough King gives the combined most levels and second most Fragments   in the game. The first in terms of most fragments is Tyrant of the Skies.
After killing the Dough King and unlocking the red door, the player can purchase as many Dough raid chips as they need (  1,000 every 2 hours, or a Fruit worth over   1,000,000).
Due to the nature of his abilities, the Dough King is one of the enemies to be able to "combo" players in certain circumstances.
Unlike the Cake Prince, the Dough King does not use the abilities of the Spikey Trident.
The Dough King has the most drops out of any Raid Boss.
The Dough King is sometimes abbreviated as "DK".

swords.name: Tushita
moves: — The user stabs repeatedly in front of them that stun the enemy it hits. (Holding the button makes it last longer.) It ends with a strong large stab which has a longer range, more damage, and knocks enemies away.

— The user dashes and creates multiple red slashes with incredible speed, dealing high damage, it leaves a brief "X" mark. This move has two separate slashes, if the players cursor is facing a different direction after the first slash, they will slash in that direction instead of straight.
trivia: Tushita is named after Tusita, one of the six deva-worlds of the Desire Realm in Buddhism.
"Tushita" cannot be said in Roblox chat. This is due to it having a swear word in it. This means that the player has to say an alternative such as "tusita".

swords.name: Longma
trivia:
Players can glitch into Longma's room by using any instant-dash move of a sword/fighting style. (Such as Electric Claw's [Z] move, Shizu [Z] move, etc.)
However, glitching into his room doesn't have much use, as the player cannot hit Longma unless the player has access to his room (similar to Ice Admiral and Don Swan).
However, glitching into his room doesn't have much use, as the player cannot hit Longma unless the player has access to his room (similar to Ice Admiral and Don Swan).
Players can use Love's [V] move or Ghost's [V] move to kill Longma without unlocking the door, but he will only drop money, mastery and bounty.
Longma is the last part of the Tushita Puzzle to obtain Tushita.
Longma has the least amount of health out of all the Bosses in Third Sea.
Longma is named after a fabled winged horse with dragon scales in Chinese mythology. "龙" (Lóng) means dragon, and "马" (Mǎ) means horse.

swords.name: Yama
moves: — The user performs a spinning slash, rapidly rotating while moving towards the target cursor. This attack carries significant knockback and inflicts decent damage. If the user successfully connects with both the spinning slash and the subsequent air slash, the combined strike will inflict slightly higher damage.

— The user enters a stance, charging an attack while black and red slashes appear for a split second. Upon releasing the button, the user swiftly dashes forward, executing a rapid tornado of slashes on the opponent, dealing decent damage while the tornado drags the enemy forward in a stun.
trivia:
In Buddhism, Yama is the King of Hell, named after Yāma — the third of the six heavenly worlds in the desire realm.
The sword could also be named after the Yamadharma Raja (Yama in short), the god of death and justice in Hindu mythology.
The sword could also be named after the Yamadharma Raja (Yama in short), the god of death and justice in Hindu mythology.
Yama is one of the two cursed katanas, the other being Tushita. Together, they are capable of making the Cursed Dual Katana.
There is no level requirement to get Yama, unlike Tushita. However, the player will still need to be at least Lv. 1500 in order to get into the Third Sea, where it can be obtained.

It is recommended to grind Elite Pirates on a private server or server hop for them. This is because in public servers Elite Pirates can be easily killed before the player comes to their place by other players or some hackers because some scripts have the option “auto-farm elite.”
The player does not lose their Elite Hunter's progress upon failure to pull out Yama.

[Z] Hellish Slash can be used to glitch through walls.
Example: Using this move while aiming for the entrance of King Toad's House next to Awakenings Expert (in Second Sea) will glitch the user into the room.
Example: Using this move while aiming for the entrance of King Toad's House next to Awakenings Expert (in Second Sea) will glitch the user into the room.
When [X] Infernal Hurricane is used on top of the stairs that the Aura Editor is on, the user will glitch into an empty area.
Yama [X] can cause other players to get flung if they use a momentum skill into it.

swords.name: Elite Hunter
trivia: The Elite Hunter's skin is based on old Popcat avatar from Guashiem, a Brazilian Admin and a Tester.

swords.name: Cursed Dual Katana
moves: — The user spins around, zooming their view out and forming a red and black tornado that stuns and damages targets that are near. Afterwards, the user will unleash the tornado, which pulls enemies away and captures and drags any enemies in its path, and then explodes, which will fling enemies towards the user. While this move is held, the tornado will stay in place for some time, dealing extra damage.

— The user executes a backflip before crossing their swords in an X pattern, dashing towards the enemy(s) at high speed, and slicing them, dealing high damage. This move can be held to go further and deal more damage. Additionally, when hit, a second explosion will occur, dealing slightly less damage and knocking back the target. Finally, the target will see a large quickly spinning X obstructing their screen when hit. This move can bypass the protection granted by Dragon and Buddha transformations.
trivia: Cursed Dual Katana is often abbreviated as "CDK" by players.
The Cursed Dual Katana deals the fourth highest damage per click out of every sword in the game (the third is True Triple Katana, second is Bisento V2, and the first is Triple Dark Blade).
[Z] Revolving Ravager is as fast as Dark Blade's X move, but Dark Blade’s X move has more range.

[X] Slayer of Goliath requires 375 Mastery, the second highest move mastery requirement in the game. Only Death Step's Maximum Overheat is higher, at 400 Mastery.
Despite this, once a player reaches Cake Land, NPCs yield relatively more mastery, making it easier to grind past this point.
Despite this, once a player reaches Cake Land, NPCs yield relatively more mastery, making it easier to grind past this point.

Using Godhuman's [Z] (Soaring Beast) move while the opponent is trapped inside the tornado from Cursed Dual Katana's [Z] move will cause the move's animation to follow the opponent who is trapped inside the tornado.
The Cursed Dual Katana is considered one of the best swords in the game by the community due to its versatility and attack power.
The Cursed Dual Katana, along with Shark Anchor, are the only swords in the game that ignores Dragon's defense buff.

A glitch that requires the player to use [X] Slayer of Goliath and immediately unequip the sword from their hotbar will freeze the target in place, rendering them unable to move until they die or switch teams. This has been patched.

swords.name: Cursed Dual Katana (Puzzle)
swords.description: This article is a guide that explains how to solve the puzzle needed to obtain the Cursed Dual Katana.
trivia: Haze of Misery is widely considered the most complicated quest by the community due to the foggy vision, similar to the one in the Mirage Island or when rip_indra True Form is summoned.

There is a glitch where enemies in both the Heavenly Dimension and Hell Dimension can fall out of the area, making the quest nearly impossible to complete. To avoid this, players should refrain from using knockback abilities or forcing enemies through walls.

swords.name: Demonic Wisp
trivia: A total of  38  Demonic Wisps are required to buy everything that requires this material. (Excluding Abyssal Bait.)

swords.name: Shop
swords.description: The shop is an in-game store, accessible through the GUI Menu. Players can purchase numerous items/boosts for Robux   in this shop or gifts for other players.
trivia:
There used to be various types of limited-time packs for previous Christmas Updates, those being:
Beast Bundle
Holiday Special
Winter Combo
Holiday Essential
Ultimate Bundle
Beast Bundle
Holiday Special
Winter Combo
Holiday Essential
Ultimate Bundle
Designs of products, game passes, and chromatic artwork were created by @EGOTISMS_RBLX.
The player can store a game pass by clicking "Gift" and then clicking "Store in Inventory", This doesn't work with Respawn Bosses and Race Reroll, as of Update 21.

After Update 24, owners of the Permanent Dragon Token could briefly buy a discounted permanent dragon for   2400 Robux. Due to backlash and threats of legal action, the developers quickly fixed the issue. However, some users later spotted an unbuyable shop item labeled "Discounted Dragon" with a 500k money icon, but it turned out to be just a visual bug.
When used in trades, shop items allow the player to bypass the 40% maximum value difference requirement.

swords.name: Hallow Scythe
moves: — The user initiates a stance before releasing an orange-black tornado with a decent hitbox, being able to destroy trees. This move causes knockback to entities hit by the tornado, dealing multiple ticks of damage in one attack.

— The user dashes forward, grabbing the nearest enemies, before ending the move with a strike, dealing knockback. This move is not limited to single targets. Move activates a brief period of flight, which is controllable. It does x1.2 more damage if the enemy's health is below 50%. This move breaks Instinct. The dash part of this move is  similar to Godhuman's [Z] move and Dragon's [X] move.
trivia:
The Hallow Scythe is the first sword to have a unique mechanic.
The less health the opponent has, the more damage the player will do with this weapon and life-leeching abilities.
The less health the opponent has, the more damage the player will do with this weapon and life-leeching abilities.

The Hallow Scythe was once used to kill an admin with extremely high HP. In this video, a player used a combo with Portal [C] to teleport the admin into the lava in Hot and Cold, then dragged them into it using the sword’s [Z] move, resulting in an instant kill.

The engravings on the blade of the scythe mean "Death", while the engravings on the tang of the scythe "風間" can be read as Kazama in Japanese, meaning "Between Wind". Both the engravings combined make the word "Death Between Wind", alluding to Death Cyclone.
The Hallow Scythe is used by the Lv. 2100 Raid Boss, Soul Reaper.
The Burning blessing does not visually appear on Hallow Scythe.

swords.name: Soul Reaper
swords.description: "An unknown being has entered this world..."
moves: Death Cyclone — Soul Reaper releases an orange-black tornado with a decent hitbox, damaging anyone who is within range of it. The victim will also get knocked back heavily because of the move. This move can be dodged with Instinct.

Soul Execution — Soul Reaper dashes forward, grabbing anyone within the radius of the tornado , before ending the move with a strike, dealing knockback. Deals x1.4 damage if the victim health is below 50% hp. This move breaks Instinct.
trivia: The Soul Reaper is the second Raid Boss to give Mastery instead of Levels with the first being the Cursed Captain.
As with all Raid Bosses, the player needs to have done at least 10% damage to the Soul Reaper in order to get rewarded.
The Soul Reaper is a part of the quest for the Cursed Dual Katana, to view the puzzle for Cursed Dual Katana click here.
The Soul Reaper will despawn after a certain amount of time, like most other raid bosses.
The Soul Reaper, along with the Cake Queen, drops the highest amount of Mastery in the game.

swords.name: Bones
trivia: The Posessed Mummy NPC drops high amounts of bones but the Boss that drops the most is the Soul Reaper.
Bones used to drop when the player defeated an NPC inside the First Sea, but the feature was removed on Update 17.1 and was added back in Update 20 but only for the Evil Wraith and Bone Wraith.
This material's icon includes a tooth, which is odd, due to teeth not being bones.
The Undead Lord and Death King titles can only be obtained during the Halloween Events.
The maximum amount of Bones a player can hold in their inventory is 5,000.
A total of  1300  Bones is required to craft everything that requires this material.

swords.name: Triple Dark Blade
moves: While held: The same move occurs, but the user dashes along with the slashes.
While held: The same move occurs, but the user dashes along with the slashes.
When held: The same move occurs, except faster.
When held: The same move occurs, except faster.

— The user launches an instantaneous barrage of multiple green slashes, hitting enemies and stunning them for a very short period of time. This move is similar to the standard move, except larger and with more reach.
While held: The same move occurs, but the user dashes along with the slashes.

— The user launches three thin, tall, vertical slashes of green energy toward their opponent, which deals high damage and has a little knockback.
This move does not break Instinct.

When held: The same move occurs, except faster.
trivia: The Triple Dark Blade is infamously one of the hardest things to obtain in the game, only being given by admins.
The Triple Dark Blade deals the highest damage per click out of every sword in the game.
The Triple Dark Blade has one of the largest attacks in the game.
The Triple Dark Blade's description might prove to be misleading, as there is no guarantee that the Dark Blade is the strongest sword in the game.
The Triple Dark Blade's upgrade requires the most amount of materials out of any weapon in the game.
Since the Triple Dark Blade is rarely removed from a player unless they are in a very bad standing with Blox Fruits, certain retired helpers and testers still keep their Triple Dark Blade.
There was a glitch where [Z] One Thousand Slices dealt very little damage.

swords.name: True Triple Katana
moves: — The user dashes forward, creating a great shockwave that stuns the enemy. If the user hits an enemy, the user will slice the enemy four times, stunning them each slice. This move is similar to Rengoku's [Z] and Kitsune's [F].

— The user summons a fast-paced dragon that if an enemy touches, the enemy will get blown towards the sky, and a tornado will appear. This tornado can hit enemies who touched it, whether or not if they got harmed by the summoned dragon.
trivia:
The True Triple Katana is often abbreviated as "TTK".
The abbreviation "TTK" cannot be said in Roblox chat, mainly due to it containing a sensitive word. Instead, the player can use "True Trip" or other abbreviations.
The abbreviation "TTK" cannot be said in Roblox chat, mainly due to it containing a sensitive word. Instead, the player can use "True Trip" or other abbreviations.
If the True Triple Katana's fourth M1 is used in the air, the user would then be able to travel greater distances than the [Z] move.
The True Triple Katana deals the third highest M1 damage out of every fighting style or sword in the game.
If [Z] Wolf Fang Rush is used in a corner of a wall, the player has a chance to glitch through.
[X] Dragon Hurricane can pull enemies much farther than the hurricane's hitboxes.
[X] Dragon Hurricane can go through thin walls like the walls of the Mansion (Third Sea).
This is the sword with the highest mastery-requiring obtainment.
The True Triple Katana can be obtained even without finishing the Colosseum Quest, but it will be extremely difficult without the Manager's help in finding the Legendary Sword Dealer.

swords.name: Blade
moves: If an NPC is lower level than the user (If the user is 105%-106%  the NPC's level) and uses Sword attacks, it functions similar to an Elemental fruit. Unlike Elemental fruits, the immunity applies even when the attacks are Aura imbued. This is also applied to other players (no need to be lower level).

Blade Reflex — When attacked by Swords, the user will swiftly pull out a blade to block the attack. Blade users will be completely immune to all swords, including ones with Aura.
If an NPC is lower level than the user (If the user is 105%-106%  the NPC's level) and uses Sword attacks, it functions similar to an Elemental fruit. Unlike Elemental fruits, the immunity applies even when the attacks are Aura imbued. This is also applied to other players (no need to be lower level).
Exception: Bosses and Raid Bosses.

— The user creates sharp, pointed blades in their arm, before swinging it around, releasing purple slashes in quick succession that travel a good distance before dissipating. Upon contact, targets are knocked back slightly.

— The user creates blades on their arms, then launches themselves towards their cursor, cutting continually in a horizontal cyclone pattern. This move is similar to Dual-Headed Blade's [Z] Assassinate.

— After making blades on their arms, the user spins around and creates a radius of slashes, creating a whirlwind-like effect around themselves. After the animation ends, NPCs or Players will jump with medium distance.
— The user spins blades on their arms quickly before hurling them at their target. Upon contact, the user is propelled forward and slits the opponent in an X shape, slightly stunning the target.

— The user creates blades on their raised right arm before rotating it rapidly, propelling air downwards and achieving flight. It's flight speed increases the lower HP the player has, unlike most flight moves.
trivia:
Although Blade's passive function is to avoid damage from sword slashes, Blade can also automatically parry swords that can create fire, freeze, cause electric shock, and even magic damage.
However, some swords can still stun Blade users, specifically Saishi and Rengoku.
However, some swords can still stun Blade users, specifically Saishi and Rengoku.
Blade is mostly known for its sword immunity.
It is recommended to become a fruit main instead of a sword main when using Blade in the first sea.
Most attacks look weird with R15 and layered clothing since the user's body stretches and does not disconnect.

Blade is a very good replacement for Elemental fruits to use at a low level since most enemies use swords in the First Sea, although it gets bad quickly, getting outclassed in every way by higher rarity fruits because of its lack of abilities, and the fact that later NPCs (Second Sea and Third Sea) more commonly use Fighting Styles.

Blade is currently the only Common fruit to have an M1 attack.
Blade is also the cheapest fruit to have an M1 attack.
Blade is also the cheapest fruit to have an M1 attack.
Blade is useful for PvP due to most bounty hunters being sword mains and unable to damage Blade users.
When spamming the M1 move really fast on air while holding the forward button, the user will be able to glide. The movement speed of the glide is based on the run speed on land.
Blade's M1 can hit sea events like Sea Beasts, although it's not recommended to use it for sea events due to its bad overall moveset against sea events.
Due to Blade's fast M1s, passives and how easy it is to obtain, Blade can be considered one of the best early-game grinding fruits for First Sea players.
A small change to Blade is that now Blade deflects attacks instead of its past version (Chop) which separated the limbs of the user to dodge the sword.
[F] Turbine Flight is faster when the user's health is lower, similar to Venom's F move.
If the user sets an auto clicker to zero milliseconds, they can glide in the air with Blade's M1's.

Blade's current icon depicts multiple, purple, circular buzzsaws. This is shown in the rotating of blades in most attacks excluding the M1s, showing that Blade is more towards circular cuts than just plain slashing.
Blade is one of the best fruits for early level grinding because of the sword immunity.
The abilities of Blade are used by the Lv. 55 boss, Chef.

swords.name: Aura
trivia: There is no relation between sea events and Aura. Turning aura off does not make sea events spawn more often.

All swords and guns will change their color when a colored Aura is active, based on its color.
Some swords, when transformed with Buddha will not have the Aura effect.
Some swords, when transformed with Buddha will not have the Aura effect.

Light's Spear and Ice's Trident visual is affected by Aura.
The same goes for Awakened Dough's and Rubber's attacks. The user can also change the color of its moves with an Aura skin.
Awakened Spider’s [V] move also has different colors depending on the user’s aura color, and if their aura color slowly changes, the same would be for Spider’s [V] move, most likely because the move is webs covered in Aura shooting forward.
The same goes for Awakened Dough's and Rubber's attacks. The user can also change the color of its moves with an Aura skin.

Awakened Spider’s [V] move also has different colors depending on the user’s aura color, and if their aura color slowly changes, the same would be for Spider’s [V] move, most likely because the move is webs covered in Aura shooting forward.

swords.name: Chef
moves: — The Chef creates blades on his arms, then launches himself towards the target, cutting continually in a horizontal cyclone pattern.
— The Chef spins around using blades or their arms and creates a radius of slashes, creating a whirlwind-like effect around himself. After the attack ends, the target will be launched to the air.
trivia: Inside the building in which the Chef spawns, there is a Golden Chest.
This is the first boss that uses reworked fruits, the second being is Cyborg (except Raid bosses).

swords.name: Buddha
moves: Awakened moves cannot be used in this form.
If the user's avatar does not have any skin, the user will just become a bigger version of themselves.
Awakened moves cannot be used in this form.
If the user's avatar does not have any skin, the user will just become a bigger version of themselves.

Seismic Jump — V2 only, When jumping, the user will create a small AoE shock wave that does relatively small damage to enemies, breaks Instinct and has a cooldown of two seconds. The user will also jump at least 2x as high. (Stacks with Angel jump height boost)

Divine Aura — While transformed, the player gains a 35% (46.4% against NPCs), or 45% if awakened (54.6% against NPCs), damage reduction against all attacks, and can hit enemies with their melee and sword M1s 5× (8× if V2) farther than a normal player. In V2, the player's hitbox is above water and thus has the water-walking passive ability. If dragged underwater, the user will still take damage (unless the user has Shark V2 or above). Although, the user's offense is not amplified while in Buddha form.

— The user gets engulfed by a yellow column of light, before transforming into a huge, yellow, glowing Buddha that bases off the user's roblox avatar, becoming approximately 3x bigger than their normal form. 
Awakened moves cannot be used in this form.
If the user's avatar does not have any skin, the user will just become a bigger version of themselves.

— The user charges a shining ball of light, then touches the ground with their palm, creating a large explosion that blows nearby enemies away. A large amount of startup time renders the user vulnerable. This move can only be used in Buddha form.

— The user leaps into the air, landing where the cursor is pointed. This creates a shock wave that damages enemies on impact, unless landed in water This move has a one second end-lag. This move can only be used in the Buddha form. Similar to Mammoth and T-Rex's [F] move

— The user charges themselves for 0.5 seconds inside their body, then lets out a large explosion around them, dealing heavy damage to all enemies nearby and launching them away. This move can only be used in the Buddha form.

— The user transforms into a giant golden Buddha, which has three rings and two squares with symbols that surround the user, with the squares having Chinese Hanzi. At the same time, a thunder light strikes the ground where the user is, knocking away any enemies nearby and dealing damage. While transformed, the player is big enough to stand on the floor of the sea, allowing them to dash, Flash Step, and reset their Air Jumps. This move increases the size of the player's melee and sword range hitboxes, and grants them a 45% damage reduction against other players. The user will also gain a significant jump boost, but in exchange, their overal walking speed will be reduced.
— The user slams the ground with their right fist and an explosion occurs as light erupts from the place hit. This move breaks Instinct and cannot be held.
— The player gathers energy, then explodes with a big explosion, shooting a light beam out of their mouth, dealing damage. This move breaks Instinct.

— The user rises up and fires a huge barrage of golden beams that make a big golden explosion, then finishes by bringing down a golden ray and a golden wave that knocks people away and causes damage. This move breaks Instinct and cannot be held.
— The user dashes forward, creating a trail of golden light behind. If they touch an enemy when dashing, they will grab the enemy up and then slam them into the ground.
trivia: Although this fruit is named Buddha, its icon is actually Budai, the laughing monk often mistaken for the real Buddha.

Buddha used to grant the user twice their health during transformation, which was then removed in order to balance it.
Buddha was the actual first fruit (the "second-first" fruit being Phoenix) to grant the user health benefits.
Buddha was the actual first fruit (the "second-first" fruit being Phoenix) to grant the user health benefits.

The Japanese Kanji/Traditional Chinese characters around the aura of the awakened version of [Z] Shift mean: 草 (grass), 体 (body), 心 (heart), 魂 (soul), 火 (fire), 水 (water), 風 (wind), and 岩 (stone).
Similarly, the symbols in the outer circle are derived from Elder Futhark runes, and they represent ᛓ (wealth), ᚨ (god), ᚷ (gift), ᛖ (horse), ᛟ (heritage), ᛈ (pear-tree), ᛝ (the god Ingwaz), ᛗ (man), ᛢ (yew-tree), ᛉ (elk), ᛃ (good year), ᚹ (joy), ᛋ (sun), ᛞ (day), ᚱ (journey), and ᛒ (birch). It's the language of the symbols of the Colosseum Quest.

Similarly, the symbols in the outer circle are derived from Elder Futhark runes, and they represent ᛓ (wealth), ᚨ (god), ᚷ (gift), ᛖ (horse), ᛟ (heritage), ᛈ (pear-tree), ᛝ (the god Ingwaz), ᛗ (man), ᛢ (yew-tree), ᛉ (elk), ᛃ (good year), ᚹ (joy), ᛋ (sun), ᛞ (day), ᚱ (journey), and ᛒ (birch). It's the language of the symbols of the Colosseum Quest.

A glitch can be done where if the user starts any Raid and use awakened Buddha’s [V] Twilight of the Gods, the final column after the user teleports to the raid island will appear there, and will not disappear before the final explosion reaches Hot and Cold (Raid room).
The player will get similar result when they use the move when they get teleported away after the raid ends.
The player will get similar result when they use the move when they get teleported away after the raid ends.
Buddha and Control are the only fruits that buff weapons. Additionally, this is the only fruit that buffs Fighting Styles.
Due to the animation of [Z] moves (awakened) being under the ground, the user can use this move to collect fruits that are put under tables
Buddha's [X] and [V] moves (unawakened) have the same sound effect as one of the Sea Beast's Water Beam moves (while charging).
Buddha's [Z] move (unawakened) has the same sound effect as the Shocker's Electrical Floor but modified (pitched down).

The player can perform a speed glitch by first holding any fruit in Buddha form, then initiating shift lock and finally holding the D or S keys whilst pressing the 'jump' button.
A similar glitch can be performed with Skull Guitar, by holding it while in Buddha form, then initiating shift lock and using its M1 while holding the D or S key whilst jumping.
However, the anti-cheat can put the player back in place if they go too fast while using this glitch.
A similar glitch can be performed with Skull Guitar, by holding it while in Buddha form, then initiating shift lock and using its M1 while holding the D or S key whilst jumping.
However, the anti-cheat can put the player back in place if they go too fast while using this glitch.

There used to be a well known glitch/bug where if the user untransformed and quickly switched to other item in their hotbar (fighting style, sword or gun), their weapon would retain its size and, more importantly, its M1 reach buffs of their fighting style and sword, making this fruit the best fruit for grinding. Unfortunately, this was patched in Update 24.
Buddha's [C] move (unawakened) won't stop falling until it hits a surface of any kind (including walls).
It is possible for the user to be immune to water whilst in the awakened transformed state by simply using the Z move while on the sea.
If the user is in Buddha's [Z] move (unawakened) form while using Race Awakening as Rabbit or Shark race, the user's hair will turn golden instead of white.
When using Buddha and turning Aura on, the user's head will not be affected by the aura. If the user de-transforms with aura active, their head will sometimes still not be affected.

Buddha is sometimes regarded as 'unskilled' in PvP due to how easy it is to use with high damage output and how players only need to click the screen to get this massive amount of damage, meaning that players don't really need to do anything to get the massive damage.

Although Buddha generally makes the user very powerful, its main weaknesses are its huge hitbox, slow speed, and low range, since most Buddha users use swords as their main damage output, so some fruits can easily counter Buddha, either by using long and inescapable combos, or by simply out-ranging. A great example is Gas, as its transformation fixes most issues Buddha has, mainly with speed, range, and stuns, and is even considered by some people as a superior option for both grinding and PvP.
Buddha's [V] Twilight of the Gods, when used in enclosed space (e.g. Mansion), can deal extremely high damage of 10k - 12k to NPCs.
In the shop, Buddha is labeled as a fruit that "can M1" despite the fruit itself not having an M1. It could be taken that it can M1 because sword/fighting styles can be used while transformed.

When using fighting styles to deal damage through M1 while transformed, the player is not able to damage enemies behind the area the player is facing, unlike swords where the player can hit all nearby enemies when using M1 regardless of direction.

By looking at the player's Buddha aura from the top, the player can see their fighting style's M1 max range. This is now no-longer the case, as the M1 range extends inconsistently further away than the aura.

The physical fruit icon's shadow casted by the stem doesn't match the shape of the stem - the shadow seems to have a shape of a normal, two-leafed or four-leafed stem, similarly to Spin's stem, but the actual Buddha's stem has a shape of a ring.

swords.name: Control
moves: Area Bound — Control's abilities are confined within the Area it establishes, which remains active for approximately 55 seconds. While inside the Area, the moves of the Koko sword are greatly buffed. The longer that the key is held the bigger it is.

— The user creates an Area. Holding Z will make the Area bigger. When used with the Koko sword, both the Z and X moves of the sword will be massively buffed. This also turns the icon of the fruit in their hotbar green until the area disappears.
— The user levitates an object, or part of an object within range of the Area, and can then fling it by releasing the X key. The user cannot dash while holding this move.

— The user holds out a purple/blue-ish sword, then performs a laido strike. If hit, a cutscene will trigger where the user performs multiple slashes on the target and then finishes them off with the final blow, launching them into the air.

— The user holds out a green-ish sword, then launches a green projectile towards their cursor. If it hits an enemy, a cutscene will trigger where the user begins to launch green slashes all over the Area, damaging everyone inside of it. When the slashing ends, the user goes back to their physical form and does one final slash, dealing the most damage on a specific enemy who gets hit by it.
— The user teleports to where their cursor is. The user can only teleport onto surfaces inside of their Area. Placing the cursor on a player makes them teleport behind that player.
trivia: Control is seen by the community as a fun, though skilled, fruit to use.
Control is used by the Lv. 1250 Raid Boss, Order.

Control is one of the fruits that have two icons, the other being Dragon. The other icon can be shown in the inventory when the Control Area move is activated, instead of its usual blue, it will be green.
Control and Buddha are the only fruits that buff weapons.
Control is the only fruit that cannot deal damage to large object with any of its moves.
Control is the first fruit with cutscenes in its move, being [C] Echo Knife and [V] Gamma Rush. The second being Gravity, with [V] Asteriod Crash.
Control is one of the fruits that needs to have its [Z] move active before being able to use the other moves, others being Buddha and Diamond.
If the user holds down to make an Area while in the air, they can stay mid-air for a short while.
This move used to last for 35 seconds.
Holding it below a boss would cause the boss to be stuck on the boulder that is held until it is being released.
Its ability to levitate boats is what makes Control a fun trolling fruit.
This move, when combined with the Choppa accessory, Ghoul's V3 ability (Heightened Senses) and Ghoul V4 Domain Expansion gear, has the shortest skill cooldown out of all of the other moves.
Despite being rocks, the rocks that spawn when going to any Sea Danger Level (except During Rough Sea) aren't usable.
When used on trees, the player will cut the tree horizontally and use the upper slice like normal.
Yeti's ice layer on water can also be used. Although this is not very helpful.

This move used to shrink the Control Area to its minimum size and the area disappears immediately after the move finished, if it does not hit anyone, the Control Area still disappears immediately after that. This leads the opponent to escape the area. This feature was later removed from the game.
If the user holds for 10~13 seconds, they can move while holding the move and use it outside their control area.
This move has very high mastery requirement for a fruit alongside Dragon and Spirit, which is 350.
There is a bug where the user can increase the damage slightly by holding a weapon with a higher mastery than the Control. This is not necessary if the Control's mastery has reached 600.
There is a bug where if the user uses the move while stunned, there is small chance that they disappear and the cutscene also disappears.
