There is a bug where if the user uses the move while stunned, there is small chance that they disappear and the cutscene also disappears.

swords.name: Fighting Styles
trivia:
All fighting styles have three different moves, except Combat, which has two, and Death Step and Dark Step, which have four.
However, the extra moves on the four-skill fighting styles exist mainly to boost damage of the other abilities.
However, the extra moves on the four-skill fighting styles exist mainly to boost damage of the other abilities.
Dragon Breath is currently the only fighting style having a fragment-only price.
Sanguine Art and possibly Combat are the only fighting styles in the game without a "V2".
Godhuman and Sanguine Art are the only fighting styles that require Materials.
On each fighting style other than Combat, there is the letter M at the bottom left corner of their icon, along with a white or black border surrounding the icon.
All First Sea fighting style teachers are Shop NPCs, but in the Second Sea and the Third Sea, all Fighting Style Teachers are Misc. NPCs.

swords.name: Flail
moves: — The user launches a leopard-like blast of smoke in the direction of their cursor that travels for a long distance, briefly stunning, blinding, and damaging enemies hit.

— The user teleports to their cursor's location and releases billowing smoke, damaging and blinding nearby enemies for approximately two seconds. Smoke is left at both the original and destination points, dealing damage in both areas.
trivia: The Flail is used by the Lv. 1150 Boss, Smoke Admiral and a Lv. 2600 Raid Boss, Tyrant of the Skies.
The Flail is the only weapon used by two bosses, but only dropped by one.

A special glitch can be done with the Flail to make it look like the player is using /opfun, an admin command which allows a player to spam abilities even when they are still doing the ability. (Maybe patched)
Flail is not a typical sword but actually a spin-off of Morning Star, it was typically used by the cavalry in the medieval times.

swords.name: Gravity Blade
moves: — The user attracts all nearby enemies in the direction of the cursor, mustering a lavender aura before releasing it in an explosion.
— The user reverses gravity and flings the target in the air, slashing them and dealing constant damage, before finally slamming them back into the ground.
trivia:
Gravity Blade is based on the Chokutō, which is a traditional Japanese sword.
In real life, the way this sword is held is known as the "reverse grip". While this grip reduces the power and precision of attacks, it allows for quicker and less predictable movements in close quarters, making it ideal for surprise strikes.

In real life, the way this sword is held is known as the "reverse grip". While this grip reduces the power and precision of attacks, it allows for quicker and less predictable movements in close quarters, making it ideal for surprise strikes.
[X] Lunar Blitz is quite similar to Awakened Dough's grounded [X] Pastry River, with both sharing a lift-and-drop mechanic.
Gravity Blade's old [Z] (Gravity Push) was identical to Gravity's old [Z], with both sharing names, VFX and move purpose. (Other than the direction of the move.)
Gravity Blade's old moves were similar to Orbitus' moves with the [Z] being the same as one of his moves and the [X] being a shorter version of his other move.

swords.name: Saishi
moves: — The user dashes forward, leaving behind a golden trail. When in contact with an enemy, the user performs multiple vertical slashes before launching them upwards.
— The user launches a large, golden air slash in the direction of their cursor, which damages and pushes back enemies hit by it.
trivia: Saishi, along with Shizu and Oroshi are required (and with 300 mastery on each respectively) to obtain the True Triple Katana.
The user can grab Besto Friendos (Love's [V] move) with [Z] Swords Dance.
Saishi is debated to be the best sword in the Second Sea, with its main competitors being Rengoku, Dragon Trident, and Midnight Blade.
[Z] Swords Dance will lock the user in place for a second after dealing damage to big targets such as Sea Beasts.
[Z] Swords Dance and [X] True Air Slash deal the same amount of damage. (Only if [Z] is used close to the target)

swords.name: Shizu
moves: — The user dashes in the direction of their cursor, dealing damage to enemies in their path. Purple energy bursts from the user after their dash. This slightly stuns the enemies that were hit, similar to Katana's [Z] move.
— The user swiftly fires an extremely fast purple projectile followed by a purple trail in the direction of their cursor. It slightly stuns and causes knockback when hit.
trivia: Although Shizu is considered out meta by the community because of its bad hitbox and does not break Instinct, its combos are still extremely fast and the sword itself deals good damage.
Shizu, along with Oroshi and Saishi are required (and with 300 mastery on each respectively) to obtain the True Triple Katana.

Shizu is much like Canvander or Koko.
Many people refer to Shizu as an improved version of Cutlass and Katana.
Many people refer to Shizu as an improved version of Cutlass and Katana.

swords.name: Oroshi
moves: — The user rapidly slashes with the sword, creating a flurry of white sword slashes in front of them that continuously damages enemies within the area. The duration of this attack can be extended by holding the associated key, with a maximum duration of 5 seconds. After the move concludes, the sword slashes expand, knocking back enemies. This ability is similar to Spin's [Z] and Superhuman’s [Z] move.
— The user dashes forward, grabs the player and shoots a ball of wind that deals slight knockback upon impact.
trivia: Oroshi, along with Shizu and Saishi are required (and with 300 mastery on each respectively) to obtain the True Triple Katana.
Oroshi's pre-rework [X] move (Scatter Shot) was much similar to that of pre-rework Bisento's.
Oroshi is often used in skilled builds, together with Bizarre Revolver and Rumble.

[Z] Continuous Slashing is similar to both Spin's and Dark Blade's [Z] moves, although it is smaller and lasts longer.
[Z] Continuous Slashing had a larger hitbox before it was reworked.
[Z] Continuous Slashing had a larger hitbox before it was reworked.

swords.name: Inventory
trivia: Before Update 17.3.5 players could not un-store fruits in First Sea.
The inventory was added to replace the Treasure Inventory.

swords.name: Fishing Rods
swords.description: Fishing Rods are gear that can be used for Fishing.
moves: Fishing Rod Protector: Prevents line snap once per catch. Instead, boosts progress by 30% and calms the fish.
Curse of the Leviathan: Catching a specific species may trigger an unknown event.
Curse of the Terrorshark: Start with 20% extra progress, but fish panic much faster.
Curse of the Whale: Final fish weight increases by 15%, but may consume 2 bait instead of 1.
Blessing of Bait Efficiency: 20% chance to not consume materials when crafting bait.
Blessing of an Angler’s Treasure: Increases daily treasure limit by 3. (This enchantment is bugged and currently doesn't work.)

swords.name: Fish
trivia: Giving fish to the event fisherman with max tokens will give nothing.
If the player consumes the last type of fish they have and then captures the same fish it will appear as captured for the first time even though it is not.

The player can only have 301 fish in their inventory. If they try to catch another fish with a full inventory, a message will display saying: "Your fish inventory is full! If you catch any fish, you won't be able to carry them! Release them manually or visit the Fisherman to sell them".

In the Update 27.1 trailer, Admin Uzoth is shown fishing in the pond at Dragon Dojo and catch a Dragon Koi. However, it is actually unknown where to fish for it, and what rods and baits are required for it. It is thought to be unobtainable as of now.

Fishing for making Money is not recommended as it is slow and Rarities does not matter (only weight does).
Fishing is recommended for crafting Foods and Potions, or completing Events, such as RIP Event and Red King Event.
Fishing is recommended for crafting Foods and Potions, or completing Events, such as RIP Event and Red King Event.
The higher the weight, higher the rarity. Therefore a gold fish, which weights 12kg, is a rare.

swords.name: Items
swords.description: Items are objects or weapons that can be carried in the hotbar and held or simply stored in the inventory bar.

swords.name: Consumables
swords.description: Consumables are items that can be consumed to gain special effects. They can be obtained from the campfire.

swords.name: Foods
swords.description: Foods are consumables that grants their consumer effects.

swords.name: Skins
swords.description: Skins are wearable cosmetics that change the visuals of certain abilities and transformations.
trivia:
Collecting all Legendary colors (excluding limited variants) requires   22,500,  15 ,  10 , and  15 .
Collecting all Rare colors requires   15,000,  3 ,  8 ,  3 ,  2 ,  2 ,  2 ,  2 , and  4 .
Collecting all Rare colors requires   15,000,  3 ,  8 ,  3 ,  2 ,  2 ,  2 ,  2 , and  4 .
Unlocking all aura skins requires a total cost of   37,500 or   1,830,  3 ,  8 ,  6 ,  2 ,  2 ,  25 ,  12 ,  25 ,  1000 ,  1000 , at least  15 ,  250 and  250
During Update 17.3.5, a bug occurred where the Party Hat and the Aquamarine aura color could not be equipped.

There is a known glitch where the aura color on the avatar does not exactly match the aura color on Swords, Guns or Electric Claw.
This happens when you activate an aura, then you switch to another, without reactivating.
This happens when you activate an aura, then you switch to another, without reactivating.
Equipping Rainbow Saviour causes the color cycle to stop when zooming out. The effect resumes once zooming back in.
Mythical Aura Skins, (Rainbow Saviour, Dragon, Kitsune, Oni and Celestial), are the only with shifting animations.
Before Update 24, Hoops were required to change the color of the Dragon (Classic).
After Update 24, all players who had purchased an Aura color prior to the update were automatically awarded the Hakaishin title due to a glitch.
Three Blox Fruits currently have attacks that change color depending on the equipped aura color: Rubber, Spider, and Dough.
Skins for Portal are already listed in the Barista Menu but are not yet craftable. They are planned for release in a future update.

stats.Notes: Currently having 2750 stat levels on Gun, Sword, and Blox Fruit stats will give an 88.4x multiplier. Each stat level adds a x1.0346759259 (3.46759259%) buff.

swords.name: Health
swords.description: Health (also known as HP, hit points, health points) is a fundamental feature in Blox Fruits. Once a player has zero health, they will die and respawn a few seconds later , with the exception of the Ghost and Pain fruits which can resurrect you one time before you can be killed. The more health the player has, the more durable they will be from other attacks. Health deduction can be reduced by activating Aura. Full body Aura reduces damage taken by 30% before subtracting it from the player's health. Health scales off the current Defense stat, with 5 HP being added for each stat point put, the amount of health one has can be measured by using the following equation:
trivia:
The max health a player can have is 16512. It can be obtained by having 2750 Defense point stats and using the Leviathan Shield accessory, and having at least Draco v3. With no accessories or buffs, the max amount of health would be 13845.
20483 when using the Leviathan Shield accessory and Shark V4's (upgraded) Leviathan Armor ability.
With just the Leviathan Shield accessory, the max health would be 14845.
20483 when using the Leviathan Shield accessory and Shark V4's (upgraded) Leviathan Armor ability.
With just the Leviathan Shield accessory, the max health would be 14845.
Leviathan Crown, Pilot Helmet, Kitsune Ribbon, Lei and Feathered Visage (dropped from the 'Tyrant of the Skies' Raid Boss) are the only accessories that increase health regeneration speed.

Players can get the following two Titles in Second or Third Sea for losing health:
The Undefeated One (#080): Receive damage from a player and survive with less than 50 HP left
Immortal Being (#081): Receive damage from a player and survive with 1 HP left
The Undefeated One (#080): Receive damage from a player and survive with less than 50 HP left
Immortal Being (#081): Receive damage from a player and survive with 1 HP left
Every time the player levels up or completes a quest with low health and/or energy, their health and energy will automatically be restored unless the player is in combat.

The [F] (mobility) moves of Flame, Ice, Spider, Light and Eagle go faster with the higher Health the player has.
Opposite to that, the [F] (mobility) moves of Blade, Sound and Venom move go faster the lower the Health the player has.
Opposite to that, the [F] (mobility) moves of Blade, Sound and Venom move go faster the lower the Health the player has.
Bomb's [V] move exchanges the player's health for damage.

swords.name: Energy
swords.description: Energy is a fundamental feature in Blox Fruits. Once a player has zero energy, they have to wait until their energy bar is no longer empty or else the player cannot dash or use certain moves. It is essential for performing most actions in Blox Fruits, such as using moves, dodges, Air Jumps, Flash Steps, and others. Energy scales off the current Melee stat, with 5 Energy being added for each stat point allocated. The amount of energy one has can be measured by using the following equation:
trivia: The regeneration of energy scales with the players stats, being faster the higher their energy stats are. (2x faster on the ground)
One dash consumes 30 energy (unless the player is using the Rabbit race, which allows only 15 energy to be consumed).

The max amount of energy a player can have is 17930, with 2750 stat points in Melee, using the Kitsune Ribbon accessory, whilst being in an awakened form of their race. With no accessories or buffs, the max energy would be 13845. With just the Kitsune Ribbon accessory, it would be 16345.

Trying to use a move that requires more energy than the player currently has will make a message appear saying "Low energy! [Amount of energy the move requires] energy required." and the move will not activate.

Normal M1 attacks, such as kicking, punching, swinging a sword, firing a gun, using abilities such as the V3/V4 of a Race, Summon Sea Beast, and Admin Abilities will not drain energy.
The only exceptions are Skull Guitar, Rubber, Dough (V2), Phoenix (V2)'s M1 and Diamond M1.
The only exceptions are Skull Guitar, Rubber, Dough (V2), Phoenix (V2)'s M1 and Diamond M1.
Other players' and enemies' energy bars can be seen by using Instinct and Instinct V2
The Masterpiece enchantment can remove the energy cost for the attacks of the item it is on.
If the player completely runs out of energy, they are given the title “Empty Vessel” (#067).  It is recommended to use Phoenix's [X] move for the most efficient energy drain.

swords.name: Quests
trivia: The Forgotten Quest Giver and the Kingdom of Rose Area 2 Quest Giver have a similar appearance.
There are two Mole Quest Givers. One is located near the Skylands next to the temple that teleports to the Upper Skylands. The other is found in the Upper Skyland itself.
The Deep Forest Quest Giver 1 looks similar to the Tiki Quest Giver 2.
Most quest givers have a yellow exclamation mark on above or even behind them, which makes it easier to find them while searching.
The Arena quest giver is the only quest giver that rewards the player with   fragments.
There is currently a total of 116 quests in the game (including side quests).

swords.name: Sea Events
trivia: Some Sea Events can spawn with another Sea Events, but this is very rare. For example, Mirage Island with a Rumbling Waters and a Terrorshark, making it a heavily guarded Island.
After the players' boat gets destroyed whilst exploring danger levels, the meter for it will be gone, unless another boat is nearby.
Though very rare, Sea Events such as Sharks can spawn in Sea Danger Level 0 outside of Tiki Outpost.

swords.name: Allying
trivia: There was a glitch where if the user is a Marine and joins the Pirates team through the Pirate Recruiter, the ally button will disappear.
Allied players can only be damaged with Meme.

Allying is the only way for the player to ride a Love user's flamingo, a transformed Kitsune or a transformed Dragon with Strong Hair/Saddle. To get teleported by Portal's [C] World Warp without getting allied, the player needs to be outside safe zone. (The player can also get teleported if both are in combat in safe zone.)

swords.name: Abilities
swords.description: Abilities are various unique effects and bonuses that the player can learn and use to gain advantages in Blox Fruits.

swords.name: Damage Counter
trivia: Currently, the YouTuber/admin Uzoth is the record holder for the greatest amount of damage the game has ever recorded, at 988 septillion (9.88 x 10²⁶). The video can be found here.
The most amount of damage done by a non-admin player is imFiji, with 127,518,285. The video can be found here.

swords.name: Fast Mode
swords.description: Fast mode is a mode that reduces lag for Blox Fruits on devices. It works by removing the textures in models, making all parts have a smooth plastic texture. It normally takes around 20 seconds to completely execute, and the player can still play during the execution time. However, on some devices, it could take longer.
trivia: Fast mode can be used for finding the hidden texts on the trading tables at mansion. It could still be found without fast mode but using it makes it easier.
Fast mode does not change a lot of FPS in heavy/powerful devices such as PCs or gaming tablets/phones, but it is recommended if the player has a weak phone, old computer.
Some V3 or V4 abilities might not show up. An example for it is the Cyborg V3 ability where the player does not see the particles but they still receive the buffs.

Since update 24, there's a bug where turning on Fast Mode on the menu before choosing a team doesn't fully disable all textures in the game, and the Fast Mode button through the Settings appears as if it wasn't even turned on at all.
This is especially noticeable in the Third Sea, as far areas like Temple of Time may appear fully/partially textured, even when Fast Mode was turned on beforehand. (In this case, turning on Fast Mode through the Settings while being in the Temple of Time will fix this issue.)

This is especially noticeable in the Third Sea, as far areas like Temple of Time may appear fully/partially textured, even when Fast Mode was turned on beforehand. (In this case, turning on Fast Mode through the Settings while being in the Temple of Time will fix this issue.)

swords.name: Safe Zone
trivia: If the player is already in Combat with another player, the Safe Zone will not protect the player from that person until their Combat indicator disappears. This is to prevent players immediately running to a Safe Zone when losing in PvP or when getting attacked.

The first location of every sea is a safe zone (e.g Pirate/Marine Starter, Kingdom of Rose Docks and Port Town Docks). This is to prevent the player getting attacked immediately while they are spawning in.
The Safe Zone has a delay of about one second before it activates. That means it is possible to be attacked when the player first joins the game.
There is a glitch where after dying in combat the player can be attacked even in a safe zone if other player's combat is still on.
The safe zone near the Blox Fruit Gacha in Jungle was added in Update 20.
The player's speed gets slower by roughly 37.5% whenever they enter a safe zone.

Now in Update 24, if the player is on a private server and the PvP mode is set to "Friendly PvP", the player can be attacked anytime even on Safe Zone places, but they can't lose honor/bounty if they die to another player (that player also can't get honor/bounty).

swords.name: Titles
swords.description: Titles are labels that appear next to the player's name when they speak in the Roblox chat.
trivia: “Sugar Rush”, “Christmas Spirit” and “Loco Verde” were only available during the Presents event.
The titles "Death King" and "Undead Lord" are only available during Halloween events.
There was a glitch where upon killing the Leviathan’s head, the title was not awarded. This has recently been fixed.
There is a glitch where if the player is the last person standing in a raid and run out of time, they will still receive the "Last Hope" title.
Unlocking the Rainbow Saviour Aura Color without unlocking any other Aura Colors will wrongfully award the player the "The Collector" title.
Getting the Kitsune Aura skin does not unlock the "The Enhancer" title.
Blox Fruits Staff members who can drop the "Equal to the Heavens" title cannot turn it off unlike normal YouTuber titles.
The "Hakaishin" title #147 means "God of Destruction" in Japanese.
The "Loco Verde" title #156 means "Crazy Green" in Spanish.
The "Shinigami" title #169 means "Soul Reaper" or "God of Death" in Japanese.
Uzoth's title, "Doragontarontorēnā", is a Japanese anglicism which means "dragon talon trainer", likely a reference to the NPC that sells Dragon Talon being based off him.
The "LA FLEUR DU MAL 悪の華" title means "THE FLOWER OF EVIL (French), before Flower of Evil (Japanese)."

swords.name: Wanted Posters
trivia: If the player is alone in a server as a Pirate, all the posters will only have them displayed, if  there aren't any pirates in the server the wanted posters will not spawn at all.
Upon completion of the quest, the message "<QUEST COMPLETED> Earned   " will appear.
Unlike the Player Hunter, the player can choose whoever they want to hunt down.
Unlike the Player Hunter, kills with quests from wanted posters don't count and don't give exp.
If the target's level has max level, the reward will be stuck at   50,000.
Every couple of minutes the wanted posters will change and the quest will disappear.
If the player dies, the wanted poster will change to another player.

swords.name: Pictures
trivia: Some pictures do not have official names.
There is a glitch with the pictures "Staff Photo" and "Dragon Talon Trainer" where they fail to load and appear blank. This could possibly be due to a bug or Roblox deleted them.

swords.name: Sea Exploration Group
trivia: Sea Exploration Group appears only in the Third Sea.
The 20 required sea events for Frozen Dimension include only those that spawn enemies. Events like islands, Haunted Shipwrecks, or Rough Seas do not count.

swords.name: Experience
trivia: EXPEXP is currently the most abundant quantity in the game, easily reaching into the hundreds of millions for a single level, while other Stats and currencies are rarely seen above ten million.
Roblox Premium allows the user to gain more experience on a quest/kill than a normal player.
It took Uzoth 7 minutes and 45.92 seconds to reach Update 20's MAX level (2550).
The amount of EXPEXP needed per level is defined by [2 x Level^2.3 + 84] = EXP to level up.
It takes a total of 119,938,274,162 EXP119,938,274,162 EXP to reach level 2650.

swords.name: Mastery
trivia:
Currently, the maximum amount of mastery a fighting style, fruit, sword, or gun can have is 600.
The maximum amount of mastery for fishing rods is 100.
The maximum amount of mastery for fishing rods is 100.

The amount of EXPEXP needed per mastery is defined by this formula:
54 + ((2 * mastery ^ 2.26 + 30) * 0.5)
EXP Calculator
EXP Calculator
The total amount of EXP needed to reach mastery 600 is 348,679,374 EXP348,679,374 EXP.
Getting mastery can be doubled by using the gamepass 2x mastery.
When the player reaches MAX mastery, the item's stats is increased to 425.

swords.name: Gifting
trivia: Game passes can be stored in the inventory (by "gifting" their inventory), allowing them to be traded (excluding the Respawn Bosses and Change Race game passes).

swords.name: Update Log
swords.description: The Update Log is a feature in Blox Fruits that lets players see the planned upcoming updates. It can be accessed by clicking on "Settings", then on "Open Log".

swords.name: Campfire
swords.description: The campfire can be crafted through the user's inventory by using one Wooden Plank. It allows the player to craft Potions and other consumables using unlocked recipes, obtained from the Note in a Bottle through fishing.
trivia: Campfires can be available for beginners since wooden planks can be obtained with a lower chance without Shipwright subclass as of Update 27.
When the campfire is going to disappear, you will be notified, saying "Your campfire's flames have been extinguished..." a few seconds before it disappears.
Other players can use your campfire, and so can can you.
If you open the Craft Menu, then walk away from the campfire, the Craft Menu will disappear.
There are currently only 6 available recipes as of Updates/27.1.
The player need 18 Fishes (1 Rare, 4 Uncommon And 13 Common), 1 Leather, 1 Scrap Metal, and 1 Fish Tail to craft every recipe once.
The Player can craft a Fish Kebab, Lava Potion, Aggro Elixir, Loot Seeker, Berserkers Elixir, and Fortune Elixir.
Monk Potion, Invisibility Potion, and Oni Soul potions were limited to Oni Campfire.

swords.name: Valor
trivia: Valor is currently the only currency that is exclusively obtainable in the Third Sea.
It takes a total of   17,300 and   12,800 to unlock and fully level up all the abilities.

swords.name: Rules
swords.description: Thank you for coming to the Blox Fruits Wiki. We have rules set in place to make this place as friendly as possible. Discussion/post rules can be found here, it's probably best that you read those as well.

swords.name: Wiki Staff Page
swords.description: Information on the roles and permissions that these users possess can be found at the Roles page.

stats.Senbo to Kami100:
Fandom: Senbo to Kami
Discord: enVi#7952

swords.name: Manual of Style
swords.description: Hi, and welcome to the Blox Fruits Wiki. This page is a manual, complete with guidelines and etiquette when editing/creating basic articles on this wiki. This page is a standard that you should seriously consider following, so that people know how and what to edit.

swords.name: History of Stock
swords.description: This page is dedicated to writing down the "Stock" of every month, going as far back as December of 2020. Current stock can be seen on the Blox Fruits "Stock" page.

swords.name: History of Stock/Year
swords.description: This is the Blox Fruits Stock History, going as far back as December of 2020.

swords.name: Natural
swords.description: Natural is one of the three classifications of Blox Fruits, alongside Elemental and Beast. Natural fruits grant the user a wide variety of powers that do not fall strictly into elemental control or beast transformations. These abilities are often considered “superpower” types, ranging from gravity manipulation and string control to barrier creation and sound waves. There are currently 24 Natural fruits in the game.
trivia: Natural-type Blox Fruits are not any different from other fruits; it is only a classification, unlike Elemental fruits, which provide the user with immunity to physical attacks.

swords.name: Elemental
swords.description: Elemental is one of the three classifications of Blox Fruits, alongside Natural and Beast. Elemental fruits grant the user powers tied to specific elements, allowing them to manipulate fire, ice, light, magma, and other forces of nature. There are currently 11 Elemental fruits in the game.
trivia: The Level that the player needs for Elemental Reflex to activate is set at about 2% more than their current level.
Smoke is the only common Elemental-type fruit.
Smoke, Blizzard, Lightning and Gas are the only elemental fruits without an awakening, considering that Lightning lost its awakening.
Elemental is the second largest category of Blox Fruits, ahead of Beast and behind Natural.
Uncommon has the most elemental fruits of every category.
Lightning is currently the only fully reworked Elemental fruit.
Lightning is also the only upgradable Elemental fruit via the Admin panel
Dough is notable for being the only fruit based on an artificial substance, rather than a naturally occurring one.
Gas is the only Elemental-type fruit that has a Transformation.
Gas is the most recent (and currently most expensive) Elemental fruit.
Dough is currently the most expensive Elemental fruit to awaken, costing   18,500 to fully awaken.
Magma has the most passive abilities of all Elemental fruits
Elemental fruits have the most fruits that can deal infinite damage which are Smoke, Lightning and Blizzard.
Elemental Fruits have the most fruits that are able to Awaken out of any category.

swords.name: Beast
swords.description: Beast is one of the three main classifications of Blox Fruits, alongside Natural and Elemental. Beast fruits allow the user to transform into powerful animals, mythological creatures, or divine beings, granting abilities that reflect the nature of the form they take. These fruits are often defined by their transformative power, enhanced mobility, and overwhelming presence in combat. There are currently 9 Beast fruits in the game.
trivia: Despite Venom, Rubber, and Diamond having a transformation, they are currently considered Natural fruits. Gas is currently an Elemental fruit, despite it having a transformation.
There are currently no Common or Rare Beast fruits in the game.
Beast fruits make up the highest amount of Mythical fruits in the game.
Every beast fruit except Eagle has a full transformation.
Only 2 Beast-type fruits have an awakening, those fruits being Phoenix and Buddha.

Spider is not a beast fruit. Despite the fact that it has changed its name, it has not changed its type: it is a Natural fruit. It is also because that the Spider fruit allows the user to control strings instead of turning them into a spider (because it used to be the String Fruit).
Mammoth and T-Rex cost the same amount of Money and have the same Permanent Value. Leopard and Yeti now share these too.
Eagle is currently the cheapest and least rare of all the Beast-type fruits in the game.
Dragon is the most expensive Beast-type Blox Fruit, costing   15,000,000, as well as being the most expensive Blox Fruit.
Buddha is the only Beast fruit that needs to have its transformation active to be able to use its moves.
Awakened Buddha, Phoenix, T-Rex and Dragon are the only Beast fruits to have a transformation move that is not named "Transformation".
As of Update 26, Eagle is the newest beast fruit in the game.
There are currently 8 beast fruits that have an M1 (left click), these fruits are: Dragon, Kitsune, Yeti, Leopard, T-Rex, Mammoth, Awakened Phoenix and Eagle.

Many of the Beast fruits do not allow the user to use their Fighting Styles, Swords or Guns while transformed except for Buddha and Dragon (Hybrid).
Eagle technically does not have a transformation, but the user is able to yield weapons while flying.
Eagle technically does not have a transformation, but the user is able to yield weapons while flying.
As of Update 26, Eagle and Dragon are the only beast fruits that have usable skins.
Beast has the least number of Blox Fruits, after Elemental with 11 and Natrual with 21.

swords.name: Permanent Blox Fruits
swords.description: Permanent Blox Fruits are Blox Fruits purchased through the Blox Fruit Dealer or the Shop menu. They may be obtained at any time, in any sea via Robux   or through gifting. When purchasing a Permanent Fruit, players have the option to gift to others, causing immediate activation on the receiving end, or to store the fruit in the Inventory, allowing the fruit to be traded at a later date. Permanent Fruits in the Inventory will be assigned the Premium rarity regardless of price.
trivia: With the release of revamped fruits, Permanent Fruit prices changed, with the most notable being Bomb, Spike, Rocket, and Spin.
Dragon had the most drastic change in price, spiking up from   2,600 to   5,000 (a 92.3% increase).
In older updates, Permanent Fruits were the only reliable way to own multiple fruits at once, as the Fruit Storage gamepass was not yet available.
The total cost of every Permanent Fruit is   68,880.
Permanent Fruits are generally known as Perm Fruits or Perms.
Permanent Fruits can be bought from the Dealer even when not in stock.

swords.name: Rarities
swords.description: Most items that are found in Blox Fruits are given a rarity, which is indicated by a tag of colored text. They are applied to Blox Fruits, swords, guns, accessories, materials, scrolls, fishing rods, and various paid items.

swords.name: Premium
swords.description: Premium is a special rarity for paid items in the inventory.

swords.name: Private Servers
swords.description: Private servers are an integrated part of Roblox that Blox Fruits uses. They can be purchased for   200 which renews every 30 days for the same price.
trivia: Only 2 fruits can spawn inside of a private server since its start.
Bosses will not immediately spawn at the start of a server. They'll instead spawn when their respawn period is over.
Upon start, servers start on a half moon, with the sun halfway in the sky.
The Player Hunter will refuse to give the player a quest while in a private server, stating "Sorry, you must join a public server for PvP tasks."
Inside private servers, the build limit of the Creation Fruit increases from 40 to 189.

swords.name: Server Browser
trivia: Server names use the old version of fruit names. For example, a server may be named "Weak Soul", despite the fact that it was renamed to Spirit.
Server names can also contain usernames of developers, like "Large TAWG", which was one of mygame43's previous usernames.
Some servers like England, Hong Kong, etc. have been removed.
The Server Browser button can also be a circle with no text.

swords.name: System Messages
swords.description: System Messages are notifications of specific events such as the spawning of Raid Bosses, high-bounty player joins, questline quotes, event messages, etc.
trivia: When the Stored <Sword> message appears, instead of Stored Fox Lamp , it shows the words of another sword. It can even display swords that users do not own or already own, or admin-exclusive swords like Triple Dark Blade.

swords.name: Soundtracks
swords.description: Soundtracks are an indispensable part of every game. Blox Fruits has many soundtracks, these soundtracks in game all contribute to increasing highlights in certain locations, creating atmosphere or sometimes improving the experience.

swords.name: Codes
swords.description: Codes can be redeemed by clicking the  icon on the bottom left side of the player's screen and entering the code.

fightingStyles.name: Blox Fruits
trivia: It would cost   68,880 to buy every permanent fruit, and   84,432,500 to buy every fruit from the Blox Fruit Dealer.

Most bosses use the older versions of their fruits.
Don Swan is the only one who uses Spider with its updated moveset.
Don Swan is the only one who uses Spider with its updated moveset.
Many Blox Fruit moves have Destructible Physics, as with many other types of attacks.

fightingStyles.name: Guns
trivia:
Guns can have many different types of projectile weapons, such as:
The Venom Bow being a bow,
The Skull Guitar being a guitar,
The Refined Slingshot, the Kabucha and the Slingshot being slingshots.
The Venom Bow being a bow,
The Skull Guitar being a guitar,
The Refined Slingshot, the Kabucha and the Slingshot being slingshots.

fightingStyles.name: First Sea
trivia: The First Sea is the first type of sea in the game and also the oldest of the 3 seas in Blox Fruits. This is also where the fewest scripters and bounty hunters are found.
Set Home Point NPCs appear on every island except the Jean-Luc Island.

fightingStyles.name: Second Sea
trivia: Second Sea contains the most Easter Eggs in the game.

fightingStyles.name: Third Sea
trivia: The Third Sea holds the title of having the least number of islands (8); however, more are to come. It also could be counted as 12 islands, as there are several mini-islands in the Sea of Treats or 17 if the Mirage Island, Kitsune Island, Treasure Island, Frozen Dimension and Prehistoric Island are included.
The enemies past the Ice Cream Land (Sea of Treats) use Aura, nullifying Elemental Reflex even if the player surpasses the required Level.

fightingStyles.name: Combat
moves: This move takes up less energy than regular dashing, despite traveling much further, making this useful if a low leveled user wants to conserve energy.
This move takes up less energy than regular dashing, despite traveling much further, making this useful if a low leveled user wants to conserve energy.
This move can slightly stun opponents, though it is not very useful for PvP being very close ranged.

When used in the air, there will be a hitbox that goes slightly beyond the normal range of the ground version, being able to hit opponents standing just below the user. However, when used too high, such as when using awakened Buddha's transformation, it cannot hit any regular sized enemies.
This move can slightly stun opponents, though it is not very useful for PvP being very close ranged.

When used in the air, there will be a hitbox that goes slightly beyond the normal range of the ground version, being able to hit opponents standing just below the user. However, when used too high, such as when using awakened Buddha's transformation, it cannot hit any regular sized enemies.

— The user dashes forward, tackling into any enemies nearby, knocking them back quite far, while leaving behind a whirlwind of air from the swiftness of their attack.
This move takes up less energy than regular dashing, despite traveling much further, making this useful if a low leveled user wants to conserve energy.

— The user stomps their foot on the ground with devastating force, creating a medium shockwave that will knock away anyone within radius, leaving a huge crack on the floor and fragments of the ground tossed up in the air from the impact.
This move can slightly stun opponents, though it is not very useful for PvP being very close ranged.
When used in the air, there will be a hitbox that goes slightly beyond the normal range of the ground version, being able to hit opponents standing just below the user. However, when used too high, such as when using awakened Buddha's transformation, it cannot hit any regular sized enemies.
trivia: Combat is by far the most realistic fighting style in-game as it is the only one that does not use attacks out of magical elements such as fire, water, magic and electricity.
Combat is considered the rarest thing in the game, as once the user changes their fighting style they cannot get it back.
Combat is the only fighting style that only has two moves.
Combat is the only fighting style without an icon, and it is simply presented as "Combat".

Combat is the only fighting style that cannot be learned back after using another fighting style.
Combat can only be learned again through admin commands.
Combat can only be learned again through admin commands.
Combat has the second slowest M1s, Dark Step having the slowest.
Combat's moves are similar to the [C] and [X] moves of Superhuman and Godhuman.
Most Enemies use the M1 of Combat.
Raiders use the [M1] and the [Z] move of Combat.
Combat has the most realistic idle stance of all Fighting Styles, as it resembles a real-life boxing guard.

[Z] Quick Tackle cannot hit normal sized NPCs and players on the ground while using unawakened and awakened Buddha's transformation. This is because Buddha's hitbox is above the ground, and as [Z] Quick Tackle cannot be aimed vertically and [X] Ground Smash has a small hitbox, only the M1s can be used while transformed.

fightingStyles.name: Dark Step
moves: This move launches the user in an arc, with a red line showing the user where they will land (can be inaccurate if used from a long distance).
This move launches the user in an arc, with a red line showing the user where they will land (can be inaccurate if used from a long distance).
Overheat also deals damage after the leg lights on fire, but it's best not to use it for doing damage since it does the same amount of damage as a singular M1 click.
Overheat also deals damage after the leg lights on fire, but it's best not to use it for doing damage since it does the same amount of damage as a singular M1 click.

— The user launches towards their cursor, leaving an impact.
This move launches the user in an arc, with a red line showing the user where they will land (can be inaccurate if used from a long distance).
If used when Overheat is active it deals extra damage and does AoE damage upon impact.

— The user handstands, starts spinning, attacks everything around them using their legs. Upon contact with an enemy, the user will deal damage and stun the enemy for the duration of the move. The user is unable to move during this.
If used during Overheat, it deals extra damage and ignites the wind around the user.

— The user releases a barrage of kicks towards their cursor. The duration of this move will be increased if the key is held down. If the user is hit during this move, the move is canceled.
If used during Overheat, it deals extra damage and the barrage will be on fire.

— The user spins really fast and sets both of their legs on fire, increasing Dark Step's damage by ~22% for 60 seconds.
Overheat also deals damage after the leg lights on fire, but it's best not to use it for doing damage since it does the same amount of damage as a singular M1 click.
trivia: Dark Step is considered to be the best fighting style for grinding aura mastery.
If the user uses [V] Overheat and goes into Light's [F] Light Flight, the flames will get all messed up.

If [V] Overheat is used over 100 times, the user will have both legs on fire upon using it again, similar to Death Step's [V] move which doesn't have a requirement for both legs to be on fire and has it from the start upon use.

If the user uses [V] Overheat, and then switches to another fighting style, the user's legs will still be on fire without an expiration timer. Hence, it is possible to get both flame legs and flame fists by activating the move and equipping Dragon Talon. This effect only gets removed if the player dies or rejoins, and it is purely cosmetic if they switch to another fighting style. The expiration timer is however restored if using the [V] move again.
The damage multiplier is only applied while using Dark Step or Death Step's moves, so the user cannot use this to get extra damage on other moves.
If the player has Dark Step or Death Step equipped, their Aura stages will start at their legs, instead of their hands.
[C] Barrage is similar to Rubber's [C] Rush.
If the user uses [C] Barrage and quickly switch fighting styles while holding it, they will be stuck in the animation.
Dark Step is the one of the only two fighting styles to have four moves, the other being its successor, Death Step.
In Update 9 Dark Step was almost renamed to Fire Feet.
By equipping Death Step/Dark Step and climbing to a ladder, the user will climb with their legs instead of their hands, due to the user's hands being on their waist.
Dark Step is chronologically the first fighting style that the player can purchase.

Similar to Death Step, Dark Step's [V] Overheat can permanently be activated by using Ghoul V3 to ignore 40% of the final cooldown time. However, for Death Step, the user needs to wait until the move expires, otherwise it will only disable the flames and they will need to wait longer to be able to use it again.

fightingStyles.name: Dark Step Teacher
trivia: The old model of the Dark Step Teacher is still used in the Second Sea and the Third Sea. This model wears a black and gold suit and has blonde hair instead of black.

fightingStyles.name: Electric
moves: — The user leaps into the air. They then fill their hand with electricity and linger in the air for a short second. The user then slams down into the ground, creating a small explosion of lightning. This can be aimed by holding a direction key on startup (i.e. forward, backward, left, right etc).
— The user dashes forward where the cursor points, doing medium damage. Used primarily for dashing forward mid-air.
— The user slams their fists in the ground, infusing the ground in front of them with electric rays for a few moments, doing AoE and stun.
trivia: Due to having electrical properties, Electric cannot harm Rubber users due to Rubber being immune to electricity.
While Electric is equipped, the user's hands will be covered in electricity, though this is purely cosmetic.

fightingStyles.name: Water Kung Fu
moves: — The user punches repeatedly with their water infused hands. There is no lag after the fourth M1, so this can be used infinitely without pause.
— The user fires a blue ring that releases steam, inflicting knockback.
— The user shoots many fast projectiles out of their hands; this move deals decent damage. (Requires aim to be used effectively.)
— The user charges water and lunges a powerful punch in the direction of the cursor, dealing high knockback. Can be used for movement.
trivia: Water Kung Fu is the most expensive fighting style in the First Sea.
The unreworked version of [X] Deadly Shower is used by Sea Beasts.

fightingStyles.name: Water Kung-fu Teacher
trivia: The Water Kung-fu Teacher is the hardest NPC to find in comparison to other shop NPCs, with his location being hidden similarly to an in-game bug.

fightingStyles.name: Dragon Breath
moves: — The user dashes forward twice, pausing in between to change direction, while engulfed in flames, with slicing particles appearing. If the second dash hits as well as the first dash, the damage of the second dash is divided by 10.
— The user fires two fire dragons from their fists, spiraling them in front of them and doing damage and knockback.
— The user buries their fists beneath them and creates an explosion with a huge radius that leaves small, fiery rocks sticking out of the ground.
trivia:
Dragon Breath is the cheapest fighting style that costs Fragments  .
Dragon Breath is also the only fighting style that does not require Money   to purchase.
Dragon Breath is also the only fighting style that does not require Money   to purchase.

Usually, when equipping a fighting style, the system message displays: 'Bought <Fighting Style> for   0 and  0'. However, when equipping Dragon Breath, the message instead reads: 'Activated <Dragon Breath>.'

fightingStyles.name: Fragments
trivia: On PS5, the player will still be able to see how many fragments they have even if they haven't entered Second Sea.
To see how much Fragments the player has, they need to hover over the Money value on PC. On console and mobile, it always displays.
The Rare Artifact used to fulfill some of the purposes of this currency, but it was then removed in Update 11.
Before Update 20, this currency didn't appear when the player was in the First Sea.
The maximum amount of Fragments a player can hold is   1,000,000,000

It costs   667,450 to fully max everything the player can buy with Fragments (excluding Race Reroll and Stat Reset)
  187,300 to fully Awaken all fruits
  187,250 to fully awaken V4 on every race
  2,500 to buy the Cyborg race for the first time (excluding potential re-purchases)
  31,500 to unlock all Fighting Styles
  30,000 to unlock all crew slots
  1,500 to purchase the Lantern boat from Cyborg
  1,500 to get Kabucha
  37,500 to get all Aura colors from Barista
  91,000 to get all Dragon skins from Barista (both East and West variants)
  10,000 to get the 2 Dragon seats (  5,000 each from the Dragon Tamer)
  15,800 to max the Shipwright subclass
  62,100 to upgrade Gravity, Eagle, Pain and Lightning fruits in the Admin Panel
  9,500 to get all Eagle skins from Barista
187,300 to fully Awaken all fruits
187,250 to fully awaken V4 on every race
2,500 to buy the Cyborg race for the first time (excluding potential re-purchases)
31,500 to unlock all Fighting Styles
30,000 to unlock all crew slots
1,500 to purchase the Lantern boat from Cyborg
1,500 to get Kabucha
37,500 to get all Aura colors from Barista
91,000 to get all Dragon skins from Barista (both East and West variants)
10,000 to get the 2 Dragon seats (  5,000 each from the Dragon Tamer)
15,800 to max the Shipwright subclass
62,100 to upgrade Gravity, Eagle, Pain and Lightning fruits in the Admin Panel
9,500 to get all Eagle skins from Barista

fightingStyles.name: Superhuman
moves: — The user travels a decent amount of distance in any direction (can move in different directions while using the move), and if the user collides with an enemy, they will punch the target 20+ times, dealing a good amount of damage, and knocking them back slightly with a strong punch. If the user does not hit an enemy, they will just travel a decent distance. This move does not work when used with awakened Buddha unless aimed downward at the enemy. However, it can be used with unawakened Buddha. This move doesn't break Instinct, but can be useful in draining it.

— The user charges up an attack and summons a tornado (if held down, the tornado does not deal damage) and when released or used, the user stomps the ground and releases a ring of power horizontally with a thunderous boom that deals decent damage to nearby enemies. Holding the move does not increase damage or knockback. This move breaks Instinct. This move somewhat works with Buddha as the ring is off-ground but can hit enemies on the ground, although its knockback makes it very bad for grinding.
— The user dashes forward in immense speed and knocks the enemy back (great knockback and damage).
trivia: If the user hits an NPC using [C] Conqueror Gun on the hot side of Hot and Cold, the user will take damage because of the lava underneath.
Superhuman is used by the Living Zombies at Haunted Castle, but they only utilize M1s (left clicks) and not the moves.
Even though Superhuman is the most expensive V1 fighting style, and others are better due to factors such as damage or range, this still is a decent fighting style to use.
Superhuman is said to be Combat's successor, although it was proven false after the announcement of "Superhuman V2" (Godhuman) by rip_indra.

Superhuman is basically a weaker version of Godhuman because both fighting styles have similar moves with Superhuman. This fighting style simply has older, more outdated design, slightly lower damage and [X] Thunder Clap not containing two variants compared to its successor, Godhuman.
Superhuman can be good for grinding aura since [Z] Beast Owl Pounce deals a decent amount of hits.
Superhuman is the fighting style with the second highest mastery requiring obtainment, with all other fighting styles (except Godhuman) being tied to each other in the mastery requirements.
Superhuman isn't very good for grinding or PvP compared to the V2s, so it is recommended to use a different fighting style, such as its upgraded version, Godhuman.
This is (sometimes) regarded as the 'most skilled fighting style' in the game.

fightingStyles.name: Death Step
moves:
— The user enters a stance and a whirlwind-like effect appears around the user. After releasing the move, the user dashes forward at high speed in the direction of the cursor, kicking back anyone in their way. If the user or the hit enemy makes contact with a surface, it will create an AoE dent in the surface and deals damage to anyone within it. This move can be held up to 1 second to dash further and faster.
With Maximum Overheat:

The user enters a stance and a fiery whirlwind-like effect appears around the user. Upon releasing the move, the user dashes forward slightly faster, dealing higher damage to anyone in their way, while also leaving flames in the area of contact which deal tick damage to all enemies within it.

— The user pulls their left leg back and, upon releasing the move, kicks the air, creating a very fast wind bullet, which explodes into an AoE wind blast upon contact with a solid surface, or when it reaches its maximum distance, dealing damage and knocking back nearby enemies. The travel time of the projectile is instant. The explosion deals 25% more damage than the projectile.
With Maximum Overheat:

Upon releasing the move, the user quickly kicks the air, creating a very fast flaming wind bullet that deals greater damage and leaves a flaming trail if used close to the ground.

— The user releases a barrage of kicks in a drill-like fashion towards their cursor, stunning anyone caught in the attack, and ends with a powerful downward axe kick if an enemy is caught in the barrage. The duration of this move will be increased if the key is held down. This move can be held for 3 seconds. If the user is on the ground, they will jump up upon starting this move.
With Maximum Overheat:

The user barrages their opponent with flaming kicks, and the final axe kick lights the ground on fire, dealing extra burn damage.

— The user sets their legs on fire and creates a small explosion around their legs, damaging anyone near them. While active, this move increases Death Step's damage by ~15% for around 60 seconds. Additionally, all Death Step attacks leave fire on the ground that deals tick damage to enemies inside of it, lasting for 4 seconds. This move has a cooldown of 90 seconds.
trivia: Death Step and its inferior version Dark Step are the only current fighting styles in the whole game that have a transformation-type move that enhances damage, as well as the only ones that have four moves.

There is a bug where if [V] Maximum Overheat is active while switching fighting styles, the visual effect on the user's feet will stay until the user dies or leaves the game. This also applies to Dark Step. Keep in mind that this is purely visual effect, and does not provide any buffs.
When using [Z] Rocket Kick on the edges of the volcano at the Magma Village, the crater created will be purple, similar to T-Rex's [F] move.

The [V] ability Maximum Overheat has the highest mastery required for a move in the whole game, being 400 mastery, with other [V] moves usually having mastery requirements of 150, 225, 250, 300, 350 mastery. However, Maximum Overheat before Update 14 used to have a mastery requirement of 450.

Before Update 14, Death Step's [V] was one of the most tedious things to get in the game, with things like Godhuman, Sanguine Art, Race Awakenings and others, did not exist at the time, so getting this move was one of the most tedious things to do at the time, similar to getting max level, 30m Bounty/Honor, getting 600 mastery on something, owning the most expensive fruits, and others. But when Update 14 rolled around, the mastery requirement went from 450 to 400.
Death Step, along with Dark Step, are the only fighting styles that have [V] abilities.
Death Step's [V] move used to be called Devil Flames.

fightingStyles.name: Phoeyu, the Reformed
trivia: Phoeyu's skin is based on Phoeyu or Phoeating, who developed a game named Grand Piece Online.
Phoeyu used to have an area that could only be summoned by admins, which was called the Phoeyu Dimension. (Now changed to the Pocket Dimension)

fightingStyles.name: Sharkman Karate
moves: — The user swings their water infused arms twice, before executing a slide forward and a ground slam with their fists.

— The user summons six water bodies and rushes forward. If hit, the enemy is caught in an onslaught of palm strikes by all six figures, and the user. If upgraded, the user will shoot out a water shark at the enemy after the rush.

— The player fires a shark made of water, which on hitting an enemy, traps the enemy in a bubble for about 1 second, before exploding. If upgraded, the user will be able to control the position of the bubble, and the bubble will last longer.

— The player launches a vortex of water and then draws it towards their body. If hit, the vortex pulls in the enemy, followed up by a barrage of aquatic strike and a finishing double-palm strike. If upgraded, the move turns from single-target to multi-target, and also grants a temporary shield which provides a 35% defense buff.
trivia: Both Kilo Admiral and Fish Crew Member uses Sharkman Karate Old's M1's as its melee.
Sharkman Karate is considerably the best way to grind for Aura levels, as almost all the moves are tick damage, especially [C] Great Sea Spear as it has lots of tick damage.
Sharkman Karate is the second V2 Fighting Style to have an upgraded version, the first being Dragon Talon.
Before Update 27.3, Sharkman Karate was obtained from Daigrock, the Sharkman.

Despite being an upgrade to Water Kung Fu, Sharkman Karate currently stands as the fighting style with the worst m1s in-game, due to their overall bad hitbox and dash on 3rd M1 causing many people to hate the rework. It is recommended to use Sharkman Karate solely for pvp, and Water Kung Fu for grinding.

Currently, the Sharkman Master's final belt in the Fish slap battle training is excruciatingly hard, as it requires a 100% critical hit ratio, and getting lucky so the Sharkman Master misses his final hit.

fightingStyles.name: Sharkman Teacher
trivia: Upon death or character reset, the player loses the Water Key unless it has already been delivered to Sharkman Teacher, and the player will have to obtain it again.
This is the only Fighting Style NPC that doesn't say "It seems you already know this style. Would you like to start using it again?" when trying to switch to its fighting style.

fightingStyles.name: Electric Claw
moves: — The user executes a series of four slashes with their claws toward the cursor. The user moves a short distance forward on each click.

— The user rapidly slashes using their claws (which lasts longer if held), stunning the enemy, and then dashing forward, creating electric sparks, which also deal damage. This ability also causes the user to dash farther if held.

— The user dashes forward where the cursor points. If the player touches the enemy, the player will push the enemy like a spear and then the player will make an electric explosion that deals high damage, as well as leaving the ground scorched with a blue electric pattern. After holding this skill for two seconds, a sound similar to Lightning's [F] move regenerating will play. After releasing the attack, the distance traveled will be twice as far as just pressing the button. (This does not give any effect on the damage.)

— The user dashes forward at their target at blinding speeds six times and then smashes them onto the ground, leaving the ground scorched with a blue electric pattern and bouncing the opponent into the air, stunning them for about seconds. This move is also amazing for opening combos. Its movements are described to be akin to lightning ripping through the air.
trivia: Somehow, the damage dealt to Sea Beasts with [Z] Electric Rampage is measly. (Probably because only the final slashes are counted as physical attacks, and it deals most of damage)

The player can use Flash Step while triggering [Z] Electric Rampage or [C] Thunderclap and Flash (only for mobile users) by pressing Flash Step first, then pressing "Use" [C] Thunderclap and Flash. This can be used for surprising enemies.

Players can turn Electric Claw's M1's to something useful. Using an auto clicker and setting the click interval to one millisecond, players can glide because the M1's of this fighting style has a short dash. This is similar to Dragon Talon.
If the player turns on the damage counter before using [X] Lightning Thrust, the damage counter will say 0 damage before it creates the explosion.
If [X] Lightning Thrust is held down long enough, (approximately 30 seconds) the electrical effects and sound will stop but nothing else changes.
[X] Lightning Thrust can sometimes launch the user very far away if they have a low-end PC or high ping, making it great for traveling and running.
Sometimes, [X] Lightning Thrust can glitch the user under an island and into the water in raids. (Usually when their ping is high.)
[C] Thunderclap and Flash sometimes glitches the user into the sea, killing them. The reason is unknown.
[C] Thunderclap and Flash can glitch the user under islands like Tiki Outpost and Sea of Treats.
The [X] Lighting Thrust move is the same sound as when Piranhas use their shocks.
The Electric Claw is the only Fighting Style that has a model just like Guns and Swords.
With enough lag, [Z] Electric Rampage cannot teleport the user.

fightingStyles.name: Previous Hero
trivia: If the player has a friend, their friend can use Love's [F] to carry the player to the Mansion whilst they still have the dialogue active. Although, this method is  mostly useless due to the fact that this is not any more legitimate than setting their home point at the Mansion or even using Portal's [C] move (World Warp).

Can be held to increase dash distance.

If this projectile collides with a surface or reaches its maximum distance, it will explode, dealing great damage. The explosion leaves flames on the ground that deal damage over time.
Can be maneuvered using the cursor after release.

— The user lights their hand on fire and dashes towards the cursor. If the user collides with an enemy, the user will grab them and force-light their flames that turn from orange to blue inside of the enemy. With its upgraded version; and if the enemy's health is low enough to be killed with Talon Lighter, the player will perform a finisher with a flurry of fire punches at the enemy and a roundhouse kick, killing them. It will always be an instant one shot if it is used like this. This move is somewhat similar to Godhuman's Z move.

— The user jumps into the sky then after up to 5 and a half seconds comes crashing down dealing an AoE explosion, the explosion deals massive damage and heavy knockback to anyone within the range of the explosion. Additionally, the move turns the screen orange during the attack. When upgraded, it will stun enemies that are near the range at the start of the move.
trivia: Dragon Talon is the fighting style with the highest M1 damage in the game.
The sound of Dragon Talon's [Z] move when it misses is the same as the sound of the Yama [Z] move when it misses.
Dragon Talon's M1 sound effects originated from Dragon Breath's fire-based M1s, it being a predecessor to this fighting style.

Many people think Dragon Talon's [Z] move is the only move in the game with a finisher variant, although this is actually wrong. Shadow's [C] Nightmare Leech also has a finisher variant, and the reason people don't notice is because the finisher only slightly changes the move.

The finisher variant of [Z] Talon Lighter is a guaranteed kill—bypassing all forms of resurrection (like Ghost's and Pain's Resurrection passives, but also Friendly PvP's revive), defense (like Shark V3 and Cyborg V3), healing (like Phoenix's [X] and Angel V3), and instinct-tricking.
Dragon Talon's M1s release a mark that looks like a dragon's footprint.
When the user uses [Z] Talon Lighter, they will see a faint image of a dragon head as they dash.
When the user uses [X]Ember Annihilation at a thin wall like the Ice Castle's wall, they will have a slight chance of phasing through the wall.
[C] Infernal Vortex resembles Transformed Eastern Dragon's [X], as the user holds the enemy in place, jumps up, then slams down with devastating force.
Dragon Talon is the first V2 Fighting Style to be able to be upgraded, followed by Sharkman Karate.

fightingStyles.name: Uzoth
trivia: The NPC is actually based on an Admin/YouTuber, which is Uzoth.
The player does not need to have Dragon Breath equipped to give the Fire Essence to Uzoth.
Even if the player lacks   3,000,000 and   5,000, they can still give the Fire Essence to Uzoth and buy Dragon Talon later without requiring another Fire Essence.
If the player gives Uzoth the Fire Essence, but does not have 400+ mastery on Dragon Breath, then he will say: "Thanks for the fire essence, but I cannot teach you anything yet!"
Uzoth is the only fighting style teacher that can give and upgrade a fighting style.
Uzoth is the first NPC to be moved. His previous location was at a giant gear at Haunted Castle.
Uzoth is the first NPC to be able to upgrade a V2 Fighting Style, the second being the Sharkman Master.

fightingStyles.name: Fire Essence
trivia: The Fire Essence is often confused with Hallow Essence due to its similar model and name.

fightingStyles.name: Godhuman
moves:
If tapped:
The user releases a swift gust of wind that travels rapidly. Upon contact with an enemy or at maximum range, the wind explodes and launches the target upward while dealing damage.
The user releases a swift gust of wind that travels rapidly. Upon contact with an enemy or at maximum range, the wind explodes and launches the target upward while dealing damage.

If held:
The user generates a massive whirlwind around themselves, gradually expanding in size. After holding the attack for 3 seconds, the user claps their hands, unleashing a powerful shockwave into the air. The damage and range of the shockwave increase the longer the attack is held. If executed on the ground, it leaves behind a trail of upturned debris. Unlike Superhuman, this attack can hit enemies above and below the user.

This barrage ends with a punch that delivers brief knockback. During the move, the user is invulnerable to attacks. Additionally, the screen momentarily darkens during the last punch.
Notably, the move inflicts greater damage when executed at close proximity to the target and has the ability to break the opponent's instinct at point blank range.

trivia: Godhuman costs   5,000,000,   5,000, and will cost   20,400,000,   26,500 and 3,600 combined masteries from 400 each on all Fighting Styles except Combat and Sanguine Art.
Godhuman is the only fighting style to have 2 moves with tap/held variants, with them being [X] Heaven and Earth and [C] Sixth Realm Gun.
Godhuman is considered the most tedious Fighting Style to obtain to most players, due to it requiring almost every fighting style in the game at 400 mastery along with the hard-to-obtain materials.
Godhuman's [TAP] Normal Attack leaves a rainbow trail for a split second, just like how Instinct V2 leaves a trail when enabled.
Like Superhuman, the M1s make a shockwave of compressed air and have a small trail behind when used, Godhuman's being more prominent.

[Z] Soaring Beast and [C] Sixth Realm Gun will cause the player to take water damage if their target is below water, so be wary. (Unless the player is using the Shark race or the user is not using a Blox Fruit.)
[Z] Soaring Beast and [C] Sixth Realm Gun can allow the player to grab an enemy through a thin wall if their target is close to the wall.
Godhuman is commonly abbreviated as 'GH'.
Godhuman is a very versatile and popular fighting style for bounty hunting, and many people use it.

Godhuman's [Z] Soaring Beast and [C] Sixth Realm Gun tap variants (as Godhuman's [C] Sixth Realm Gun (held) breaks Instinct) themselves are easily "instinct-trickable". It is recommended to use an ability to break or wear off Instinct beforehand, like Cyborg's V3 or Godhuman's [X] Heaven and Earth.

fightingStyles.name: Ancient Monk
trivia: Due to how hard it is to get, it is recommended to start grinding for Godhuman early in the game by getting mastery on the fighting styles necessary shown above and gathering the materials needed.
If the player does not meet the requirements, the Ancient Monk will say "Come back when you are prepared enough."
When talking to the Ancient Monk while reaching the requirements, he will say that Godhuman has four special skills (including the [X] move tap and held).

fightingStyles.name: Fish Tail
trivia: A total of  99  is required to upgrade/obtain everything that requires this material.

fightingStyles.name: Dragon Scale
trivia: Dragon Scales are considered extremely difficult to obtain since the enemies are extremely few or far apart. Even with Buddha or Dragon, it is still hard to farm due to massive land elevation and nearly having zero destructible physics decorations. It is recommended to use awakened Quake's [V] Seaquake for AFK farming since it is one of the only abilities that could hit all enemies.
A total of  124  Dragon Scales are required to acquire to buy or upgrade everything that requires this material. ( 223  if including the Triple Dark Blade.)

fightingStyles.name: Mystic Droplet
trivia: A total of  102  Mystic Droplets is required to buy everything that requires this material.
The Mystic Droplet can be obtained in the Third Sea through enemies that spawn in the Pirate Raid.

The Sharp claws will push enemies back.

The Sharp claws will push enemies back.

It also splits into more "Leeches" based on how many enemies are getting hit. This skill can disable the enemy's Dashes, Flash Step, and moves for ~1,2 seconds. If stunning enemies in the air, it will increase stun duration by ~0,2%.

If there’s no one within its range, then the ball will simply dissipate.

The small explosion and the large projectile both can break Instinct.

— The user summons dark energy that has moderate range, first doing a slash to the left with right hand, a slash to the right with left hand, then doing a double slash with both hands, ending with a forward blast of darkness. The click speed is very fast, similar to Water Kung Fu's. If it is paired with Buddha, it will have greatly increased range.

— The user propels themself towards the cursor and then immediately grabs the enemy by the neck. If it hits, it unleashes bat-like creatures on target that heal the player as they deal damage. If it doesn’t hit, then the user will travel a short-medium distance. When hit, it ignores defensive buffs.
This move heals 20% of the user's health when hit. This healing does not depend on the amount of damage the user deals ‐ it heals based on the MAX health the user has. This move is similar to Shadow's [C] ability.

— The user launches six slashes towards the cursor (Similar to transformed West Dragon X or the third M1 in the dragon untransformed M1 combo), leaving claw marks on the surrounding floor or walls in front of the user. Explodes into a scarlet burst at the end. Does greater damage when used from a certain distance. 
If aimed at the ground, while an enemy is far:

The burst will bounce enemies back towards user.
If aimed at the ground, while an enemy is close:

The Sharp claws will push enemies back.
