trivia: The first part of the name "Sanguine Art" comes from the Latin word for blood, sanguis.

Sanguine Art is the first fighting style to have a life-stealing move. ([Z] move - Bloodbane Drain)
Likewise, the bats can damage large objects (Such as Sea Beasts), but it does not restore the user's health or grab.
Additionally, this move features aim assist that enables the user to grab enemies within the attack path directly ahead, provided they are at a close enough distance. This effectively extends the range for grabbing enemies to approximately 1.6 times farther along the straight line in front of the move.
Likewise, the bats can damage large objects (Such as Sea Beasts), but it does not restore the user's health or grab.

Additionally, this move features aim assist that enables the user to grab enemies within the attack path directly ahead, provided they are at a close enough distance. This effectively extends the range for grabbing enemies to approximately 1.6 times farther along the straight line in front of the move.

The [C] move is a multi-target move, meaning it can grab multiple targets at the same time if directly used.
Even if it misses, it can still track multiple enemies.
Even if it misses, it can still track multiple enemies.
Sanguine Art is the fighting style with the fastest M1 speed.
Sanguine Art is the fighting style with the highest [C] move damage in the game.
The player is not required to have mastery on any other fighting style to learn Sanguine Art. It is possible to learn even if the user is still using Combat.
Haunted Crew Member and the Red Commander the only enemy in the game that uses this fighting style
If combining Skull Guitar's [X] move, Ghoul Mask, Ghoul V4 Blood Siphon (tier 2), night time, and using the [Z] move, the player's life-leech can reach ~47-50%.
Sanguine Art, alongside Combat, are the only fighting styles without an upgraded version of them.
If the player has a Leviathan Heart and interact with Shafi, their materials (if they have them) will be consumed automatically, even if they didn't wish to.
There is a glitch where after using [C] Devourer of Worlds, the user will be stuck in the move stance. This can be undone by using the [C] move again.

fightingStyles.name: Shafi
trivia: Shafi is based on ShafiDev, a developer of Blox Fruits.

fightingStyles.name: Dark Fragment
trivia: A total of  9  is required to craft, purchase, or upgrade everything that requires the Dark Fragment ( 34  if the Triple Dark Blade is included).

fightingStyles.name: Demonic Wisp
trivia: A total of  38  Demonic Wisps are required to buy everything that requires this material. (Excluding Abyssal Bait.)

fightingStyles.name: Vampire Fang
trivia: The Vampire Fang is considered as one of the most annoying and difficult materials to obtain, having an extremely low drop chance, despite being dropped from only one NPC.
A total of  74  Vampire Fangs is required to buy and upgrade everything that needs this material.

fightingStyles.name: Leviathan Heart
trivia: A total of  2  are required to be used to purchase, upgrade and unlock everything that requires the Leviathan Heart, excluding the Mythical Scroll, because it can be crafted multiple times.
If the player who bought the Beast Hunter leaves the game or buys another one after harpooning the Leviathan Heart, the heart will despawn.
If the player proceeds to sail to Sea Danger Level 6 after harpooning the Leviathan Heart, the mist effect will not occur.

fightingStyles.name: Pirate Village
trivia: Most players in First Sea often go chest hunting on Pirate Village due to the amount of chests that can be found there.
All of the enemies use swords, so it is recommended to use Blade because of its sword immunity.

fightingStyles.name: Skylands
trivia: The Skylands are a group of islands with the second highest amount of separate landmasses, beaten out only by the Sea of Treats, which has five islands.
Since Update 17.2, the Skylands (excluding the Upper Skylands) now connect with each other with bridges. The player no longer needs to Fly or Air Jump up there.
It is recommended to skip the Sky Bandits quest by server hopping Vice Admiral at Marine Fortress.
Until Update 24, the player could fly through Hoops to change their appearance if they were using the Dragon (Classic) fruit.

fightingStyles.name: Underwater City
trivia: All enemies in the Underwater City drop Fish Tails with a low chance.
It is the first island that needs to have completed a task to enter.
The Underwater City is the first island where the player must be multiple levels higher than the enemies in order for Elemental immunity to activate.
There are three gold chests and one diamond chest in the Underwater City.
It is possible to get to the Underwater City without going through the whirlpool by using a flight ability to eventually find the island way off in the distance.

The Underwater City is one of seven islands to contain a Portal, the others being Castle on the Sea, Hydra Island, Kingdom of Rose, Cursed Ship, Skylands/Upper Skylands, and Floating Turtle; however, this island uses a completely different system and model for the portals.

The Underwater City is the only island to be supposedly located underwater. Even though it is depicted as being "Underwater", the player can see a round shaped island (dome/atmosphere) really far away from the islands overwater. The player can also access outside the dome by finding a gap in the invisible wall near the Fisherman Commandos, and swim towards the shell of the dome. The dome does not collide with the player so they can walk through it. The exterior view of the underwater cityUnderwater city seen at the Whirlpool Docks, the entrance to it.Outside the underwater city.

Even though it is depicted as being "Underwater", the player can see a round shaped island (dome/atmosphere) really far away from the islands overwater. The player can also access outside the dome by finding a gap in the invisible wall near the Fisherman Commandos, and swim towards the shell of the dome. The dome does not collide with the player so they can walk through it. The exterior view of the underwater cityUnderwater city seen at the Whirlpool Docks, the entrance to it.Outside the underwater city.

fightingStyles.name: Kingdom of Rose
trivia: One of the sections of the Bridge is the second largest object that Control can throw. It can hit players from the bridge to the Café.
The Kingdom of Rose is currently the largest island in the game.
There is a tree that has white leaves where the Swan Pirates spawn.

fightingStyles.name: Snow Mountain
trivia:
The player can destroy the bridge when using a Destructible Physics move.
The player cannot cross the bridge while having Dough's awakened F (Scorching Donut) or Blizzard's F (Tornado Flight) as the bridge will break from too many hits, since those attacks have continuous ticks.

The player cannot cross the bridge while having Dough's awakened F (Scorching Donut) or Blizzard's F (Tornado Flight) as the bridge will break from too many hits, since those attacks have continuous ticks.
The player can spawn a Sea Beast between the mountains; Sea Beasts can also spawn naturally there.
The Snow Mountain is hollow, so if the player angles their camera correctly, they can use Flash Step to get in.
The Snow Mountain had a Poneglyph but it was later removed in Update 13.

Control fruit is powerful at this location, being able to pick up the whole bridge and throw it, resulting in an explosion that covers the entire island. Mind that throwing the bridge could mess with the bridge's collisions, and there is a chance that the bridge could phase through the island with no explosion, although this is decently rare.

fightingStyles.name: Ice Castle
trivia: Until Update 24, the player could fly through Hoops to change their appearance if they were using the Dragon fruit.

fightingStyles.name: Forgotten Island
trivia:
The Forgotten Island has a high number of exploiters farming Water Fighters, so it is recommended to try to use codes for 2x XP to pass this island as soon as possible, or use a private server.
Due to the large number of exploiters, the Forgotten Island is also one of the best places to kill them and get lots of Bounty/Honor.
Due to the large number of exploiters, the Forgotten Island is also one of the best places to kill them and get lots of Bounty/Honor.

fightingStyles.name: Floating Turtle
trivia: Floating Turtle is the largest island in Third Sea and the second largest island in the whole game, the largest being Kingdom of Rose.
Floating Turtle has the highest number of Elite Pirate spawn locations, with about seven locations.
Floating Turtle Island also bears the Mansion, a crucial building in the Third Sea as it holds important NPC's and one of the four Portals in the Third Sea.
Until Update 24, The player could fly through Hoops to change their appearance if they were using Dragon.
The Floating Turtle has the highest number of bosses in the game, having four.

fightingStyles.name: Hydra Island
trivia: At the Hydra Town, if the player goes to the house in front of the Hydra Town Quest Giver, they can actually enter it. However, nothing is actually inside the building.
If the player's Instinct vision range is far enough, they can see the Beautiful Pirate underneath the Hydra Leader's spawn point.
If the player performs the Flash Step glitch in the Secret Temple, they can get to the Tushita Puzzle portal and the Beautiful Pirate Domain.
There are a lot of hitbox issues in Hydra Island, most notably the "invisible wall" in the Training Dummy's area, preventing players from using moves such as Spikey Trident's [X] move.
Behind the Dragon Crew Warriors and Dragon Crew Archers, there is a weird piece of floating terrain on a tree.

fightingStyles.name: Tiki Outpost
trivia: The Tiki Outpost is the first and only island to introduce rain and cloud physics, although rain can be seen outside islands in the Rumbling Waters and Rough Sea.
The rain sound effects on the island are technically part of the background music, as muting the background music also turns off the raid sounds.
The landmass that the castle is built on is an island inside a lake inside an island, making the Tiki Outpost currently the only true recursive island in the game.
The Heaven Dimension and Hell Dimension can be found at the top of the Tiki Outpost. It can only appear when someone is doing the Cursed Dual Katana quest.

Near the Submarine Worker's location, there is a room full of bookshelves. In this room there is a ladder and behind said ladder there is a snake symbol, possibly hinting at a new race. There are also cranes with the same symbol on them.

fightingStyles.name: Mastery
trivia:
Currently, the maximum amount of mastery a fighting style, fruit, sword, or gun can have is 600.
The maximum amount of mastery for fishing rods is 100.
The maximum amount of mastery for fishing rods is 100.

The amount of EXPEXP needed per mastery is defined by this formula:
54 + ((2 * mastery ^ 2.26 + 30) * 0.5)
EXP Calculator
EXP Calculator
The total amount of EXP needed to reach mastery 600 is 348,679,374 EXP348,679,374 EXP.
Getting mastery can be doubled by using the gamepass 2x mastery.
When the player reaches MAX mastery, the item's stats is increased to 425.

fightingStyles.name: Enemies
fightingStyles.description: Enemies (also known as NPCs) can be found clustered together in certain areas, attacking the player when provoked. Defeating them is required for completing most quests, and by extension, for grinding. Some enemies utilize Aura, along Blox Fruits, fighting styles, swords, abilities or guns. They may use the moves of these weapons, or just the [M1] attacks. Most of enemies drop Money   or materials, while a few drop Fragments  .
trivia: Enemies are the main source of money, mostly from quests.

Many people often think that grinding Bosses will help players receive more Mastery. In fact, this is completely wrong. Players constantly jumping servers to grinding Bosses is slower than grinding enemies, so grinding is still the most effective and optimal method when needing a lot of Mastery.
Most enemies in Third Sea use Aura which disables Elemental fruits passive ability.
There are currently 108 enemies in the game.

fightingStyles.name: Elemental
fightingStyles.description: Elemental is one of the three classifications of Blox Fruits, alongside Natural and Beast. Elemental fruits grant the user powers tied to specific elements, allowing them to manipulate fire, ice, light, magma, and other forces of nature. There are currently 11 Elemental fruits in the game.
trivia: The Level that the player needs for Elemental Reflex to activate is set at about 2% more than their current level.
Smoke is the only common Elemental-type fruit.
Smoke, Blizzard, Lightning and Gas are the only elemental fruits without an awakening, considering that Lightning lost its awakening.
Elemental is the second largest category of Blox Fruits, ahead of Beast and behind Natural.
Uncommon has the most elemental fruits of every category.
Lightning is currently the only fully reworked Elemental fruit.
Lightning is also the only upgradable Elemental fruit via the Admin panel
Dough is notable for being the only fruit based on an artificial substance, rather than a naturally occurring one.
Gas is the only Elemental-type fruit that has a Transformation.
Gas is the most recent (and currently most expensive) Elemental fruit.
Dough is currently the most expensive Elemental fruit to awaken, costing   18,500 to fully awaken.
Magma has the most passive abilities of all Elemental fruits
Elemental fruits have the most fruits that can deal infinite damage which are Smoke, Lightning and Blizzard.
Elemental Fruits have the most fruits that are able to Awaken out of any category.

fightingStyles.name: Aura
trivia: There is no relation between sea events and Aura. Turning aura off does not make sea events spawn more often.

All swords and guns will change their color when a colored Aura is active, based on its color.
Some swords, when transformed with Buddha will not have the Aura effect.
Some swords, when transformed with Buddha will not have the Aura effect.

Light's Spear and Ice's Trident visual is affected by Aura.
The same goes for Awakened Dough's and Rubber's attacks. The user can also change the color of its moves with an Aura skin.
Awakened Spider’s [V] move also has different colors depending on the user’s aura color, and if their aura color slowly changes, the same would be for Spider’s [V] move, most likely because the move is webs covered in Aura shooting forward.
The same goes for Awakened Dough's and Rubber's attacks. The user can also change the color of its moves with an Aura skin.

Awakened Spider’s [V] move also has different colors depending on the user’s aura color, and if their aura color slowly changes, the same would be for Spider’s [V] move, most likely because the move is webs covered in Aura shooting forward.

fightingStyles.name: Instinct/Break
fightingStyles.description: Instinct breaking is the act of forcing someone out of their Instinct state. This can be achieved by attacking with specific moves.

fightingStyles.name: NPCs
fightingStyles.description: NPCs, or Non-Player Characters, are entities ingame that the player can interact with in some way. They can be found on almost every Island. They provide Quests, sell Items, or teach the player Fighting Styles.
trivia: Some NPCs are based on developers of Blox Fruit or popular Blox Fruits Youtubers.
There are currently 146 NPCs in the game.
Sometimes when joining the game, some NPCs will load slowly or stop loading costumes, making them wearing nothing.
Dog House (Indra) is the first NPC in the game.
The Arena Trainer and Horned Man are the only Quest NPCs to ever reward the players Fragments.

Blox Fruit Dealer Cousin, Norp, Wenlocktoad Over Heaven, Layandikit12, Treasure Inventory, Colors Specialist are NPCs that have been removed from the game or will not return in the future. As for Party Shop, Valentine Shop, Magic Elf, Greedy Elf, and Santa Claws NPCs can only appear during the event.
Among them, Treasure Inventory is the only NPC whose glowing circle color is purple.
Among them, Treasure Inventory is the only NPC whose glowing circle color is purple.

fightingStyles.name: Inventory
trivia: Before Update 17.3.5 players could not un-store fruits in First Sea.
The inventory was added to replace the Treasure Inventory.

fightingStyles.name: Fishing Rods
fightingStyles.description: Fishing Rods are gear that can be used for Fishing.
moves: Fishing Rod Protector: Prevents line snap once per catch. Instead, boosts progress by 30% and calms the fish.
Curse of the Leviathan: Catching a specific species may trigger an unknown event.
Curse of the Terrorshark: Start with 20% extra progress, but fish panic much faster.
Curse of the Whale: Final fish weight increases by 15%, but may consume 2 bait instead of 1.
Blessing of Bait Efficiency: 20% chance to not consume materials when crafting bait.
Blessing of an Angler’s Treasure: Increases daily treasure limit by 3. (This enchantment is bugged and currently doesn't work.)

fightingStyles.name: Fish
trivia: Giving fish to the event fisherman with max tokens will give nothing.
If the player consumes the last type of fish they have and then captures the same fish it will appear as captured for the first time even though it is not.

The player can only have 301 fish in their inventory. If they try to catch another fish with a full inventory, a message will display saying: "Your fish inventory is full! If you catch any fish, you won't be able to carry them! Release them manually or visit the Fisherman to sell them".

In the Update 27.1 trailer, Admin Uzoth is shown fishing in the pond at Dragon Dojo and catch a Dragon Koi. However, it is actually unknown where to fish for it, and what rods and baits are required for it. It is thought to be unobtainable as of now.

Fishing for making Money is not recommended as it is slow and Rarities does not matter (only weight does).
Fishing is recommended for crafting Foods and Potions, or completing Events, such as RIP Event and Red King Event.
Fishing is recommended for crafting Foods and Potions, or completing Events, such as RIP Event and Red King Event.
The higher the weight, higher the rarity. Therefore a gold fish, which weights 12kg, is a rare.

fightingStyles.name: Items
fightingStyles.description: Items are objects or weapons that can be carried in the hotbar and held or simply stored in the inventory bar.

fightingStyles.name: Consumables
fightingStyles.description: Consumables are items that can be consumed to gain special effects. They can be obtained from the campfire.

fightingStyles.name: Foods
fightingStyles.description: Foods are consumables that grants their consumer effects.

fightingStyles.name: Skins
fightingStyles.description: Skins are wearable cosmetics that change the visuals of certain abilities and transformations.
trivia:
Collecting all Legendary colors (excluding limited variants) requires   22,500,  15 ,  10 , and  15 .
Collecting all Rare colors requires   15,000,  3 ,  8 ,  3 ,  2 ,  2 ,  2 ,  2 , and  4 .
Collecting all Rare colors requires   15,000,  3 ,  8 ,  3 ,  2 ,  2 ,  2 ,  2 , and  4 .
Unlocking all aura skins requires a total cost of   37,500 or   1,830,  3 ,  8 ,  6 ,  2 ,  2 ,  25 ,  12 ,  25 ,  1000 ,  1000 , at least  15 ,  250 and  250
During Update 17.3.5, a bug occurred where the Party Hat and the Aquamarine aura color could not be equipped.

There is a known glitch where the aura color on the avatar does not exactly match the aura color on Swords, Guns or Electric Claw.
This happens when you activate an aura, then you switch to another, without reactivating.
This happens when you activate an aura, then you switch to another, without reactivating.
Equipping Rainbow Saviour causes the color cycle to stop when zooming out. The effect resumes once zooming back in.
Mythical Aura Skins, (Rainbow Saviour, Dragon, Kitsune, Oni and Celestial), are the only with shifting animations.
Before Update 24, Hoops were required to change the color of the Dragon (Classic).
After Update 24, all players who had purchased an Aura color prior to the update were automatically awarded the Hakaishin title due to a glitch.
Three Blox Fruits currently have attacks that change color depending on the equipped aura color: Rubber, Spider, and Dough.
Skins for Portal are already listed in the Barista Menu but are not yet craftable. They are planned for release in a future update.

stats.Notes: Currently having 2750 stat levels on Gun, Sword, and Blox Fruit stats will give an 88.4x multiplier. Each stat level adds a x1.0346759259 (3.46759259%) buff.

fightingStyles.name: Levels
trivia: Uzoth reached Lv. 2550 (the max level for Update 20)  in just 7 minutes and 45.92 seconds.

It would take around 23 years of non-stop playing to reach Lv. 2750 by doing only Bandit or Trainee quests every three seconds. The player would need to grind the quest 375,909,459 times and need 112,772,837,596 EXPEXP total.

fightingStyles.name: Health
fightingStyles.description: Health (also known as HP, hit points, health points) is a fundamental feature in Blox Fruits. Once a player has zero health, they will die and respawn a few seconds later , with the exception of the Ghost and Pain fruits which can resurrect you one time before you can be killed. The more health the player has, the more durable they will be from other attacks. Health deduction can be reduced by activating Aura. Full body Aura reduces damage taken by 30% before subtracting it from the player's health. Health scales off the current Defense stat, with 5 HP being added for each stat point put, the amount of health one has can be measured by using the following equation:
trivia:
The max health a player can have is 16512. It can be obtained by having 2750 Defense point stats and using the Leviathan Shield accessory, and having at least Draco v3. With no accessories or buffs, the max amount of health would be 13845.
20483 when using the Leviathan Shield accessory and Shark V4's (upgraded) Leviathan Armor ability.
With just the Leviathan Shield accessory, the max health would be 14845.
20483 when using the Leviathan Shield accessory and Shark V4's (upgraded) Leviathan Armor ability.
With just the Leviathan Shield accessory, the max health would be 14845.
Leviathan Crown, Pilot Helmet, Kitsune Ribbon, Lei and Feathered Visage (dropped from the 'Tyrant of the Skies' Raid Boss) are the only accessories that increase health regeneration speed.

Players can get the following two Titles in Second or Third Sea for losing health:
The Undefeated One (#080): Receive damage from a player and survive with less than 50 HP left
Immortal Being (#081): Receive damage from a player and survive with 1 HP left
The Undefeated One (#080): Receive damage from a player and survive with less than 50 HP left
Immortal Being (#081): Receive damage from a player and survive with 1 HP left
Every time the player levels up or completes a quest with low health and/or energy, their health and energy will automatically be restored unless the player is in combat.

The [F] (mobility) moves of Flame, Ice, Spider, Light and Eagle go faster with the higher Health the player has.
Opposite to that, the [F] (mobility) moves of Blade, Sound and Venom move go faster the lower the Health the player has.
Opposite to that, the [F] (mobility) moves of Blade, Sound and Venom move go faster the lower the Health the player has.
Bomb's [V] move exchanges the player's health for damage.

fightingStyles.name: Energy
fightingStyles.description: Energy is a fundamental feature in Blox Fruits. Once a player has zero energy, they have to wait until their energy bar is no longer empty or else the player cannot dash or use certain moves. It is essential for performing most actions in Blox Fruits, such as using moves, dodges, Air Jumps, Flash Steps, and others. Energy scales off the current Melee stat, with 5 Energy being added for each stat point allocated. The amount of energy one has can be measured by using the following equation:
trivia: The regeneration of energy scales with the players stats, being faster the higher their energy stats are. (2x faster on the ground)
One dash consumes 30 energy (unless the player is using the Rabbit race, which allows only 15 energy to be consumed).

The max amount of energy a player can have is 17930, with 2750 stat points in Melee, using the Kitsune Ribbon accessory, whilst being in an awakened form of their race. With no accessories or buffs, the max energy would be 13845. With just the Kitsune Ribbon accessory, it would be 16345.

Trying to use a move that requires more energy than the player currently has will make a message appear saying "Low energy! [Amount of energy the move requires] energy required." and the move will not activate.

Normal M1 attacks, such as kicking, punching, swinging a sword, firing a gun, using abilities such as the V3/V4 of a Race, Summon Sea Beast, and Admin Abilities will not drain energy.
The only exceptions are Skull Guitar, Rubber, Dough (V2), Phoenix (V2)'s M1 and Diamond M1.
The only exceptions are Skull Guitar, Rubber, Dough (V2), Phoenix (V2)'s M1 and Diamond M1.
Other players' and enemies' energy bars can be seen by using Instinct and Instinct V2
The Masterpiece enchantment can remove the energy cost for the attacks of the item it is on.
If the player completely runs out of energy, they are given the title “Empty Vessel” (#067).  It is recommended to use Phoenix's [X] move for the most efficient energy drain.

fightingStyles.name: Quests
trivia: The Forgotten Quest Giver and the Kingdom of Rose Area 2 Quest Giver have a similar appearance.
There are two Mole Quest Givers. One is located near the Skylands next to the temple that teleports to the Upper Skylands. The other is found in the Upper Skyland itself.
The Deep Forest Quest Giver 1 looks similar to the Tiki Quest Giver 2.
Most quest givers have a yellow exclamation mark on above or even behind them, which makes it easier to find them while searching.
The Arena quest giver is the only quest giver that rewards the player with   fragments.
There is currently a total of 116 quests in the game (including side quests).

fightingStyles.name: Sea Events
trivia: Some Sea Events can spawn with another Sea Events, but this is very rare. For example, Mirage Island with a Rumbling Waters and a Terrorshark, making it a heavily guarded Island.
After the players' boat gets destroyed whilst exploring danger levels, the meter for it will be gone, unless another boat is nearby.
Though very rare, Sea Events such as Sharks can spawn in Sea Danger Level 0 outside of Tiki Outpost.

fightingStyles.name: Allying
trivia: There was a glitch where if the user is a Marine and joins the Pirates team through the Pirate Recruiter, the ally button will disappear.
Allied players can only be damaged with Meme.

Allying is the only way for the player to ride a Love user's flamingo, a transformed Kitsune or a transformed Dragon with Strong Hair/Saddle. To get teleported by Portal's [C] World Warp without getting allied, the player needs to be outside safe zone. (The player can also get teleported if both are in combat in safe zone.)

fightingStyles.name: Abilities
fightingStyles.description: Abilities are various unique effects and bonuses that the player can learn and use to gain advantages in Blox Fruits.

fightingStyles.name: Damage Counter
trivia: Currently, the YouTuber/admin Uzoth is the record holder for the greatest amount of damage the game has ever recorded, at 988 septillion (9.88 x 10²⁶). The video can be found here.
The most amount of damage done by a non-admin player is imFiji, with 127,518,285. The video can be found here.

fightingStyles.name: Fast Mode
fightingStyles.description: Fast mode is a mode that reduces lag for Blox Fruits on devices. It works by removing the textures in models, making all parts have a smooth plastic texture. It normally takes around 20 seconds to completely execute, and the player can still play during the execution time. However, on some devices, it could take longer.
trivia: Fast mode can be used for finding the hidden texts on the trading tables at mansion. It could still be found without fast mode but using it makes it easier.
Fast mode does not change a lot of FPS in heavy/powerful devices such as PCs or gaming tablets/phones, but it is recommended if the player has a weak phone, old computer.
Some V3 or V4 abilities might not show up. An example for it is the Cyborg V3 ability where the player does not see the particles but they still receive the buffs.

Since update 24, there's a bug where turning on Fast Mode on the menu before choosing a team doesn't fully disable all textures in the game, and the Fast Mode button through the Settings appears as if it wasn't even turned on at all.
This is especially noticeable in the Third Sea, as far areas like Temple of Time may appear fully/partially textured, even when Fast Mode was turned on beforehand. (In this case, turning on Fast Mode through the Settings while being in the Temple of Time will fix this issue.)

This is especially noticeable in the Third Sea, as far areas like Temple of Time may appear fully/partially textured, even when Fast Mode was turned on beforehand. (In this case, turning on Fast Mode through the Settings while being in the Temple of Time will fix this issue.)

fightingStyles.name: Upgrading
trivia: Upon upgrading an item, a white star will appear at the top left corner of the item in the player's inventory.

In order for the player to upgrade every single weapon from the First Sea, they have to be at least in the Third Sea because of Soul Cane, Pole (1st Form), and Saber needing Radioactive Material, and Bazooka needing Dragon Scales.

In total, to upgrade every weapon (excluding Triple Dark Blade), a player would need exactly:
 800  Bones
 432  Scrap Metals
 399  Leathers
 149  Magma Ores
 104  Dragon Scales
 79  Angel Wings
 79  Fish Tails
 69  Mystic Droplets

 40  Ectoplasms
 30  Radioactive Materials
 18  Demonic Wisps
 16  Conjured Cocoas
 10  Azure Embers
 10  Blaze Embers
 5  Dark Fragments
 4  Meteorites

432  Scrap Metals

10  Blaze Embers
5  Dark Fragments
4  Meteorites
Weapons that are obtained in the First Sea have a higher upgrade output than those in the Second or Third Sea, which might be due to the betterment of weapons as the player progresses through seas.

fightingStyles.name: Safe Zone
trivia: If the player is already in Combat with another player, the Safe Zone will not protect the player from that person until their Combat indicator disappears. This is to prevent players immediately running to a Safe Zone when losing in PvP or when getting attacked.

The first location of every sea is a safe zone (e.g Pirate/Marine Starter, Kingdom of Rose Docks and Port Town Docks). This is to prevent the player getting attacked immediately while they are spawning in.
The Safe Zone has a delay of about one second before it activates. That means it is possible to be attacked when the player first joins the game.
There is a glitch where after dying in combat the player can be attacked even in a safe zone if other player's combat is still on.
The safe zone near the Blox Fruit Gacha in Jungle was added in Update 20.
The player's speed gets slower by roughly 37.5% whenever they enter a safe zone.

Now in Update 24, if the player is on a private server and the PvP mode is set to "Friendly PvP", the player can be attacked anytime even on Safe Zone places, but they can't lose honor/bounty if they die to another player (that player also can't get honor/bounty).

fightingStyles.name: Titles
fightingStyles.description: Titles are labels that appear next to the player's name when they speak in the Roblox chat.
trivia: “Sugar Rush”, “Christmas Spirit” and “Loco Verde” were only available during the Presents event.
The titles "Death King" and "Undead Lord" are only available during Halloween events.
There was a glitch where upon killing the Leviathan’s head, the title was not awarded. This has recently been fixed.
There is a glitch where if the player is the last person standing in a raid and run out of time, they will still receive the "Last Hope" title.
Unlocking the Rainbow Saviour Aura Color without unlocking any other Aura Colors will wrongfully award the player the "The Collector" title.
Getting the Kitsune Aura skin does not unlock the "The Enhancer" title.
Blox Fruits Staff members who can drop the "Equal to the Heavens" title cannot turn it off unlike normal YouTuber titles.
The "Hakaishin" title #147 means "God of Destruction" in Japanese.
The "Loco Verde" title #156 means "Crazy Green" in Spanish.
The "Shinigami" title #169 means "Soul Reaper" or "God of Death" in Japanese.
Uzoth's title, "Doragontarontorēnā", is a Japanese anglicism which means "dragon talon trainer", likely a reference to the NPC that sells Dragon Talon being based off him.
The "LA FLEUR DU MAL 悪の華" title means "THE FLOWER OF EVIL (French), before Flower of Evil (Japanese)."

fightingStyles.name: Wanted Posters
trivia: If the player is alone in a server as a Pirate, all the posters will only have them displayed, if  there aren't any pirates in the server the wanted posters will not spawn at all.
Upon completion of the quest, the message "<QUEST COMPLETED> Earned   " will appear.
Unlike the Player Hunter, the player can choose whoever they want to hunt down.
Unlike the Player Hunter, kills with quests from wanted posters don't count and don't give exp.
If the target's level has max level, the reward will be stuck at   50,000.
Every couple of minutes the wanted posters will change and the quest will disappear.
If the player dies, the wanted poster will change to another player.

fightingStyles.name: Pictures
trivia: Some pictures do not have official names.
There is a glitch with the pictures "Staff Photo" and "Dragon Talon Trainer" where they fail to load and appear blank. This could possibly be due to a bug or Roblox deleted them.

fightingStyles.name: Sea Exploration Group
trivia: Sea Exploration Group appears only in the Third Sea.
The 20 required sea events for Frozen Dimension include only those that spawn enemies. Events like islands, Haunted Shipwrecks, or Rough Seas do not count.

fightingStyles.name: Experience
trivia: EXPEXP is currently the most abundant quantity in the game, easily reaching into the hundreds of millions for a single level, while other Stats and currencies are rarely seen above ten million.
Roblox Premium allows the user to gain more experience on a quest/kill than a normal player.
It took Uzoth 7 minutes and 45.92 seconds to reach Update 20's MAX level (2550).
The amount of EXPEXP needed per level is defined by [2 x Level^2.3 + 84] = EXP to level up.
It takes a total of 119,938,274,162 EXP119,938,274,162 EXP to reach level 2650.

fightingStyles.name: Gifting
trivia: Game passes can be stored in the inventory (by "gifting" their inventory), allowing them to be traded (excluding the Respawn Bosses and Change Race game passes).

fightingStyles.name: Update Log
fightingStyles.description: The Update Log is a feature in Blox Fruits that lets players see the planned upcoming updates. It can be accessed by clicking on "Settings", then on "Open Log".

fightingStyles.name: Campfire
fightingStyles.description: The campfire can be crafted through the user's inventory by using one Wooden Plank. It allows the player to craft Potions and other consumables using unlocked recipes, obtained from the Note in a Bottle through fishing.
trivia: Campfires can be available for beginners since wooden planks can be obtained with a lower chance without Shipwright subclass as of Update 27.
When the campfire is going to disappear, you will be notified, saying "Your campfire's flames have been extinguished..." a few seconds before it disappears.
Other players can use your campfire, and so can can you.
If you open the Craft Menu, then walk away from the campfire, the Craft Menu will disappear.
There are currently only 6 available recipes as of Updates/27.1.
The player need 18 Fishes (1 Rare, 4 Uncommon And 13 Common), 1 Leather, 1 Scrap Metal, and 1 Fish Tail to craft every recipe once.
The Player can craft a Fish Kebab, Lava Potion, Aggro Elixir, Loot Seeker, Berserkers Elixir, and Fortune Elixir.
Monk Potion, Invisibility Potion, and Oni Soul potions were limited to Oni Campfire.

fightingStyles.name: Valor
trivia: Valor is currently the only currency that is exclusively obtainable in the Third Sea.
It takes a total of   17,300 and   12,800 to unlock and fully level up all the abilities.

fightingStyles.name: Rules
fightingStyles.description: Thank you for coming to the Blox Fruits Wiki. We have rules set in place to make this place as friendly as possible. Discussion/post rules can be found here, it's probably best that you read those as well.

fightingStyles.name: Wiki Staff Page
fightingStyles.description: Information on the roles and permissions that these users possess can be found at the Roles page.

stats.Senbo to Kami100:
Fandom: Senbo to Kami
Discord: enVi#7952

fightingStyles.name: Manual of Style
fightingStyles.description: Hi, and welcome to the Blox Fruits Wiki. This page is a manual, complete with guidelines and etiquette when editing/creating basic articles on this wiki. This page is a standard that you should seriously consider following, so that people know how and what to edit.

fightingStyles.name: History of Stock
fightingStyles.description: This page is dedicated to writing down the "Stock" of every month, going as far back as December of 2020. Current stock can be seen on the Blox Fruits "Stock" page.

fightingStyles.name: History of Stock/Year
fightingStyles.description: This is the Blox Fruits Stock History, going as far back as December of 2020.

fightingStyles.name: Natural
fightingStyles.description: Natural is one of the three classifications of Blox Fruits, alongside Elemental and Beast. Natural fruits grant the user a wide variety of powers that do not fall strictly into elemental control or beast transformations. These abilities are often considered “superpower” types, ranging from gravity manipulation and string control to barrier creation and sound waves. There are currently 24 Natural fruits in the game.
trivia: Natural-type Blox Fruits are not any different from other fruits; it is only a classification, unlike Elemental fruits, which provide the user with immunity to physical attacks.

fightingStyles.name: Beast
fightingStyles.description: Beast is one of the three main classifications of Blox Fruits, alongside Natural and Elemental. Beast fruits allow the user to transform into powerful animals, mythological creatures, or divine beings, granting abilities that reflect the nature of the form they take. These fruits are often defined by their transformative power, enhanced mobility, and overwhelming presence in combat. There are currently 9 Beast fruits in the game.
trivia: Despite Venom, Rubber, and Diamond having a transformation, they are currently considered Natural fruits. Gas is currently an Elemental fruit, despite it having a transformation.
There are currently no Common or Rare Beast fruits in the game.
Beast fruits make up the highest amount of Mythical fruits in the game.
Every beast fruit except Eagle has a full transformation.
Only 2 Beast-type fruits have an awakening, those fruits being Phoenix and Buddha.

Spider is not a beast fruit. Despite the fact that it has changed its name, it has not changed its type: it is a Natural fruit. It is also because that the Spider fruit allows the user to control strings instead of turning them into a spider (because it used to be the String Fruit).
Mammoth and T-Rex cost the same amount of Money and have the same Permanent Value. Leopard and Yeti now share these too.
Eagle is currently the cheapest and least rare of all the Beast-type fruits in the game.
Dragon is the most expensive Beast-type Blox Fruit, costing   15,000,000, as well as being the most expensive Blox Fruit.
Buddha is the only Beast fruit that needs to have its transformation active to be able to use its moves.
Awakened Buddha, Phoenix, T-Rex and Dragon are the only Beast fruits to have a transformation move that is not named "Transformation".
As of Update 26, Eagle is the newest beast fruit in the game.
There are currently 8 beast fruits that have an M1 (left click), these fruits are: Dragon, Kitsune, Yeti, Leopard, T-Rex, Mammoth, Awakened Phoenix and Eagle.

Many of the Beast fruits do not allow the user to use their Fighting Styles, Swords or Guns while transformed except for Buddha and Dragon (Hybrid).
Eagle technically does not have a transformation, but the user is able to yield weapons while flying.
Eagle technically does not have a transformation, but the user is able to yield weapons while flying.
As of Update 26, Eagle and Dragon are the only beast fruits that have usable skins.
Beast has the least number of Blox Fruits, after Elemental with 11 and Natrual with 21.

fightingStyles.name: Permanent Blox Fruits
fightingStyles.description: Permanent Blox Fruits are Blox Fruits purchased through the Blox Fruit Dealer or the Shop menu. They may be obtained at any time, in any sea via Robux   or through gifting. When purchasing a Permanent Fruit, players have the option to gift to others, causing immediate activation on the receiving end, or to store the fruit in the Inventory, allowing the fruit to be traded at a later date. Permanent Fruits in the Inventory will be assigned the Premium rarity regardless of price.
trivia: With the release of revamped fruits, Permanent Fruit prices changed, with the most notable being Bomb, Spike, Rocket, and Spin.
Dragon had the most drastic change in price, spiking up from   2,600 to   5,000 (a 92.3% increase).
In older updates, Permanent Fruits were the only reliable way to own multiple fruits at once, as the Fruit Storage gamepass was not yet available.
The total cost of every Permanent Fruit is   68,880.
Permanent Fruits are generally known as Perm Fruits or Perms.
Permanent Fruits can be bought from the Dealer even when not in stock.

fightingStyles.name: Rarities
fightingStyles.description: Most items that are found in Blox Fruits are given a rarity, which is indicated by a tag of colored text. They are applied to Blox Fruits, swords, guns, accessories, materials, scrolls, fishing rods, and various paid items.

fightingStyles.name: Common
trivia: The carp is the lightest of all common fish (19kg).
The heaviest fish is the Grouper (44kg).

fightingStyles.name: Legendary
trivia: Beast Hunter is the only boat to have a rarity.

fightingStyles.name: Premium
fightingStyles.description: Premium is a special rarity for paid items in the inventory.

fightingStyles.name: Private Servers
fightingStyles.description: Private servers are an integrated part of Roblox that Blox Fruits uses. They can be purchased for   200 which renews every 30 days for the same price.
trivia: Only 2 fruits can spawn inside of a private server since its start.
Bosses will not immediately spawn at the start of a server. They'll instead spawn when their respawn period is over.
Upon start, servers start on a half moon, with the sun halfway in the sky.
The Player Hunter will refuse to give the player a quest while in a private server, stating "Sorry, you must join a public server for PvP tasks."
Inside private servers, the build limit of the Creation Fruit increases from 40 to 189.

fightingStyles.name: Server Browser
trivia: Server names use the old version of fruit names. For example, a server may be named "Weak Soul", despite the fact that it was renamed to Spirit.
Server names can also contain usernames of developers, like "Large TAWG", which was one of mygame43's previous usernames.
Some servers like England, Hong Kong, etc. have been removed.
The Server Browser button can also be a circle with no text.

fightingStyles.name: System Messages
fightingStyles.description: System Messages are notifications of specific events such as the spawning of Raid Bosses, high-bounty player joins, questline quotes, event messages, etc.
trivia: When the Stored <Sword> message appears, instead of Stored Fox Lamp , it shows the words of another sword. It can even display swords that users do not own or already own, or admin-exclusive swords like Triple Dark Blade.

fightingStyles.name: Soundtracks
fightingStyles.description: Soundtracks are an indispensable part of every game. Blox Fruits has many soundtracks, these soundtracks in game all contribute to increasing highlights in certain locations, creating atmosphere or sometimes improving the experience.

fightingStyles.name: Codes
fightingStyles.description: Codes can be redeemed by clicking the  icon on the bottom left side of the player's screen and entering the code.

guns.name: Blox Fruits
trivia: It would cost   68,880 to buy every permanent fruit, and   84,432,500 to buy every fruit from the Blox Fruit Dealer.

Most bosses use the older versions of their fruits.
Don Swan is the only one who uses Spider with its updated moveset.
Don Swan is the only one who uses Spider with its updated moveset.
Many Blox Fruit moves have Destructible Physics, as with many other types of attacks.

guns.name: Fighting Styles
trivia:
All fighting styles have three different moves, except Combat, which has two, and Death Step and Dark Step, which have four.
However, the extra moves on the four-skill fighting styles exist mainly to boost damage of the other abilities.
However, the extra moves on the four-skill fighting styles exist mainly to boost damage of the other abilities.
Dragon Breath is currently the only fighting style having a fragment-only price.
Sanguine Art and possibly Combat are the only fighting styles in the game without a "V2".
Godhuman and Sanguine Art are the only fighting styles that require Materials.
On each fighting style other than Combat, there is the letter M at the bottom left corner of their icon, along with a white or black border surrounding the icon.
All First Sea fighting style teachers are Shop NPCs, but in the Second Sea and the Third Sea, all Fighting Style Teachers are Misc. NPCs.

guns.name: Upgrading
trivia: Upon upgrading an item, a white star will appear at the top left corner of the item in the player's inventory.

In order for the player to upgrade every single weapon from the First Sea, they have to be at least in the Third Sea because of Soul Cane, Pole (1st Form), and Saber needing Radioactive Material, and Bazooka needing Dragon Scales.

In total, to upgrade every weapon (excluding Triple Dark Blade), a player would need exactly:
 800  Bones
 432  Scrap Metals
 399  Leathers
 149  Magma Ores
 104  Dragon Scales
 79  Angel Wings
 79  Fish Tails
 69  Mystic Droplets
 58  Mini Tusks
 49  Vampire Fangs
 40  Ectoplasms
 30  Radioactive Materials
 18  Demonic Wisps
 16  Conjured Cocoas
 10  Azure Embers
 10  Blaze Embers
 5  Dark Fragments
 4  Meteorites
800  Bones
432  Scrap Metals
399  Leathers
149  Magma Ores
104  Dragon Scales
79  Angel Wings
79  Fish Tails
69  Mystic Droplets
58  Mini Tusks
49  Vampire Fangs
40  Ectoplasms
30  Radioactive Materials
18  Demonic Wisps
16  Conjured Cocoas
10  Azure Embers
10  Blaze Embers
5  Dark Fragments
4  Meteorites
Weapons that are obtained in the First Sea have a higher upgrade output than those in the Second or Third Sea, which might be due to the betterment of weapons as the player progresses through seas.

guns.name: Blacksmith
trivia: The Blacksmith is also the only NPC that holds an item in their hands (a hammer).

When the player first enters the Second Sea and the Third Sea, the Blacksmith will be at the island when they first enter them. However, this is not the same for the First Sea, since he is at the Pirate Village.

If the player steps away or moves their camera far enough from the Blacksmith, they will freeze in his position. This is similar to the Rainbow Saviour Aura color, which stops changing colors when the player's or their camera moves far away enough.

guns.name: Enchantments
moves: Fishing Rod Protector — Prevents line snap once per catch. Instead, boosts progress by 30% and calms the fish.

guns.name: Dragon Talon Sage
trivia: The Dragon Talon Sage is based on Uzoth, who is an admin, YouTuber and the Dragon Talon trainer.

guns.name: NPCs
guns.description: NPCs, or Non-Player Characters, are entities ingame that the player can interact with in some way. They can be found on almost every Island. They provide Quests, sell Items, or teach the player Fighting Styles.
trivia: Some NPCs are based on developers of Blox Fruit or popular Blox Fruits Youtubers.
There are currently 146 NPCs in the game.
Sometimes when joining the game, some NPCs will load slowly or stop loading costumes, making them wearing nothing.
Dog House (Indra) is the first NPC in the game.
The Arena Trainer and Horned Man are the only Quest NPCs to ever reward the players Fragments.

Blox Fruit Dealer Cousin, Norp, Wenlocktoad Over Heaven, Layandikit12, Treasure Inventory, Colors Specialist are NPCs that have been removed from the game or will not return in the future. As for Party Shop, Valentine Shop, Magic Elf, Greedy Elf, and Santa Claws NPCs can only appear during the event.
Among them, Treasure Inventory is the only NPC whose glowing circle color is purple.
Among them, Treasure Inventory is the only NPC whose glowing circle color is purple.

guns.name: Bosses
guns.description: Bosses are a type of enemy that is significantly stronger than a normal enemy. They drop more EXPEXP and Money  , as well as item drops such as swords, materials, accessories, and guns. They can often attack the player using not only M1 attacks but also abilities. Bosses reward bounty/honor upon being defeated. Additionally, immunities don't work against them (e.g. Blade's Passive, Elemental Immunities). For more information, see Tips for Bosses.
trivia: There are currently 34 bosses in the game.

Most older bosses use the legacy version of their respective Swords or Blox Fruits. For example, Stone uses the old version of the Bomb fruit.
An exception to this is Don Swan, who has been updated to use modern moves from Spider, and Hydra Leader, who uses the first two moves of Venom.
An exception to this is Don Swan, who has been updated to use modern moves from Spider, and Hydra Leader, who uses the first two moves of Venom.
Longma was the only boss to not be able to be seen with Instinct. That was changed later after Update 20.
The average spawn time of every boss is around 20 to 45 minutes (except Raid Bosses).

The First Sea has the most bosses out of all seas, with the number of 16. Third Sea is on the second place after Third Sea with the amount of 10, and last place being Second Sea with the amount of eight (Although 4 of the Third Sea bosses are quest-specific.)
Killing all of the bosses with the quest will give about   165,000 in the First Sea,   170,000 in the Second Sea, and   247,500 in the Third Sea (without 2x Money).

guns.name: Puzzles
guns.description: Puzzles are a frequent game mechanic the game that is normally found for some items such as Cursed Dual Katana and Dark Blade V2. Puzzles are similar to quests, but players have to think to them. A puzzle is usually found to unlock powerful items or other game mechanics such as the Saber or Race V4. This page does not show all instructions, but it shows the player the link to each puzzle in every sea. This page also has a trivia and tips for the puzzles mentioned below.
trivia: The Second Sea has the most puzzles in the game.

Despite its difficulty, the Race V4 puzzle is not as hard as many people say it is. The mirage part was relatively peaceful and easy before Update 20. Now, it can be deemed even harder than the Leviathan because of the low spawn chance and high chance of spawning Terrorsharks.
The first puzzle that should be completed is the Saber Expert Puzzle since it allows the player to use Instinct, and the Second Sea Puzzle as soon as they reach Lv. 700.
Every puzzle has its own requirements. Such as the Colosseum Quest, which requires the player to kill 50 Swan Pirates and Jeremy, then do a puzzle for the Warrior Helmet.
The Cyborg Puzzle and the Race V4 Puzzle are the only Puzzles to not have a level requirement.

guns.name: Common
trivia: The carp is the lightest of all common fish (19kg).
The heaviest fish is the Grouper (44kg).

guns.name: Acidum Rifle
moves: — The user shoots a green acidic bullet that deals poison damage over time to the target. It also causes a small knockback and stun, which can help set up combos.

— The user shoots a green projectile that explodes after a short time, dealing damage and stunning enemies.
If the projectile directly hits a player/NPC, the bomb will latch on to them, stopping them from escaping it. After the explosion, the leftover gas resembles a skull.

— The user shoots a gas projectiles that deal damage as well as poison damage over time. It also disables the enemy's Instinct. It does not stun, but disables the opponent from attacking, dashing, using Flash Step or using Air Jump for a short duration of time.
trivia: The Acidum Rifle is widely used in PvP due to its ability to break Instinct, have large AoE stun moves, and extremely high damage.
When equipping this gun, backflip animations when jumping and dashing will not show, although the user is still able to use them.
There may be visual glitches when the Acidum Rifle appears in front of the player's character. This is due to the avatar's arms, and the player will need to change their avatar's arms to fix it.
Acidum Rifle is the only gun that goes around to any players back.
Many players in the community complain about the rework making the Acidum Rifle's moves harder to hit. Although it was "fixed", it is still arguably worse than pre-rework.

guns.name: Bizarre Revolver
moves: — The user shoots three fast, blue shots appearing out of a small portal toward their cursor before having to reload. The third shot is an instant beam toward the cursor. (Does not effect range or damage.)

— The user shoots a blue ball towards their cursor, which goes through walls. If it is close enough to an enemy, it goes through a portal before reappearing itself to the side of the enemy, shooting out and exploding if it hits an enemy, stunning them for a short time. (Can be dodged)

— The user fires off multiple short, electric blasts coming from many portals in front of the user as an AoE, gaining range as the move is held. This can hit multiple targets, as well as stunning them and breaking Instinct.
trivia: The old version of the Bizarre Revolver, Bizarre Rifle, was the gun that had the most mastery needed; however, it is now tied with Skull Guitar. Both of their X moves require 300 mastery.
Currently, Bizarre Revolver is the cheapest item that can be bought from the Cursed Ship, with it only being priced at  25 .
The third shot of Bizarre Revolver is the fastest gun attack in the game, as well as one of the only 3 gun attacks with a cooldown longer than 20 seconds.

guns.name: Legendary
trivia: Beast Hunter is the only boat to have a rarity.

guns.name: PvP mechanics
guns.description: There are several PvP mechanics implemented into Blox Fruits. Some PvP mechanics allow players to get on a more even playing field, while other mechanics make a certain player overpowered. These mechanics mostly do not apply to NPCs and bosses and only apply to players fighting each other, as PvP means Player Versus Player.

guns.name: Slingshot
moves: — The user shoots out a squid that deals damage in a small AoE range and slightly stuns the enemy.
— The user fires a bomb that explodes and slightly knockbacks enemies that are near it.
trivia: Slingshot is the first gun and the only Common gun in the game.

Slingshot does the least amount of damage out of all the guns in the game.
Slingshot deals lower damage than Combat.
Slingshot deals lower damage than Combat.
Slingshot has the lowest range out of any gun in the game.
Slingshot and Rocket both cost the same price.

guns.name: Weapon Dealer
trivia: The Advanced Weapon Dealer sells the refined version of a gun sold by the Weapon Dealer, which is the Refined Slingshot.
The guns sold by the Weapon Dealer are the cheapest guns in the whole game.

guns.name: Leather
trivia: A total of    354 is required to craft everything that requires this material.

Farming Leather at Pirate Village in the First Sea is recommended.
Quake's [V] or any other large AoE move can be used to easily obtain Leather.
Quake's [V] or any other large AoE move can be used to easily obtain Leather.

guns.name: Angel Wings
trivia: A total of 95 Angel Wings is required to craft everything that requires this material (including Eagle upgrades).

guns.name: Flintlock
moves: — The user shoots a bullet. If someone gets hit by the bullet, they will be stunned for a short amount of time and a few bullets split out dealing damage on impact.
— The user shoots three bullets that explode upon contact. (Cursor impact)
trivia: The Flintlock's M1's (click) cannot be used on Chromebook, unless it is a touchscreen.
The Flintlock's icon does not match its model.

guns.name: Musket
moves: — The user fires an explosive bullet at the target that explodes into smaller homing bullets when it hits.
— The user fires an arrow shaped explosive bullet that creates small AoE damage. This moves is similar to Kabucha's [Z] Blazing Phoenix.
trivia: The Pistol Billionaires in the Third Sea uses the old version of the Musket.
The Musket's M1's (click) cannot be used on Chromebook, unless it is touchscreen.
[Z] Draconic Bullet has similar VFX to [Z] Venomous Spit of Venom Bow.

guns.name: Fish Tail
trivia: A total of  99  is required to upgrade/obtain everything that requires this material.

guns.name: Factory
trivia:
Players can enter the Factory using Flash Step, however, they will not be able to damage the core. This trick can help to damage the core at its start.
Another way to enter the Factory is use Creation's V move near it, some of the pillars can teleport inside.
Another way to enter the Factory is use Creation's V move near it, some of the pillars can teleport inside.
The Cyborg NPC is located in one of the holes in the wall, where the player can buy the Lantern ship for   1,500.

The factory can be found on the third island of the Spider Raid because it is based on the Kingdom of Rose, however, the building appears to be destroyed. Cafe can also be found in the Spider Raid but it is also destroyed and half underwater.
It is best to do Factory Raids in Private Servers as there will be no interruption when attacking it.
The factory is one of the best ways to farm Bounty at Lv. 1500 since people over Lv. 1000 go here the most.

During the 30 seconds before the Factory opens which is displayed by the announcement, some enemies (including bosses) will completely freeze, they won't be able to attack or move which makes an easy kill for grinding Bounty or money, for example, Snow Trooper, Winter Warrior, and Order.
If the player joins a high difficulty raid (for example, a Buddha raid) and reaches the fifth island, the player can time it so that when the raid boss appears, the factory raid starts. This way, the player can deal a lot of damage within 30 seconds without losing too much health because all enemies in this raid will freeze completely.
If the player is not good at PvP, it is recommended to turn off PvP in some way before participating in a Factory Raid because the player will be damaged by other players trying to deal damage to the core (if the player's PvP is on).
It is possible to exit the Factory when five minutes have almost passed to escape death.
Sometimes, a glitch will occur that traps players inside the Factory after the raid has been completed.
The factory can drop Radioactive Material.

If the player joins a high difficulty raid (for example, a Buddha raid) and reaches the fifth island, the player can time it so that when the raid boss appears, the factory raid starts. This way, the player can deal a lot of damage within 30 seconds without losing too much health because all enemies in this raid will freeze completely.

If the player is not good at PvP, it is recommended to turn off PvP in some way before participating in a Factory Raid because the player will be damaged by other players trying to deal damage to the core (if the player's PvP is on).
It is possible to exit the Factory when five minutes have almost passed to escape death.
Sometimes, a glitch will occur that traps players inside the Factory after the raid has been completed.
The factory can drop Radioactive Material.

guns.name: Vampire Fang
trivia: The Vampire Fang is considered as one of the most annoying and difficult materials to obtain, having an extremely low drop chance, despite being dropped from only one NPC.
A total of  74  Vampire Fangs is required to buy and upgrade everything that needs this material.

guns.name: Ectoplasm
trivia: A total of  565  is required to buy everything that requires this material.
The Ship Stewards and Ship Deckhands are the best enemies for Ectoplasm grinding.
Ectoplasm can also be obtained in the Third Sea by killing Cursed Ship enemies that spawn in a Pirate Raid.
The Ectoplasm is one of many other materials that can be obtained in Pirate Raids.
The player can see how much Ectoplasm they have by talking to Guashiem.
If the player has Dragon (West), they can enter the Cursed Ship and continuously use the [C] Scorching Downfall ability, almost covering the entire area.
If the player has Quake V awakened, they can hit every enemy in the ship.

guns.name: El Rodolfo
trivia: El Rodolfo used to sell the Bizarre Rifle (pre-rework Bizarre Revolver) before Update 24.

guns.name: Cannon
moves: — Fires a long glowing chain which explodes when a target is hit.
— Shoots three burning cannonballs that explode upon impact. Leaves behind a small pool of flames.
trivia: Bazooka is an upgraded version of the Cannon, which is a boss drop, unlike Cannon.
Cannon [X] has one less bullet that fires off than Bazooka.
This is the strongest purchasable gun in First Sea.

guns.name: Advanced Weapon Dealer
trivia: The Advanced Weapon Dealer used to sell the Refined Flintlock, which got replaced with the Dual Flintlock.

guns.name: Dual Flintlock
moves: — The user fires two blue bullets.
— The user fires two thin blue beams and then moves the beams in a 180-degree angle. This will drag any enemies hit. This can hit multiple enemies.

— The user shoots a multitude of orange and blue bullets that rapidly move around the user, ending with an explosion at the end, dealing AoE damage to enemies around them. The user can hold this move to deal more damage. This move is similar to Spring's V move and Diamond's V move.
trivia: the X move has the longest cooldown time of all gun moves

guns.name: Scrap Metal
trivia: Scrap Metal is the most common and most used material in the game.
A total of  432  is required to buy everything that needs this material (excluding Volcanic Magnet, which may be crafted several times).
Farming at the Pirate Village (in First Sea) with an AoE fruit is recommended.
This is the most used material, as a high amount of it is required to do everything the material has to offer.

guns.name: Magma Blaster
moves: — The user fires a magma bullet that explodes on impact, or when it reaches it's maximum range, scattering molten debris that vanishes shortly after.
— The user shoots out a beam made out of scorching hot magma that locks and pushes targets away from the user. This move can be held for 2.5 seconds.
trivia: Despite being made of magma, one of the materials used to upgrade the Magma Blaster is Fish Tail, which is a material related to water.
The Magma Blaster's aiming animation is the same as the Bizarre Revolver and some other guns.
Although only being a Rare gun, the Magma Blaster currently does the highest amount of damage out of every gun. (This is mostly due to its X move)
Although the Magma Blaster can be obtained by killing Magma Admiral, Magma Admiral does not use this gun.

guns.name: Magma Admiral
moves: Magma Fist — The Magma Admiral launches a magma-coated fist that has a decent hitbox.

Magma Column — The Magma Admiral punches the ground and creates a Column (with the same mesh of the pre-reworked unawakened Flame C move) that disappears and then leaves an AoE area around him that can cause damage if nearby.
trivia: Both Magma Fist and Magma Column were old moves of previously unawakened Magma Z and X, although Magma Admiral's Magma Fist can only fire one shot and Magma Column has smaller AoE.
The Magma Admiral can walk into lava without taking damage.
Magma Admiral, Hydra Leader, and Wysper are the only bosses to drop Guns upon defeat. (Excluding the Core)
The Magma Admiral uses a variant of the Marine Cap and the Coat, although he doesn't gain their buffs.

guns.name: Refined Slingshot
moves: — The user fires a sticky ball, keeping targets from moving momentarily. After a few seconds, it breaks into seven small octopuses, which, when stepped on, will attach themselves to the enemy and suck out their health, healing the user.
— The user fires an explosive, red pellet that blows up once it hits any surface or target, knocking enemies away.
trivia: The Refined Slingshot, as the name implies, is a "refined" version of the Slingshot.
The best use for the Refined Slingshot is just to gather enemies for farming.
Firing an Ink Swarm and then using a knockback move will do less knockback.
The Refined Slingshot and Blade cost the same amount of money, both costing   30,000.
Refined Slingshot's [Z] Ink Swarm and Skull Guitar's [X] El Diablo are the only gun moves that are able to apply Life Leech.

guns.name: Bazooka
moves: — The user shoots a rocket that does AoE damage upon impact. This move can damage Sea Beasts.

— The user fires a flaming orange beam toward their cursor, damaging and providing knockback toward targets hit, as well as leaving a flaming trail and flames at the end of the beam if it hits a surface. (The flames at the end of the beam last longer)

— The user launches five missiles toward their cursor, which will also seek a target if the target is within range of the missiles. The missiles explode in AoE and leaves a flaming area if they explode near a surface.
trivia: The Bazooka is essentially an improved version of Cannon.
The Bazooka is the only Legendary Gun which can be obtained in the First Sea.
The Bazooka is recommended to be used to grind wooden planks for repairing ships and building campfires.

The Bazooka could very well be considered one of the most modern guns in the game, alongside the Acidum Rifle and Bizarre Revolver, since most others use very old mechanisms, or are not even firearms. Though, Dragonstorm may very well be a minigun.
The Bazooka, along with the Skull Guitar and Dragonstorm are the only guns that require a Mythical material ( Dark Fragment ) to upgrade.
The Bazooka is also the only First Sea weapon that needs a Mythical material for its upgrade.
The Bazooka's [TAP] Normal Attack can damage Sea Beasts.
Along with the Skull Guitar and the Cannon, [TAP] Normal Attack can also break Instinct.

guns.name: Wysper
moves: Bazooka [M1] — Wysper pulls out the Bazooka and shoots a rocket, which will explode if it comes in contact with any player or surface, dealing AoE damage. The AoE damage breaks Instinct, but the missile itself can be dodged. The damage can vary depending on whether it landed directly at the player or not.
trivia: Wysper, the Hydra Leader, and the Magma Admiral are the only bosses (excluding the Core) to drop Guns upon defeat.
Sometimes, whenever Wysper uses Bazooka's M1, it will make two explosions, one with the pre-rework VFX and the other with the post-rework VFX.

guns.name: Dark Fragment
trivia: A total of  9  is required to craft, purchase, or upgrade everything that requires the Dark Fragment ( 34  if the Triple Dark Blade is included).

guns.name: Dragon Scale
trivia: Dragon Scales are considered extremely difficult to obtain since the enemies are extremely few or far apart. Even with Buddha or Dragon, it is still hard to farm due to massive land elevation and nearly having zero destructible physics decorations. It is recommended to use awakened Quake's [V] Seaquake for AFK farming since it is one of the only abilities that could hit all enemies.
A total of  124  Dragon Scales are required to acquire to buy or upgrade everything that requires this material. ( 223  if including the Triple Dark Blade.)

guns.name: Dragonstorm
moves: The user sends a fireball into the ground, leaving it scorched, and then shoots up a dragon-like projectile from the ground at where the cursor is pointing, which flies into the sky and then explodes, and leaves the ground behind it scorched. Anyone unfortunate enough to be close to the projectile will be launched up into the sky and stunned.

The user shoots up multiple, dragon-like projectiles into the sky, which then crash into the ground and explode. If an enemy is close enough to their vicinity, the projectiles will lock on to them and then explode after hitting the target. If the user holds this move long enough, they will briefly sprout a pair of fiery wings around them. This variant has auto-tracking.

The user sends a fireball into the ground, leaving it scorched, and then shoots up a dragon-like projectile from the ground at where the cursor is pointing, which flies into the sky and then explodes, and leaves the ground behind it scorched. Anyone unfortunate enough to be close to the projectile will be launched up into the sky and stunned.

The user shoots up multiple, dragon-like projectiles into the sky, which then crash into the ground and explode. If an enemy is close enough to their vicinity, the projectiles will lock on to them and then explode after hitting the target. If the user holds this move long enough, they will briefly sprout a pair of fiery wings around them. This variant has auto-tracking.
Initial start-up breaks Instinct. Can be dodged after the initial hit. Explosions can rarely be dodged on the edge.
Breaks Instinct most of the time. The explosions can sometimes be dodged on the edge. (It requires the player to be mobile to dodge.)

— The user shoots 3 exploding bullets from the gun. Holding the attack will prolong the barrage, which is limited by a heat meter (red line under the crosshair). Can act like a stunning move when held.

— This move posseses two distinct variations:
If used on the ground:

The user sends a fireball into the ground, leaving it scorched, and then shoots up a dragon-like projectile from the ground at where the cursor is pointing, which flies into the sky and then explodes, and leaves the ground behind it scorched. Anyone unfortunate enough to be close to the projectile will be launched up into the sky and stunned.
If used in the air:

The user shoots up multiple, dragon-like projectiles into the sky, which then crash into the ground and explode. If an enemy is close enough to their vicinity, the projectiles will lock on to them and then explode after hitting the target. If the user holds this move long enough, they will briefly sprout a pair of fiery wings around them. This variant has auto-tracking.

— The player shoots a red fire, dragon-like projectile that pulls anyone in its way with it and then explodes into particles upon contact or once it has reached maximum range, leaving flames on the ground after exploding close enough to it. This move deals tick damage to enemies who were hit and pulled by the projectile.
trivia: The Dragonstorm was initially considered to be included in the new kit of the reworked Dragon fruit.
The Dragonstorm is the first and currently only gun with a holdable M1 and works like a Gatling gun.
If the user is in Buddha transformation (either version) and then uses [Z] Draconic Cascade, they will perform its air variant.
The Dragonstorm,Bizarre Revolver, along with Skull Guitar, are the only two guns that can be crafted using materials.
Despite the crafting recipe being available after obtaining Dojo Belt (Red), the Dragonstorm cannot be obtained until the player has Dragon Tether as it requires  2  Dragon Eggs.

The Dragonstorm usually does not visually show Blessings or Curses beside Rot on the weapon, due to the point of visual effects being inside this weapon. However, small fractions of it can clip out, as like with Storm, whose Thunder effect periodically goes outside this weapon.
The Dragonstorm, Bazooka and Skull Guitar have the same exact materials needed to upgrade them to Grade 1.
If [X] Infernal Comet is cast on a wall, the attack will ricochet off of it, making the dragon explode at a different angle.
The Draco race's V4 requires the user to attain 500 Mastery on Dragonstorm and Dragonheart.

Similar to Dragonheart, this is the only gun having a compound noun as its name. The word "Dragonstorm" is not an English word and is a compound/combination of the words, "dragon" and "storm". (Another example of a compound noun would be "moveset".)

guns.name: Dragon Egg
trivia: The number of Dragon Eggs that spawn upon completion of the Volcano Event depends on player count, with a maximum of  4  if the event was started with four players. This amount does not increase further with more players.
A total of  8  Dragon Eggs is required to buy everything that requires this material.

Similar to the Kitsune Shrine where it has a very small chance to give the player a physical Kitsune fruit, there is a very small chance to obtain a physical Dragon fruit (East or West) upon interacting with the Dragon Egg to pick it up.

guns.name: Dinosaur Bones
trivia: A total of  49  is required to craft everything that requires the Dinosaur Bones. Excluding Random Mythical Dragon Skin Recipe, there are mainly 4 Dragon Skin Recipes, so in total it would add up to  60 .

Upon completing the Volcano Event, five Dinosaur Bones for each player involved fall onto the floor near the skull/relic used to start the event.
Ironically, player can pick up other's Dinosaur Bones, even they already picked up their five bones before.
Ironically, player can pick up other's Dinosaur Bones, even they already picked up their five bones before.

guns.name: Blaze Ember
trivia: A total of  137  Blaze Embers is required to upgrade and craft everything that requires this material (excluding Volcanic Magnet as they can be crafted an indefinite number of times).
The Blaze Ember is very similar to the Azure Ember.

guns.name: Kabucha
moves: — The user fires a flying bird shaped projectile that explodes upon contact and leaves a flame trail behind that deals damage. Holding this move will make the user's screen cover in flames.

— The user fires a long thin blast of wind that knocks enemies back, stuns, and breaks Instinct (similar to the old Flame's Fire Beam before Update 17.3, but with stun). The knockback for this move is very predictable and the enemy doesn't get flung instantly like with Superhuman's Conqueror Gun or awakened Flame. This attack is also an AoE attack.
trivia:
The Kabucha has the second fastest fire rate of any gun in the game, but it does not have a lot of range.
Dragonstorm now takes the lead as the fastest fire rate of any gun.
Dragonstorm now takes the lead as the fastest fire rate of any gun.
The Kabucha is the earliest Legendary Gun that can be obtained at Second Sea.
[Z] Blazing Phoenix leaves a path of fire if the user sends it near the ground.
After the addition of Spikey Trident, Kabucha has become a much more meta gun not only as support but for gun mains as well, as the sword compliments the gun very well.
The Kabucha is usually best paired with awakened Dark, Ice, Shizu, Canvander and Spikey Trident.
The Kabucha is best paired with swords that have a fast dash damaging move like Shizu, Koko, and Canvander due to the high knockback. Spikey Trident is also good as its X move pulls the enemies back.
While the Kabucha is technically a slingshot, it is still classified as a gun.
The Kabucha's M1's do not work on Chromebook, unless it is touchscreen.
Before Update 11, Kabucha could only be bought with a Rare Artifact (replaced by fragments).
The appearance of Kabucha is reminiscent of an indigenous and tribal style.
[X] Dragon Tempest dragon head model is similar to Dragon Talon [X] Ember Annihilation and True Triple Katana [X] Dragon Hurricane.

guns.name: Fragments
trivia: On PS5, the player will still be able to see how many fragments they have even if they haven't entered Second Sea.
To see how much Fragments the player has, they need to hover over the Money value on PC. On console and mobile, it always displays.
The Rare Artifact used to fulfill some of the purposes of this currency, but it was then removed in Update 11.
Before Update 20, this currency didn't appear when the player was in the First Sea.
The maximum amount of Fragments a player can hold is   1,000,000,000

It costs   667,450 to fully max everything the player can buy with Fragments (excluding Race Reroll and Stat Reset)
  187,300 to fully Awaken all fruits
  187,250 to fully awaken V4 on every race
  2,500 to buy the Cyborg race for the first time (excluding potential re-purchases)
  31,500 to unlock all Fighting Styles
  30,000 to unlock all crew slots
  1,500 to purchase the Lantern boat from Cyborg
  1,500 to get Kabucha
  37,500 to get all Aura colors from Barista
  91,000 to get all Dragon skins from Barista (both East and West variants)
  10,000 to get the 2 Dragon seats (  5,000 each from the Dragon Tamer)
  15,800 to max the Shipwright subclass
  62,100 to upgrade Gravity, Eagle, Pain and Lightning fruits in the Admin Panel
  9,500 to get all Eagle skins from Barista
