guns.name: The Strongest God
trivia: The Strongest God used to sell the Kabucha for a Rare Artifact before it was replaced with Fragments.
The Strongest God used to be called "Usoapp" but this was later changed, likely due to copyright reasons.
The Strongest God is seen wearing the accessory "Usoap's Hat".

guns.name: Venom Bow
moves: — The user fires a venomous shot that deals damage, applies a poison effect that inflicts damage four times after the shot, and does small knockback to the enemy.

— The user fires a fast, purple projectile from their bow. It explodes in a purple blast upon contact with an enemy or surface, and deals instantaneous damage and poison damage, breaking Instinct in one hit. Once the projectile explodes, three smaller purple arrows will come out from the explosion and chase after the nearest enemy. The arrows are very fast and hard to outrun.

— The user fires a medium-speed purple projectile which, upon contact with an enemy, deals some damage and stuns them for a short period of time, making them unable to Flash Step, dash or use any moves (this still applies even if the enemy turns on Instinct after being hit by the move).
trivia: The Venom Bow does not turn black when Aura is active, though Aura colors still appear.
The design of Venom Bow is a curved Hydra with a bowstring.

The Venom Bow is the first and only "bow" to be added in the game.
Despite it being a bow, the Venom Bow is still in the gun category.
Despite it being a bow, the Venom Bow is still in the gun category.
The [Z] move of the Venom Bow is used by the Dragon Crew Archers.

guns.name: Hydra Leader
moves: Poison Daggers — Hydra Leader shoots a barrage of close-ranged venomous projectiles, which then explode, producing venom-like particles on the range of the projectile dealing moderate damage. (Drains Instinct dodges, but can Instinct break.)

Noxious Shot — Hydra Leader gathers a large poison ball around their hands. After that, they launch three bolts of venom at the same time, dealing damage and leaving one puddle that splits into three more puddles, dealing moderate damage.
trivia: The Hydra Leader is the first boss to be replaced in terms of abilities and appearance (potentially gender too), and one of the only bosses to use a mythical fruit, the other being Orbitus.

guns.name: Meteorite
trivia: A total of  7  is required to craft everything that requires this material.
The icon of this material resembles the old Gravity's icon.

guns.name: Skull Guitar
moves: — The user plays a riff, quickly releasing a swirl of glowing green notes with green strands trailing it. It explodes on impact and when it explodes, it shoots out small green notes (these notes don't do damage). It does high damage with a large hitbox. This move has Destructible Physics and consumes 20 Energy.

— The user strums the guitar and summons a skull with the power of the undead in front of them, which opens its mouth and instantly shoots a beam of souls from its mouth that can go through walls and solid surfaces, whilst tinting their screens in red for a single frame. The beam explodes on impact with an enemy, dealing high damage and knocking them away, similar to Kabucha's [X] move but faster. However, this move does not break Instinct most of the time, making it a weaker version of Kabucha's [X] move.

— The user quickly strums the guitar before summoning a skull with the power of the undead above them, which rises to the sky with soul static before exploding and creating a tick-damage AoE move that damages and stuns anyone on the ground in the radius of the move. If the user hits an NPC or a Player a soul will follow and regenerate the user's health. It heals about 3% of the user's max health and 10% damage converted to health (only when damaging a player or NPC).
trivia: The Skull Guitar is currently the first and only Mythical gun in the game.
The Skull Guitar, along with Dragonstorm are the only guns that are obtained by crafting.
The Skull Guitar is the only gun in the game with an M1 that consumes energy (20 per use).
The Skull Guitar, Bizarre Revolver, Dragonstorm and Kabucha are the only guns that can be bought without requiring Money.
The Skull Guitar, along with the Bazooka and the Cannon, can break Instinct using their M1s.
While pressing M1 and [X] El Diablo at the same time, it will cancel the move.
"El Diablo" means "The Devil" in Spanish.
The Skull Guitar is regarded as one of the best guns for PvP and is the most popular by far.
Refined Slingshot's [Z] Ink Swarm and Skull Guitar's [X] El Diablo are the only gun moves that are able to apply Life Leech.
The Skull Guitar is useful in finding the Blue Gear in Mirage Island, due to its M1s being able to light up a place.
The Skull Guitar’s M1 animation causes the player to go further with jump dashes (dashing and jumping successively), similar to Cyborg V4's Super Dashes/Jumps.

guns.name: Bones
trivia: The Posessed Mummy NPC drops high amounts of bones but the Boss that drops the most is the Soul Reaper.
Bones used to drop when the player defeated an NPC inside the First Sea, but the feature was removed on Update 17.1 and was added back in Update 20 but only for the Evil Wraith and Bone Wraith.
This material's icon includes a tooth, which is odd, due to teeth not being bones.
The Undead Lord and Death King titles can only be obtained during the Halloween Events.
The maximum amount of Bones a player can hold in their inventory is 5,000.
A total of  1300  Bones is required to craft everything that requires this material.

guns.name: Weird Machine
trivia: The Weird Machine has no character model, similar to the Mysterious Force and the Sealed King .

guns.name: Area of Effect
moves: Magma (Unawakened) — Z X C V F
Phoenix (Awakened) — Untransformed:TAP Z C FTransformed:TAP Z C
Blizzard — Z X C V F
Gravity — TAP Z X C V F
Mammoth (Transformed) — TAP Z C V F
T-Rex (Untransformed) — TAP Z X C V F
T-Rex (Transformed) — TAP Z X C F
Dough (Awakened) — TAP Z X C V F
Leopard (Untransformed) — Z X C V F
Leopard (Transformed) — TAP Z X C F
Kitsune (Untransformed) — Z X C V F
Dragon (East) (Transformed) — TAP Z X C F
Dragon (West) (Transformed) — TAP Z X C F
Water Kung Fu — Z X C
trivia: Generally, items obtained later in the game have much more AoE than those obtained earlier. This is likely to keep pace with the greater mobility and speed available in the later seas.

Currently, the largest AoE ability from every fruit in the game is the awakened Quake's [V] Seaquake ability.
Other abilities with very large AoE include:
Unawakened Quake's [V] Dual Tsunami ability.
Bomb's [V] Self Destruct ability.
Awakened Buddha's [V] Twilight of the Gods ability.
Blizzard's [V] Blizzard Domain ability.
Lightning's [V]  ability.
Transformed Venom's [C] ability.
Transformed Dragon's [C] ability.

Other abilities with very large AoE include:
Unawakened Quake's [V] Dual Tsunami ability.
Bomb's [V] Self Destruct ability.
Awakened Buddha's [V] Twilight of the Gods ability.
Blizzard's [V] Blizzard Domain ability.
Lightning's [V]  ability.
Transformed Venom's [C] ability.
Transformed Dragon's [C] ability.

Blizzard's [V] Blizzard Domain ability.
Lightning's [V]  ability.
Transformed Venom's [C] ability.
Transformed Dragon's [C] ability.

guns.name: Sea Events
trivia: Some Sea Events can spawn with another Sea Events, but this is very rare. For example, Mirage Island with a Rumbling Waters and a Terrorshark, making it a heavily guarded Island.
After the players' boat gets destroyed whilst exploring danger levels, the meter for it will be gone, unless another boat is nearby.
Though very rare, Sea Events such as Sharks can spawn in Sea Danger Level 0 outside of Tiki Outpost.

guns.name: Rubber
moves: This applies to Gun Users and NPCs if the NPC is lower level than the user as if it worked as an Elemental.
Exception: Shocker, Mythological Pirate, Bosses and Raid Bosses.

Rubber Body — Similarly to Elemental Reflex, Rubber users will have complete immunity to all guns, Lightning and Electric fighting style, even those with Aura. However, it does not grant immunity to Electric Claw, Pole (1st Form) and Pole (2nd Form).
This applies to Gun Users and NPCs if the NPC is lower level than the user as if it worked as an Elemental.
Exception: Shocker, Mythological Pirate, Bosses and Raid Bosses.
— The user stretches their arm using their right hand, dealing damage to whoever is in the direction of the arm.
— The user pulls their arms backward, stretching them as they do so. Upon releasing the respective button, the user springs their arms forward, dealing knockback as well as damage.
— The user stretches their right leg upwards, and upon releasing the respective button they launch their leg down, dealing damage as well as a small amount of knockback.
— The user does a barrage of punches towards the direction they are facing, dealing continuous damage. Holding down the respective button for this move causes it to last longer.

— Upon activation, the user gains a pink-like texture on their skin and begins to emit steam. While having this move active, all animations change to be faster and all moves gain a damage increase, but the user's energy regeneration is reduced by 25%. This ability will last as long as the user does not die or run out of energy.

— The user stretches both their arms in the direction of the cursor. If they hit an object, the user will be launched at a fast speed towards the object. This can be used to launch the user beyond or above the object. If they hit a player/NPC, the user will launch towards the player/NPC, dealing damage and slight knockback. If held, the user can charge it up to four stages, which is seen by rings appearing around the user. Each stage allows the user's arms to go a bit farther upon release. The further the user is from said object, the further the user goes.
— The user quickly stretches their arm, dealing damage in the cursor's direction.
— The user pulls their arms backward, resulting in them being stretched. Upon releasing the respective button, the user quickly springs their arms forward, dealing knockback as well as damage.
— The user teleports above the location of their cursor and quickly throws a heavy punch in its direction, breaking the ground below them and dealing damage to targets as well as knockback.
— The user launches a barrage of high-speed punches in the direction they are facing, dealing continuous damage. Holding down the respective button for this move causes it to last longer.

— The user's skin goes back to its normal state and they stop emitting steam, causing the abilities gained while transformed to be removed, but restoring the user's energy regeneration back to normal.

— The user stretches both their arms in the direction of the cursor. If they hit an object, the user will be launched at a fast speed towards the object. This can be used to launch the user beyond or above the object. If they hit a player/NPC, the user will launch towards, dealing damage and slight knockback. If held, the user can charge it up to four stages, which is seen by rings appearing around the user. Each stage allows the user's arms to go a bit farther upon release. The further the user is from said object, the further the user goes.  Although this version goes much further than the untransformed version, the sudden speed of this move sometimes makes the anticheat system think the player is hacking and will be teleported back.
trivia: Rubber is the only fruit having a resistance against three attack types. (Fruits, Guns and Fighting Styles)
Previously, Pole (1st Form) could not damage Rubber, which may have been a bug as it was changed in Update 20.
Rubber [F] is the highest impulse dash move in the game.
If used properly, the [F] move can be faster than Dragon's [F] at the start.
Rubber is one of the Blox Fruits to have gotten a rework in Update 17.3.
Rubber used to only cost   100,000, however, it now costs   750,000. (Maybe due to its Transformation buff)

Rubber was originally named Gum.
Rubber used to have a move called "Gum Rocket" which would function as a great mobility tool. This was replaced with "Transformation".
Some of Rubber's old moves used to be able to pick up physical fruit when dropped on the ground.
Rubber used to have a move called "Gum Rocket" which would function as a great mobility tool. This was replaced with "Transformation".
Some of Rubber's old moves used to be able to pick up physical fruit when dropped on the ground.
Despite being immune to Lightning, Rubber does not provide immunity to the attacks used by the Thunder God, due to him being a boss.
If Rubber's M1 attack is held while in the air and released while the user's mouse is on a menu button, they'll be able to stay in the air for a long time and then fall down.
Permanent Rubber costs the same amount of Robux   as Dark Blade.

If the player holds  or tap Cursed Dual Katana's [X] move, then quickly switch to [X] or [C] move of the Rubber Fruit when it is released, the transformed variant of the [X]/[C] move will be used, regardless of whether the player is in their transformed state.
The [Z] skill has the same name as the Phoenix unawakened [Z] move.
Rubber is the first ever fruit to have a M1 outside of a transformed or unawakened state.
Rubber M1, Z, X, and C changes color depending on the user's aura color, similar to Spider's V move (Heavenly Punishment).
Rubber is the only fruit to only have an M1 before unlocking an actual move, make this is the only fruit with a [Z] move mastery requirement of over 1.
Rubber is the first fruit to be a non-beast type fruit with a transformation, followed by Diamond and Venom in second, and Gas in third.
Rubber is based on the Gum-Gum fruit from One piece

guns.name: Aura
trivia: There is no relation between sea events and Aura. Turning aura off does not make sea events spawn more often.

All swords and guns will change their color when a colored Aura is active, based on its color.
Some swords, when transformed with Buddha will not have the Aura effect.
Some swords, when transformed with Buddha will not have the Aura effect.

Light's Spear and Ice's Trident visual is affected by Aura.
The same goes for Awakened Dough's and Rubber's attacks. The user can also change the color of its moves with an Aura skin.
Awakened Spider’s [V] move also has different colors depending on the user’s aura color, and if their aura color slowly changes, the same would be for Spider’s [V] move, most likely because the move is webs covered in Aura shooting forward.
The same goes for Awakened Dough's and Rubber's attacks. The user can also change the color of its moves with an Aura skin.

Awakened Spider’s [V] move also has different colors depending on the user’s aura color, and if their aura color slowly changes, the same would be for Spider’s [V] move, most likely because the move is webs covered in Aura shooting forward.

moves: — The user fires a venomous shot that deals damage, applies a poison effect that inflicts damage four times after the shot, and does small knockback to the enemy.

— The user fires a fast, purple projectile from their bow. It explodes in a purple blast upon contact with an enemy or surface, and deals instantaneous damage and poison damage, breaking Instinct in one hit. Once the projectile explodes, three smaller purple arrows will come out from the explosion and chase after the nearest enemy. The arrows are very fast and hard to outrun.

— The user fires a medium-speed purple projectile which, upon contact with an enemy, deals some damage and stuns them for a short period of time, making them unable to Flash Step, dash or use any moves (this still applies even if the enemy turns on Instinct after being hit by the move).
trivia: The Venom Bow does not turn black when Aura is active, though Aura colors still appear.
The design of Venom Bow is a curved Hydra with a bowstring.

The Venom Bow is the first and only "bow" to be added in the game.
Despite it being a bow, the Venom Bow is still in the gun category.
Despite it being a bow, the Venom Bow is still in the gun category.
The [Z] move of the Venom Bow is used by the Dragon Crew Archers.

guns.name: Bizarre Rifle
moves: — The user shot a quick blue laser (which looked similar to Acidum Rifle's M1, but doesn’t do poison damage). Upon hit, the targeted victim will take high damage.
— The user shot a blue ball towards their cursor, which sought an enemy if they are close enough. When hit, the blue ball exploded and stunned for a very short period of time.
— The user shot a burst of four dark blue shots, which dealt damage and left a fire effect similar to Awakened Flame's burning effect, but much stronger and dark blue.
trivia:
[X] Hellfire Shower deals the highest damage among all guns before Update 24, especially when all burn damage is applied.
Additionally, using stun moves (such as Ice) after the [X] move is recommended, as enemies remain stunned within the fire, allowing maximum damage output.
Additionally, using stun moves (such as Ice) after the [X] move is recommended, as enemies remain stunned within the fire, allowing maximum damage output.
[X] Hellfire Shower is considered an upgraded version of the old Cannon [X], with higher fire damage and a longer-lasting burn effect.

guns.name: Refined Musket
moves: — The user fired an explosive bullet that did knockback damage.
— The user summoned a small tornado with their mouse pointer.
trivia: The Refined Musket had the same moves of the Musket, but with higher damage.
Unlike its refined counterparts (like the Refined Slingshot or Refined Flintlock), the Refined Musket could not be bought from the Advanced Weapon Dealer.
The Refined Musket's [M1] attack could not be used on a Chromebook, unless it has touchscreen.

guns.name: Refined Flintlock
moves: — Shoots a purple bullet that stuns targets for a short amount of time.
— Shoots three bullets that explode upon contact.
trivia: The Refined Flintlock is the upgraded version of the Flintlock, having the same moves as the original Flintlock, but also doing more damage.

guns.name: Inventory
trivia: Before Update 17.3.5 players could not un-store fruits in First Sea.
The inventory was added to replace the Treasure Inventory.

guns.name: Fishing Rods
guns.description: Fishing Rods are gear that can be used for Fishing.
moves: Fishing Rod Protector: Prevents line snap once per catch. Instead, boosts progress by 30% and calms the fish.
Curse of the Leviathan: Catching a specific species may trigger an unknown event.
Curse of the Terrorshark: Start with 20% extra progress, but fish panic much faster.
Curse of the Whale: Final fish weight increases by 15%, but may consume 2 bait instead of 1.
Blessing of Bait Efficiency: 20% chance to not consume materials when crafting bait.
Blessing of an Angler’s Treasure: Increases daily treasure limit by 3. (This enchantment is bugged and currently doesn't work.)

guns.name: Fish
trivia: Giving fish to the event fisherman with max tokens will give nothing.
If the player consumes the last type of fish they have and then captures the same fish it will appear as captured for the first time even though it is not.

The player can only have 301 fish in their inventory. If they try to catch another fish with a full inventory, a message will display saying: "Your fish inventory is full! If you catch any fish, you won't be able to carry them! Release them manually or visit the Fisherman to sell them".

In the Update 27.1 trailer, Admin Uzoth is shown fishing in the pond at Dragon Dojo and catch a Dragon Koi. However, it is actually unknown where to fish for it, and what rods and baits are required for it. It is thought to be unobtainable as of now.

Fishing for making Money is not recommended as it is slow and Rarities does not matter (only weight does).
Fishing is recommended for crafting Foods and Potions, or completing Events, such as RIP Event and Red King Event.
Fishing is recommended for crafting Foods and Potions, or completing Events, such as RIP Event and Red King Event.
The higher the weight, higher the rarity. Therefore a gold fish, which weights 12kg, is a rare.

guns.name: Items
guns.description: Items are objects or weapons that can be carried in the hotbar and held or simply stored in the inventory bar.

guns.name: Consumables
guns.description: Consumables are items that can be consumed to gain special effects. They can be obtained from the campfire.

guns.name: Foods
guns.description: Foods are consumables that grants their consumer effects.

guns.name: Skins
guns.description: Skins are wearable cosmetics that change the visuals of certain abilities and transformations.
trivia:
Collecting all Legendary colors (excluding limited variants) requires   22,500,  15 ,  10 , and  15 .
Collecting all Rare colors requires   15,000,  3 ,  8 ,  3 ,  2 ,  2 ,  2 ,  2 , and  4 .
Collecting all Rare colors requires   15,000,  3 ,  8 ,  3 ,  2 ,  2 ,  2 ,  2 , and  4 .
Unlocking all aura skins requires a total cost of   37,500 or   1,830,  3 ,  8 ,  6 ,  2 ,  2 ,  25 ,  12 ,  25 ,  1000 ,  1000 , at least  15 ,  250 and  250
During Update 17.3.5, a bug occurred where the Party Hat and the Aquamarine aura color could not be equipped.

There is a known glitch where the aura color on the avatar does not exactly match the aura color on Swords, Guns or Electric Claw.
This happens when you activate an aura, then you switch to another, without reactivating.
This happens when you activate an aura, then you switch to another, without reactivating.
Equipping Rainbow Saviour causes the color cycle to stop when zooming out. The effect resumes once zooming back in.
Mythical Aura Skins, (Rainbow Saviour, Dragon, Kitsune, Oni and Celestial), are the only with shifting animations.
Before Update 24, Hoops were required to change the color of the Dragon (Classic).
After Update 24, all players who had purchased an Aura color prior to the update were automatically awarded the Hakaishin title due to a glitch.
Three Blox Fruits currently have attacks that change color depending on the equipped aura color: Rubber, Spider, and Dough.
Skins for Portal are already listed in the Barista Menu but are not yet craftable. They are planned for release in a future update.

stats.Notes: Currently having 2750 stat levels on Gun, Sword, and Blox Fruit stats will give an 88.4x multiplier. Each stat level adds a x1.0346759259 (3.46759259%) buff.

guns.name: Levels
trivia: Uzoth reached Lv. 2550 (the max level for Update 20)  in just 7 minutes and 45.92 seconds.

It would take around 23 years of non-stop playing to reach Lv. 2750 by doing only Bandit or Trainee quests every three seconds. The player would need to grind the quest 375,909,459 times and need 112,772,837,596 EXPEXP total.

guns.name: Health
guns.description: Health (also known as HP, hit points, health points) is a fundamental feature in Blox Fruits. Once a player has zero health, they will die and respawn a few seconds later , with the exception of the Ghost and Pain fruits which can resurrect you one time before you can be killed. The more health the player has, the more durable they will be from other attacks. Health deduction can be reduced by activating Aura. Full body Aura reduces damage taken by 30% before subtracting it from the player's health. Health scales off the current Defense stat, with 5 HP being added for each stat point put, the amount of health one has can be measured by using the following equation:
trivia:
The max health a player can have is 16512. It can be obtained by having 2750 Defense point stats and using the Leviathan Shield accessory, and having at least Draco v3. With no accessories or buffs, the max amount of health would be 13845.
20483 when using the Leviathan Shield accessory and Shark V4's (upgraded) Leviathan Armor ability.
With just the Leviathan Shield accessory, the max health would be 14845.
20483 when using the Leviathan Shield accessory and Shark V4's (upgraded) Leviathan Armor ability.
With just the Leviathan Shield accessory, the max health would be 14845.
Leviathan Crown, Pilot Helmet, Kitsune Ribbon, Lei and Feathered Visage (dropped from the 'Tyrant of the Skies' Raid Boss) are the only accessories that increase health regeneration speed.

Players can get the following two Titles in Second or Third Sea for losing health:
The Undefeated One (#080): Receive damage from a player and survive with less than 50 HP left
Immortal Being (#081): Receive damage from a player and survive with 1 HP left
The Undefeated One (#080): Receive damage from a player and survive with less than 50 HP left
Immortal Being (#081): Receive damage from a player and survive with 1 HP left
Every time the player levels up or completes a quest with low health and/or energy, their health and energy will automatically be restored unless the player is in combat.

The [F] (mobility) moves of Flame, Ice, Spider, Light and Eagle go faster with the higher Health the player has.
Opposite to that, the [F] (mobility) moves of Blade, Sound and Venom move go faster the lower the Health the player has.
Opposite to that, the [F] (mobility) moves of Blade, Sound and Venom move go faster the lower the Health the player has.
Bomb's [V] move exchanges the player's health for damage.

guns.name: Energy
guns.description: Energy is a fundamental feature in Blox Fruits. Once a player has zero energy, they have to wait until their energy bar is no longer empty or else the player cannot dash or use certain moves. It is essential for performing most actions in Blox Fruits, such as using moves, dodges, Air Jumps, Flash Steps, and others. Energy scales off the current Melee stat, with 5 Energy being added for each stat point allocated. The amount of energy one has can be measured by using the following equation:
trivia: The regeneration of energy scales with the players stats, being faster the higher their energy stats are. (2x faster on the ground)
One dash consumes 30 energy (unless the player is using the Rabbit race, which allows only 15 energy to be consumed).

The max amount of energy a player can have is 17930, with 2750 stat points in Melee, using the Kitsune Ribbon accessory, whilst being in an awakened form of their race. With no accessories or buffs, the max energy would be 13845. With just the Kitsune Ribbon accessory, it would be 16345.

Trying to use a move that requires more energy than the player currently has will make a message appear saying "Low energy! [Amount of energy the move requires] energy required." and the move will not activate.

Normal M1 attacks, such as kicking, punching, swinging a sword, firing a gun, using abilities such as the V3/V4 of a Race, Summon Sea Beast, and Admin Abilities will not drain energy.
The only exceptions are Skull Guitar, Rubber, Dough (V2), Phoenix (V2)'s M1 and Diamond M1.
The only exceptions are Skull Guitar, Rubber, Dough (V2), Phoenix (V2)'s M1 and Diamond M1.
Other players' and enemies' energy bars can be seen by using Instinct and Instinct V2
The Masterpiece enchantment can remove the energy cost for the attacks of the item it is on.
If the player completely runs out of energy, they are given the title “Empty Vessel” (#067).  It is recommended to use Phoenix's [X] move for the most efficient energy drain.

guns.name: Quests
trivia: The Forgotten Quest Giver and the Kingdom of Rose Area 2 Quest Giver have a similar appearance.
There are two Mole Quest Givers. One is located near the Skylands next to the temple that teleports to the Upper Skylands. The other is found in the Upper Skyland itself.
The Deep Forest Quest Giver 1 looks similar to the Tiki Quest Giver 2.
Most quest givers have a yellow exclamation mark on above or even behind them, which makes it easier to find them while searching.
The Arena quest giver is the only quest giver that rewards the player with   fragments.
There is currently a total of 116 quests in the game (including side quests).

guns.name: Allying
trivia: There was a glitch where if the user is a Marine and joins the Pirates team through the Pirate Recruiter, the ally button will disappear.
Allied players can only be damaged with Meme.

Allying is the only way for the player to ride a Love user's flamingo, a transformed Kitsune or a transformed Dragon with Strong Hair/Saddle. To get teleported by Portal's [C] World Warp without getting allied, the player needs to be outside safe zone. (The player can also get teleported if both are in combat in safe zone.)

guns.name: Abilities
guns.description: Abilities are various unique effects and bonuses that the player can learn and use to gain advantages in Blox Fruits.

guns.name: Damage Counter
trivia: Currently, the YouTuber/admin Uzoth is the record holder for the greatest amount of damage the game has ever recorded, at 988 septillion (9.88 x 10²⁶). The video can be found here.
The most amount of damage done by a non-admin player is imFiji, with 127,518,285. The video can be found here.

guns.name: Fast Mode
guns.description: Fast mode is a mode that reduces lag for Blox Fruits on devices. It works by removing the textures in models, making all parts have a smooth plastic texture. It normally takes around 20 seconds to completely execute, and the player can still play during the execution time. However, on some devices, it could take longer.
trivia: Fast mode can be used for finding the hidden texts on the trading tables at mansion. It could still be found without fast mode but using it makes it easier.
Fast mode does not change a lot of FPS in heavy/powerful devices such as PCs or gaming tablets/phones, but it is recommended if the player has a weak phone, old computer.
Some V3 or V4 abilities might not show up. An example for it is the Cyborg V3 ability where the player does not see the particles but they still receive the buffs.

Since update 24, there's a bug where turning on Fast Mode on the menu before choosing a team doesn't fully disable all textures in the game, and the Fast Mode button through the Settings appears as if it wasn't even turned on at all.
This is especially noticeable in the Third Sea, as far areas like Temple of Time may appear fully/partially textured, even when Fast Mode was turned on beforehand. (In this case, turning on Fast Mode through the Settings while being in the Temple of Time will fix this issue.)

This is especially noticeable in the Third Sea, as far areas like Temple of Time may appear fully/partially textured, even when Fast Mode was turned on beforehand. (In this case, turning on Fast Mode through the Settings while being in the Temple of Time will fix this issue.)

guns.name: Safe Zone
trivia: If the player is already in Combat with another player, the Safe Zone will not protect the player from that person until their Combat indicator disappears. This is to prevent players immediately running to a Safe Zone when losing in PvP or when getting attacked.

The first location of every sea is a safe zone (e.g Pirate/Marine Starter, Kingdom of Rose Docks and Port Town Docks). This is to prevent the player getting attacked immediately while they are spawning in.
The Safe Zone has a delay of about one second before it activates. That means it is possible to be attacked when the player first joins the game.
There is a glitch where after dying in combat the player can be attacked even in a safe zone if other player's combat is still on.
The safe zone near the Blox Fruit Gacha in Jungle was added in Update 20.
The player's speed gets slower by roughly 37.5% whenever they enter a safe zone.

Now in Update 24, if the player is on a private server and the PvP mode is set to "Friendly PvP", the player can be attacked anytime even on Safe Zone places, but they can't lose honor/bounty if they die to another player (that player also can't get honor/bounty).

guns.name: Titles
guns.description: Titles are labels that appear next to the player's name when they speak in the Roblox chat.
trivia: “Sugar Rush”, “Christmas Spirit” and “Loco Verde” were only available during the Presents event.
The titles "Death King" and "Undead Lord" are only available during Halloween events.
There was a glitch where upon killing the Leviathan’s head, the title was not awarded. This has recently been fixed.
There is a glitch where if the player is the last person standing in a raid and run out of time, they will still receive the "Last Hope" title.
Unlocking the Rainbow Saviour Aura Color without unlocking any other Aura Colors will wrongfully award the player the "The Collector" title.
Getting the Kitsune Aura skin does not unlock the "The Enhancer" title.
Blox Fruits Staff members who can drop the "Equal to the Heavens" title cannot turn it off unlike normal YouTuber titles.
The "Hakaishin" title #147 means "God of Destruction" in Japanese.
The "Loco Verde" title #156 means "Crazy Green" in Spanish.
The "Shinigami" title #169 means "Soul Reaper" or "God of Death" in Japanese.
Uzoth's title, "Doragontarontorēnā", is a Japanese anglicism which means "dragon talon trainer", likely a reference to the NPC that sells Dragon Talon being based off him.
The "LA FLEUR DU MAL 悪の華" title means "THE FLOWER OF EVIL (French), before Flower of Evil (Japanese)."

guns.name: Wanted Posters
trivia: If the player is alone in a server as a Pirate, all the posters will only have them displayed, if  there aren't any pirates in the server the wanted posters will not spawn at all.
Upon completion of the quest, the message "<QUEST COMPLETED> Earned   " will appear.
Unlike the Player Hunter, the player can choose whoever they want to hunt down.
Unlike the Player Hunter, kills with quests from wanted posters don't count and don't give exp.
If the target's level has max level, the reward will be stuck at   50,000.
Every couple of minutes the wanted posters will change and the quest will disappear.
If the player dies, the wanted poster will change to another player.

guns.name: Pictures
trivia: Some pictures do not have official names.
There is a glitch with the pictures "Staff Photo" and "Dragon Talon Trainer" where they fail to load and appear blank. This could possibly be due to a bug or Roblox deleted them.

guns.name: Sea Exploration Group
trivia: Sea Exploration Group appears only in the Third Sea.
The 20 required sea events for Frozen Dimension include only those that spawn enemies. Events like islands, Haunted Shipwrecks, or Rough Seas do not count.

guns.name: Experience
trivia: EXPEXP is currently the most abundant quantity in the game, easily reaching into the hundreds of millions for a single level, while other Stats and currencies are rarely seen above ten million.
Roblox Premium allows the user to gain more experience on a quest/kill than a normal player.
It took Uzoth 7 minutes and 45.92 seconds to reach Update 20's MAX level (2550).
The amount of EXPEXP needed per level is defined by [2 x Level^2.3 + 84] = EXP to level up.
It takes a total of 119,938,274,162 EXP119,938,274,162 EXP to reach level 2650.

guns.name: Mastery
trivia:
Currently, the maximum amount of mastery a fighting style, fruit, sword, or gun can have is 600.
The maximum amount of mastery for fishing rods is 100.
The maximum amount of mastery for fishing rods is 100.

The amount of EXPEXP needed per mastery is defined by this formula:
54 + ((2 * mastery ^ 2.26 + 30) * 0.5)
EXP Calculator
EXP Calculator
The total amount of EXP needed to reach mastery 600 is 348,679,374 EXP348,679,374 EXP.
Getting mastery can be doubled by using the gamepass 2x mastery.
When the player reaches MAX mastery, the item's stats is increased to 425.

guns.name: Gifting
trivia: Game passes can be stored in the inventory (by "gifting" their inventory), allowing them to be traded (excluding the Respawn Bosses and Change Race game passes).

guns.name: Update Log
guns.description: The Update Log is a feature in Blox Fruits that lets players see the planned upcoming updates. It can be accessed by clicking on "Settings", then on "Open Log".

guns.name: Campfire
guns.description: The campfire can be crafted through the user's inventory by using one Wooden Plank. It allows the player to craft Potions and other consumables using unlocked recipes, obtained from the Note in a Bottle through fishing.
trivia: Campfires can be available for beginners since wooden planks can be obtained with a lower chance without Shipwright subclass as of Update 27.
When the campfire is going to disappear, you will be notified, saying "Your campfire's flames have been extinguished..." a few seconds before it disappears.
Other players can use your campfire, and so can can you.
If you open the Craft Menu, then walk away from the campfire, the Craft Menu will disappear.
There are currently only 6 available recipes as of Updates/27.1.
The player need 18 Fishes (1 Rare, 4 Uncommon And 13 Common), 1 Leather, 1 Scrap Metal, and 1 Fish Tail to craft every recipe once.
The Player can craft a Fish Kebab, Lava Potion, Aggro Elixir, Loot Seeker, Berserkers Elixir, and Fortune Elixir.
Monk Potion, Invisibility Potion, and Oni Soul potions were limited to Oni Campfire.

guns.name: Valor
trivia: Valor is currently the only currency that is exclusively obtainable in the Third Sea.
It takes a total of   17,300 and   12,800 to unlock and fully level up all the abilities.

guns.name: Rules
guns.description: Thank you for coming to the Blox Fruits Wiki. We have rules set in place to make this place as friendly as possible. Discussion/post rules can be found here, it's probably best that you read those as well.

guns.name: Wiki Staff Page
guns.description: Information on the roles and permissions that these users possess can be found at the Roles page.

stats.Senbo to Kami100:
Fandom: Senbo to Kami
Discord: enVi#7952

guns.name: Manual of Style
guns.description: Hi, and welcome to the Blox Fruits Wiki. This page is a manual, complete with guidelines and etiquette when editing/creating basic articles on this wiki. This page is a standard that you should seriously consider following, so that people know how and what to edit.

guns.name: History of Stock
guns.description: This page is dedicated to writing down the "Stock" of every month, going as far back as December of 2020. Current stock can be seen on the Blox Fruits "Stock" page.

guns.name: History of Stock/Year
guns.description: This is the Blox Fruits Stock History, going as far back as December of 2020.

guns.name: Natural
guns.description: Natural is one of the three classifications of Blox Fruits, alongside Elemental and Beast. Natural fruits grant the user a wide variety of powers that do not fall strictly into elemental control or beast transformations. These abilities are often considered “superpower” types, ranging from gravity manipulation and string control to barrier creation and sound waves. There are currently 24 Natural fruits in the game.
trivia: Natural-type Blox Fruits are not any different from other fruits; it is only a classification, unlike Elemental fruits, which provide the user with immunity to physical attacks.

guns.name: Elemental
guns.description: Elemental is one of the three classifications of Blox Fruits, alongside Natural and Beast. Elemental fruits grant the user powers tied to specific elements, allowing them to manipulate fire, ice, light, magma, and other forces of nature. There are currently 11 Elemental fruits in the game.
trivia: The Level that the player needs for Elemental Reflex to activate is set at about 2% more than their current level.
Smoke is the only common Elemental-type fruit.
Smoke, Blizzard, Lightning and Gas are the only elemental fruits without an awakening, considering that Lightning lost its awakening.
Elemental is the second largest category of Blox Fruits, ahead of Beast and behind Natural.
Uncommon has the most elemental fruits of every category.
Lightning is currently the only fully reworked Elemental fruit.
Lightning is also the only upgradable Elemental fruit via the Admin panel
Dough is notable for being the only fruit based on an artificial substance, rather than a naturally occurring one.
Gas is the only Elemental-type fruit that has a Transformation.
Gas is the most recent (and currently most expensive) Elemental fruit.
Dough is currently the most expensive Elemental fruit to awaken, costing   18,500 to fully awaken.
Magma has the most passive abilities of all Elemental fruits
Elemental fruits have the most fruits that can deal infinite damage which are Smoke, Lightning and Blizzard.
Elemental Fruits have the most fruits that are able to Awaken out of any category.

guns.name: Beast
guns.description: Beast is one of the three main classifications of Blox Fruits, alongside Natural and Elemental. Beast fruits allow the user to transform into powerful animals, mythological creatures, or divine beings, granting abilities that reflect the nature of the form they take. These fruits are often defined by their transformative power, enhanced mobility, and overwhelming presence in combat. There are currently 9 Beast fruits in the game.
trivia: Despite Venom, Rubber, and Diamond having a transformation, they are currently considered Natural fruits. Gas is currently an Elemental fruit, despite it having a transformation.
There are currently no Common or Rare Beast fruits in the game.
Beast fruits make up the highest amount of Mythical fruits in the game.
Every beast fruit except Eagle has a full transformation.
Only 2 Beast-type fruits have an awakening, those fruits being Phoenix and Buddha.

Spider is not a beast fruit. Despite the fact that it has changed its name, it has not changed its type: it is a Natural fruit. It is also because that the Spider fruit allows the user to control strings instead of turning them into a spider (because it used to be the String Fruit).
Mammoth and T-Rex cost the same amount of Money and have the same Permanent Value. Leopard and Yeti now share these too.
Eagle is currently the cheapest and least rare of all the Beast-type fruits in the game.
Dragon is the most expensive Beast-type Blox Fruit, costing   15,000,000, as well as being the most expensive Blox Fruit.
Buddha is the only Beast fruit that needs to have its transformation active to be able to use its moves.
Awakened Buddha, Phoenix, T-Rex and Dragon are the only Beast fruits to have a transformation move that is not named "Transformation".
As of Update 26, Eagle is the newest beast fruit in the game.
There are currently 8 beast fruits that have an M1 (left click), these fruits are: Dragon, Kitsune, Yeti, Leopard, T-Rex, Mammoth, Awakened Phoenix and Eagle.

Many of the Beast fruits do not allow the user to use their Fighting Styles, Swords or Guns while transformed except for Buddha and Dragon (Hybrid).
Eagle technically does not have a transformation, but the user is able to yield weapons while flying.
Eagle technically does not have a transformation, but the user is able to yield weapons while flying.
As of Update 26, Eagle and Dragon are the only beast fruits that have usable skins.
Beast has the least number of Blox Fruits, after Elemental with 11 and Natrual with 21.

guns.name: Permanent Blox Fruits
guns.description: Permanent Blox Fruits are Blox Fruits purchased through the Blox Fruit Dealer or the Shop menu. They may be obtained at any time, in any sea via Robux   or through gifting. When purchasing a Permanent Fruit, players have the option to gift to others, causing immediate activation on the receiving end, or to store the fruit in the Inventory, allowing the fruit to be traded at a later date. Permanent Fruits in the Inventory will be assigned the Premium rarity regardless of price.
trivia: With the release of revamped fruits, Permanent Fruit prices changed, with the most notable being Bomb, Spike, Rocket, and Spin.
Dragon had the most drastic change in price, spiking up from   2,600 to   5,000 (a 92.3% increase).
In older updates, Permanent Fruits were the only reliable way to own multiple fruits at once, as the Fruit Storage gamepass was not yet available.
The total cost of every Permanent Fruit is   68,880.
Permanent Fruits are generally known as Perm Fruits or Perms.
Permanent Fruits can be bought from the Dealer even when not in stock.

guns.name: Rarities
guns.description: Most items that are found in Blox Fruits are given a rarity, which is indicated by a tag of colored text. They are applied to Blox Fruits, swords, guns, accessories, materials, scrolls, fishing rods, and various paid items.

guns.name: Premium
guns.description: Premium is a special rarity for paid items in the inventory.

guns.name: Private Servers
guns.description: Private servers are an integrated part of Roblox that Blox Fruits uses. They can be purchased for   200 which renews every 30 days for the same price.
trivia: Only 2 fruits can spawn inside of a private server since its start.
Bosses will not immediately spawn at the start of a server. They'll instead spawn when their respawn period is over.
Upon start, servers start on a half moon, with the sun halfway in the sky.
The Player Hunter will refuse to give the player a quest while in a private server, stating "Sorry, you must join a public server for PvP tasks."
Inside private servers, the build limit of the Creation Fruit increases from 40 to 189.

guns.name: Server Browser
trivia: Server names use the old version of fruit names. For example, a server may be named "Weak Soul", despite the fact that it was renamed to Spirit.
Server names can also contain usernames of developers, like "Large TAWG", which was one of mygame43's previous usernames.
Some servers like England, Hong Kong, etc. have been removed.
The Server Browser button can also be a circle with no text.

guns.name: System Messages
guns.description: System Messages are notifications of specific events such as the spawning of Raid Bosses, high-bounty player joins, questline quotes, event messages, etc.
trivia: When the Stored <Sword> message appears, instead of Stored Fox Lamp , it shows the words of another sword. It can even display swords that users do not own or already own, or admin-exclusive swords like Triple Dark Blade.

guns.name: Soundtracks
guns.description: Soundtracks are an indispensable part of every game. Blox Fruits has many soundtracks, these soundtracks in game all contribute to increasing highlights in certain locations, creating atmosphere or sometimes improving the experience.

guns.name: Codes
guns.description: Codes can be redeemed by clicking the  icon on the bottom left side of the player's screen and entering the code.

stats.Notes: Currently having 2750 stat levels on Gun, Sword, and Blox Fruit stats will give an 88.4x multiplier. Each stat level adds a x1.0346759259 (3.46759259%) buff.

accessories.name: Upgrading
trivia: Upon upgrading an item, a white star will appear at the top left corner of the item in the player's inventory.

In order for the player to upgrade every single weapon from the First Sea, they have to be at least in the Third Sea because of Soul Cane, Pole (1st Form), and Saber needing Radioactive Material, and Bazooka needing Dragon Scales.

In total, to upgrade every weapon (excluding Triple Dark Blade), a player would need exactly:
 800  Bones
 432  Scrap Metals
 399  Leathers
 149  Magma Ores
 104  Dragon Scales
 79  Angel Wings
 79  Fish Tails
 69  Mystic Droplets
 58  Mini Tusks
 49  Vampire Fangs
 40  Ectoplasms
 30  Radioactive Materials
 18  Demonic Wisps
 16  Conjured Cocoas
 10  Azure Embers
 10  Blaze Embers
 5  Dark Fragments
 4  Meteorites
800  Bones
432  Scrap Metals
399  Leathers
149  Magma Ores
104  Dragon Scales
79  Angel Wings
79  Fish Tails
69  Mystic Droplets
58  Mini Tusks
49  Vampire Fangs
40  Ectoplasms
30  Radioactive Materials
18  Demonic Wisps
16  Conjured Cocoas
10  Azure Embers
10  Blaze Embers
5  Dark Fragments
4  Meteorites
Weapons that are obtained in the First Sea have a higher upgrade output than those in the Second or Third Sea, which might be due to the betterment of weapons as the player progresses through seas.

accessories.name: Enchantments
moves: Fishing Rod Protector — Prevents line snap once per catch. Instead, boosts progress by 30% and calms the fish.

accessories.name: Dark Coat
trivia: The Dark Coat was the first Mythical accessory introduced to Blox Fruits, arriving well over a year before any others.
The Dark Coat ranks among the top accessories available in Second Sea.
Equipping the Dark Coat will grant the player the title "Wicked Captain" #127.
While the Dark Coat is a Mythical accessory, many Legendary accessories far surpass it.
The Dark Coat is the symbol in the 2x Boss Drop Chance's icon.

accessories.name: First Sea
trivia: The First Sea is the first type of sea in the game and also the oldest of the 3 seas in Blox Fruits. This is also where the fewest scripters and bounty hunters are found.
Set Home Point NPCs appear on every island except the Jean-Luc Island.

accessories.name: Second Sea
trivia: Second Sea contains the most Easter Eggs in the game.

accessories.name: Third Sea
trivia: The Third Sea holds the title of having the least number of islands (8); however, more are to come. It also could be counted as 12 islands, as there are several mini-islands in the Sea of Treats or 17 if the Mirage Island, Kitsune Island, Treasure Island, Frozen Dimension and Prehistoric Island are included.
The enemies past the Ice Cream Land (Sea of Treats) use Aura, nullifying Elemental Reflex even if the player surpasses the required Level.

accessories.name: Inventory
trivia: Before Update 17.3.5 players could not un-store fruits in First Sea.
The inventory was added to replace the Treasure Inventory.

accessories.name: PvP mechanics
accessories.description: There are several PvP mechanics implemented into Blox Fruits. Some PvP mechanics allow players to get on a more even playing field, while other mechanics make a certain player overpowered. These mechanics mostly do not apply to NPCs and bosses and only apply to players fighting each other, as PvP means Player Versus Player.

accessories.name: Nerd
trivia: If the player does not have any accessory equipped, he will instead say "Are you lurking?".
The Nerd is one of the only NPCs besides the scientists to wear glasses visually.

accessories.name: NPCs
accessories.description: NPCs, or Non-Player Characters, are entities ingame that the player can interact with in some way. They can be found on almost every Island. They provide Quests, sell Items, or teach the player Fighting Styles.
trivia: Some NPCs are based on developers of Blox Fruit or popular Blox Fruits Youtubers.
There are currently 146 NPCs in the game.
Sometimes when joining the game, some NPCs will load slowly or stop loading costumes, making them wearing nothing.
Dog House (Indra) is the first NPC in the game.
The Arena Trainer and Horned Man are the only Quest NPCs to ever reward the players Fragments.

Blox Fruit Dealer Cousin, Norp, Wenlocktoad Over Heaven, Layandikit12, Treasure Inventory, Colors Specialist are NPCs that have been removed from the game or will not return in the future. As for Party Shop, Valentine Shop, Magic Elf, Greedy Elf, and Santa Claws NPCs can only appear during the event.
Among them, Treasure Inventory is the only NPC whose glowing circle color is purple.
Among them, Treasure Inventory is the only NPC whose glowing circle color is purple.

accessories.name: Colosseum Quest
accessories.description: The Colosseum quest is a special quest given out by Bartilo that is extremely important as it allows access to both the Third Sea and Race V2. The quests are pretty easy if the player uses an Elemental, large AoE fruits/swords, or Buddha.
trivia: The quest of the trial saves, even when the player leaves, but the Swan Pirate's part does not save because of the same system of normal Quests.
The code for freeing gladiators is this:  ᛉᛞᛈᛃᛖᚫᚺᛒ
The same symbols from the code for freeing gladiators can also be seen in Buddhas awakened transformation.

accessories.name: Bosses
accessories.description: Bosses are a type of enemy that is significantly stronger than a normal enemy. They drop more EXPEXP and Money  , as well as item drops such as swords, materials, accessories, and guns. They can often attack the player using not only M1 attacks but also abilities. Bosses reward bounty/honor upon being defeated. Additionally, immunities don't work against them (e.g. Blade's Passive, Elemental Immunities). For more information, see Tips for Bosses.
trivia: There are currently 34 bosses in the game.

Most older bosses use the legacy version of their respective Swords or Blox Fruits. For example, Stone uses the old version of the Bomb fruit.
An exception to this is Don Swan, who has been updated to use modern moves from Spider, and Hydra Leader, who uses the first two moves of Venom.
An exception to this is Don Swan, who has been updated to use modern moves from Spider, and Hydra Leader, who uses the first two moves of Venom.
Longma was the only boss to not be able to be seen with Instinct. That was changed later after Update 20.
The average spawn time of every boss is around 20 to 45 minutes (except Raid Bosses).

The First Sea has the most bosses out of all seas, with the number of 16. Third Sea is on the second place after Third Sea with the amount of 10, and last place being Second Sea with the amount of eight (Although 4 of the Third Sea bosses are quest-specific.)
Killing all of the bosses with the quest will give about   165,000 in the First Sea,   170,000 in the Second Sea, and   247,500 in the Third Sea (without 2x Money).

accessories.name: Coat
trivia: The Coat is the first and only accessory that can change its visual appearance depending on which team the player is in.
The Marines logo on the Coat is not actually the same marine logo on marine ships, but is instead inspired from outside of Blox Fruits.

accessories.name: Tomoe Ring
trivia: It is not recommended for players to buy the Tomoe Ring because of the high cost. Instead, saving   500,000 to buy other things (Instinct, Water Kung-Fu) is a lot better.
If the player does not meet the requirements to purchase Tomoe Ring, Yoshi will say "You're not ready yet, brat." when spoken to.
The Lv. 575 Boss, Thunder God wears the Tomoe Ring but does not gain any buffs from it.
The Tomoe Ring's description says that it is a metal ring with tomoes, but instead of having tomoes, it has yin-and-yang.
The Tomoe Ring, along with the Swordsman Hat and Lei, are the only accessories that provide a buff to only one stat.

accessories.name: Terror Jaw
trivia: The Terrorshark also has a similar design of the accessory on its model, hence the name "Terror Jaw".

accessories.name: Events
accessories.description: Events are limited-time activities. Every year or visit milestone, Blox Fruits releases a special update that comes with a new limited currency, NPCs, titles and items or to organize a small event.

accessories.name: Common
trivia: The carp is the lightest of all common fish (19kg).
The heaviest fish is the Grouper (44kg).

accessories.name: Legendary
trivia: Beast Hunter is the only boat to have a rarity.

accessories.name: Fighting Styles
trivia:
All fighting styles have three different moves, except Combat, which has two, and Death Step and Dark Step, which have four.
However, the extra moves on the four-skill fighting styles exist mainly to boost damage of the other abilities.
However, the extra moves on the four-skill fighting styles exist mainly to boost damage of the other abilities.
Dragon Breath is currently the only fighting style having a fragment-only price.
Sanguine Art and possibly Combat are the only fighting styles in the game without a "V2".
Godhuman and Sanguine Art are the only fighting styles that require Materials.
On each fighting style other than Combat, there is the letter M at the bottom left corner of their icon, along with a white or black border surrounding the icon.
All First Sea fighting style teachers are Shop NPCs, but in the Second Sea and the Third Sea, all Fighting Style Teachers are Misc. NPCs.

accessories.name: Blox Fruits
trivia: It would cost   68,880 to buy every permanent fruit, and   84,432,500 to buy every fruit from the Blox Fruit Dealer.

Most bosses use the older versions of their fruits.
Don Swan is the only one who uses Spider with its updated moveset.
Don Swan is the only one who uses Spider with its updated moveset.
Many Blox Fruit moves have Destructible Physics, as with many other types of attacks.

accessories.name: Guns
trivia:
Guns can have many different types of projectile weapons, such as:
The Venom Bow being a bow,
The Skull Guitar being a guitar,
The Refined Slingshot, the Kabucha and the Slingshot being slingshots.
The Venom Bow being a bow,
The Skull Guitar being a guitar,
The Refined Slingshot, the Kabucha and the Slingshot being slingshots.

accessories.name: Water
trivia: While sailing in the First Sea, one will find a glowing red brick identical to the classic Roblox killbrick. The brick, however, does no damage and the player can't stand on it. This brick is found in front of Frozen Village, and near Jungle.
Players can get a title named "The Kraken" by dropping a fruit into the sea (only in Second Sea or Third Sea). Recommended that the player uses a low rarity fruit to obtain this.

Water appears everywhere, even in areas such as Portal's Dimensional Rift. There is also a glitch where if the player gets past the teleportation wall, they will fall into space and then into the water. Or simply, the player can see the water surface in Underwater City.

Enemies do not swim or take damage in water, instead, they immediately teleport back to their spawn point if they touch the water, an exception to this is sea event enemy.
Enemies using Ice or awakened Magma cannot walk on water, despite the player being able to do so.
In Buddha Raids, the Buddha users can walk in water for a medium distance before they get teleported back.
Enemies using Ice or awakened Magma cannot walk on water, despite the player being able to do so.
In Buddha Raids, the Buddha users can walk in water for a medium distance before they get teleported back.

accessories.name: Health
accessories.description: Health (also known as HP, hit points, health points) is a fundamental feature in Blox Fruits. Once a player has zero health, they will die and respawn a few seconds later , with the exception of the Ghost and Pain fruits which can resurrect you one time before you can be killed. The more health the player has, the more durable they will be from other attacks. Health deduction can be reduced by activating Aura. Full body Aura reduces damage taken by 30% before subtracting it from the player's health. Health scales off the current Defense stat, with 5 HP being added for each stat point put, the amount of health one has can be measured by using the following equation:
trivia:
The max health a player can have is 16512. It can be obtained by having 2750 Defense point stats and using the Leviathan Shield accessory, and having at least Draco v3. With no accessories or buffs, the max amount of health would be 13845.
20483 when using the Leviathan Shield accessory and Shark V4's (upgraded) Leviathan Armor ability.
With just the Leviathan Shield accessory, the max health would be 14845.
20483 when using the Leviathan Shield accessory and Shark V4's (upgraded) Leviathan Armor ability.
With just the Leviathan Shield accessory, the max health would be 14845.
Leviathan Crown, Pilot Helmet, Kitsune Ribbon, Lei and Feathered Visage (dropped from the 'Tyrant of the Skies' Raid Boss) are the only accessories that increase health regeneration speed.

Players can get the following two Titles in Second or Third Sea for losing health:
The Undefeated One (#080): Receive damage from a player and survive with less than 50 HP left
Immortal Being (#081): Receive damage from a player and survive with 1 HP left
The Undefeated One (#080): Receive damage from a player and survive with less than 50 HP left
Immortal Being (#081): Receive damage from a player and survive with 1 HP left
Every time the player levels up or completes a quest with low health and/or energy, their health and energy will automatically be restored unless the player is in combat.

The [F] (mobility) moves of Flame, Ice, Spider, Light and Eagle go faster with the higher Health the player has.
Opposite to that, the [F] (mobility) moves of Blade, Sound and Venom move go faster the lower the Health the player has.
Opposite to that, the [F] (mobility) moves of Blade, Sound and Venom move go faster the lower the Health the player has.
Bomb's [V] move exchanges the player's health for damage.

accessories.name: Energy
accessories.description: Energy is a fundamental feature in Blox Fruits. Once a player has zero energy, they have to wait until their energy bar is no longer empty or else the player cannot dash or use certain moves. It is essential for performing most actions in Blox Fruits, such as using moves, dodges, Air Jumps, Flash Steps, and others. Energy scales off the current Melee stat, with 5 Energy being added for each stat point allocated. The amount of energy one has can be measured by using the following equation:
trivia: The regeneration of energy scales with the players stats, being faster the higher their energy stats are. (2x faster on the ground)
One dash consumes 30 energy (unless the player is using the Rabbit race, which allows only 15 energy to be consumed).

The max amount of energy a player can have is 17930, with 2750 stat points in Melee, using the Kitsune Ribbon accessory, whilst being in an awakened form of their race. With no accessories or buffs, the max energy would be 13845. With just the Kitsune Ribbon accessory, it would be 16345.

Trying to use a move that requires more energy than the player currently has will make a message appear saying "Low energy! [Amount of energy the move requires] energy required." and the move will not activate.

Normal M1 attacks, such as kicking, punching, swinging a sword, firing a gun, using abilities such as the V3/V4 of a Race, Summon Sea Beast, and Admin Abilities will not drain energy.
The only exceptions are Skull Guitar, Rubber, Dough (V2), Phoenix (V2)'s M1 and Diamond M1.
The only exceptions are Skull Guitar, Rubber, Dough (V2), Phoenix (V2)'s M1 and Diamond M1.
Other players' and enemies' energy bars can be seen by using Instinct and Instinct V2
The Masterpiece enchantment can remove the energy cost for the attacks of the item it is on.
If the player completely runs out of energy, they are given the title “Empty Vessel” (#067).  It is recommended to use Phoenix's [X] move for the most efficient energy drain.

accessories.name: Life Leech
accessories.description: Life Leech (also known as "lifesteal") is a Game Mechanic that allows users to regain health by dealing damage to enemies and players.
trivia: Gaining health with Shark's Leviathan's Armor gear is not considered a life leech as it has a fixed amount of shield capacity.

accessories.name: Instinct
trivia: Extra Instinct dodges that the player gains from accessories count towards training.
If the player is holding a move (ex. Cursed Dual Katana's [X] move) with Instinct active and they get hit, it will break regardless of if they have dodges.

Non-boss enemies only drain half a dodge charge, instead of a full charge.
They still give the player 1 EXP, meaning using instinct on non-boss enemies is the best way to grind EXP.
They still give the player 1 EXP, meaning using instinct on non-boss enemies is the best way to grind EXP.

Many attacks can temporarily disable Instinct (such as Spider's X move), known as "Instinct Breaking". Players can use this to their advantage during PvP. NPC attacks can also sometimes disable Instinct.
For a list of moves that can break Instinct, see Instinct/Break.
For a list of moves that can break Instinct, see Instinct/Break.

Activating Instinct during a move to avoid additional damage or combos is known as "Instinct-Tricking" or more commonly known as 'Ken-Tricking'. This can be used to avoid a lot of damage but might need practice to perform successfully.

The maximum number of dodges is 8 (11 with Pale Scarf or Kitsune Mask, and Human v2) at 2824 EXP, but players are recommended to get it to 5000 EXP for maximum range and to be able to do the Hungry Man Quest to get Instinct V2.
Upon reaching Instinct’s max level, the player will be given the "Ultra Instinct" title #072.
It takes approximately 50 seconds for 1 dodge to recover.
Other players are always detected from further away than NPCs. This is to prevent lag.
It is recommended to get Instinct before going Second Sea since it can prove to be very important and useful later on in the game, alongside gaining more EXP as the player goes on with the game.
There is no cooldown when the player hops servers, therefore making it easier to grind EXP by simply hopping servers when the player has finished their charges.
Instinct can detect NPCs that have not spawned if the player's range is far enough.
Resetting with Instinct enabled will disable Instinct.

The player's Instinct will be forcefully disabled when they join a raid, since "special abilities" are disabled during raids. Instinct is disabled for the entire time until they die or complete the raid.
Equipping an accessory that grants extra dodges then removing the accessory will allow the player to keep the extra dodges until they’re used up.
The player can see the enemy’s health and energy before they spawn.

Moves that can go through solid objects and still damage opponents (ex. Skull Guitar's [Z]) mostly miss when the user tries to aim at their enemy through Instinct, because the object decreases the depth between the aimed location and the user.

accessories.name: Sea Danger Level
trivia: When Frozen Dimension is spawned before the Leviathan fight is triggered, Sea Danger Level 6 will appear just as clear as other levels.

Level 6 is actually supposed to be called "The Dark Sea" as supported by Nerd's dialogue when interacting with him while wearing Kitsune Mask.
This might be a reference to the Dark Sea from the game Arcane Odyssey, made by Vetex Games.
This might be a reference to the Dark Sea from the game Arcane Odyssey, made by Vetex Games.
Danger levels are a feature only found in the Third Sea.

There was a bug where if the player brings 10-12 players (a normal server's full player capacity) into one, single boat, rare Sea Events such as Frozen Dimension and Prehistoric Island could spawn at any Danger Level, including 0. The bug has since been patched.

There was a bug where if the player used another accessory and then equipped the Leviathan Shield or Kitsune Ribbon, they would get flung a bit. (If the player equipped it while sitting in the boat, it would change the direction of their boat. The bug was later patched.

accessories.name: Pink Coat
trivia: The Pink Coat used to be the only Uncommon accessory, but it has been changed in Update 24 with the addition of the Dojo Belts.
The Pink Coat is the only Uncommon accessory that isn't connected with the Dragon Dojo or the Dojo Belts.
Although the Pink Coat is a spikey coat, it isn't called Pink Spikey Coat like the Blue Spikey Coat , Red Spikey Coat or Black Spikey Coat.

accessories.name: Bandanna (Black)
trivia: Second highest energy increase out of all accessories (the first being the Kitsune Ribbon with 2,500 energy).
Second highest movement speed increase out of all accessories, tied with Hunter Cape and Dojo Belt (Black). (First being Pilot Helmet)

accessories.name: Bandanna (Green)
trivia: Second highest energy increase out of all accessories (the first being the Kitsune Ribbon with 2,500 energy).
Second highest movement speed increase out of all accessories, tied with Hunter Cape. (First being Pilot Helmet)

accessories.name: Bandanna (Red)
trivia: Second highest energy increase out of all accessories (the first being the Kitsune Ribbon with 2,500 energy).
Second highest movement speed increase out of all accessories, tied with Hunter Cape. (First being Pilot Helmet)

accessories.name: Black Cape
trivia: As the item's description insinuates, the Black Cape is not very black, even to the point of being considered gray instead.
The Black Cape is one of the easiest accessories to obtain although it can only be bought as soon as the player has enough money and being Lv. 50.

accessories.name: Black Spikey Coat
trivia: This accessory is a direct upgrade to the Black Cape accessory in First Sea.

accessories.name: Blue Spikey Coat
trivia: The Blue Spikey Coat can be thought of as an inversion of the Red Spikey Coat, since Energy and Health are swapped.
The Red Spikey Coat and the Blue Spikey Coat is a better improved version when it comes to health and energy of the Black Spikey Coat.

accessories.name: Choppa
trivia: Choppa has one of the highest cooldown reductions in Blox Fruits, along with the Zebra Cap.

accessories.name: Cool Shades
trivia: Cool Shades is considered as the best accessory available in the First Sea (other than the accessories obtained from Events) for grinding and buffs, mainly because of its damage and movement speed buffs.
The Swan Glasses are a direct upgrade to the Cool Shades in terms of stats.
Cool Shades is the only accessory in First Sea that buffs movement speed.

accessories.name: Dojo Belt (Black)
trivia: After obtaining the Dojo Belt (Black), the player gains the ability talk to the Dragon Wizard.
The Dojo Belt (Black) is the only Dojo Belt that is Rare instead of Uncommon.
The Dojo Belt (Black) has the highest Melee damage buff in the game, making it good for grinding for Buddha users.
The following statement would be true if it wasn't bugged to only give 7% damage buff for some reason.

accessories.name: Hunter Cape (Black)
trivia:
The Hunter Cape is the second highest health increase out of all accessories (the first being the Leviathan Shield with 1,000 health).
It also has the second highest movement speed increase out of all accessories, tied with Bandanna and Dojo Belt (Black) (the first being Pilot Helmet). It is considered by many players that this is the overall best accessory in the game.

It also has the second highest movement speed increase out of all accessories, tied with Bandanna and Dojo Belt (Black) (the first being Pilot Helmet). It is considered by many players that this is the overall best accessory in the game.

accessories.name: Hunter Cape (Green)
trivia: The Hunter Cape is considered by many players to be one of the best overall accessories in the game.

The Hunter Cape and Uzoth's Cloak is the second highest health increase out of all accessories (the first being the Leviathan Shield with 1,000 health).
It also has the second highest movement speed increase out of all accessories, tied with Bandanna and Dojo Belt (Black) (the first being Pilot Helmet).
It also has the second highest movement speed increase out of all accessories, tied with Bandanna and Dojo Belt (Black) (the first being Pilot Helmet).

accessories.name: Hunter Cape (Red)
trivia:
The Hunter Cape is the second highest health increase out of all accessories (the first being the Leviathan Shield with 1,000 health).
It also has the second highest movement speed increase out of all accessories, tied with Bandanna and Dojo Belt (Black) (the first being Pilot Helmet). It is considered by many players that this is the overall best accessory in the game.

It also has the second highest movement speed increase out of all accessories, tied with Bandanna and Dojo Belt (Black) (the first being Pilot Helmet). It is considered by many players that this is the overall best accessory in the game.

accessories.name: Jaw Shield
trivia: The Captain Elephant wears the Jaw Shield visually, although he does not drop it upon defeat.

accessories.name: Lei
trivia: The Lei is the highest health regeneration accessory in the game.
The Lei can be useful when paired with other recovery moves, or with Buddha, giving the user extra health regeneration on top of the damage reduction.
The Lei is powerful if paired with other regeneration abilities, such as Phoenix's [X], Angel's Heavenly Blood, and it can also stack with Ghoul to increase regeneration speed.
The Lei is the one of the only accessories that provides a single buff, alongside the Swordsman Hat and the Tomoe Ring.

accessories.name: Pilot Helmet
trivia: The Pilot Helmet provides the highest movement speed among every accessory.
The Pilot Helmet is good for PvP when paired with a Blox Fruit that increases movement speed, such as Leopard.

The Pilot Helmet is widely regarded as one of the best accessories in the PvP community due to it having the highest raw speed increase, which makes it very suitable for air PvP where accessories that buff dash distance are disadvantaged.

accessories.name: Red Spikey Coat
trivia: The Blue Spikey Coat gives a 7.5% attack bonus, and swaps the health and energy stats.

accessories.name: Top Hat
trivia: Sabi wears the Top Hat.

accessories.name: Warrior Helmet
trivia: The Warrior Helmet appears to be based off an ancient Spartan helmet.

accessories.name: Cupid's Coat
trivia: This item shares a model with the Holiday Cloak.
The Cupid's Coat, along with Kitsune Ribbon, Holiday Cloak and some other accessories have animation.

accessories.name: Dragon Mantle
trivia: The Dragon Mantle has the highest gun damage buff in the game.
The Dragon Mantle is the first and only accessory to grant more Air Jumps.

accessories.name: Feathered Visage
trivia: The Tyrant of the Skies wears the Feathered Visage, but does not receive the buffs of it.
The Feathered Visage looks quite similar to the Valkyrie Helm.

accessories.name: Sea Danger Level
trivia: When Frozen Dimension is spawned before the Leviathan fight is triggered, Sea Danger Level 6 will appear just as clear as other levels.

Level 6 is actually supposed to be called "The Dark Sea" as supported by Nerd's dialogue when interacting with him while wearing Kitsune Mask.
This might be a reference to the Dark Sea from the game Arcane Odyssey, made by Vetex Games.
This might be a reference to the Dark Sea from the game Arcane Odyssey, made by Vetex Games.
Danger levels are a feature only found in the Third Sea.

There was a bug where if the player brings 10-12 players (a normal server's full player capacity) into one, single boat, rare Sea Events such as Frozen Dimension and Prehistoric Island could spawn at any Danger Level, including 0. The bug has since been patched.

There was a bug where if the player used another accessory and then equipped the Leviathan Shield or Kitsune Ribbon, they would get flung a bit. (If the player equipped it while sitting in the boat, it would change the direction of their boat. The bug was later patched.

accessories.name: Kitsune Ribbon
trivia: Some Roblox avatars cause an error making the ribbon to move away from the player whilst using Buddha.
This is the only accessory that decreases Flash Step ability's cooldown.

This accessory is very useful for hybrid builds; when stats on melee are unneeded, the energy provided from this accessory is enough for the player not to worry about energy depletion and skill usage.

accessories.name: Leviathan Crown
trivia: The Leviathan Crown does not affect the chance of getting the Fist of Darkness from Sea Beasts, Blox Fruits from Ship raids and Dragon from Dragon Eggs in Prehistoric Island.
The Leviathan Crown is the second accessory that increases Sea Event damage, with the first being Shark Tooth Necklace.
The Leviathan Crown is recommended to be used in order to ease the process of getting materials from sea events, as well as dealing additional damage against sea events.

accessories.name: Musketeer Hat
trivia: The word "musket" is in the Musketeer Hat's name, yet it provides buffs for swords, suggesting irony in its naming.

accessories.name: Pale Scarf
trivia: If the user equips Pale Scarf, turns on Instinct and then unequips it (or equips another accessory) the user can see that its ability to increase Instinct range is still active, but when Instinct is turned off and turned on again, it will be lost.
The Pale Scarf can be used to farm Instinct due to the additional dodges provided.
It is recommended to use the Pale Scarf alongside Human V4 as it significantly boosts the player's Instinct dodges.
There is a bug where if players die with the scarf with instinct active, even if you switch accessories still has 10 dodges. This bug will reset after rejoining.

accessories.name: Sea Events
trivia: Some Sea Events can spawn with another Sea Events, but this is very rare. For example, Mirage Island with a Rumbling Waters and a Terrorshark, making it a heavily guarded Island.
After the players' boat gets destroyed whilst exploring danger levels, the meter for it will be gone, unless another boat is nearby.
Though very rare, Sea Events such as Sharks can spawn in Sea Danger Level 0 outside of Tiki Outpost.

accessories.name: Valkyrie Helm
trivia: The Valkyrie Helm is worn by the rip_indra Raid Boss.
The Valkyrie Helm is based off of the expensive Valkyrie in the Roblox catalog.

accessories.name: Holiday Cloak
trivia: The Holiday Cloak is the first accessory that has an animation, the second being Cupid's Coat.

During Update 18, there was a glitch where if the player shifts and unshifts with Buddha, the Holiday Cloak would have cloned itself. The player could have wore other accessories with it, although the buffs would have not been stacked or added on. (Patched)
There is also a glitch where if a player transforms with Leopard, and then equip the Holiday Cloak in their inventory, when double jumps, the cape will spin.
There is also a glitch where if a player transforms with Leopard, and then equip the Holiday Cloak in their inventory, when double jumps, the cape will spin.

If the player uses first person mode, they can see the Holiday Cloak behind them, unlike other accessories, which appear invisible in first person.
This is due to the in-game animation not available on the original Roblox Avatar as the avatar only supports non-animated clothing.
This is due to the in-game animation not available on the original Roblox Avatar as the avatar only supports non-animated clothing.

accessories.name: Leviathan Shield
trivia: The Leviathan Shield and the Dark Coat are the only Mythical obtainable accessories without events.
The Leviathan Shield is currently the only Mythical accessory that can be crafted with Materials.
The Leviathan Shield is the only Mythical accessory that can be obtained through sea events.
The Leviathan Shield is the only accessory that gives damage reduction to water.

accessories.name: Oni Helmet
trivia: Oddly enough, both the Sanguine Cloak and Oni Helmet do not have any descriptions.
As with the Sanguine Cloak, in the first hours after the update it was giving only +15% Oni Tokens from the Oni Fisherman, but they later buffed it to 30%.

accessories.name: Party Hat
trivia: This is the only accessory to give bonus experience in both levels and mastery.

This is the only Mythical accessory that has to be bought from an event currency.
It is also the second mythical accessory to be added. (Dark Coat being the first)
It is also the second mythical accessory to be added. (Dark Coat being the first)
Party Hat's old description being changed may imply that this accessory may return in the future.

accessories.name: Sanguine Cloak
trivia: As with the Oni Helmet, in the first hours after the update it was giving only +15% Oni Tokens from the Oni Fisherman, but they later buffed it to 30%.
When the Sanguine Cloak was first released, it had a 5% damage reduction on both Melee and Sword, but the Sword defense was later removed.
