Oddly enough, both the Sanguine Cloak and Oni Helmet do not have a description in the inventory.
When using the Sanguine Cloak, defeating Oni Soldiers and giving a Common Corrupted Fish to the Oni Fisherman will reward 13 Oni Tokens and defeating the Red Commander will grant 390 Oni Tokens.
This item is now unobtainable.
As of update 27.3 the +30% Oni Tokens buff is useless as they are unobtainable.

accessories.name: Uzoth's Cloak
trivia: Uzoth's Cloak was first revealed in a Uzoth video, and has not been shown in any other channel source that showcases it being used.
Uzoth's Cloak also has an animated skull necklace attached to it.

accessories.name: Fishing Rods
accessories.description: Fishing Rods are gear that can be used for Fishing.
moves: Fishing Rod Protector: Prevents line snap once per catch. Instead, boosts progress by 30% and calms the fish.
Curse of the Leviathan: Catching a specific species may trigger an unknown event.
Curse of the Terrorshark: Start with 20% extra progress, but fish panic much faster.
Curse of the Whale: Final fish weight increases by 15%, but may consume 2 bait instead of 1.
Blessing of Bait Efficiency: 20% chance to not consume materials when crafting bait.
Blessing of an Angler’s Treasure: Increases daily treasure limit by 3. (This enchantment is bugged and currently doesn't work.)

accessories.name: Fish
trivia: Giving fish to the event fisherman with max tokens will give nothing.
If the player consumes the last type of fish they have and then captures the same fish it will appear as captured for the first time even though it is not.

The player can only have 301 fish in their inventory. If they try to catch another fish with a full inventory, a message will display saying: "Your fish inventory is full! If you catch any fish, you won't be able to carry them! Release them manually or visit the Fisherman to sell them".

In the Update 27.1 trailer, Admin Uzoth is shown fishing in the pond at Dragon Dojo and catch a Dragon Koi. However, it is actually unknown where to fish for it, and what rods and baits are required for it. It is thought to be unobtainable as of now.

Fishing for making Money is not recommended as it is slow and Rarities does not matter (only weight does).
Fishing is recommended for crafting Foods and Potions, or completing Events, such as RIP Event and Red King Event.
Fishing is recommended for crafting Foods and Potions, or completing Events, such as RIP Event and Red King Event.
The higher the weight, higher the rarity. Therefore a gold fish, which weights 12kg, is a rare.

accessories.name: Items
accessories.description: Items are objects or weapons that can be carried in the hotbar and held or simply stored in the inventory bar.

accessories.name: Consumables
accessories.description: Consumables are items that can be consumed to gain special effects. They can be obtained from the campfire.

accessories.name: Foods
accessories.description: Foods are consumables that grants their consumer effects.

accessories.name: Skins
accessories.description: Skins are wearable cosmetics that change the visuals of certain abilities and transformations.
trivia:
Collecting all Legendary colors (excluding limited variants) requires   22,500,  15 ,  10 , and  15 .
Collecting all Rare colors requires   15,000,  3 ,  8 ,  3 ,  2 ,  2 ,  2 ,  2 , and  4 .
Collecting all Rare colors requires   15,000,  3 ,  8 ,  3 ,  2 ,  2 ,  2 ,  2 , and  4 .
Unlocking all aura skins requires a total cost of   37,500 or   1,830,  3 ,  8 ,  6 ,  2 ,  2 ,  25 ,  12 ,  25 ,  1000 ,  1000 , at least  15 ,  250 and  250
During Update 17.3.5, a bug occurred where the Party Hat and the Aquamarine aura color could not be equipped.

There is a known glitch where the aura color on the avatar does not exactly match the aura color on Swords, Guns or Electric Claw.
This happens when you activate an aura, then you switch to another, without reactivating.
This happens when you activate an aura, then you switch to another, without reactivating.
Equipping Rainbow Saviour causes the color cycle to stop when zooming out. The effect resumes once zooming back in.
Mythical Aura Skins, (Rainbow Saviour, Dragon, Kitsune, Oni and Celestial), are the only with shifting animations.
Before Update 24, Hoops were required to change the color of the Dragon (Classic).
After Update 24, all players who had purchased an Aura color prior to the update were automatically awarded the Hakaishin title due to a glitch.
Three Blox Fruits currently have attacks that change color depending on the equipped aura color: Rubber, Spider, and Dough.
Skins for Portal are already listed in the Barista Menu but are not yet craftable. They are planned for release in a future update.

accessories.name: Levels
trivia: Uzoth reached Lv. 2550 (the max level for Update 20)  in just 7 minutes and 45.92 seconds.

It would take around 23 years of non-stop playing to reach Lv. 2750 by doing only Bandit or Trainee quests every three seconds. The player would need to grind the quest 375,909,459 times and need 112,772,837,596 EXPEXP total.

accessories.name: NPCs
accessories.description: NPCs, or Non-Player Characters, are entities ingame that the player can interact with in some way. They can be found on almost every Island. They provide Quests, sell Items, or teach the player Fighting Styles.
trivia: Some NPCs are based on developers of Blox Fruit or popular Blox Fruits Youtubers.
There are currently 146 NPCs in the game.
Sometimes when joining the game, some NPCs will load slowly or stop loading costumes, making them wearing nothing.
Dog House (Indra) is the first NPC in the game.
The Arena Trainer and Horned Man are the only Quest NPCs to ever reward the players Fragments.

Blox Fruit Dealer Cousin, Norp, Wenlocktoad Over Heaven, Layandikit12, Treasure Inventory, Colors Specialist are NPCs that have been removed from the game or will not return in the future. As for Party Shop, Valentine Shop, Magic Elf, Greedy Elf, and Santa Claws NPCs can only appear during the event.
Among them, Treasure Inventory is the only NPC whose glowing circle color is purple.
Among them, Treasure Inventory is the only NPC whose glowing circle color is purple.

accessories.name: Quests
trivia: The Forgotten Quest Giver and the Kingdom of Rose Area 2 Quest Giver have a similar appearance.
There are two Mole Quest Givers. One is located near the Skylands next to the temple that teleports to the Upper Skylands. The other is found in the Upper Skyland itself.
The Deep Forest Quest Giver 1 looks similar to the Tiki Quest Giver 2.
Most quest givers have a yellow exclamation mark on above or even behind them, which makes it easier to find them while searching.
The Arena quest giver is the only quest giver that rewards the player with   fragments.
There is currently a total of 116 quests in the game (including side quests).

accessories.name: Allying
trivia: There was a glitch where if the user is a Marine and joins the Pirates team through the Pirate Recruiter, the ally button will disappear.
Allied players can only be damaged with Meme.

Allying is the only way for the player to ride a Love user's flamingo, a transformed Kitsune or a transformed Dragon with Strong Hair/Saddle. To get teleported by Portal's [C] World Warp without getting allied, the player needs to be outside safe zone. (The player can also get teleported if both are in combat in safe zone.)

accessories.name: Abilities
accessories.description: Abilities are various unique effects and bonuses that the player can learn and use to gain advantages in Blox Fruits.

accessories.name: Damage Counter
trivia: Currently, the YouTuber/admin Uzoth is the record holder for the greatest amount of damage the game has ever recorded, at 988 septillion (9.88 x 10²⁶). The video can be found here.
The most amount of damage done by a non-admin player is imFiji, with 127,518,285. The video can be found here.

accessories.name: Fast Mode
accessories.description: Fast mode is a mode that reduces lag for Blox Fruits on devices. It works by removing the textures in models, making all parts have a smooth plastic texture. It normally takes around 20 seconds to completely execute, and the player can still play during the execution time. However, on some devices, it could take longer.
trivia: Fast mode can be used for finding the hidden texts on the trading tables at mansion. It could still be found without fast mode but using it makes it easier.
Fast mode does not change a lot of FPS in heavy/powerful devices such as PCs or gaming tablets/phones, but it is recommended if the player has a weak phone, old computer.
Some V3 or V4 abilities might not show up. An example for it is the Cyborg V3 ability where the player does not see the particles but they still receive the buffs.

Since update 24, there's a bug where turning on Fast Mode on the menu before choosing a team doesn't fully disable all textures in the game, and the Fast Mode button through the Settings appears as if it wasn't even turned on at all.
This is especially noticeable in the Third Sea, as far areas like Temple of Time may appear fully/partially textured, even when Fast Mode was turned on beforehand. (In this case, turning on Fast Mode through the Settings while being in the Temple of Time will fix this issue.)

This is especially noticeable in the Third Sea, as far areas like Temple of Time may appear fully/partially textured, even when Fast Mode was turned on beforehand. (In this case, turning on Fast Mode through the Settings while being in the Temple of Time will fix this issue.)

accessories.name: Safe Zone
trivia: If the player is already in Combat with another player, the Safe Zone will not protect the player from that person until their Combat indicator disappears. This is to prevent players immediately running to a Safe Zone when losing in PvP or when getting attacked.

The first location of every sea is a safe zone (e.g Pirate/Marine Starter, Kingdom of Rose Docks and Port Town Docks). This is to prevent the player getting attacked immediately while they are spawning in.
The Safe Zone has a delay of about one second before it activates. That means it is possible to be attacked when the player first joins the game.
There is a glitch where after dying in combat the player can be attacked even in a safe zone if other player's combat is still on.
The safe zone near the Blox Fruit Gacha in Jungle was added in Update 20.
The player's speed gets slower by roughly 37.5% whenever they enter a safe zone.

Now in Update 24, if the player is on a private server and the PvP mode is set to "Friendly PvP", the player can be attacked anytime even on Safe Zone places, but they can't lose honor/bounty if they die to another player (that player also can't get honor/bounty).

accessories.name: Titles
accessories.description: Titles are labels that appear next to the player's name when they speak in the Roblox chat.
trivia: “Sugar Rush”, “Christmas Spirit” and “Loco Verde” were only available during the Presents event.
The titles "Death King" and "Undead Lord" are only available during Halloween events.
There was a glitch where upon killing the Leviathan’s head, the title was not awarded. This has recently been fixed.
There is a glitch where if the player is the last person standing in a raid and run out of time, they will still receive the "Last Hope" title.
Unlocking the Rainbow Saviour Aura Color without unlocking any other Aura Colors will wrongfully award the player the "The Collector" title.
Getting the Kitsune Aura skin does not unlock the "The Enhancer" title.
Blox Fruits Staff members who can drop the "Equal to the Heavens" title cannot turn it off unlike normal YouTuber titles.
The "Hakaishin" title #147 means "God of Destruction" in Japanese.
The "Loco Verde" title #156 means "Crazy Green" in Spanish.
The "Shinigami" title #169 means "Soul Reaper" or "God of Death" in Japanese.
Uzoth's title, "Doragontarontorēnā", is a Japanese anglicism which means "dragon talon trainer", likely a reference to the NPC that sells Dragon Talon being based off him.
The "LA FLEUR DU MAL 悪の華" title means "THE FLOWER OF EVIL (French), before Flower of Evil (Japanese)."

accessories.name: Wanted Posters
trivia: If the player is alone in a server as a Pirate, all the posters will only have them displayed, if  there aren't any pirates in the server the wanted posters will not spawn at all.
Upon completion of the quest, the message "<QUEST COMPLETED> Earned   " will appear.
Unlike the Player Hunter, the player can choose whoever they want to hunt down.
Unlike the Player Hunter, kills with quests from wanted posters don't count and don't give exp.
If the target's level has max level, the reward will be stuck at   50,000.
Every couple of minutes the wanted posters will change and the quest will disappear.
If the player dies, the wanted poster will change to another player.

accessories.name: Pictures
trivia: Some pictures do not have official names.
There is a glitch with the pictures "Staff Photo" and "Dragon Talon Trainer" where they fail to load and appear blank. This could possibly be due to a bug or Roblox deleted them.

accessories.name: Sea Exploration Group
trivia: Sea Exploration Group appears only in the Third Sea.
The 20 required sea events for Frozen Dimension include only those that spawn enemies. Events like islands, Haunted Shipwrecks, or Rough Seas do not count.

accessories.name: Experience
trivia: EXPEXP is currently the most abundant quantity in the game, easily reaching into the hundreds of millions for a single level, while other Stats and currencies are rarely seen above ten million.
Roblox Premium allows the user to gain more experience on a quest/kill than a normal player.
It took Uzoth 7 minutes and 45.92 seconds to reach Update 20's MAX level (2550).
The amount of EXPEXP needed per level is defined by [2 x Level^2.3 + 84] = EXP to level up.
It takes a total of 119,938,274,162 EXP119,938,274,162 EXP to reach level 2650.

accessories.name: Mastery
trivia:
Currently, the maximum amount of mastery a fighting style, fruit, sword, or gun can have is 600.
The maximum amount of mastery for fishing rods is 100.
The maximum amount of mastery for fishing rods is 100.

The amount of EXPEXP needed per mastery is defined by this formula:
54 + ((2 * mastery ^ 2.26 + 30) * 0.5)
EXP Calculator
EXP Calculator
The total amount of EXP needed to reach mastery 600 is 348,679,374 EXP348,679,374 EXP.
Getting mastery can be doubled by using the gamepass 2x mastery.
When the player reaches MAX mastery, the item's stats is increased to 425.

accessories.name: Gifting
trivia: Game passes can be stored in the inventory (by "gifting" their inventory), allowing them to be traded (excluding the Respawn Bosses and Change Race game passes).

accessories.name: Update Log
accessories.description: The Update Log is a feature in Blox Fruits that lets players see the planned upcoming updates. It can be accessed by clicking on "Settings", then on "Open Log".

accessories.name: Campfire
accessories.description: The campfire can be crafted through the user's inventory by using one Wooden Plank. It allows the player to craft Potions and other consumables using unlocked recipes, obtained from the Note in a Bottle through fishing.
trivia: Campfires can be available for beginners since wooden planks can be obtained with a lower chance without Shipwright subclass as of Update 27.
When the campfire is going to disappear, you will be notified, saying "Your campfire's flames have been extinguished..." a few seconds before it disappears.
Other players can use your campfire, and so can can you.
If you open the Craft Menu, then walk away from the campfire, the Craft Menu will disappear.
There are currently only 6 available recipes as of Updates/27.1.
The player need 18 Fishes (1 Rare, 4 Uncommon And 13 Common), 1 Leather, 1 Scrap Metal, and 1 Fish Tail to craft every recipe once.
The Player can craft a Fish Kebab, Lava Potion, Aggro Elixir, Loot Seeker, Berserkers Elixir, and Fortune Elixir.
Monk Potion, Invisibility Potion, and Oni Soul potions were limited to Oni Campfire.

accessories.name: Fragments
trivia: On PS5, the player will still be able to see how many fragments they have even if they haven't entered Second Sea.
To see how much Fragments the player has, they need to hover over the Money value on PC. On console and mobile, it always displays.
The Rare Artifact used to fulfill some of the purposes of this currency, but it was then removed in Update 11.
Before Update 20, this currency didn't appear when the player was in the First Sea.
The maximum amount of Fragments a player can hold is   1,000,000,000

It costs   667,450 to fully max everything the player can buy with Fragments (excluding Race Reroll and Stat Reset)
  187,300 to fully Awaken all fruits
  187,250 to fully awaken V4 on every race
  2,500 to buy the Cyborg race for the first time (excluding potential re-purchases)
  31,500 to unlock all Fighting Styles
  30,000 to unlock all crew slots
  1,500 to purchase the Lantern boat from Cyborg
  1,500 to get Kabucha
  37,500 to get all Aura colors from Barista
  91,000 to get all Dragon skins from Barista (both East and West variants)
  10,000 to get the 2 Dragon seats (  5,000 each from the Dragon Tamer)
  15,800 to max the Shipwright subclass
  62,100 to upgrade Gravity, Eagle, Pain and Lightning fruits in the Admin Panel
  9,500 to get all Eagle skins from Barista
187,300 to fully Awaken all fruits
187,250 to fully awaken V4 on every race
2,500 to buy the Cyborg race for the first time (excluding potential re-purchases)
31,500 to unlock all Fighting Styles
30,000 to unlock all crew slots

1,500 to get Kabucha

15,800 to max the Shipwright subclass
62,100 to upgrade Gravity, Eagle, Pain and Lightning fruits in the Admin Panel
9,500 to get all Eagle skins from Barista

accessories.name: Valor
trivia: Valor is currently the only currency that is exclusively obtainable in the Third Sea.
It takes a total of   17,300 and   12,800 to unlock and fully level up all the abilities.

accessories.name: Rules
accessories.description: Thank you for coming to the Blox Fruits Wiki. We have rules set in place to make this place as friendly as possible. Discussion/post rules can be found here, it's probably best that you read those as well.

accessories.name: Wiki Staff Page
accessories.description: Information on the roles and permissions that these users possess can be found at the Roles page.

stats.Senbo to Kami100:
Fandom: Senbo to Kami
Discord: enVi#7952

accessories.name: Manual of Style
accessories.description: Hi, and welcome to the Blox Fruits Wiki. This page is a manual, complete with guidelines and etiquette when editing/creating basic articles on this wiki. This page is a standard that you should seriously consider following, so that people know how and what to edit.

accessories.name: History of Stock
accessories.description: This page is dedicated to writing down the "Stock" of every month, going as far back as December of 2020. Current stock can be seen on the Blox Fruits "Stock" page.

accessories.name: History of Stock/Year
accessories.description: This is the Blox Fruits Stock History, going as far back as December of 2020.

accessories.name: Natural
accessories.description: Natural is one of the three classifications of Blox Fruits, alongside Elemental and Beast. Natural fruits grant the user a wide variety of powers that do not fall strictly into elemental control or beast transformations. These abilities are often considered “superpower” types, ranging from gravity manipulation and string control to barrier creation and sound waves. There are currently 24 Natural fruits in the game.
trivia: Natural-type Blox Fruits are not any different from other fruits; it is only a classification, unlike Elemental fruits, which provide the user with immunity to physical attacks.

accessories.name: Elemental
accessories.description: Elemental is one of the three classifications of Blox Fruits, alongside Natural and Beast. Elemental fruits grant the user powers tied to specific elements, allowing them to manipulate fire, ice, light, magma, and other forces of nature. There are currently 11 Elemental fruits in the game.
trivia: The Level that the player needs for Elemental Reflex to activate is set at about 2% more than their current level.
Smoke is the only common Elemental-type fruit.
Smoke, Blizzard, Lightning and Gas are the only elemental fruits without an awakening, considering that Lightning lost its awakening.
Elemental is the second largest category of Blox Fruits, ahead of Beast and behind Natural.
Uncommon has the most elemental fruits of every category.
Lightning is currently the only fully reworked Elemental fruit.
Lightning is also the only upgradable Elemental fruit via the Admin panel
Dough is notable for being the only fruit based on an artificial substance, rather than a naturally occurring one.
Gas is the only Elemental-type fruit that has a Transformation.
Gas is the most recent (and currently most expensive) Elemental fruit.
Dough is currently the most expensive Elemental fruit to awaken, costing   18,500 to fully awaken.
Magma has the most passive abilities of all Elemental fruits
Elemental fruits have the most fruits that can deal infinite damage which are Smoke, Lightning and Blizzard.
Elemental Fruits have the most fruits that are able to Awaken out of any category.

accessories.name: Beast
accessories.description: Beast is one of the three main classifications of Blox Fruits, alongside Natural and Elemental. Beast fruits allow the user to transform into powerful animals, mythological creatures, or divine beings, granting abilities that reflect the nature of the form they take. These fruits are often defined by their transformative power, enhanced mobility, and overwhelming presence in combat. There are currently 9 Beast fruits in the game.
trivia: Despite Venom, Rubber, and Diamond having a transformation, they are currently considered Natural fruits. Gas is currently an Elemental fruit, despite it having a transformation.
There are currently no Common or Rare Beast fruits in the game.
Beast fruits make up the highest amount of Mythical fruits in the game.
Every beast fruit except Eagle has a full transformation.
Only 2 Beast-type fruits have an awakening, those fruits being Phoenix and Buddha.

Spider is not a beast fruit. Despite the fact that it has changed its name, it has not changed its type: it is a Natural fruit. It is also because that the Spider fruit allows the user to control strings instead of turning them into a spider (because it used to be the String Fruit).
Mammoth and T-Rex cost the same amount of Money and have the same Permanent Value. Leopard and Yeti now share these too.
Eagle is currently the cheapest and least rare of all the Beast-type fruits in the game.
Dragon is the most expensive Beast-type Blox Fruit, costing   15,000,000, as well as being the most expensive Blox Fruit.
Buddha is the only Beast fruit that needs to have its transformation active to be able to use its moves.
Awakened Buddha, Phoenix, T-Rex and Dragon are the only Beast fruits to have a transformation move that is not named "Transformation".
As of Update 26, Eagle is the newest beast fruit in the game.
There are currently 8 beast fruits that have an M1 (left click), these fruits are: Dragon, Kitsune, Yeti, Leopard, T-Rex, Mammoth, Awakened Phoenix and Eagle.

Many of the Beast fruits do not allow the user to use their Fighting Styles, Swords or Guns while transformed except for Buddha and Dragon (Hybrid).
Eagle technically does not have a transformation, but the user is able to yield weapons while flying.
Eagle technically does not have a transformation, but the user is able to yield weapons while flying.
As of Update 26, Eagle and Dragon are the only beast fruits that have usable skins.
Beast has the least number of Blox Fruits, after Elemental with 11 and Natrual with 21.

accessories.name: Permanent Blox Fruits
accessories.description: Permanent Blox Fruits are Blox Fruits purchased through the Blox Fruit Dealer or the Shop menu. They may be obtained at any time, in any sea via Robux   or through gifting. When purchasing a Permanent Fruit, players have the option to gift to others, causing immediate activation on the receiving end, or to store the fruit in the Inventory, allowing the fruit to be traded at a later date. Permanent Fruits in the Inventory will be assigned the Premium rarity regardless of price.
trivia: With the release of revamped fruits, Permanent Fruit prices changed, with the most notable being Bomb, Spike, Rocket, and Spin.
Dragon had the most drastic change in price, spiking up from   2,600 to   5,000 (a 92.3% increase).
In older updates, Permanent Fruits were the only reliable way to own multiple fruits at once, as the Fruit Storage gamepass was not yet available.
The total cost of every Permanent Fruit is   68,880.
Permanent Fruits are generally known as Perm Fruits or Perms.
Permanent Fruits can be bought from the Dealer even when not in stock.

accessories.name: Rarities
accessories.description: Most items that are found in Blox Fruits are given a rarity, which is indicated by a tag of colored text. They are applied to Blox Fruits, swords, guns, accessories, materials, scrolls, fishing rods, and various paid items.

accessories.name: Premium
accessories.description: Premium is a special rarity for paid items in the inventory.

accessories.name: Private Servers
accessories.description: Private servers are an integrated part of Roblox that Blox Fruits uses. They can be purchased for   200 which renews every 30 days for the same price.
trivia: Only 2 fruits can spawn inside of a private server since its start.
Bosses will not immediately spawn at the start of a server. They'll instead spawn when their respawn period is over.
Upon start, servers start on a half moon, with the sun halfway in the sky.
The Player Hunter will refuse to give the player a quest while in a private server, stating "Sorry, you must join a public server for PvP tasks."
Inside private servers, the build limit of the Creation Fruit increases from 40 to 189.

accessories.name: Server Browser
trivia: Server names use the old version of fruit names. For example, a server may be named "Weak Soul", despite the fact that it was renamed to Spirit.
Server names can also contain usernames of developers, like "Large TAWG", which was one of mygame43's previous usernames.
Some servers like England, Hong Kong, etc. have been removed.
The Server Browser button can also be a circle with no text.

accessories.name: System Messages
accessories.description: System Messages are notifications of specific events such as the spawning of Raid Bosses, high-bounty player joins, questline quotes, event messages, etc.
trivia: When the Stored <Sword> message appears, instead of Stored Fox Lamp , it shows the words of another sword. It can even display swords that users do not own or already own, or admin-exclusive swords like Triple Dark Blade.

accessories.name: Soundtracks
accessories.description: Soundtracks are an indispensable part of every game. Blox Fruits has many soundtracks, these soundtracks in game all contribute to increasing highlights in certain locations, creating atmosphere or sometimes improving the experience.

accessories.name: Codes
accessories.description: Codes can be redeemed by clicking the  icon on the bottom left side of the player's screen and entering the code.

races.name: Race Awakening
moves: 2 — Extends the rage meter duration and raises the cap to 150%.
2 — Faster charge regeneration, increased dash distance, and moves are no longer interrupted by damage.
2 — Increases shield capacity and regeneration per hit.
2 — Debuff duration and slow effect increased.
2 — Increases tornado stun duration, range, and damage.
2 — Allows super dash by holding the dash button.
2 — Improves glide and flight effects, with slightly increased speed.
2 — Enhances all effects: higher damage, faster energy drain, and stronger slow.
2 — Field expands and summons crows that attack when dashing or damaging enemies.
2 — Life leech increases: ~20% from NPCs, ~35% from players.
2 — Increased orb damage. Super Jump and Dash no longer require Instinct and deal damage.
2 — Disabling effect becomes stronger and lasts longer.
2 — Explosions deal ~3,500 damage and require 3 hits.
2 — Damage reflection increases to ~63.7%, and ally defense increases.
trivia: 12/31 \"Release\"
Full Moon Cycles
Purpose of Race Awakening
Valentine's Update Changes
Extra Info
It takes 77 minutes of transformation (or 77 transformations) to complete the full training for a single race. For all seven races, this adds up to 539 minutes (roughly 9 hours).
Fully awakening a race costs   26,750. Awakening all seven (Human, Rabbit, Shark, Angel, Ghoul, Cyborg, and Draco) costs   187,250 in total.
When Race V4 was first released, a bug allowed players to fill the Awakening gauge by grinding Bandits in First Sea. This was quickly patched.
Holding a move during the transformation countdown would auto-cast it after the countdown ends. This was useful for abilities like Flash Step, particularly during difficult trials like Cyborg's.
For every new trial stage, the player must bring two different races—this requirement applies to all stages, not just the first one.

races.name: Rabbit
trivia:
The speed boosts provided by accessories and Leopard will stack with Rabbit's speed boost.
As such, a Rabbit's V3 ability combined with the Pilot Helmet can reach a speed surpassing even Light's [F] (in both versions of the fruit).
As such, a Rabbit's V3 ability combined with the Pilot Helmet can reach a speed surpassing even Light's [F] (in both versions of the fruit).
If the user's skin has no hair when using V4, a white hair will automatically appear.

Before the arrival of Race Awakenings, Rabbit was widely considered the best race for PvP. However, after their introduction, Rabbit fell out of favor and was seen as one of the weaker options. This shift highlighted other races and their V3 abilities' usefulness (such as Angel and Ghoul) which have since become some of the most popular choices in the game.

races.name: Angel
trivia: Unawakened Buddha's transformation can turn the wings into golden wings. (Although, they cannot be used with Prince of the Skies.)
The Prince of the Skies gear is disabled while any transformation is active.

races.name: Ghoul
trivia: Ghoul V3 with Dino Hood can outrun Mink V3 user with Pilot Helmet.

races.name: Cyborg
trivia: The damage reduction from Cyborg V2 (10%) and V3 (30%) combined is 37% (not 40%).

races.name: Draco
trivia: The name "Draco" comes from the Latin word for dragon.
Draco is the only race where V2 is not obtainable from Alchemist, V3 is not obtainable from Arowe, and V4 is not obtainable from the Temple of Time.
Ancient One will reply with, "Your race treads a different path to power. I'm unable to help with this." when the player interacts with it with Draco V4.
When the player interacts with Arowe or Alchemist NPCs as a Draco, they'll ask "What are you?".
Draco is the first and only quest race as of now which can be obtained in Third Sea.
Draco is one of the 3 races which cannot be obtained in race re-rolls.
Draco is the only race having a mastery requirement to be obtainable.
Obtaining Draco (up to V3) is the costliest out of all the other races, priced at   4,000,000, instead of the usual   2,500,000.

Draco race is the first and only race to have color customization, as seen with the new Chromatic bundle skins.
Similarly, Draco wings change color depending on which Dragon skin the player has equipped.
Similarly, Draco wings change color depending on which Dragon skin the player has equipped.
Higher bounty players take increased damage from Cometic Field's orbs.
Instead of replacing gears, the player has to replace embers to upgrade Draco's Race Awakening.
The Volcano Event must be completed before the player can gain access to the secret cave for trials, otherwise, they will not be able to do the trials.
Godhuman X fully charged is as big as the Draco V4 circle.
Control Z tap is as big as the Draco V4 circle.

If the player changes their race, they can obtain Draco for free again by talking to Dragon Wizard.
Draco is the second race to be free upon re-obtainment, the first being Ghoul.
Draco is the second race to be free upon re-obtainment, the first being Ghoul.
Draco is the only race that has visual changes in all forms.
Draco is the only race that grants a unique passive ability at the V2 stage (Flight).
Draco is the first and currently only race that does not require the Blue Gear to unlock its Race Awakening (See Mirage Island for more info).
Draco V4 race is one of, if not, the most difficult race to get due to achieving all the belts, spawning the Prehistoric Island, and hunting a Leviathan to freeze the Hydra Island.
Draco is the only race that upon awakening upgrade another passive buff from the race (Fiery Flight getting more higher).
Some sparks will be added circling around the orange domain/aura, as well as a transparent symbol centered around the player, upon obtaining Thorn Mail or Cometic Field.
If the player is using Gravity, Draco V2's Flash Step will be replaced by Gravity's own unique Flash Step.

If the player is absurdly high levelled (e.g. Lv. 7000), when paired with Sound's [F] Tempo: Prestissimo, Thorn Mail will provide 100% damage reduction to the player themself as well as all allies within range.

races.name: Cyborg Puzzle
races.description: Cyborg Puzzle is a puzzle that lets the player unlock Cyborg.

races.name: Ectoplasm
trivia: A total of  565  is required to buy everything that requires this material.
The Ship Stewards and Ship Deckhands are the best enemies for Ectoplasm grinding.
Ectoplasm can also be obtained in the Third Sea by killing Cursed Ship enemies that spawn in a Pirate Raid.
The Ectoplasm is one of many other materials that can be obtained in Pirate Raids.
The player can see how much Ectoplasm they have by talking to Guashiem.
If the player has Dragon (West), they can enter the Cursed Ship and continuously use the [C] Scorching Downfall ability, almost covering the entire area.
If the player has Quake V awakened, they can hit every enemy in the ship.

races.name: Hellfire Torch
trivia: The Hellfire Torch's model is the same as the torch and Holy Torch but with blue flames.
The Hellfire Torch has a faint blue glow underneath.

races.name: Dragon Wizard
trivia: The Dragon Wizard used to be inaccessible until December 15th, 2024 due to the timer limitations on the Dojo Trainer quests.

races.name: Fragments
trivia: On PS5, the player will still be able to see how many fragments they have even if they haven't entered Second Sea.
To see how much Fragments the player has, they need to hover over the Money value on PC. On console and mobile, it always displays.
The Rare Artifact used to fulfill some of the purposes of this currency, but it was then removed in Update 11.
Before Update 20, this currency didn't appear when the player was in the First Sea.
The maximum amount of Fragments a player can hold is   1,000,000,000

It costs   667,450 to fully max everything the player can buy with Fragments (excluding Race Reroll and Stat Reset)
  187,300 to fully Awaken all fruits
  187,250 to fully awaken V4 on every race
  2,500 to buy the Cyborg race for the first time (excluding potential re-purchases)
  31,500 to unlock all Fighting Styles
  30,000 to unlock all crew slots
  1,500 to purchase the Lantern boat from Cyborg
  1,500 to get Kabucha
  37,500 to get all Aura colors from Barista
  91,000 to get all Dragon skins from Barista (both East and West variants)
  10,000 to get the 2 Dragon seats (  5,000 each from the Dragon Tamer)
  15,800 to max the Shipwright subclass
  62,100 to upgrade Gravity, Eagle, Pain and Lightning fruits in the Admin Panel
  9,500 to get all Eagle skins from Barista
187,300 to fully Awaken all fruits
187,250 to fully awaken V4 on every race
2,500 to buy the Cyborg race for the first time (excluding potential re-purchases)
31,500 to unlock all Fighting Styles
30,000 to unlock all crew slots
1,500 to purchase the Lantern boat from Cyborg
1,500 to get Kabucha
37,500 to get all Aura colors from Barista
91,000 to get all Dragon skins from Barista (both East and West variants)
10,000 to get the 2 Dragon seats (  5,000 each from the Dragon Tamer)
15,800 to max the Shipwright subclass
62,100 to upgrade Gravity, Eagle, Pain and Lightning fruits in the Admin Panel
9,500 to get all Eagle skins from Barista

races.name: tort
trivia: tort's appearance is based on Limeturtkle's previous Roblox avatar, a Bureaucrat of the Blox Fruits Wiki.
Prior to Update 17.3, the race reroll NPC was named Norp and had a different appearance.
Purchasing a race reroll for the first time will give the player a title named "The Grandfather".
tort has a computer next to her in the Second Sea, but not in the Third Sea.

races.name: First Sea
trivia: The First Sea is the first type of sea in the game and also the oldest of the 3 seas in Blox Fruits. This is also where the fewest scripters and bounty hunters are found.
Set Home Point NPCs appear on every island except the Jean-Luc Island.

races.name: Shop
races.description: The shop is an in-game store, accessible through the GUI Menu. Players can purchase numerous items/boosts for Robux   in this shop or gifts for other players.
trivia:
There used to be various types of limited-time packs for previous Christmas Updates, those being:
Beast Bundle
Holiday Special
Winter Combo
Holiday Essential
Ultimate Bundle
Beast Bundle
Holiday Special
Winter Combo
Holiday Essential
Ultimate Bundle
Designs of products, game passes, and chromatic artwork were created by @EGOTISMS_RBLX.
The player can store a game pass by clicking "Gift" and then clicking "Store in Inventory", This doesn't work with Respawn Bosses and Race Reroll, as of Update 21.

After Update 24, owners of the Permanent Dragon Token could briefly buy a discounted permanent dragon for   2400 Robux. Due to backlash and threats of legal action, the developers quickly fixed the issue. However, some users later spotted an unbuyable shop item labeled "Discounted Dragon" with a 500k money icon, but it turned out to be just a visual bug.
When used in trades, shop items allow the player to bypass the 40% maximum value difference requirement.

races.name: Events
races.description: Events are limited-time activities. Every year or visit milestone, Blox Fruits releases a special update that comes with a new limited currency, NPCs, titles and items or to organize a small event.

races.name: Christmas Event
races.description: Christmas Event is an event in Blox Fruits usually held in late December to celebrate Christmas.

races.name: NPCs
races.description: NPCs, or Non-Player Characters, are entities ingame that the player can interact with in some way. They can be found on almost every Island. They provide Quests, sell Items, or teach the player Fighting Styles.
trivia: Some NPCs are based on developers of Blox Fruit or popular Blox Fruits Youtubers.
There are currently 146 NPCs in the game.
Sometimes when joining the game, some NPCs will load slowly or stop loading costumes, making them wearing nothing.
Dog House (Indra) is the first NPC in the game.
The Arena Trainer and Horned Man are the only Quest NPCs to ever reward the players Fragments.

Blox Fruit Dealer Cousin, Norp, Wenlocktoad Over Heaven, Layandikit12, Treasure Inventory, Colors Specialist are NPCs that have been removed from the game or will not return in the future. As for Party Shop, Valentine Shop, Magic Elf, Greedy Elf, and Santa Claws NPCs can only appear during the event.
Among them, Treasure Inventory is the only NPC whose glowing circle color is purple.
Among them, Treasure Inventory is the only NPC whose glowing circle color is purple.

races.name: Second Sea
trivia: Second Sea contains the most Easter Eggs in the game.

races.name: Third Sea
trivia: The Third Sea holds the title of having the least number of islands (8); however, more are to come. It also could be counted as 12 islands, as there are several mini-islands in the Sea of Treats or 17 if the Mirage Island, Kitsune Island, Treasure Island, Frozen Dimension and Prehistoric Island are included.
The enemies past the Ice Cream Land (Sea of Treats) use Aura, nullifying Elemental Reflex even if the player surpasses the required Level.

races.name: Alchemist
trivia: To evolve all races to V2 (with the exception of Draco), the player needs   3,000,000 and to find all flowers three times for six races (18 in total).
Talking to the Alchemist with the Draco race will make him say "What are you?".

Each race V2 gives its own title (without a special color). These are stated as follows:
"The Unleashed" - Human
"Unmatched Speed" - Rabbit
"Sea Monster" - Shark
"Sacred Warrior" - Angel
"The Ghoul" - Ghoul
"The Cyborg" - Cyborg
"The Unleashed" - Human
"Unmatched Speed" - Rabbit
"Sea Monster" - Shark
"Sacred Warrior" - Angel
"The Ghoul" - Ghoul
"The Cyborg" - Cyborg

races.name: Green Zone
trivia: Some of the leaf wings at the Green Zone have a hitbox to stand on, while some do not, which is quite confusing, so fruits that help the user fly would be more recommended.
The Green Zone has one of the highest points of altitude in the Second Sea.
The second nearest vine to the bridge connecting Kingdom of Rose and this island has a small area where the Red flower spawns.
The Green Zone is not a place that the player can teleport to using Portal, so the player can instead teleport to Dock 3 to get there.

races.name: Flowers
trivia: The Blue Flower will only spawn at nighttime, and will despawn when it is daytime. However, the Red Flower will not despawn until someone picks it up.
Both Blue and Red Flowers can spawn twice a day or night, but this is rare.
The Yellow Flower can be obtained from the Factory, as it is considered as an Enemy.
When the player receives the flowers, they will show up in the their inventory numbered from: Flower 1 (Blue), Flower 2 (Red) and Flower 3 (Yellow), regardless of what order they retrieve them in.
The Flowers do not actually have icons in-game, and none of them actually have green stems as shown in the icons.
It is recommended to turn Fast Mode on and turn brightness to max for easier flower spotting.

races.name: Colosseum Quest
races.description: The Colosseum quest is a special quest given out by Bartilo that is extremely important as it allows access to both the Third Sea and Race V2. The quests are pretty easy if the player uses an Elemental, large AoE fruits/swords, or Buddha.
trivia: The quest of the trial saves, even when the player leaves, but the Swan Pirate's part does not save because of the same system of normal Quests.
The code for freeing gladiators is this:  ᛉᛞᛈᛃᛖᚫᚺᛒ
The same symbols from the code for freeing gladiators can also be seen in Buddhas awakened transformation.

races.name: Arowe
trivia: In order to obtain every race V3, the player will need   15,000,000. (Excluding the amount of Fragments   to change the race)

In order to obtain the Dark Blade Slayer Skin, the player must have every Race developed to V3, excluding Ghoul, Cyborg and Draco.
Talking to Arowe with the Draco race will make him say "What are you?".
Talking to Arowe with the Draco race will make him say "What are you?".
The theme of the secret area is Hypnotical Suspense, courtesy of APM music. It shares the same music with both the Temple of Time and the Secret Temple.

Wenlocktoad, a removed NPC had the same function. He was then replaced by Arowe in Update 14.
The lore for Wenlocktoad's state and what happened can be found at Wenlocktoad's Lore.
The lore for Wenlocktoad's state and what happened can be found at Wenlocktoad's Lore.
After completing his race V3 Quest, Arowe will refer the player as "friend" rather than "sir".

races.name: Races
races.description: Races are a core mechanic in the game. Depending on the player's race, they will gain unique passives and buffs.
trivia: To obtain all V3 race the player will need   19,000,000 (excluding the amount of Fragments   to change the race).
The player can press T on their keyboard to activate the V3 ability of each Race without having to use it from their inventory.
The player can press Y on their keyboard to activate Race Awakening of each Race without having to use it from their inventory.
Switching races will keep the Race version of the player's original race. (Example: If the player gets Angel to V3, then switch to Human, they will still have V3 Angel when they switch back to it.)
Cyborg is the only race that doesn't provide any movement buffs passively (excluding V4).
The Rabbit's special ability Agility does not stack with Awakened Ice's Ice Skating ability.
The player used to be able to trade a Rare Artifact with Norp to get a Race Reroll but was replaced by Fragments in Update 13.
It costs   187,250 to fully awaken V4 for every race.

If a player changes their race during combat through any means of doing so, their respawning will not count as a death, and even if the player they were in combat with fulfilled the required bounty/honor gap to gain bounty from aforementioned player, they will simply go out of combat and the game will ignore it. (Meaning not even the bounty counter will have any change in it.) This could be because a race reroll directly respawns the player instead of killing them and then respawning the player.

races.name: Don Swan
moves: Cross-Spider Attack — Don Swan summons dozens of strings to impale his opponent from above.
Ultimate Thread — Don Swan summons multiple strings weaved together covered in Aura and sends them at the target in a piercing formation.
Over-heated Sniper — Don Swan shoots a thick rope made of condensed strings from his palm.
Flash Step — Don Swan Flash Steps towards the user.
trivia: The Ice Admiral mentions Don Swan (as Swan) in his dialogue being defeated by the player. (In order to access the Second Sea through the Military Detective's quest.)
Don Swan is the only boss to have 2 in-game accessories equipped at once, those being the Pink Coat and Swan Glasses.
Don Swan's room is right under Jeremy's spawn.
Sometimes, a glitch occurs where the player gets teleported to the Café when they try to enter Don Swan's room.
Don Swan, Longma, Saber Expert, Ice Admiral and Mob Leader are the only bosses that don't have a defeat Quest.
Don Swan, Fishman Lord, Beautiful Pirate and rip_indra True Form are the only Bosses with two forms.
Don Swan is the only boss that gives the player a boat upon defeat, which is the Guardian. He once gave the Swan Ship, but as of Update 20, it was replaced by the Guardian instead.
Don Swan does the most damage out of all the bosses in the Second Sea as his [V] Ultimate Thread ability in its second form can deal up to 5,000 damage.
Unlike normal bosses, the player needs to meet certain requirements to enter Don Swan's room.

If the player uses the Flash Step to enter Don Swan's room without meeting certain requirements, the player will not be able to damage him but they will be damaged by him.
The player can use the Flash Step to exit his room too.
The player can use the Flash Step to exit his room too.
This room uses the same background music as Temple of Time and  Secret Temple.

races.name: Diamond
moves: Annihilate — Diamond slashes rapidly around himself, stunning and damaging nearby targets.

Glorious Smash — Diamond teleports a short distance in the direction of the target, leaving behind a white blur. Upon teleporting, he forcefully slams the sword into the ground, generating a shockwave that inflicts damage to nearby targets and propels them into the air.
Air Slash — Diamond launches a thin but small vertical white air slash that deals a small amount of damage.
trivia: Diamond can drop Longsword even though his sword's model is Cutlass.
Diamond is a part of Human V3's quest.

races.name: Bosses
races.description: Bosses are a type of enemy that is significantly stronger than a normal enemy. They drop more EXPEXP and Money  , as well as item drops such as swords, materials, accessories, and guns. They can often attack the player using not only M1 attacks but also abilities. Bosses reward bounty/honor upon being defeated. Additionally, immunities don't work against them (e.g. Blade's Passive, Elemental Immunities). For more information, see Tips for Bosses.
trivia: There are currently 34 bosses in the game.

Most older bosses use the legacy version of their respective Swords or Blox Fruits. For example, Stone uses the old version of the Bomb fruit.
An exception to this is Don Swan, who has been updated to use modern moves from Spider, and Hydra Leader, who uses the first two moves of Venom.
An exception to this is Don Swan, who has been updated to use modern moves from Spider, and Hydra Leader, who uses the first two moves of Venom.
Longma was the only boss to not be able to be seen with Instinct. That was changed later after Update 20.
The average spawn time of every boss is around 20 to 45 minutes (except Raid Bosses).

The First Sea has the most bosses out of all seas, with the number of 16. Third Sea is on the second place after Third Sea with the amount of 10, and last place being Second Sea with the amount of eight (Although 4 of the Third Sea bosses are quest-specific.)
Killing all of the bosses with the quest will give about   165,000 in the First Sea,   170,000 in the Second Sea, and   247,500 in the Third Sea (without 2x Money).

races.name: Jeremy
moves: Spring Snipe — Jeremy leaps forward towards his target, dealing damage and knockback when it hits.

Spring Cannon — Jeremy turns his legs into springs, stretches, jumps into the air, and then falls back onto the ground. Upon coming into contact with the ground, he will create a small crater, dealing AoE damage to those within range.
trivia: Jeremy spawns above Don Swan's room, which is hidden inside a giant rock. If the player turns on Instinct, they will be able to see Don Swan beneath him.

Jeremy is the second boss to have speech (When the player defeats him for the Colosseum Quest.) when the player kills him, after Ice Admiral.
The speech spoken is relatively smaller than the Ice Admiral's.
The speech spoken is relatively smaller than the Ice Admiral's.

races.name: Orbitus
moves: — Orbitus uses the force of gravity and pushes the player away. This ability breaks Instinct.
— Orbitus releases the energy of gravity and causes a large number of meteorites to rain down. These meteorites explode upon collision, and this ability also breaks Instinct.

races.name: Chests
trivia: The quest to acquire Rabbit V3 requires collecting 30 chests.

Rarely, the player can get a Fist of Darkness from a chest in Second Sea, or a God's Chalice in Third Sea.
The Fist of Darkness spawns in a random chest every 4 hours.
The God's Chalice spawns in a random chest every 4 hours.
The Fist of Darkness spawns in a random chest every 4 hours.
The God's Chalice spawns in a random chest every 4 hours.

They will respawn if a player is standing where the chest is supposed to spawn, allowing the player to auto collect it, which makes this a quite effective method for farming money (although there are better methods).

The 2x Money game pass does not affect the amount of money obtained by chests, unlike Premium benefits.
However, it affects Cursed Chests, as they spawn enemies and 2x Money affects them.
However, it affects Cursed Chests, as they spawn enemies and 2x Money affects them.
Premium Roblox users have the benefit of gaining 1.1x more Money   from chests (and everything else).

The Rengoku chest can be found in the Ice Castle, located in the Second Sea, after defeating the Awakened Ice Admiral and obtaining the Hidden Key then going to the side of the stairs where he spawns and unlocking the chest.
There's a glitch where when a player collects a chest, it will respawn again after a few seconds (Note that the player won’t get any money from this glitch; nor it affects other chests).

races.name: Sea Beast
moves: Tip: When the Sea Beast charges its water beam, turn on Instinct and turn it off afterward to prevent Instinct Breaks or dodges being used up.
Tip: When the Sea Beast charges its water beam, turn on Instinct and turn it off afterward to prevent Instinct Breaks or dodges being used up.

— The Sea Beast uses a similar ability to Water Kung Fu's [X] ability, though significantly larger.
Medium-ranged attack, used commonly against ledges. Deals the most damage out of all other moves, although it is easy to dodge when in the sea. The entire move can be dodged using Instinct if the player has enough dodges.

— The Sea Beast charges and then shoots a deadly blue-colored beam that deals about 1500 damage and knocks the player back. This move can be dodged with Instinct. It is similar to old Cannon's Z attack, only blue and much larger.
Tip: When the Sea Beast charges its water beam, turn on Instinct and turn it off afterward to prevent Instinct Breaks or dodges being used up.

— The Sea Beast roars, sending out an AoE attack that stuns the player, deals damage, and breaks Instinct. Close-range attack, used to knock players away and prevent them from countering the Water Beam move.
— The Sea Beast returns to the water for a short amount of time, then emerges back a while after. Completely disappears while underwater, cannot be seen or damaged by any moves.
trivia: The revamp of Sea Beast was created by @SIRL_ (Twitter), a Brazilian who remade Blox Fruits models in Update 17.3.
In the previous updates, around Update 17.1 and earlier, Sea Beast was considered a boss because Sea Events had not been released yet, it was the only enemy in the Sea Event.

The theme that plays when the player encounter a Sea Beast is called "Haunted Halls". The same theme also plays when the player is at the Dark Arena, Treasure Island, an inactive Prehistoric Island or triggering the Rumbling Waters.

Multiple Sea Beasts can spawn in the Second Sea, but they aren't a Rumbling Waters because there is no rain, and the text indicating that it is one doesn't show up (Instead, "<Sea Beast>" will show up).

Sea Beasts let out roars when spawned. The player can use this to find Sea Beasts efficiently. However, the player should keep in mind that Awakened Magma's [F] move has a similar sound effect, but a little bit shorter duration and higher pitched. The similar sounds may lead to confusion.
Sea Beasts will disappear once the player is out of range for too long (around 30 seconds), or automatically after 15 minutes if not killed.
Players were able to walk on Sea Beasts' heads before the remodel of their design.
"SB" is an abbreviation of Sea Beast (such as "sb hunt" for when people want to hunt Sea Beasts).
Multiple people can get a Fist of Darkness from the same Sea Beast, as long as they do enough damage.
Sea Beasts cannot be seen with Instinct, although their moves can be dodged with it.
Although able to receive damage from Sanguine Art's [Z] Move, the player will not attach or steal any health, which damages the Sea Beast thanks to the bats.
Killing a Sea Beast is required to obtain Shark V3.
There is currently a bug for some people that after killing 25 Sea Beasts you will not receive the title #114 "The Beast"

races.name: Summon Sea Beast
races.description: Summon Sea Beast is a tool.

races.name: Tide Keeper
moves: Sea Dragon Fury — The Tide Keeper fires a large beam of water with a dragon's head, damaging and pushing away players in its path.
Water Dragon Prison — The Tide Keeper swings the trident, releasing a wave of water that creates a sphere of swirling water in front of them, damaging and briefly trapping players within it.

Summon Sea Beast — The Tide Keeper has the ability to spawn a Sea Beast, similar to players when they've reached 10,000,000 bounty/honor. The Sea Beasts Tide Keeper spawns only have 20,000 health but do just as much damage as a normal Sea Beast. They do not give any rewards upon being defeated.
trivia: The Water Key can be given to Daigrock, the Sharkman to buy Sharkman Karate for   2,500,000 and   5,000 once the player meets all the requirements (getting 400 mastery on Water Kung Fu), for more information, click here.
The Tide Keeper spawns every 30 minutes.
The Tide Keeper's Sea Beast has less health than a normal Sea Beast and does not drop anything.
For grinding mastery, it is recommended to kill Awakened Ice Admiral instead because he gives 750k-950k, while the Tide Keeper only gives 800k-900k.
A Silver, Gold and Diamond chest can be found near the Tide Keeper boss, on raised platforms.

races.name: Terrorshark
moves:
— The Terrorshark jumps out of the water to attract every player nearby and splashes back down. This move breaks Instinct and deals a huge amount of damage.
This attack is used when it's close to the player, can't be tricked with Instinct, and will deal a decent amount of knockback. Also, this move has an explosion similar to Shark Anchor's [Z] Typhoon Toss move but bigger and can attract players more easily.

— When the player is close enough, the Terrorshark will do a tail swipe combo, knocking the player down to the sea.
This attack is used when the player is swimming or is close enough, and can be very dangerous if the player is fighting a group of Terrorsharks since they can spam this move on them and make it extremely difficult to keep a distance. This move is similar to the Shark Anchor [X] move but has much more AOE.

— Dashes at extremely high speed in the direction of a player. Upon contact, the Terrorshark will perform an explosion. Unlike the other Terrorshark moves, this move is not included/similar to the Shark Anchor weapon.
trivia: Terrorsharks are sometimes abbreviated as "TS".
Anchored Terrorshark are sometimes nicknamed "Anchorshark"

Terrorsharks can despawn if the player out of range from the Terrorshark's Area. As long as the Terrorshark is still chasing them and taking damage in close range, they will not despawn.
If the player runs away for long enough, the Terrorshark has a chance of getting stuck.
If the player runs away for long enough, the Terrorshark has a chance of getting stuck.

2 or more Terrorsharks can spawn at once, which will make the fight way harder, as both Terrorsharks will attack right after another one does. This makes the splash attack way more deadly as it can stun lock the player.
The player can also air camp while using their ranged attacks, enabling them to kill any quantity of Terrorsharks without taking any damage.
Terrorsharks can spawn in multiple colors such as red, green, blue, and gray.

This is the most annoying sea event, as it constantly disturbs the player and knocks them out of the boat, making it so they can't escape it, for example: If the player wants to do Kitsune Shrine then the Terrorshark spawns, they are unlikely to do the Kitsune Shrine event, therefore wasting their time.
The Terrorshark can actually growl. However, in the test, it could only be heard when the Terrorshark music stopped after the player went out of range. While growling, it also shakes.
The Terrorshark wears the Terror Jaw's model but bigger.

There is a small chance that the player can craft the Monster Magnet while having Shark Anchor at the same time. (The players current Shark Anchor's mastery, enchants and moves will not disappear completely, nor be obtainable back from an Anchored Terrorshark, if the player ever happens to spawn one.)
Terrorshark is one of the most hated sea events by the community as it can ruin hunts for the Kitsune Island, Prehistoric Island or even the Frozen Dimension.

races.name: rip_indra True Form
moves: One Thousand Slices — rip_indra launches an instantaneous barrage of multiple green slashes, dealing high damage, hitting players, and stunning them for a very short period of time. This will be white and black when he's in his true form.

Dark Air Slash — rip_indra launches a thin, tall, vertical slash of green energy toward players, which deals high damage and has a little knockback. When in his true form, this slash will be black and appear to be larger.

Black Pillar — rip_indra sends out 12 black-colored pillars (with the same mesh as the old unawakened Flame [C] (Fire Column) move) in a 180-degree blast, damaging anything within range. Only used when in true form.

Black Blast — rip_indra launches 3 Dark Air Slashes with bigger size, and farther range. Each air slash can be stacked if the player stands too close, making it deal a massive amount of damage. Also used only when in true form.
trivia: While Indra is spawned, the Castle on the Sea will be temporarily renamed to "Battle of the Gods" and the theme will change to Lizard Bandit Clan, which was composed by @DTF.
rip_indra is the third boss to make an appearance in two separate seas, the first being Ice Admiral/Awakened Ice Admiral and the second being Swan /Don Swan.

rip_indra is the Boss that rewards the highest Bounty/Honor in game upon defeat, being 125,000.
Because of this, the player can skip directly to 2.6M bounty by killing Indra if they have a little lower bounty than 2.5M (around 2.49M), because bounty is no longer rewarded if the player has 2.5M bounty or more, but it can be bypassed if the player gains one large bounty reward before hitting 2.5M.

Because of this, the player can skip directly to 2.6M bounty by killing Indra if they have a little lower bounty than 2.5M (around 2.49M), because bounty is no longer rewarded if the player has 2.5M bounty or more, but it can be bypassed if the player gains one large bounty reward before hitting 2.5M.
Upon summoning, everyone in the same server as Indra being spawned in will have their screen shake.
rip_indra is the only Raid Boss to have a second form.
rip_indra, Fishman Lord, Don Swan and Beautiful Pirate are the only Bosses with two forms.
Before Update 20, when the player turns on Instinct, it shows "rip_indra True Form Lv. 5000 [Raid Boss]", but when they go close, it shows "rip_indra".
rip_indra in both forms are shown in "rip_indra True Form Lv. 5000 [Raid Boss]" in the boss bar. This might be a glitch or might be intentional as well.

rip_indra's health bar changes to the second form when its health reaches about 100,000.
If dealt an amount of damage greater than 100,000 while being in the first form, he will not be immediately destroyed, the excess damage will be converted for Indra's second form.
If dealt an amount of damage greater than 100,000 while being in the first form, he will not be immediately destroyed, the excess damage will be converted for Indra's second form.

rip_indra actually uses nerfed versions of Black Blast and Black Pillars, as he'll only launch three air slashes, and send out about 12 black pillars. The real Black Blast launches 11 Dark Air Slashes, and Black Pillar sends out 36 pillars.
The mist effect caused by rip_indra is cancelled out by Sea Danger Level 6's dark fog.
Currently only one other npc shares the same extreme level as rip_indra, that being the Red commander.

races.name: Dough King
races.description: "A dimension worthy of a god has spawned."
trivia: The Dough King gives the combined most levels and second most Fragments   in the game. The first in terms of most fragments is Tyrant of the Skies.
After killing the Dough King and unlocking the red door, the player can purchase as many Dough raid chips as they need (  1,000 every 2 hours, or a Fruit worth over   1,000,000).
Due to the nature of his abilities, the Dough King is one of the enemies to be able to "combo" players in certain circumstances.
Unlike the Cake Prince, the Dough King does not use the abilities of the Spikey Trident.
The Dough King has the most drops out of any Raid Boss.
The Dough King is sometimes abbreviated as "DK".

races.name: Sealed King
trivia: The dialogue seen above, "Good morning bro, I'm at Temple of Time right now, WSG?" is no longer what Sealed King says, as of the Christmas Update on 12/25/22. Strangely, for those who obtained the Blue Gear, they reverted the Sealed King dialogue back to "That place may hold the key...the light of a full moon." Despite this, those who finished the step can still pull the lever.
There is currently no specific information about whether the Sealed King has escaped from his mental prison. He could possibly be hiding at the Temple of Time and the Ancient One is his incarnation.
According to the Spy, he has a connection to the Leviathan, as it must listen to its command.
The Sealed King has no character model, similar to the Mysterious Force and the Weird Machine.

races.name: Slayer Skin
trivia: Many people often call this Dark Blade V3. In fact, this is just a different color version.
The Slayer skin does not provide any damage/ability buffs and is purely cosmetic.
The pre-reworked version of this skin is used by Rip indra True Form.
The player can toggle from the original to white at the rip_indra NPC at the Graveyard or vice versa.
It can also turn the Triple Dark Blade's swords white.
The player does not need Cyborg V3, Ghoul V3, and Draco V3, they only need the four races obtainable from race rerolls at V3, which are Human, Rabbit, Shark, and Angel.
Many players consider this a hard quest due to another player needed to make it and the fact that the player needs four Races V3.
The total amount of money required to obtain the Slayer Skin is   10,000,000.
Contrary to popular beliefs, the Slayer Skin does not require the user to have evolved the Dark Blade to V2.

races.name: Dark Blade
moves: While held: The same move occurs, but the user dashes along with the slashes.(NOTE: This effect only applies after evolving via The Son Quest)
While held: The same move occurs, but the user dashes along with the slashes.(NOTE: This effect only applies after evolving via The Son Quest)
While held: The same move occurs, but the slash goes faster, and farther. (Note: This effect also only applies after evolving via The Son Quest)
While held: The same move occurs, but the slash goes faster, and farther. (Note: This effect also only applies after evolving via The Son Quest)

— The user executes a near instantaneous barrage of several green slashes, dealing high damage, hitting enemies, and stunning them for a short amount of time. This breaks Instinct if the first attack hits the opponent.
— The user launches a thin, tall, vertical slash of green energy towards the direction the are facing, which deals high damage and has a little knockback. This move doesn't break Instinct.

— The user executes a near instantaneous barrage of several green slashes, dealing high damage, hitting enemies, and stunning them for a short amount of time. This breaks Instinct if the first attack hits the opponent.
— The user launches a thin, tall, vertical slash of green energy towards their cursor, which deals high damage and has a little knockback. This move doesn't break Instinct.

— The user execute a near instantaneous barrage of several green slashes that travel forward slightly, dealing high damage, hitting enemies, and stunning them for a short amount of time. This breaks Instinct if the first attack hits the opponent.
While held: The same move occurs, but the user dashes along with the slashes.(NOTE: This effect only applies after evolving via The Son Quest)

— The user launches a thin, tall, vertical slash of green energy toward the direction they are facing, which deals high damage and has a little knockback. This move doesn't break Instinct.
While held: The same move occurs, but the slash goes faster, and farther. (Note: This effect also only applies after evolving via The Son Quest)
This move does break Instinct but does not break objects.
— The user executes a near instantaneous barrage of several black and white slashes, dealing high damage, hitting enemies, and stunning them for a short amount of time.

— The user launches a thin, tall, vertical slash of black energy toward their cursor which deals high damage and has a little knockback. If held, the same move occurs, but the slash travels much faster and goes farther, this effect also only applies after evolving via The Son Quest.
trivia: The Dark Blade makes the user spin when they do an Air Jump or side dash. The user will also do a roll when they back dash.
The Dark Blade was previously called the "Yoru" which was then changed to Dark Blade.

There is a triple version of the Dark Blade, named the Triple Dark Blade.
This version is only usable by admins or people they granted it to.
This version is only usable by admins or people they granted it to.
The Dark Blade is the only sword that requires obtaining a Game Pass to obtain.
The Dark Blade is technically the only sword that can be traded, because the player can store it in the form of a Game Pass.
The Brazil Cube allowed the first player who touched it to receive Dark Blade. However, it could only be spawned in by an admin.
The Dark Blade is the only sword that has an alternate skin.
The Dark Blade is one of the swords that are difficult to use, due to requiring decent aiming and prediction skills.
The [X] Dark Air Slash from its V1 has higher stun duration than its V2 counterpart and smaller AoE.
The Dark Blade is one of the few items in the game to have its rarity altered.
The Dark Blade is often abbreviated as "DB". Check Dictionary for more info about such abbreviations.
The Dark Blade is recommended for all seas as it has high damage and low mastery requirements and are comparable to swords like Cursed Dual Katana, True Triple Katana, or Shark Anchor.

races.name: Quests
trivia: The Forgotten Quest Giver and the Kingdom of Rose Area 2 Quest Giver have a similar appearance.
There are two Mole Quest Givers. One is located near the Skylands next to the temple that teleports to the Upper Skylands. The other is found in the Upper Skyland itself.
The Deep Forest Quest Giver 1 looks similar to the Tiki Quest Giver 2.
Most quest givers have a yellow exclamation mark on above or even behind them, which makes it easier to find them while searching.
The Arena quest giver is the only quest giver that rewards the player with   fragments.
There is currently a total of 116 quests in the game (including side quests).

races.name: Agility
trivia: If the user uses Rabbit's Agility while transformed as Buddha, then transforming back, the aura from the ability will still appear, but will be scaled to Buddha size.
If the user is using a mini avatar, the "heart" will go on their face.
This V3 is the only V3 of any race that does not have 2 words in its name.

races.name: Ice
moves: Elemental Reflex — The fruit user is immune to all physical attacks (fighting style, sword, gun) from players unless the attacks are imbued with Aura. Against NPCs, this immunity applies only if the player is a certain level above them. This effect is only effective against non-boss enemies.
Ice Trident — Whenever Ice is selected, the user can slash with an icy trident by clicking the left mouse button or tapping on mobile. This can hit Blade users as it is part of the fruit.
Frost Walker — The user will create walkable ice platforms each time they touch the sea. Every ice platform the user creates takes up 4 energy. It will only take energy if the user walks on water.
— The user hits enemies with their Ice Trident, dealing damage as a fruit (can hit Blade users).
— The user fires a barrage of ice shards that rapidly travels to the enemy (Does not break Instinct if the projectiles do not touch the ground). This move is very similar to Diamond's X move.

— The user stomps and releases a medium-sized surge of ice from the floor below, which deals damage and knocks back anyone it hits (Does not break Instinct). The ice rapidly falls and vanishes within two to three seconds. The ice surge covers a distance of about five to six seconds of walking from its starting point to where it ends.
— The user creates a bird made of ice and launches it at where they are aiming, freezing whoever is hit. This move explodes on contact and stuns enemies for 1.5 seconds.

— The user casts the ground into ice, creating a huge AoE area that freezes and damages enemies. Often used by sword and gun users as their primary combo-starter. This move disables all attacks, dashes, and jumps from both enemies and the user for two seconds.
— The user hits enemies with their Ice Trident, dealing damage as a fruit (can hit Blade users).

— The user fires multiple glacial hurricanes that travel at slow speeds towards the cursor. Upon contact with the enemy, it will slowly deal damage and while stunning them for the duration of the move. This move breaks Instinct on startup, but it can be easily prevented by Instinct-Tricking.
— The user unleashes a huge surge of ice, which launches enemies away and deals good damage. (Does not break Instinct).
— The user launches a large, high-speed ice dragon into the air, which then crashes down at the aimed area, causing a huge AoE cold explosion and freezing enemies.

— The user unleashes a gigantic wave of piercing ice around them, freezing everyone in its radius and causing damage. This move disables all attacks, dash, jump from enemies and the user for two seconds.

— Along with the ability to passively walk on water, the user gains the ability to skate at high speeds. When the user unlocks this ability, the ice patterns under their feet when they walk on water will change into a brighter blue color.
trivia: [Z] Ice Spears used to be the Awakened [Z] move before it got reworked.
The user can wall run on an inclined walls by holding down [F] Ice Skating, and will run faster than usual if they try running straight on them.
[Z] Cold Storm is similar to Blizzard’s [X] White Out but slower.
It is possible to glitch through thin walls (for example: Mansion or Café walls) with [F] Ice Skating.
[C] Ice Bird is better than [C] Frozen Dragon for combos.
The player can use Flash Step onto the trail of ice on water.
Some skins can cause the trail of ice on water to be generated more slowly as players run.
[V] Absolute Zero shares the same name with the Aura Skin, Absolute Zero.

Ice and Light are the only fruits that have a unique weapon that can be used when equipped (Gas and Blade could be considered yet another one with a weapon of its own, just not visible to the naked eye).
[C] Frozen Dragon's stun time depends on how far the enemy is (i.e. the further the enemy is from the user, the longer the stun).
Ice shares the Frost Walker passive with Yeti, with both having the same purpose and similar path models.
Sometimes, [V] Absolute Zero can make the animation in air, but the AoE does not appear in the floor.
Ice’s Elemental Reflex sound is the same as Blizzard's.

races.name: Rare Artifact
trivia: This Rare Artifact was not the same Rare Artifact the YouTuber Kitt Gaming has; this one was removed a couple years ago.
The Rare Artifact was highly sought after, as they had many uses, especially for Dragon Breath, which was a rare fighting style at the time.

races.name: norp
trivia: norp's skin was based on old avatar from norperz, a Tester and also a person who often uses Admin Abilities to make jokes. (Like making the Rogue-Rogue fruit.)
norp was replaced in Update 11 by tort when Fragments replaced Rare Artifact. However, norp still asked for Fragments instead of Rare Artifacts.

races.name: Air Jump
trivia: If the player uses Awakened Buddha with the Z move activated, transformed Venom, Gas, Leopard, Mammoth (only the first jump), T-Rex or Kitsune, they will be able to jump higher.

The move "Spiraling Kick" [X] from Leopard can reset the users Air Jump counter, meaning that they can gain a much higher height by using the move midair.
This will only work on the tenth air jump, meaning when used on Angel V2/above's 11th jump, the glitch will no longer work.
This will only work on the tenth air jump, meaning when used on Angel V2/above's 11th jump, the glitch will no longer work.
For maximum air jumps without ANY buffs or transformation, the player can time their air jumps with a gap of 1.30 seconds between each jump.

races.name: Aura
trivia: There is no relation between sea events and Aura. Turning aura off does not make sea events spawn more often.

All swords and guns will change their color when a colored Aura is active, based on its color.
Some swords, when transformed with Buddha will not have the Aura effect.
Some swords, when transformed with Buddha will not have the Aura effect.

Light's Spear and Ice's Trident visual is affected by Aura.
The same goes for Awakened Dough's and Rubber's attacks. The user can also change the color of its moves with an Aura skin.
Awakened Spider’s [V] move also has different colors depending on the user’s aura color, and if their aura color slowly changes, the same would be for Spider’s [V] move, most likely because the move is webs covered in Aura shooting forward.
The same goes for Awakened Dough's and Rubber's attacks. The user can also change the color of its moves with an Aura skin.

Awakened Spider’s [V] move also has different colors depending on the user’s aura color, and if their aura color slowly changes, the same would be for Spider’s [V] move, most likely because the move is webs covered in Aura shooting forward.

races.name: Energy Core
trivia: Energy Core is the first V3 ability that deals damage.

Defeating an NPC only using Energy Core will not grant the player mastery on anything, but if the player damages the NPC beforehand using a Blox Fruit, Gun, Sword, or Melee, they will get mastery on the Fruit, Gun, Swords, or Melee they used to damage the NPC.

races.name: Primordial Reign
trivia: Primordial Reign is one of the few abilities that, like Energy Core, is capable of nullifying movements.

Primordial Reign cannot be obtained from Arowe, unlike the other races.
Primordial Reign is also the most expensive, costing   3,000,000 unlike the other race V3 abilities, which cost   2,000,000.
Primordial Reign is also the most expensive, costing   3,000,000 unlike the other race V3 abilities, which cost   2,000,000.
Primordial Reign is the only race ability that has an animation when activated.

races.name: Instinct
trivia: Extra Instinct dodges that the player gains from accessories count towards training.
If the player is holding a move (ex. Cursed Dual Katana's [X] move) with Instinct active and they get hit, it will break regardless of if they have dodges.

Non-boss enemies only drain half a dodge charge, instead of a full charge.
They still give the player 1 EXP, meaning using instinct on non-boss enemies is the best way to grind EXP.
They still give the player 1 EXP, meaning using instinct on non-boss enemies is the best way to grind EXP.

Many attacks can temporarily disable Instinct (such as Spider's X move), known as "Instinct Breaking". Players can use this to their advantage during PvP. NPC attacks can also sometimes disable Instinct.
For a list of moves that can break Instinct, see Instinct/Break.
For a list of moves that can break Instinct, see Instinct/Break.

Activating Instinct during a move to avoid additional damage or combos is known as "Instinct-Tricking" or more commonly known as 'Ken-Tricking'. This can be used to avoid a lot of damage but might need practice to perform successfully.

The maximum number of dodges is 8 (11 with Pale Scarf or Kitsune Mask, and Human v2) at 2824 EXP, but players are recommended to get it to 5000 EXP for maximum range and to be able to do the Hungry Man Quest to get Instinct V2.
Upon reaching Instinct’s max level, the player will be given the "Ultra Instinct" title #072.
It takes approximately 50 seconds for 1 dodge to recover.
