Other players are always detected from further away than NPCs. This is to prevent lag.
It is recommended to get Instinct before going Second Sea since it can prove to be very important and useful later on in the game, alongside gaining more EXP as the player goes on with the game.
There is no cooldown when the player hops servers, therefore making it easier to grind EXP by simply hopping servers when the player has finished their charges.
Instinct can detect NPCs that have not spawned if the player's range is far enough.
Resetting with Instinct enabled will disable Instinct.

The player's Instinct will be forcefully disabled when they join a raid, since "special abilities" are disabled during raids. Instinct is disabled for the entire time until they die or complete the raid.
Equipping an accessory that grants extra dodges then removing the accessory will allow the player to keep the extra dodges until they’re used up.
The player can see the enemy’s health and energy before they spawn.

Moves that can go through solid objects and still damage opponents (ex. Skull Guitar's [Z]) mostly miss when the user tries to aim at their enemy through Instinct, because the object decreases the depth between the aimed location and the user.

races.name: Instinct/V2
races.description: Instinct V2 is an upgraded version of Instinct and can only be unlocked in the Third Sea with certain requirements.
moves:
Instinct V2 allows the player to see another player's:
Energy
Health
Fruit Meter
Level
Fighting Style
Sword
Blox Fruit
Gun
Fishing Rod
Instinct V2 allows the user to recharge dodges faster than V1, exactly 10 seconds faster (40 seconds instead of 50).
Instinct V2 has a much bigger detection range than V1, being able to see players that are further away.
Instinct V2 has a less blurred vision and more brightness than V1 while active.
If in combat, Instinct V2 gives the players dashes a 50% speed boost.
The icon of their ability/item will go dark when they are holding said ability/item.

Instinct V2 allows the player to see while another player is charging/holding up a move.
This displays through the other player emitting a white glow and exclamation marks.
This displays through the other player emitting a white glow and exclamation marks.
trivia:
While Instinct V2 is active, the player's eyes will emit a glow effect of their Aura color, or a trail if moving.
If the player does not have any aura color equipped, a red glow effect will be used.
If the player does not have any aura color equipped, a red glow effect will be used.
Once switched, there is no way to switch back from V2 to V1, as V2 is a direct upgrade to V1.

Instinct V2 costs   5,000,000, so the player should make sure to grind money as soon as possible (if they’re planning to get it), grinding sea beasts is advised if in third sea as this is the most efficient if not dangerous means of obtaining money.

races.name: Skins
races.description: Skins are wearable cosmetics that change the visuals of certain abilities and transformations.
trivia:
Collecting all Legendary colors (excluding limited variants) requires   22,500,  15 ,  10 , and  15 .
Collecting all Rare colors requires   15,000,  3 ,  8 ,  3 ,  2 ,  2 ,  2 ,  2 , and  4 .
Collecting all Rare colors requires   15,000,  3 ,  8 ,  3 ,  2 ,  2 ,  2 ,  2 , and  4 .
Unlocking all aura skins requires a total cost of   37,500 or   1,830,  3 ,  8 ,  6 ,  2 ,  2 ,  25 ,  12 ,  25 ,  1000 ,  1000 , at least  15 ,  250 and  250
During Update 17.3.5, a bug occurred where the Party Hat and the Aquamarine aura color could not be equipped.

There is a known glitch where the aura color on the avatar does not exactly match the aura color on Swords, Guns or Electric Claw.
This happens when you activate an aura, then you switch to another, without reactivating.
This happens when you activate an aura, then you switch to another, without reactivating.
Equipping Rainbow Saviour causes the color cycle to stop when zooming out. The effect resumes once zooming back in.
Mythical Aura Skins, (Rainbow Saviour, Dragon, Kitsune, Oni and Celestial), are the only with shifting animations.
Before Update 24, Hoops were required to change the color of the Dragon (Classic).
After Update 24, all players who had purchased an Aura color prior to the update were automatically awarded the Hakaishin title due to a glitch.
Three Blox Fruits currently have attacks that change color depending on the equipped aura color: Rubber, Spider, and Dough.
Skins for Portal are already listed in the Barista Menu but are not yet craftable. They are planned for release in a future update.

races.name: Dashing
trivia: The player cannot dash while swimming in water, stunning, or some cutscenes.

There is a bug when users use the M1 Skull Guitar and jump with a dash at the same time, their distance will be further than normal. This bug usually works when the user is in fling state.
The user can utilize moves like Z Yama, Z Sanguine Art, and other knockback abilities to launch themselves. Then immediately use the bug. Make sure to angle the body upward by aiming the move vertically, allowing the user to travel a long distance and perform surprise attacks in PvP.
If this applies to Cyborg V4 (Energy Control). The distance will be further.

The user can utilize moves like Z Yama, Z Sanguine Art, and other knockback abilities to launch themselves. Then immediately use the bug. Make sure to angle the body upward by aiming the move vertically, allowing the user to travel a long distance and perform surprise attacks in PvP.
If this applies to Cyborg V4 (Energy Control). The distance will be further.

races.name: Admin Abilities
races.description: Admin Abilities are abilities that are only able to be used by admins/developers of Blox Fruits. They often appear as hotbar items, commands, locations, etc.
moves: From one of Zioles' videos, the buddha boss is somehow immune to this ability.
From the same Zioles video mentioned in Amaterasu, the only enemy that can survive this ability is the Buddha Master in the Buddha raid.
Rogue — Rogue is a unofficial Blox Fruit made by Norp. It has 2 abilities, both one-shotting anything it touches, as well as having no cooldown.
Meme — Meme is a Mythical Blox Fruit that is considered unobtainable. It was created on behalf of Experimic, as a gift to him.
Admin Holiday Gift — The Admin Holiday Gift is a Mythical Holiday Gift. This item can only be obtained by Admins and provides players with exclusive high-tier rewards.
Black Nuke — Black Nuke is an ability that summons a huge black bomb that deals decent damage to other enemies.
Black Pillar — Black Pillar is an ability that sends out 36 black-colored pillars in a 180-degree blast, damaging anything within range.

Black Blast — Black Blast is an ability similar to the Dark Blade V3's [X] Dark Air Slash ability but it's 11 slashes with a much larger range, and bigger size. Each air slash can be stacked if an enemy stands too close, causing it to deal a huge amount of damage.

Black Meteors — Black Meteors is an ability that combines Gravity's old [C] Meteor Pitch ability and the old unawakened Lightning's [V] Thunder Bomb ability in a black form and smaller. The meteors rain from the sky and explode into huge black bombs, doing heavy damage as well as lingering very long.

Amaterasu — Amaterasu is an ability that when activated, will summon a red and black vortex-like spell above the player's head. Everyone who's near the said spell will have their screen covered with a sharingan, similar to the kamui ability, except the Amaterasu just deals damage.
This ability, unlike other abilities in the game, does not do a fixed amount of damage. In stead, it does a percentage of the health as the damage. This ability will be repeated until all the enemies that got caught by it are dead.

Has an extremely long cooldown.
Cannot break Instinct.
Very confusing range.
From one of Zioles' videos, the buddha boss is somehow immune to this ability.

Tensei — Tensei is a special ability that can capture all players or enemies instantly. It will create a tiny black hole that flies into the sky, then absorb matter, players and enemies, making them unable to move. After a period of time, the black hole will gradually be covered by matter and gradually grow to a giant size and explode, instant killing the players that get caught.
From the same Zioles video mentioned in Amaterasu, the only enemy that can survive this ability is the Buddha Master in the Buddha raid.

Draconic Incandescence of the Vermillion Firmament — Draconic Incandescence of the Vermillion Firmament is an ability made for Uzoth, which can be seen frequently used by him and Zioles, most likely as a last resort against a group of players. Once used, the screen turns orange, the sun/moon will shine, and dragon-like projectiles will start to come down from the sky, killing every player and enemies in a large range. this ability can also be seen if the volcano on prehistoric Island pressure reaches 100%
This ability isn't one-shot. However, the higher the level, the greater the damage this move causes. It also has no cooldown time, so if the player uses the ability way too many times, not only will more dragon projectiles come down from the sky, but the screen will constantly turn orange until the server crashes.

Shotgun — rip_indra was seen using what looks like a Shotgun. It is from an admin set, most commonly used by the admin Guashiem. It uses a modern gun model, and was added as a part of a brazilian moveset, which includes an outfit. The M1s of the Shotgun are one shot.
Bloxy Cola — Bloxy Cola is simply a regular Bloxy Cola from the Roblox marketplace with the same capabilities as many other Roblox games. The player can drink it.
Gate — Gate allows the player to summon a portal that goes anywhere they'd like, similar to Portal's [C] World Warp ability.

Ghost Ship — The Ghost Ship is a green luminescent boat that can fly at a really fast speed, similar to The Sentinel and Miracle boats, but it can fly above the ground, instead of limited by the seas. It can be seen in Axiore's ADMIN.EXE video, and is driven and spawned by rip_indra.
This ship is capable of traveling at extremely high speeds, faster than any other ship in the game. This ship currently does not have an official name, the original name was given by Axiore.

Brazil World — This ability turns the map into green and yellow, similar to the Brazilian flag. It was last seen activating at Second Sea. This is the owner's exclusive skill and as of now only rip_indra is the only one who can do it. When used, an event message will appear, saying "ACTIVATING BRAZIL WORLD". After this, every location will appear as <Location (MODO BRASIL)>.
trivia:
For some reason, all three abilities Black Nuke, Black Pillar, and Black Blast cannot deal damage to Blade users.
Those abilities used to have a green color similar to the Dark Blade V2 skin. (It's unclear if this is a color change similar to the Dark Blade or the old version)
Those abilities used to have a green color similar to the Dark Blade V2 skin. (It's unclear if this is a color change similar to the Dark Blade or the old version)
The Third Sea Raid Boss, rip_indra True Form, uses nerfed versions of Black Pillar and Black Blast, as he only sends out 12 pillars, and 3 dark air slashes.

The gate, amaterasu, tensei, and kamui abilities used to have "phoeyu" at the beginning of their names, similar to how the Pocket Dimension was previously called Phoeyu's Dimension. These abilities and the location were all related to Phoeyu because they were created specifically for him, as he is the owner/main developer of Grand Piece Online. This was changed later.

The Rip_Family x Red_Legion Arena used to have a dome/atmosphere covering it (similar to the Underwater City), but it got removed after some time. Currently, its replacement is the Frozen Dimension's fog.

A YouTuber called SilentAsura managed to get the rip kamui as a reward for winning an event hosted by an admin. However, because this ability can teleport players in safe zone into the Rip_Family Hideout, Asura bounty hunted with this method, abusing this ability and got his account banned along with the kamui being removed from his inventory.
He is also the same person with the Template:Unobtainable Title title on his current main account.
He is also the same person with the Template:Unobtainable Title title on his current main account.
The Blox Fruits admin Uzoth can use deleted Blox Fruits.[1] Another person who can use deleted Blox Fruits too is rip_indra.
↑ https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BAThjeqH2gM

locations.name: Bridge
trivia: Bridge is the only substantially sized bridge in the game, as well as the only land-based connection between two islands.

Since Bridge is not officially an island, Plokster is the only npc in the game to not be located within an island.
Despite this, the game still shows "Bridge" at the top of the player's screen when entering Bridge.
Despite this, the game still shows "Bridge" at the top of the player's screen when entering Bridge.

The hitboxes of the railings and the "roof" are unusual. Some of the areas that looks solid are not, and some of the areas that are transparent have collision on. This can be put to good use for escaping attacking players.
Light's unawakened [F] move cannot bounce of Bridge's floor, despite being able to bounce off of other surfaces (NPCs, walls, etc.).
The second largest object able to be levitated with Control's [X] move is the mid-section of Bridge.

locations.name: Indra Island
trivia: As of Update 20, when talking to Erin and the cutscene plays, the Indra Island can be seen inside of Sea Danger Level 4 (Extreme) as rocks appear. Although it's located 1940m away from Tiki Outpost, it can only be seen by the player who started the cutscene.
The Indra Island has no official name, so it was given one by the community.

locations.name: Beautiful Pirate
moves: Piercing Dash — The Beautiful Pirate dashes towards the player, rapidly slashing them, dealing damage and scattering purple-white flower petals.
Scattering Gust — The Beautiful Pirate dashes forward, scattering purple-white flowers and launching five purple air slashes towards the target.
trivia: The Beautiful Pirate must be defeated to complete the Horned Man's quest to unlock the Rainbow Saviour Aura skin per last questline.
The Beautiful Pirate is one of the only bosses that has a second form, the others being rip_indra True Form, the Fishman Lord and Don Swan.
Previously, dying inside the domain would respawn the player at the Hydra Island, since the Beautiful Pirate's lair was under it
The Beautiful Pirate is regarded as the boss with the highest amount of health, barely surpassing Cake Queen by 59,000 HP.
The Beautiful Pirate is fast in both forms, being capable of outrunning players without the Rabbit race or a speed boosting accessory such as the Pilot Helmet or Hunter Cape.
The Beautiful Pirate is a part of the Captain Elephant's dialogue after defeating him in the Citizen's Quest.

locations.name: Dough King
locations.description: "A dimension worthy of a god has spawned."
trivia: The Dough King gives the combined most levels and second most Fragments   in the game. The first in terms of most fragments is Tyrant of the Skies.
After killing the Dough King and unlocking the red door, the player can purchase as many Dough raid chips as they need (  1,000 every 2 hours, or a Fruit worth over   1,000,000).
Due to the nature of his abilities, the Dough King is one of the enemies to be able to "combo" players in certain circumstances.
Unlike the Cake Prince, the Dough King does not use the abilities of the Spikey Trident.
The Dough King has the most drops out of any Raid Boss.
The Dough King is sometimes abbreviated as "DK".

locations.name: Submerged Island
trivia: This is the second island to be based under the sea, the first being Underwater City.
The Third Sea islands can be seen above the island off in the distance.

As of Update 27.1, there exists a bug where if a person uses [F] Scorching Donut in the Submerged Island, they will begin to rapidly accelerate upwards, either forcing them to exit or even drown. (Can be recreated with Blade's F as well.)
Portal's [C] World Warp cannot be used to teleport to this island, despite it being required for progression.

locations.name: Third Sea
trivia: The Third Sea holds the title of having the least number of islands (8); however, more are to come. It also could be counted as 12 islands, as there are several mini-islands in the Sea of Treats or 17 if the Mirage Island, Kitsune Island, Treasure Island, Frozen Dimension and Prehistoric Island are included.
The enemies past the Ice Cream Land (Sea of Treats) use Aura, nullifying Elemental Reflex even if the player surpasses the required Level.

locations.name: Mirage Island
trivia:
The Mirage Island is based on a real phenomenon, called a "mirage".
The Mirage Island also has the same effect as a mirage, as it can only be seen from afar and fades as the person gets closer.
The Mirage Island also has the same effect as a mirage, as it can only be seen from afar and fades as the person gets closer.

The Mirage Island used to have its soundtrack removed due to a bug, making it temporarily the only island in the game without a soundtrack. But as of February 28, 2024, it was fixed and re-added after a bug fix.
Destructible Physics does not work in the Mirage Island.
Rarely, when the island despawns, the chests may occasionally remain. However, trying to loot the chest won't do anything.

While using The Sentinel or Miracle, the Mirage Island does not affect the height level of the flying boat.
Exceptions: if the player found the Treasure Island, the Haunted Shipwreck, the Prehistoric Island or the Frozen Dimension.
Exceptions: if the player found the Treasure Island, the Haunted Shipwreck, the Prehistoric Island or the Frozen Dimension.

locations.name: Second Sea
trivia: Second Sea contains the most Easter Eggs in the game.

locations.name: First Sea
trivia: The First Sea is the first type of sea in the game and also the oldest of the 3 seas in Blox Fruits. This is also where the fewest scripters and bounty hunters are found.
Set Home Point NPCs appear on every island except the Jean-Luc Island.

locations.name: Prehistoric Island
trivia: The Prehistoric Island's despawn time is around 30-45 minutes. However, it will still despawn instantly if no one is on the island or if the player who spawned it leaves the game.
The volcano eruption is one of the Admin Abilities, which is called "Draconic Incandescence of the Vermilion Firmament".
The Prehistoric Island is commonly abbreviated as "PH".
The Prehistoric Island, and other "rare" sea events, used to be spawnable in any Sea Danger Level due to the now-patched "12-player glitch".

locations.name: Tiki Outpost
trivia: The Tiki Outpost is the first and only island to introduce rain and cloud physics, although rain can be seen outside islands in the Rumbling Waters and Rough Sea.
The rain sound effects on the island are technically part of the background music, as muting the background music also turns off the raid sounds.
The landmass that the castle is built on is an island inside a lake inside an island, making the Tiki Outpost currently the only true recursive island in the game.
The Heaven Dimension and Hell Dimension can be found at the top of the Tiki Outpost. It can only appear when someone is doing the Cursed Dual Katana quest.

Near the Submarine Worker's location, there is a room full of bookshelves. In this room there is a ladder and behind said ladder there is a snake symbol, possibly hinting at a new race. There are also cranes with the same symbol on them.

locations.name: Cursed Ship
trivia:
The player can also teleport to the ship without reaching Lv. 1000 through the use of Portal's [C] World Warp. If the player enters the ship without reaching Lv. 1000, enemies will still drop Ectoplasm and they will be able to talk to the NPCs. However, the Cursed Captain will not drop the Hellfire Torch, and the player will not be able to accept any quests (because of the level requirement).
Another way to access this area is by going to the docks at the Kingdom of Rose, flying forward until the ship comes into view, and then glitching inside using Flash Step. However, this method is somewhat difficult due to the kill barriers surrounding the area. Alternatively, the player can simply die when the 'Cursed Ship' message and music appear, which will teleport them inside.

Another way to access this area is by going to the docks at the Kingdom of Rose, flying forward until the ship comes into view, and then glitching inside using Flash Step. However, this method is somewhat difficult due to the kill barriers surrounding the area. Alternatively, the player can simply die when the 'Cursed Ship' message and music appear, which will teleport them inside.
Jumping to the roof of the Cursed Ship will cause the head of the player to glitch outside and damage them.
It is possible to get both the Red and Blue Spikey Coat at the same time from the Cursed Captain.
The Barista Cousin can be found underneath the right staircase when entering from outside.
The Ship Stewards used to have a bloody scratch on their chest, but it was later removed.
When the player is in the ship during the night, using unawakened Buddha's transformation will help them see a little better in the dark.

If the player were to open up the compass and go towards the box, the compass' arrow would break after a while, and it will change (not to the player's current quest giver) but directly to the Cursed Ship's area location.
Quake's [V] Dual Tsunami or [V] Seaquake move can hit all the enemies in the ship.
Since the Cursed Ship gets very dark at night, turning on fast mode can make the area brighter if the player does not use Buddha.
The Cursed Ship is actually a gear of "Ghost Ship" Item. The gear ID of this ship is 155662051.
This room uses the same background music as Temple of Time and  Secret Temple.

locations.name: Battle of the Gods
trivia: The Battle of the Gods shares the same soundtrack as the Liberation of Tiki Outpost and Swan's Room, Lizard Bandit Clan.

locations.name: Café
trivia:
The theme of The Café is Rule of Rose Track 06 - Backbiting, which is a part of the Rule of Rose OST.
The Café and the Mansion (Third Sea) share the same theme.
The Café and the Mansion (Third Sea) share the same theme.

King Toad's House used to be an open door, a clean-living room with money in suitcases.
Players will sometimes leave fruits inside the Wenlocktoad room.
Take note that they can also hide inside this room.
Players will sometimes leave fruits inside the Wenlocktoad room.
Take note that they can also hide inside this room.
On one side of the leg of every trade table is written "Chad is the king of blox fruits" and in the top left corner is written "it exists".
There are four paintings on the walls of the Café but two of them got deleted for an unknown reason, and are now white.
The Café is considered the most visited place in the Second Sea by many players.
There is also something written beneath the trading table at the right side of the Café from its entrance as an easter egg.

locations.name: Castle on the Sea
trivia: The largest thing that can be levitated in Control X is one of the towers in the Castle on the Sea.
On top of the building in the middle, there is a book that can be read called "Echoes from the past".

locations.name: Colosseum
trivia: The Colosseum is also where some (generally friendly) PvP matches take place. This is not to be confused with Colosseum (Second Sea) though it serves practically the same purpose though considered better due to more even playing fields and a larger size.

The Colosseum is widely considered to be one of the blandest islands in the First Sea, as it has only the most basic NPCs, no bosses, and no involvement with special Quests. The island's relatively simple design also contributes to this.

It is possible to easily farm the enemies at Colosseum by standing on the ramp leading up to the colosseum while an enemy stands on the ground below and hits them with ranged attacks. This isn't always reliable though.
The soundtrack that plays at the Colosseum is called "Into the Arena".

It is recommended to skip the Colosseum as the enemies are extremely spread out. It's best to keep grinding the bosses at Prison until Lv. 300. This is because the enemies are very buggy which causes them to despawn when they are far from their spawn point.

locations.name: Colosseum (Second Sea)
trivia: Very similar to the First Sea's Colosseum, but unlike the first, the second Colosseum is circular, instead of an oval.
Underneath the Colosseum, there is a room with Gladiators that are required to rescue to complete the Colosseum Quest.

Mihawk used to hold an event in the Colosseum and whoever defeated him would receive a free Dark Blade, but unfortunately this event is no longer available. (This event was admin-only, and Mihawk is just an admin disguised.
Players with a really small avatar can take damage in the water surrounding the arena since their hitbox is below it.
The Friendly Arena in Hydra Island shares the same theme as this area.

locations.name: Crypt
trivia: The Crypt can be glitched into through Flash Step or other Teleportation methods.

The Crypt Master will still let players in the Crypt even if they have only met the requirement of one of the swords (either Tushita or Yama), despite needing both of the requirements to start the Cursed Dual Katana puzzle.
If the player enters the Crypt whilst not meeting the requirements for the puzzle, they cannot interact with anything inside.
The Crypt is not officially named.
The Crypt contains one of the 4 interactable NPCs on the Floating Turtle (excluding quest givers and NPCs in the mansion) with the Crypt Master.

locations.name: Dark Arena
trivia: The theme of the Dark Arena is 'Haunted Halls'—the same theme that plays when the player encounters a Sea Beast, triggers a Rumbling Waters event, or enters Treasure Island and Prehistoric Island without being active."

locations.name: Desert
trivia: The theme that plays at the Desert is The Endless Desert.
The Desert is the only desert-themed island in the entire game.
If the player collects the Silver Chest near the pyramid, there is a secret passage under it that leads to Hasan.
Light's raid islands are based on the Desert.
The Desert is one of few islands that does not have a Luxury Boat Dealer.

locations.name: Dimensional Rift
trivia: If the player tries to jump or run to the edges of the Dimensional Rift, they will be teleported to the center of it again.

If the player somehow goes off the Dimensional Rift (for example, the highest point of the rift ever higher than portal, afterwards the opponent uses the [V] Dimensional Rift again), they will fall out of the area and into the sea.
The Dimensional Rift is extremely effective if the player wants to hunt for script users. Once they enter, they will be stuck there and teleport continuously.
Every time the user recasts Dimensional Rift, their previous one disappears. So, the ability cannot be used to store Blox Fruits outside of the inventory.
Once someone dies inside the Dimensional Rift, outsiders who turn on their Instinct will see them die outside.

If a player were to have the prey mark from a T-Rex user and a Portal user pulled them into the Dimensional Rift, the damage dealt would max out, since the further a player is from a T-Rex user that gave them the mark, the more damage is dealt over time. There is a cap to the prey mark, but it can deal around 2,500 damage.
When the player attempts to return to their Home Point in the Dimensional Rift, a message will appear saying, "Cannot teleport while portaled".
If the user creates the Dimensional Rift when encountering a sea event and then exits. Instantly all the sea events the player is facing disappear.
[V] Dimensional Rift is considered to be an "illegal" move alongside [C] World Warp, which are often banned in the crew wars within the PvP community.

locations.name: Dimensional Shift
trivia: After the Cake Prince/Dough King has been defeated, all of the players inside the Dimensional Shift will be teleported back to the Sea of Treats.
The Cake Prince/Dough King will despawn after 7 minutes and 30 seconds.
It is possible that the player gets Anti-Cheated if they go through the portal. When this happens, the player will be teleported to the portal, and they will have to go through the portal again.

There is a glitch where the player spawns in the sky and falls when they finish the raid.
There is another glitch where the player is transformed with Awakened Buddha's [Z] Shift ability and jump when they get teleported back to the Sea of Treats. Doing so will send them flying.
There is another glitch where the player is transformed with Awakened Buddha's [Z] Shift ability and jump when they get teleported back to the Sea of Treats. Doing so will send them flying.

locations.name: Dojo Vault
trivia: By doing the Flash Step glitch, the player can no-clip inside of the Dojo Vault without actually opening it, but when interacting with the NPC, the dialogue states "..." and doesn't do anything for the player.

locations.name: Draco Temple
trivia: The NPC located inside of the room will not display any of the dialogue options and will only say "..." if the player currently does not have Draco equipped or does not have access to the room.

locations.name: Dragon Dojo
trivia: The Dragon Dojo is the second place dedicated to a certain fruit or fruit theme (first being the Kitsune Shrine).

locations.name: Factory
trivia:
Players can enter the Factory using Flash Step, however, they will not be able to damage the core. This trick can help to damage the core at its start.
Another way to enter the Factory is use Creation's V move near it, some of the pillars can teleport inside.
Another way to enter the Factory is use Creation's V move near it, some of the pillars can teleport inside.
The Cyborg NPC is located in one of the holes in the wall, where the player can buy the Lantern ship for   1,500.

The factory can be found on the third island of the Spider Raid because it is based on the Kingdom of Rose, however, the building appears to be destroyed. Cafe can also be found in the Spider Raid but it is also destroyed and half underwater.
It is best to do Factory Raids in Private Servers as there will be no interruption when attacking it.
The factory is one of the best ways to farm Bounty at Lv. 1500 since people over Lv. 1000 go here the most.

During the 30 seconds before the Factory opens which is displayed by the announcement, some enemies (including bosses) will completely freeze, they won't be able to attack or move which makes an easy kill for grinding Bounty or money, for example, Snow Trooper, Winter Warrior, and Order.
If the player joins a high difficulty raid (for example, a Buddha raid) and reaches the fifth island, the player can time it so that when the raid boss appears, the factory raid starts. This way, the player can deal a lot of damage within 30 seconds without losing too much health because all enemies in this raid will freeze completely.
If the player is not good at PvP, it is recommended to turn off PvP in some way before participating in a Factory Raid because the player will be damaged by other players trying to deal damage to the core (if the player's PvP is on).
It is possible to exit the Factory when five minutes have almost passed to escape death.
Sometimes, a glitch will occur that traps players inside the Factory after the raid has been completed.
The factory can drop Radioactive Material.

If the player joins a high difficulty raid (for example, a Buddha raid) and reaches the fifth island, the player can time it so that when the raid boss appears, the factory raid starts. This way, the player can deal a lot of damage within 30 seconds without losing too much health because all enemies in this raid will freeze completely.

If the player is not good at PvP, it is recommended to turn off PvP in some way before participating in a Factory Raid because the player will be damaged by other players trying to deal damage to the core (if the player's PvP is on).
It is possible to exit the Factory when five minutes have almost passed to escape death.
Sometimes, a glitch will occur that traps players inside the Factory after the raid has been completed.
The factory can drop Radioactive Material.

locations.name: Floating Turtle
trivia: Floating Turtle is the largest island in Third Sea and the second largest island in the whole game, the largest being Kingdom of Rose.
Floating Turtle has the highest number of Elite Pirate spawn locations, with about seven locations.
Floating Turtle Island also bears the Mansion, a crucial building in the Third Sea as it holds important NPC's and one of the four Portals in the Third Sea.
Until Update 24, The player could fly through Hoops to change their appearance if they were using Dragon.
The Floating Turtle has the highest number of bosses in the game, having four.

locations.name: Forgotten Island
trivia:
The Forgotten Island has a high number of exploiters farming Water Fighters, so it is recommended to try to use codes for 2x XP to pass this island as soon as possible, or use a private server.
Due to the large number of exploiters, the Forgotten Island is also one of the best places to kill them and get lots of Bounty/Honor.
Due to the large number of exploiters, the Forgotten Island is also one of the best places to kill them and get lots of Bounty/Honor.

locations.name: Fountain City
trivia: Galley Pirates can be farmed at Lv. 1 to give a big boost in levels.
The Fountain City is the largest island in the First Sea.
There is a diamond chest at the top of the fountain.
The water here will not damage Blox Fruit users.
Due to the fountain's great height, the Fountain City is visible from anywhere in the First Sea.
Some wanted posters can be found at the docks of the Fountain City.
Its recommended to farm the Cyborg boss until Lv.725 in order to be better prepared for the Second sea

locations.name: Freezing Hydra Island
trivia: Interestingly, during this, the dojo lanterns gain a proximity prompt that is not normally visible until this, and disappears after it ends.
The water around Freezing Hydra Island will not change and will still act as water, not ice.

While the island is frozen, enemies will be covered in ice (this affects Elite enemies as well), and while in this state, they cannot move towards the player, but they can still attack them. Breaking the ice will deal around 1/2 of their health and free them from their restraint.
This makes doing quests that require NPCs quite easy, as they take less time to kill and makes grinding for Dragon Scales and Blaze Embers quicker.
This should not be relied on, as the snowstorm only lasts for around 5-15 minutes and requires a Leviathan Heart to do so.

This makes doing quests that require NPCs quite easy, as they take less time to kill and makes grinding for Dragon Scales and Blaze Embers quicker.
This should not be relied on, as the snowstorm only lasts for around 5-15 minutes and requires a Leviathan Heart to do so.
This should not be relied on, as the snowstorm only lasts for around 5-15 minutes and requires a Leviathan Heart to do so.

locations.name: Frozen Dimension
trivia: The ice at the Frozen Dimension is slippery, which is especially noticeable when dashing.
Frozen Dimension is one of the rarest and most difficult Sea Events to find, due to the Danger Level requirement and other Sea Events likely being encountered along the way.
The Frozen Dimension can spawn alongside other sea events (e.g. Mirage Island), meaning there is a chance the Frozen Watcher NPC may be blocked and therefore unusable.
There is a really slim chance, that big rocks found at sea can block Frozen watcher, therefore wasting a possibility to fight Leviathan.

locations.name: Frozen Village
trivia:
The theme at Frozen Village is called The Start Of Winter.
This theme is also used in Festive Village's old theme from Zombie Attack.
This theme is also used in Festive Village's old theme from Zombie Attack.
The Frozen Village is one of the five winter-themed islands in the game, the others being Snow Mountain, Ice Castle, Hot and Cold (cold side), and Candy Cane Land in the Sea of Treats.

locations.name: Graveyard Island
trivia: The Blue Flower can be found on Graveyard Island.
The theme of the Graveyard Island is called Deep Mist, the same as Haunted Shipwreck.
The Death King, which was added in Update 16, then removed in Update 17, used to be found on Graveyard Island.
Two named graves can be found on Graveyard Island: one belonging to Wenlocktoad and the other to fudd10.
Graveyard Island is the smallest major island in the Second Sea.
Graveyard Island requires only 50 levels of grinding before reaching the next island, making it the easiest one to progress through in the Second Sea.

PvPing a Control user on this island can be quite difficult, primarily due to the fruit's [X] move, which allows the user to levitate the island's giant pillars and hurl them as massive AoE explosions.

locations.name: Green Zone
trivia: Some of the leaf wings at the Green Zone have a hitbox to stand on, while some do not, which is quite confusing, so fruits that help the user fly would be more recommended.
The Green Zone has one of the highest points of altitude in the Second Sea.
The second nearest vine to the bridge connecting Kingdom of Rose and this island has a small area where the Red flower spawns.
The Green Zone is not a place that the player can teleport to using Portal, so the player can instead teleport to Dock 3 to get there.

locations.name: Haunted Castle
trivia: Before Update 17, players could get bones from enemies when they killed one around their level.
The background music of Haunted Castle is the same as that of Floating Turtle's and Castle on the Sea's background music.

Haunted Castle is a good place to grind chests for money. After the player travels to the top of the flag and collects the chests, they can go to the stone hut where the Death King NPC is located and collects the two golden chests there. In total, this can give the player around   31,750 to  46,400 in total. If the player server hops, they can earn more money — provided someone else hasn't already collected the chests on that server.
The Haunted Castle is where the player can start and solve the Soul Guitar Puzzle.

The Haunted Castle is similar to Cursed Ship.
Both are horror-themed locations.
Both have a Raid Boss, being Soul Reaper here and Cursed Captain at the Cursed Ship. The Cursed Captain and the Soul Reaper both drop mastery instead of levels.
Both are horror-themed locations.
Both have a Raid Boss, being Soul Reaper here and Cursed Captain at the Cursed Ship. The Cursed Captain and the Soul Reaper both drop mastery instead of levels.
There is an altar with blue flames on the way to the cemetery, which is on the left side of the island. It is used to summon the Soul Reaper by placing a Hallow Essence on it.
The Uzoth NPC used to be found here inside the right gear behind the castle, but was moved to Dragon Dojo in Hydra Island in Update 24.

locations.name: Haunted Shipwreck
trivia: The Haunted Shipwreck's soundtrack is as same as the Graveyard Island.
In rare cases, two Haunted Shipwrecks can spawn at once.

locations.name: Heavenly Dimension
trivia: The player can visit the Heavenly Dimension as much as they want as long as they have yet to pass the trial.
If the player dies in the Heavenly Dimension, they will have to do the Soulless Quest again.
This is the last quest for the Tushita scroll.
The player can no longer access the Heavenly Dimension without the use of glitches after the completion of the quest.
While someone is in the Heavenly Dimension, the player can enter it from the top of Tiki Outpost, which looks like a giant ball in the sky. Outside Heavenly Dimension

It is possible to glitch out of the Heavenly Dimension.
For example: Using awakened Buddha then using awakened [Z] can sometimes make the player glitch under the Heavenly Dimension.
For example: Using awakened Buddha then using awakened [Z] can sometimes make the player glitch under the Heavenly Dimension.

locations.name: Hell Dimension
trivia: Sometimes there are some cases where the Enemies fall out of the Hell Dimension, making it impossible for them to complete the quest, so it is recommended to limit the use of weapons with high knockback.
If the player dies in the Hell Dimension, they will have to do the Fear the Reaper quest again.
While someone is in the Hell Dimension, the player can enter it from the top of Tiki Outpost, which looks like a giant ball with horns in the sky. Outside Hell Dimension

locations.name: Hot and Cold
trivia: Although the Smoke Admiral's quest giver is on the cold side, his boss room is on the hot side.

On the cold side of Hot and Cold, the player can glitch and go inside all the three igloos (by using shift lock and facing the players back to the black colored plates then using Flash Step or mobility moves) and get the three silver chests inside. These igloos can also be lifted with Control [X] move.
Hot and Cold is located to the south of the Green Zone.
In Update 13, there used to be an NPC called the Greedy Elf.
The Barista Cousin has a chance of spawning on top of the Smoke Admiral's Castle.
There is a glitch where if the player spawns a Boat larger than the Brigade at the Ice Island's Boat Dealer/Luxury Boat Dealer spawn, the boat will get stuck.
The Hot side of Hot and Cold is very infamous for allowing players with Portal fruit be able to teleport to the lava.
There is a small area on the bucket of pouring lava on the Hot side of Hot and Cold where the lava will not harm the player.
The Gate on the Hot side is considered as a Tree by the game since it can drop Planks after getting destroyed.
Hot and Cold is known to be annoying to grind in, due to all the enemies being spaced apart (especially the Magma Ninjas) them dealing high damage, and having lengthy stuns.

locations.name: Hydra Island
trivia: At the Hydra Town, if the player goes to the house in front of the Hydra Town Quest Giver, they can actually enter it. However, nothing is actually inside the building.
If the player's Instinct vision range is far enough, they can see the Beautiful Pirate underneath the Hydra Leader's spawn point.
If the player performs the Flash Step glitch in the Secret Temple, they can get to the Tushita Puzzle portal and the Beautiful Pirate Domain.
There are a lot of hitbox issues in Hydra Island, most notably the "invisible wall" in the Training Dummy's area, preventing players from using moves such as Spikey Trident's [X] move.
Behind the Dragon Crew Warriors and Dragon Crew Archers, there is a weird piece of floating terrain on a tree.

locations.name: Ice Castle
trivia: Until Update 24, the player could fly through Hoops to change their appearance if they were using the Dragon fruit.

locations.name: Jean-Luc Island
trivia: The Jean-Luc Island does not have an official name, the name "Jean-Luc" was given to it by Baguetteboing, one of the Blox Fruits Wiki's bureaucrats.
The Jean-Luc Island is one of the least visited islands in the First Sea, as players only come here for the Saber Puzzle or to get the bounty/honor of the Mob Leader, since his respawn time is low.
The Jean-Luc Island does not have its own soundtrack, and instead uses the regular Sea soundtrack.
Players cannot teleport to the Jean-Luc Island using Portal's [C] World Warp ability.
The Jean-Luc Island is the only island without any Shop NPCs but with fruit spawn points.

locations.name: Jungle
trivia: The theme that plays at the Jungle is called Into The Forest.
The Jungle is one of the few islands in the game to have a true lake, another one being Hydra Island.
Blox Fruits spawn in the Jungle naturally quite often since the island has a lot of Trees.
As of Update 23, there is a safe zone near the Blox Fruit Gacha.
It is recommended to stay in the safe zone when rolling due to the fact many high Level players will be at the Jungle to kill beginners.
The community often regards the Jungle as the most popular place in the First Sea, mostly because the Blox Fruit Gacha is here.

locations.name: King Toad's House
trivia: The player can enter this room by using Flash Step.
King Toad's House used to contain diamond, gold, and silver chests.
Awakenings Expert used to be inside in this room. However, in Update 14, the secret room was closed, and the NPC can instead be found right outside of it.
Even though it's called a house, this place is more like a room.

locations.name: Kingdom of Rose
trivia: One of the sections of the Bridge is the second largest object that Control can throw. It can hit players from the bridge to the Café.
The Kingdom of Rose is currently the largest island in the game.
There is a tree that has white leaves where the Swan Pirates spawn.

locations.name: Kitsune Island
locations.description: "A mysterious shrine has appeared in the sea..."
trivia: If Mirage Island spawns next to the island, the shrine will not work, and no Azure Ember will spawn on the island, the same with Rough Sea. If this happens, go far out away from the island. As long as the player still has the timer on their UI, embers will still spawn.
The trees on Kitsune Island are breakable and may drop Wooden Planks upon destroying.

locations.name: l'Église de Prophétie
trivia: L'Église de Prophétie also can be found below Floating Turtle, entering here is quite complicated, not recommended.
The previous NPC in this area used to be "Wenlocktoad Over Heaven". This has been replaced since Update 13.
On the left there are the words "Life form". This is an easter egg referring to the Dark Blade's Slayer Skin.

locations.name: Liberation of Tiki Outpost
trivia: The Tiki Outpost will be renamed to <Liberation of Tiki Outpost> if the player is in the spawn area of the Tyrant of the Skies. But if they go to a specific area outside the spawn of Tyrant of the Skies spawn, the island will be renamed back to <Tiki Outpost>.
The Liberation of Tiki Outpost shares the same soundtrack as the Battle of the Gods and Swan's Room, Lizard Bandit Clan.

locations.name: Magma Village
trivia: The Living Skeleton can be found at the Magma Village, selling the Soul Cane for   750,000. The player can find him in a secret passageway in the volcano near the left side of the island and close to the fruit spawn location.
Magma Village is the first island to include a surface that damages players (that being the lava river that goes beneath the bridge and some magma inside the volcano).
Unlike enemies found in previous islands, every enemy except Military Soldier (which only has a chance to use Aura) uses Aura, making it more tedious for players to grind here.

Blade and Buddha are usually recommended when grinding on Magma Village as the enemies' aura-imbued sword will not hit the user. In the case of Buddha, its long range prevents NPCs from hitting the player.
Magma Village is the first island that was added to the game after the original release.

Most likely, the Ability Teacher is here to sell Aura for those who didn't buy it at Frozen Village to be able to damage Magma Admiral if they don't have a Blox Fruit, since Magma Admiral has Elemental Reflex.

The part of the island under the bridge also deals damage to players who walk on it (Ineffective to NPCs) also the lava which appears to be a flowing which connects to the part under the bridge also deals damage to players who touch it and the part of lava inside the volcano next to Magma Admiral spawn point deals damage to players who touch it which can be annoying to some players who are not aware of this.

locations.name: Mansion
trivia: There is a bug that the user can use to go through the pillars to get to the Café fast.
The pillars supporting the structure are similar to Air Traffic Control/ATC Towers.
The Mansion can be found in the last island of the Spider Raid, but it is destroyed and half underwater. Factory can also be found in the 3rd island, also destroyed.
For an unknown reason, there is an invisible block on the stairs next to the door leading to Swan's Room.
A red flower spawns in the small front garden of the Mansion. There is also a diamond chest behind the chair near the bed.
The player can find the Thailand Ball on a couch near the bed and the Brazil Cube on a table.

locations.name: Mansion
trivia: The Vietnam Cone can be found behind a windmill near the Mansion, it's most likely an easter egg made by the developers to show their support towards Vietnamese Blox Fruits players, as it currently has no use besides decoration.
The Mansion and Café share the same theme.
Leaderboards for Bounty, Honor, and Fastest Raids are located in the Mansion.
The Inventory NPC was previously located next to the Blox Fruit Gacha, but was removed in Update 17.3.
The Citizen, which gives the citizen quest, is located in front of the Mansion.
The two huge bars at the center of the Mansion are actually hollow, the player can glitch into them using various skills, although it takes some effort.
Despite the Mansion having three floors, the third floor is not accessible.
If the player uses Unawakened Dough's [C] Carved Dough, they will get stuck on the roof.
The top corners of the Mansion are not Safe Zones. If a player jumps upto any one of the 4 top corners, they can notice that the Safe Zone text disappears.

locations.name: Marine Fortress
trivia:
If the player chooses the Marines side at the start of the game, they will be teleported right next to the castle. But for Pirates, the player will spawn left or right at the end of the crescent.
It is recommended to use the Marines side to grind the Vice Admiral here because it is closer to the castle.
It is recommended to use the Marines side to grind the Vice Admiral here because it is closer to the castle.
Like the Military Soldiers at Magma Village, the player can get the Chief Petty Officers stuck near the edge of the stairs and attack them while they are unable to hit the player.
Boats on the Marine Fortress cost cheaper, even if the player is a Pirate.
Grinding the Vice Admiral is one of the best ways to grind money in the First Sea.
The Marine Fortress is similar to the last island of a Phoenix raid.
Before Update 10, there was a scaffold and the floor texture was made of stone instead of grass.

locations.name: Marine Starter
trivia: The Marine Starter features wanted posters, allowing Marines to easily collect them.
Like the Pirate Starter island, the Pirate Recruiter is placed in an partially hidden location, likely to avoid being seen by Marines.
Ironically, the Marine Starter displays a black flag on the left tower—a symbol commonly associated with pirates—even though it is a military establishment.
Returning to/joining a friend in the First Sea from the Second Sea or Third Sea as a Marine will teleport the player over to Marine Starter.

locations.name: Middle Town
trivia: No other buildings in the game use domed architecture, making the two domed buildings at the Middle Town the only examples of it in the game.
The significance of the Middle Town is that it is an island where a lot of important NPCs usually appear, some of them even being event-exclusive.

locations.name: Oni Realm
trivia: For unknown reasons, using transformed T-Rex's [F] Gigantic Leap, Phoenix's [C] Flame Exodus and Longsword's [X] Glorious Smash move will throw the player out of the Oni Realm near the Haunted Castle's sea.
Fishing in the corrupted water will enhance the fortune by a 2.5% than in normal water.
The Oni Island is a Safe Zone.
When entering the Arena where Red Commander is found, every player inside is allied with each other.
If a player dies while fighting the Red Commander, they will respawn at the entrance to the Oni Realm.
Players have all stats maxed in Oni Realm, with the exception of health and energy.

The Oni Realm has a fishable pond which spawns a demonic whirlpool every four minutes after it despawns. In the red water where upon fishing, players can get corrupted fish that can be sold to the Oni Fisherman for some Oni Tokens. Demonic whirlpool despawns after fishing in it three times.
Oni Soldiers will spawn on the surrounding islands every five minutes.
The Red Commander spawns every hour at the Oni Realm. When this Raid Boss spawns, the doors around the center building open up, allowing players to go into his arena.
If the player falls off the Oni Island, they will fall from the sky into the normal map.
For unknown reasons, player cannot use [Gravity]'s [F] (tap) move inside the Oni Realm.

locations.name: Pakistan Dimension
trivia: The Pakistan Kamui ability remains a mystery to this day. No one has ever seen it in the developers/admins' hotbar items, only heard from Axiore.
Currently, this dimension was last seen in this video.

locations.name: Pirate Starter
trivia: Like the Pirate Recruiter on the Marine Starter island, the Marine Recruiter can be found on the Pirate Starter.
Originally, Pirate Starter was intended to be larger, but it was reduced in size to avoid confusing new players.
Pirate Starter is one of two starter islands in the game, along with Marine Starter Island.
Pirate Starter is one of the islands that features a map.
Pirate Starter is the second smallest island in the First Sea before Jean-Luc Island.
Returning to or joining a friend in First Sea from the Second Sea or Third Sea as a Pirate will teleport the player over to the Pirate Starter.

locations.name: Pirate Village
trivia: Most players in First Sea often go chest hunting on Pirate Village due to the amount of chests that can be found there.
All of the enemies use swords, so it is recommended to use Blade because of its sword immunity.

locations.name: Pocket Dimension
trivia: The Pocket Dimension was previously known as Phoeyu's Dimension.
This area was also featured as the main spotlight image in the Blox Bulletin Issue #007.

locations.name: Prison
trivia: The Prison has the highest number of bosses out of all islands in all seas, having three of them.
The Prison had no Set Home Point NPC but it was later added in Update 17.

The Boat Dealer was originally not intended to be added for the sake of Remove Blox Fruit, but since Update 23 due to the ability to be able to hold down the jump button and jump on water without dying, he was added.
Before Update 17.2, Prisoners did not exist, which meant that the player had to grind the bosses. After the update, they were added, along with Dangerous Prisoners.
Unlike normal water, the water exposed beneath the wooden planks of the Prison cannot actually damage Blox Fruit users.

It is recommended to server hop and grind the bosses in this island than at the Colosseum (First Sea) due to the enemies there being further apart and few in number. (Each quest requires 7/8 of them to be defeated.)
As of Update 24, the wall glitch has been fixed, so it will be annoying to fight the bosses.
This island is also recommended for grinding money due to it having 3 boss quests, with each of them rewarding the player a larger sum (in comparison to enemy quests) of both, money and bounty/honor.

locations.name: Red_Legion Hideout
trivia: The Red_Legion Hideout is the only island that can change color from white during the day to yellow at night.

The Red_Legion Hideout is one of the islands that can only appear through admin commands. Otherwise, users can make islands appear by performing Raids, finding Mirage Island, Treasure Island, completing the final challenges of the two scrolls in the Cursed Dual Katana quest, etc.

If the user can get here by all means, they are strictly forbidden from sitting on the throne while another admin is watching, this can be seen through many of Zioles and Uzoth's videos on Youtube. That implies that the throne belongs to King Red Head, one of the owners of Blox Fruits.

locations.name: Remote Island
trivia: The Remote Island is the smallest island in the Second Sea.
The Remote Island has no display name upon going onto it. However, its location name displayed on the Portal [C] World Warp's GUI is "Remote", making it its sole "official" name.

Since the Remote Island is not really considered an island, using a flying boat such as Miracle onto this island will not make the boat land onto the sea. Therefore, the player can land the boat onto the ground of this island itself.

locations.name: Rip_Family Hideout
trivia: The Triple Dark Blade can be found here, however, there is little information available regarding how it spawns.
Admins can access here by entering "/kamui2" in the chat, or by using the Rip Kamui ability.

locations.name: Rip_Family x Red_Legion Arena
trivia: This location was previously seen as Rip_Family x Red_Legion Arena, but it currently appears as Frozen Dimension. According to Uzoth, the developers put the Leviathan Gate above the arena for testing purposes.

The Rip_Family x Red_Legion Arena previously had a dome/atmosphere covering it (similar to the Underwater City), but it got removed after some time. Currently, its replacement is the Frozen Dimension's fog.

locations.name: Sea of Treats
trivia: The Candy Cane Land also appears in all seas during Christmas Events under the name of North Pole.
Despite the size of the Sea of Treats, there is only one boss that naturally spawns, which is the Cake Queen.
The Sea of Treats leveling-up range is extremely lengthy (375 levels), which makes the Sea of Treats have the largest level range in the entire game. (Lv. 2075-2450)

locations.name: Secret Laboratory
trivia: The Secret Laboratory is related to the obtainment of the Cyborg race, which the player can get by placing a Fist of Darkness where they would place the Microchip (bought from Arlthmetic) and following up, they will need to place the Core Brain (dropped by the Order Boss) after placing the Fist of Darkness at the same place. After doing so, the secret staircase will open. Inside, the player can buy the Cyborg race for   2,500.

locations.name: Secret Temple
trivia: This is also the starting point for the quest to obtain Tushita. The player must go into the castle black door on the very right from when they enter when the Rip indra True Form is still alive. Then, they light up the torch. (Refer to its puzzle for more information)
This is also the point for obtaining Yama. The player must defeat 30 Elite Pirates and click the sword in the middle without holding anything. (Refer to its puzzle for more information)
This is one of the smallest places in the game to get its own title as a location.

locations.name: Skylands
trivia: The Skylands are a group of islands with the second highest amount of separate landmasses, beaten out only by the Sea of Treats, which has five islands.
Since Update 17.2, the Skylands (excluding the Upper Skylands) now connect with each other with bridges. The player no longer needs to Fly or Air Jump up there.
It is recommended to skip the Sky Bandits quest by server hopping Vice Admiral at Marine Fortress.
Until Update 24, the player could fly through Hoops to change their appearance if they were using the Dragon (Classic) fruit.

locations.name: Snow Mountain
trivia:
The player can destroy the bridge when using a Destructible Physics move.
The player cannot cross the bridge while having Dough's awakened F (Scorching Donut) or Blizzard's F (Tornado Flight) as the bridge will break from too many hits, since those attacks have continuous ticks.

The player cannot cross the bridge while having Dough's awakened F (Scorching Donut) or Blizzard's F (Tornado Flight) as the bridge will break from too many hits, since those attacks have continuous ticks.
The player can spawn a Sea Beast between the mountains; Sea Beasts can also spawn naturally there.
The Snow Mountain is hollow, so if the player angles their camera correctly, they can use Flash Step to get in.
The Snow Mountain had a Poneglyph but it was later removed in Update 13.

Control fruit is powerful at this location, being able to pick up the whole bridge and throw it, resulting in an explosion that covers the entire island. Mind that throwing the bridge could mess with the bridge's collisions, and there is a chance that the bridge could phase through the island with no explosion, although this is decently rare.

locations.name: Swan's Room
trivia: Swan's Room shares the same soundtrack with the Battle of the Gods and Liberation of Tiki Outpost.

locations.name: Temple of Time
trivia:
The theme of the Temple of Time is Hypnotical Suspense, courtesy of APM music.
This theme is also played in Arowe's hidden place.
This theme is also played in Arowe's hidden place.
Every sound the player makes in the Temple of Time will have an echo effect.

If the player attempts to go near the walls of the Ancient Clock without "achieving greatness" or in the process of getting a gear, they will be teleported back to the entrance of the Temple of Time/spawn.
However, the player can still get the Ancient Clock when they complete a challenge to get a gear or get all the gear. (Both red and blue gear have Tier 2)
However, the player can still get the Ancient Clock when they complete a challenge to get a gear or get all the gear. (Both red and blue gear have Tier 2)
Previously, the door used to enter the secret room had a timer that said "Coming soon". This may have indicated that Race v4 could be solved when it no longer said "Coming soon".
When the player maxes out a race or gets to a certain point, they can revisit the Ancient Clock anytime.
If the player glitches outside of the temple and falls off the side, they will fall into Sea Danger Level 4.

There is a glitch that happens when the player uses Slayer of Goliath from Cursed Dual Katana or when successfully glitching up the stairway toward the Ancient Clock. A dialogue pops up saying: "Are you sure you wish to leave? You cannot come back without passing the trials again." The player can answer with "Yes" or "Nevermind". To do this, the player needs to go into First-Person mode and use Slayer of Goliath after the fourth pillar of the stairway.
There is a glitch where if the player enters the Temple of Time right before a trial starts, it will let them in the Temple of Time. However, they cannot attack any players doing the trial.

locations.name: Treasure Island
trivia: The Treasure Island (small version) is one of the smallest islands in the game, comparable to only the Remote Island, Jean-Luc Island and the Cave Island.
There is a chance of the Treasure Island spawning without the island itself, as if there is no island and only the chests can be seen floating.
The trees are considered part of Treasure Island. As a result, they do not have Destructible Physics.

If the player uses a flying boat, such as The Sentinel or Miracle, it will automatically lower upon approaching the Treasure Island, treating it like a standard island. This mechanic can be used to determine whether a Treasure Island has spawned, unlike the Mirage Island, whose appearance cannot be confirmed in the same way.
The theme for the Treasure Island is the same as Sea Beast, Dark Arena, Rumbling Waters and inactive Prehistoric Island, which is the soundtrack composed by Roblox called "Haunted Halls".
The Treasure Island can be very useful for taking a break while sailing in Sea Danger 6, as going there will remove the fog and give time to repair the ship. Enemies are guaranteed never to spawn.
If the player takes a quest from the Player Hunter and their target on located on Treasure Island, it will say that the player they are hunting has been seen around there.

locations.name: Underwater City
trivia: All enemies in the Underwater City drop Fish Tails with a low chance.
It is the first island that needs to have completed a task to enter.
The Underwater City is the first island where the player must be multiple levels higher than the enemies in order for Elemental immunity to activate.
There are three gold chests and one diamond chest in the Underwater City.
It is possible to get to the Underwater City without going through the whirlpool by using a flight ability to eventually find the island way off in the distance.

The Underwater City is one of seven islands to contain a Portal, the others being Castle on the Sea, Hydra Island, Kingdom of Rose, Cursed Ship, Skylands/Upper Skylands, and Floating Turtle; however, this island uses a completely different system and model for the portals.

The Underwater City is the only island to be supposedly located underwater. Even though it is depicted as being "Underwater", the player can see a round shaped island (dome/atmosphere) really far away from the islands overwater. The player can also access outside the dome by finding a gap in the invisible wall near the Fisherman Commandos, and swim towards the shell of the dome. The dome does not collide with the player so they can walk through it. The exterior view of the underwater cityUnderwater city seen at the Whirlpool Docks, the entrance to it.Outside the underwater city.

Even though it is depicted as being "Underwater", the player can see a round shaped island (dome/atmosphere) really far away from the islands overwater. The player can also access outside the dome by finding a gap in the invisible wall near the Fisherman Commandos, and swim towards the shell of the dome. The dome does not collide with the player so they can walk through it. The exterior view of the underwater cityUnderwater city seen at the Whirlpool Docks, the entrance to it.Outside the underwater city.

locations.name: Upper Skylands
trivia: It is possible to access the Upper Skylands without going through the main entrance, by flying up with a fruit such as Light, or by teleporting up with Portal.
Before Update 23, The Second Quest Giver on the Upper Skylands was called "Gan Fall Adventurer" but now replaced by "Sky Quest Giver 2" due to the copyright.
The Upper Skylands requires the most grinding out of all islands in First Sea.
